title: newISA Certified Arborist/Arborist
company: Wright Tree Service of Canada, Ltd.
description:
Wright Tree Service of Canada, Ltd. is currently seeking an Arborist to start in the EDMONTON, ALBERTA area on a full-time basis under our new Project Manager. Wright Tree Service of Canada, Ltd. provides vegetation management, storm restoration, and work planning services to utility companies and their communities across the country. Safety is always our highest value. That focus is guided by our “Brother’s and Sister's Keeper” pledge to keep both ourselves and others safe. We abide by the highest ethical standards, knowing our service is critical to utilities and their customers, and we work as a team to deliver creative solutions to our clients. Finally, we are proud of our family-founded history and have worked to retain those family values in our culture since becoming employee-owned in 2002.

A career with Wright Tree Service of Canada, Ltd

  • Industry Leading Pay
  • Paid lodging and per diem for out of town work
  • A benefits package with health, dental, and life insurance
  • Employee recognition program 5,10,15,20+ years service
  • Paid training
  • A safe workplace
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Full-time year-round work
  • Opportunity for career advancement
  • Modern fleet of vehicles and equipment
  • Members of PVMAA, ISA, TCIA, LANTA, and other industry associations
  • Opportunity to participate in the Company's Deferred Stock Unit (DSU) program

Duties, Responsibilities, and Skills:

  • Perform all aspects of tree pruning and removal services safely and skillfully for customers.
  • Including but not limited to: * Pruning, thinning and removing deadwood throughout the tree canopy.
  • Removal of hazardous trees.
  • Properly maintain, prepare, and operate all tools and equipment including chainsaws, chippers, aerial lifts, and more.
  • Assist the trimmers and foreperson in job site setup, debris removal, and cleanup.
  • Follow Wright Tree Service and industry safety policies and procedures

Requirements:

  • Strong communication and organizational skills
  • Ability to work independently and on a team in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to read and complete daily paperwork
  • Knowledge of principles and practices of tree maintenance and arboriculture
  • Thorough knowledge of safety in the industry, as well as the use of equipment including power and hand tools
  • Knowledge of trees, insects, and diseases
  • Valid ISA certification
  • Experience within the tree care industry, including aerial operator and/or climbing skills, pruning experience, and tree-identification skills
  • Valid class 5 driver's license, air brakes endorsement considered an asset
  • Valid First Aid and CPR
  • In-town and out-of-town positions available
  • Negative drug and alcohol screen result(s)

Wright Tree Service of Canada, Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $28.00-$32.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekends

Experience:

  • Arborist: 1 year (Required)

Licence:

  • ISA Arborist (Preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Climbing Arborists/Crew Leaders
description:
Climbing Arborist/ Crew Leader: $24-34.00 per hour based on experience and certification.

A CAREER WITH CHIPPS TREE CARE INC

  • Competitive wages.
  • Benefits package.
  • In-house training and work safe practices.
  • Safe workplace and friendly environment,
  • Opportunity for career advancement.
  • Modern fleet of vehicles and equipment.
  • Members of ISA, and other industry associations.
  • 100% Canadian owned and operated.

QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS:

The ideal candidates will have practical experience within the tree care industry, including aerial operator and/or climbing skills, pruning experience, and tree-identification skills and leading a team of tree care professionals. Valid ISA certification (preferred), or willing to work towards this certification within an agreed period.

An ability to drive a manual transmission vehicle, and hold an air brakes endorsement is not required but beneficial. Maintain a high level of technical knowledge, and retain valid First Aid certification.Maintain a high level of technical knowledge, and retain valid First Aid & Fall Arrest certification. Knowledge of trees, insects, and diseases in order to provide recommendations for proper care.

Experience: Arborist: 1 year (Required) Crew Leader: 1 year (Required)

Licence: Class 5 Drivers License (Preferred), ISA Certified Arborist (Preferred), First Aid, Fall Arrest.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$40.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Climbing Arborist: 1 year (Required)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Arborist Crew Lead
description:
Arborist

Kentucky Blue Grass Ltd is looking for ISA Arborists tree workers or equivalent to add to our growing tree department. Kentucky Blue Grass is a landscaping and tree service company that specialize in residential, commercial and industrial properties. We service Edmonton and surrounding areas. We are looking to fill various positions for our upcoming season with people that are highly energetic, have a great work attitude and safe work practice. Applicants must have plenty of experience within the Tree Service industry. A clean driver’s license is also essential. You must be willing to work in all-weather conditions.

Duties would include:

-Tree pruning

- Tree removal

- Chain saw work

- Bucket Truck/Lift work

- Working at Heights

- Heavy Lifting

- Rigging

- Chipper work

- Tree Climbing (with and without spurs)

The position would ASAP. Starting wage would be from $28-30/hr. depending on skill set.

Experience 2 yrs

ISA Arborist ticket is an asset but not a requirement.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $28.00-$30.00 per hour

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $28.00-$30.00 per hour

Expected start date: 2021-09-10

title: Groundman
description:
Additional Locations: This role will require travel across Canada

Primary Locations: Manitoba, Winnipeg, 155 Transport Road, R0E 1J0

Requisition ID: 159648

Position Overview

As a Grounds Person you will be working to support the operations above; you will play an important part in both site set up and assistance to both climbers and trimmers. You will play a vital role in the safe execution of work for our crews and members of the public or clients. This role will provide newcomers to the tree industry with a better understanding of what we do at Davey and provide the right individuals with a career advancement opportunities and training.

Job Duties

  • Groundwork support for trimming operations.
  • Chainsaw and Chipper operation/loading brush.
  • Assist Crew leader in job- site setup, debris removal, cleanup and equipment maintenance.
  • Abide by industry safety policies and procedures.
  • Raking up/ leaf blowing job sites.
  • Rigging down limbs.

Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent preferred.
  • Valid provincial driver’s license. Licensed to drive a 5-ton vehicle and air brake endorsement considered an asset.
  • Willingness to work towards becoming a certified arborist.
  • Ability to lift and carry 50 lbs.
  • Previous landscape/horticulture experience considered an asset.
  • Ability to work safely as part of a team and possess the willingness to learn and progress.

Additional Information

  • Full time. Year-round employment.
  • Daily Per Diem and Lodging Provided.
  • Occasional overtime required.
  • Must be 18 years of age or older.
  • Excellent Benefits package, RRSP and careers advancement opportunities.
  • Employee owned company with stock purchase available after 1 year of service.
  • Davey Tree Expert Co. of Canada, Limited is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
  • Davey provides ongoing training.

Company Overview

Davey Tree Expert Co. of Canada, Limited has been performing tree care and vegetation management services across Canada since 1930. With over 850 employees, we continuously pride ourselves on unmatched quality and safety. Davey Tree has numerous crews that are professionally trained to provide tree trimming and removal services to ensure the scope of this contracted work is completed safely, and well before any deadlines. Our relatable experiences and industries serviced include notably Utilities, Municipalities, Government, Rail, Commercial and Residential.

Divisional Overview

We provide utilities, rail and road transport with safe and efficient right of way clearance services. Clients rely on us for timely resource mobilization during severe weather events and proactive planning services, such as system hardening and storm restorations.


We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. As a service provider, our success depends upon our ability to attract and retain qualified personnel, regardless of their age, race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics as established by federal, provincial law.


If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please email canada.recruiting@davey.com.

title: newExperienced Arborist
description:
As an arborist with our company, you will plant, maintain, and remove trees and other woody plants using your knowledge of tree anatomy and biology along with climbing and trimming skills. You must have exposure to all aspects of the arborist's role, this is a hands-on role, requiring a high degree of physical strength and dexterity to climb and prune trees or remove diseased or entire trees. You will spend your day in the field supporting the main arborist and crew, all while ensuring a clean, safe, and organized site.

Job duties would include controlling lowering ropes, supply tools for tree workers aloft, controlling road and sidewalk traffic as needed, performing daily, weekly, and monthly maintenance inspections on equipment, cut, chip and loading brush and wood, completing proper job site cleanup, assist other crew members in performing job duties, all while maintaining industry safety policies and procedures.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Seasonal

Salary: $25.00-$35.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • No weekends

COVID-19 considerations:
All work is completed outside and all safety precautions are followed by the crew and management.

Experience:

  • Tree Trimmers & Arborists: 1 year (required)

title: Junior / Intermediate Ecologist
description:
Palmer is seeking to hire a Junior or Intermediate Ecologist to support our service areas including Toronto, Bracebridge, Collingwood or Peterborough on a range of projects throughout Ontario.

This candidate will join our growing team of professionals that include terrestrial and aquatic ecologists, geomorphologists, hydrogeologists, and geotechnical engineers to work in a dynamic and collaborative work environment on multi-disciplinary projects.

Responsibilities:

The candidate should have strong field skills in plant identification, ecological land classification, wetland evaluation, familiarity with wildlife habitat assessments, and experience in managing a variety of multi-disciplinary projects. Work experience with Species at Risk is beneficial. Responsibilities will include:

  • Completing project background reviews, field investigations, data compilation and analysis and report writing.
  • Collecting field data and observations in an accurate and well-organized manner.
  • Completing tree inventory and protection plans, edge management plans and contributing to restoration plans.
  • Working collaboratively with the project team, with some understanding of integrating study disciplines.
  • Reviewing and summarizing environmental policies and legislation such as municipal official plans and the Endangered Species Act.
  • Assisting with environmental permitting and approval processes.
  • Project management.
  • Liaise with client and regulatory agencies.

Skills/qualifications:

  • Education Requirements: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in environmental science/management, biology, ecology or geography
  • 3 – 5 years of experience in a junior ecologist position or 5 plus years in an intermediate position in the areas of ecology, biology, plant science, or other related environmental discipline.
  • Ecological Land Classification and/or Ontario Wetland Evaluation System certification or demonstrated experience.
  • ISA Certified Arborist and GIS skills are an asset.
  • Experience with wildlife surveys for herpetofauna, birds, and/or mammals.
  • Excellent communication skills and experience working with multi-disciplinary teams to solve problems in a timely manner.
  • Ability to work independently and manage own schedule.
  • Access to a personal vehicle and a valid Class G driver’s license, with a clean driving record.

Work location:

There are options to be based out of Palmer’s Toronto or Bracebridge office, or growing service areas of Collingwood and Peterborough. We offer flexibility with regards to living location and remote work environments. The Ecologist will frequently work in the field at various project sites throughout Southern Ontario and potential opportunities in Western Canada.

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Employer RRSP Matching
  • Generous vacation and sick time allowances
  • Be a part of a friendly, energetic team

We believe in investing in good people! Palmer is a growing company and there’s plenty of opportunity to learn and advance your skill set.

Application instructions:

Please submit a resume and cover letter. We thank all those who apply, but only applicants that are shortlisted will be contacted.

At Palmer, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equitable employment opportunities are available to all applicants. We believe that diversity and inclusion among our team is critical to our success, and we seek to recruit, develop, and retain talented people from a diverse candidate pool. If you are a member of an underrepresented group, you are encouraged to self-identify on your application. Appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by Company policy and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

title: newArborist/Tree Truck Operator
description:
:

General Information:


As an equal opportunity employer, the City of Thunder Bay encourages applications from Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minority groups and women.


ONTARIO HUMAN RIGHTS CODE: It is a contravention of the Human Rights Code of Ontario to discriminate on the basis of: race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, age, record of offences, gender identity or gender expression. Therefore, a resume submitted to the City must not include references to any of the above characteristics. Do not include:

  • Photos
  • Any certificates that have photo identification
  • Driver’s licences
  • Police records checks

Note: The above documentation will be requested by the Human Resources & Division should you be the successful applicant. If a Criminal Record Check is required it will be requested by Human Resources should you be the successful applicant. Please do not submit your Criminal Record Check with your application.


ACCOMMODATION: Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for all parts of the recruitment process.


PRIVACY: Personal information on this form is collected under the authority of the Municipal Act, c. 302, as amended, and will be used to determine eligibility for employment. Questions about this collection of personal information should be directed to the Human Resources & Corporate Safety Division, 125 Syndicate Ave Suite 42, Thunder Bay, Ontario, P7E 6H8, Telephone: 625-3866


Application forms must reference the competition number and be submitted to Human Resources by 11:59 p.m. on the closing date.


Job Description:

POSITION SUMMARY: Under the general supervision of the Supervisor – Forestry & Horticulture and technical direction of the Leadhand Arborist, operates equipment and vehicles for the maintenance of Parks facilities and grounds. Must be willing to work at heights, be available for overtime and be available for emergency call-outs.


MAJOR TASKS:

  • Maintains trees from the ground, operates tree truck with aerial device or climbs trees using proper accepted tree climbing techniques and current arboriculture practices.
  • Working within a crew, performs tree trimming, tree removal, stump grinding and other vegetation management duties.
  • Operates equipment with machine operator classification.
  • Performs minor servicing of equipment.
  • Reports equipment defects to Supervisor.
  • Records data related to the operation of the Urban Forestry Program, as required.
  • Provides information to and responds to enquiries from the public regarding tree related concerns
  • Participates in work related safety training programs, staff training and development.
  • Carries out caretaker and maintenance duties on winter rinks if required.
  • Performs other Park Worker duties as may be assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:


Education/Experience:

  • Secondary school graduation; and
  • Current certification as an Arborist from either the International Society of Arboriculture (ISA) or Ministry of Training Colleges & Universities (MTCU) with a minimum of one (1) year experience conducting active tree care using aerial lifts and approved climbing techniques.
  • Must possess a valid certificate in chain saw operation

Skills/Abilities:

  • Must demonstrate an ability to work at heights from aerial lift platforms and tree climbing techniques.
  • Must be proficient in the operation of all equipment used in this classification
  • Must be capable of issuing and accurately comprehending written/oral information and instructions
  • Must have the ability to deal with the public in a tactful, courteous manner
  • Must be reliable and capable of performing routine work with minimum supervision
  • Must possess and maintain a valid Class “D” Ontario Drivers Licence, or equivalent with a ‘Z’ endorsement
  • Must meet the definition of a competent driver as defined by the Corporation
  • Must have a working knowledge of the Occupational Health and Safety Act as it applies to this work

Assets:

  • Current Working at Heights Training certification through the Ministry of Labour

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:

  • Will be required to attend ongoing training when necessary
  • Must remain a competent driver as defined by the Corporation
  • May be required to provide a successful driver’s record (uncertified)
  • Must be physically able of performing the assigned duties
  • Must undergo a successful Criminal Record and Judicial Matters Check (CRJMC)

description:

Duties would include the repairs, fertilizes, waters and pruning of trees, shrubs, the removal of dead or diseased trees, shrubs, mowing of lawns, and assisting in various maintenance work as required.

Candidates must have high school or an equivalent diploma, must be highly self motivated, as well as a great team player. Work will be outdoors in spring to fall weather conditions.

title: Utility Tree Trimmer
description:
Additional Locations: This role will require travel across Alberta

Primary Locations: Alberta, Nisku, 3800-13 Street, T9E 1C6

Requisition ID: 159614

Position Overview

As a Utility Tree Trimmer, you can rest assured that one day will never be the same as the other. In this role you will have a chance to travel to several work sites across a geographic area and put your certification as either a Certified Utility Arborist or Utility Tree Trimmer to work as you safely execute trimming for our utility clients; the work you do will ensure the ongoing and safe transmission of electricity.

Job Duties

  • Provide expert level tree trimming services and inspections to client properties.
  • Operate as an active crew member with supporting ground crew and crew leader.
  • Responsible for climbing, pruning, and removing trees as per work specifications.
  • Perform required general maintenance and daily inspection of equipment.
  • Removal or trimming of trees and brush encroaching onto utility or transportation rights of ways.
  • Properly maintain, prepare, and operate all tools and equipment including chainsaws, chippers, aerial lifts and more.
  • Manage customer service expectations, safely lead jobsite and crew operations.
  • Abide by Davey and industry safety policies and procedures.

Qualifications

  • Have a valid Utility Tree Trimmer/Certified Utility Arborist ticket.
  • 3 years experience performing pruning and removals from rope and saddle, and aerial lift.
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.
  • Advanced chainsaw and chipper operation.
  • Strong tree and shrub identification skills.
  • Valid provincial driver’s license. Licensed to drive a 5-ton vehicle and air brake endorsement considered an asset.
  • Ability to work safely as part of a team and possess the willingness to learn and progress.

Additional Information

  • Full time. Year-round employment.
  • Occasional overtime required.
  • Must be 18 years of age or older.
  • Excellent Benefits package, RRSP and careers advancement opportunities.
  • Employee owned company with stock purchase available after 1 year of service.
  • Davey Tree Expert Co. of Canada, Limited is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
  • Davey provides ongoing training.

Company Overview

Davey Tree Expert Co. of Canada, Limited has been performing tree care and vegetation management services across Canada since 1930. With over 850 employees, we continuously pride ourselves on unmatched quality and safety. Davey Tree has numerous crews that are professionally trained to provide tree trimming and removal services to ensure the scope of this contracted work is completed safely, and well before any deadlines. Our relatable experiences and industries serviced include notably Utilities, Municipalities, Government, Rail, Commercial and Residential.

Divisional Overview

We provide utilities, rail and road transport with safe and efficient right of way clearance services. Clients rely on us for timely resource mobilization during severe weather events and proactive planning services, such as system hardening and storm restorations.


We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. As a service provider, our success depends upon our ability to attract and retain qualified personnel, regardless of their age, race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics as established by federal, provincial law.


If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please email canada.recruiting@davey.com.

title: newVegetation Planner
description:
Company Overview

Davey Tree Expert Co. of Canada, Limited has been performing tree care and vegetation management services across Canada since 1930. With over 850 employees, we continuously pride ourselves on unmatched quality and safety. Davey Tree is the leading full-service tree care provider for residential, commercial, utility line clearing and forestry consulting throughout Canada. All crews are professionally trained to ensure the scope of our work is completed safely, and well before any deadlines.

Divisional Overview

Since 1930, Davey has been protecting and enhancing trees and urban forests in communities across Canada. Davey Resource Group (DRG), the consulting division of the Davey Tree Expert Co. of Canada, Limited, provides a comprehensive range of natural resource and utility consulting services to the commercial, residential, municipal, and governmental markets. In Canada, our expertise and services encompass arboriculture and forestry, right-of-way vegetation management, ecology and wildlife, and asset management.

Position Overview – Vegetation Management Planner

In this exciting role you will work within the growing, qualified, and experienced leaders in vegetation management and utility asset consulting. You will be out in the field conducting a number of different vegetation assessments. This role for the right individual will provide a long-term career with advancement opportunities.

Job Duties

· Patrol and assess right-of-way vegetation with the intent of translating operational plans and prescriptions into GIS for field execution.

· Pre-operation coordination, including permitting, liaise with Governmental Agencies, Clients and Contractors, participate in negotiations, notify property owners of planned work.

· Complete post-operational auditing, inspections and compliance measurements based on client requirements.

· Act as a forestry problem solver for the client to maintain safe and reliable power.

Qualifications

· University degree preferred in a forestry, environmental science or natural resource management or College diploma in related field.

· 3+ years’ experience in a related field such as arboriculture, vegetation management, forestry or utility line clearing.

· ISA Certified Arborist or Utility Tree Trimmer or Certified Utility Arborist required.

o Additional Certifications such as Utility Specialist, Tree Risk Assessment Qualification, Wildlife Danger Tree Assessor, Registered Professional Forester (RPF), or Pesticide Applicators License considered assets.

· Working knowledge of various forestry and utility aspects, including manual, mechanical and herbicide vegetation management.

· Valid provincial driver’s license.

· Strong leadership, interpersonal, organizational and communication skills.

· Ability to work safely both independently and as part of a team and possess the willingness to learn and progress.

· Experience with MS Office Suite and GIS software an asset.

Additional Information

· Full time. Year-round employment.

· Occasional overtime required.

· Must be 18 years of age or older.

· Excellent Benefits package, RRSP and careers advancement opportunities.

· Employee owned company with stock purchase available after 1 year of service.

· Davey Tree Expert Co. of Canada, Limited is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

· Davey provides ongoing training.

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. As a service provider, our success depends upon our ability to attract and retain qualified personnel, regardless of their age, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics as established by federal, provincial law.

Job Type: Full-time

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: newPower Saw Lead Operator
company: Sun Peaks Resort LLP/Sun Peaks Grand Hotel &...
description:
Work, Live and Play

Sun Peaks Resort LLP has proven to be one of the highest levels of guest service providers within the ski industry. We can promise you a memorable and gainful working experience within our high volume and challenging work environments. Sun Peaks Resort LLP has many benefits to offer our employees including:

  • Full access Summer Alpine Hike and Downhill Bike season pass
  • Employee access to Golf Membership and discounted Golf Cart season pass
  • Employee Health and Wellness Program including EFAP services
  • Companywide discounts and benefit programs
  • Eligibility to participate in our Peak Performer Recognition Program, awarded at the end of our summer season at a specially planned event
  • Reciprocal riding at other participating BC and Alberta bike parks

Position Overview:
As the Lead Power Saw Operator you will be working closely and supporting a small crew in several different locations and terrain in the controlled recreation area of Sun Peaks Resort.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

  • High school diploma or equivalent preferred
  • Minimum of 2 years experience with maintenance and safe power saw operation
  • High level of knowledge of the controlled recreation area of Sun Peaks Resort and its surrounding area
  • Valid BC provincial driver’s license
  • Certified arborist an asset
  • Ability to left and carry 50lbs
  • Valid First aid certification
  • Forest Safety training preferred
  • Ability to work as part of a team and possess the willingness to learn and progress

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Brush cutting using power and pole saws
  • Working on steep slopes and uneven ground
  • Tree girdling
  • Lead and document the morning safety meetings and review equipment needs, vehicle assignments, special instructions, PPE requirements, mountain information updates, weather, concerns, and successes, etc, setting daily completion goals
  • Proper utilization of all safety equipment and PPE required in the performance of daily activities and aligned with Worksafe BC safety standards
  • Ensure that equipment inventories are maintained and tools are available when needed.
  • Maintain and ensure all team equipment is in top working order (chainsaws, brush cutters, quads, SideXsides and ensure that appropriate action is taken to repair your tools.

Incentive Program:

If you are a student, currently enrolled in a college/university tourism and/or hospitality program, please note, that this role is eligible for fully reimbursed staff accommodation for the Summer season for successful applicants.

Please ensure you provide the required documentation and complete the information on your student status in the job application fields. (Conditions apply and will be discussed in detail with successful applicants during the interview and at the job offer stage).

If you have been referred by a current employee of Sun Peaks Resort/Sun Peaks Grand Hotel (or someone who has an accepted job offer for the Summer 2022 start), please ensure you indicate their name and current department in the required field in your application form.

title: Ground Crew
description:
Grounds Person

The Grounds person will work on a production crew with a Lead Certified Arborist. The Grounds person will support the crew from the ground to perform tree care and removals. This individual is a key member of the crew team and is relied upon to complete projects safely and efficiently. The successful candidate is a reliable, hardworking, analytical thinker who can perform physically demanding work in all types of weather conditions.


We are looking for an extremely keen and safety conscious person to fill this position who has a passion and interest in the Arboriculture industry and wants to learn more! This is an entry level position with opportunities for growth and advancement.


Position Requirements

  • Able to arrive on time with a professional appearance, positive attitude, eagerness to work, fit for work and fully equipped.
  • Capable of performing physically demanding manual labour in a variety of weather conditions.
  • Able to carry out all duties safely and efficiently while following the Company safety policies and procedures.
  • Provides innovative and thought-out solutions to issues in the workplace to increase customer loyalty and employee engagement.
  • Able to communicate clearly and concisely with clients, co-workers, and management.
  • Actively participates in meetings, tailboards, safety talks and provides valued input into constructive change.
  • Able to help create and maintain a positive and productive team environment and culture.
  • Capable of taking direction and feedback from crew leaders and management.
  • Able to perform ground support operations such as, but not limited to, rigging, cutting, brush management and chipping, site clean up, leaving site as it was when you arrived.
  • Able to perform rigging techniques to lower wood materials from heights.
  • Ensures end of day tasks are completed, (vehicles cleaned, washed, plugged in, equipment inspected, saws sharpened)
  • Accurately completes all necessary paperwork (timesheets, tailboards, truck checks, etc.)

Education/Assets
  • High school diploma or equivalent preferred.
  • Chainsaw training or certification.
  • Valid provincial driver's license. Class G license and clean driver abstract.
  • Willingness to work towards becoming a certified Arborist.
  • Ability to work safely as part of a team and possess the willingness to learn and progress.
  • First Aid/CPR considered an asset.
  • Knowledge of industry rules and regulations considered an asset.

Additional Information

  • 40-44 hours per week (depending on weather and season)
  • Overtime hours (beyond 44 hours per week) are likely, but not definite, during spring and summer months
  • Work hours are approximately Monday to Friday 6:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. in the spring/summer months and 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. in the fall/winter months (work hours may vary due to weather, etc.)

Wage Based on experience $17.00 to $20.00 per hour

Let us know why Safe Tree Ltd. is a great fit for you! Please submit an up-to-date cover letter and resume to our Operations Manager, Craig Hartwick via info@safetree.ca.

We’d love to have you on the Safe Tree team!

title: newTemporary Seasonal Parks and Grounds Worker
description:
JOB POSTING

Temporary Seasonal
Parks and Grounds Worker

May 6, 2022

The Village of Cumberland invites applications for the temporary/seasonal Parks and Grounds Worker position within the Village’s Parks Department.

The Parks and Grounds Worker completes general duties related to the maintenance, operation, and development of parks, trails, greenways, sports fields, gardens, street trees, boulevards, natural areas, and other municipal grounds. We are seeking energetic applicants who are comfortable working individually and within a team, and are willing to learn new skills that are important to the day-to-day operations of a small but vibrant community.

The successful applicant will be required to have a valid Class 5 driver’s license with a clean driver’s abstract, as well as a minimum of a one-year diploma or certificate in horticulture, arboriculture, or landscape management. The applicant should also have two years’ experience in a similar role within the last five years.

Backgrounds and training in the following will also be considered an asset:

  • ISA Certified Arborist
  • Level 1 Certified Irrigation Technician
  • Operation and maintenance of powered and non-powered equipment
  • Care and maintenance of trees, shrubs, and turf grass
  • Experience working in a public setting, with strong interpersonal skills

This position will start immediately and will end on October 28th, 2022. The successful candidate will be expected to work a 37.5 hour week, Monday to Friday, outside and in all weather conditions.

This is a Union position and subject to the Collective Agreement between the Village of
Cumberland and CUPE Local 556. The salary for this position will be $ 30.49 per hour (2022) with benefits and increases as per the Collective Agreement.

Applications will be received until the position is filled. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Job Title: Department: Supervisor's Title:
Parks and Grounds Worker Parks and Recreation Parks, Trails, and Lands

Supervisor

Classification:
Temporary Seasonal-Union

POSITION SUMMARY

Reporting to the Parks, Trails, and Lands Supervisor, the Parks and Grounds Worker is responsible for a variety of tasks in support of Village parks and grounds operations. The Parks and Grounds Worker completes general duties related to the maintenance, operations, and development of parks, trails and greenways, sports fields, gardens, medians, boulevards, natural areas and other municipal grounds within the Village of Cumberland.

CORE COMPETENCIES REQUIRED FOR THIS ROLE

  • Knowledge in horticulture, arboriculture and other landscape maintenance best practices and procedures
  • Strong initiative and ability to work independently
  • Energetic and motivated with a strong work ethic
  • Attention to detail
  • Attention to safe work procedures
  • Positive attitude with ability to work as part of a team and in public settings

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Below is a partial list of Key Responsibilities

The Parks and Grounds Worker, under the direct supervision of Parks, Trails, and Lands Supervisor, is to perform the activities necessary to diligently and timely complete the duties of the Parks and
Recreation department. Duties may include, but are not limited to, the following:

Parks and Grounds

  • Maintains municipal lawns, gardens, boulevards, medians, natural areas, and sports fields by grass cutting, watering, leaf collection, litter picking, and performing other general grounds maintenance activities.
  • Maintains and services municipal irrigation systems, and works with irrigation contractors, as necessary.
  • Assists in the construction and maintenance of municipal parks and greenways facility and trail infrastructure.
  • Assists in maintenance, construction, and labouring duties across the Village on community services including:

- Utility corridor management
- Streets, lanes, boulevards and sidewalks
- Refuse and litter collection and disposal
- Other civic grounds and facilities

  • Provides guidance and orientation to seasonal parks workers regarding park operations and general maintenance regimes, including training on small equipment.
  • Performs necessary inspection of small equipment being operated and performs minor maintenance as required including the reporting of maintenance and servicing requirements to their supervisor.
  • Safely operates a variety of equipment including, chainsaws, all-terrain vehicles, line trimmers, ride-on mowers and power tools.
  • Performs basic carpentry tasks, including use of saws and drills.
  • Undertakes other related duties and projects as assigned.

Horticultural and Arboricultural

  • Performs pruning, planting, watering, fertilizing and landscaping based on best practices in this region.
  • Demonstrates knowledge on plants native to the region including trees, understory shrubs and forbs, and their native ecosystems.
  • Provides recommendations on restoration planting and soil amendments.
  • Maintains trees in parks, greenways, boulevards, and provides recommendations for tree planting location, species selection, and maintenance works.
  • Assists with the design, installation, and ongoing maintenance of garden beds and planted areas.

This position also plays a key supporting role in the following functions:

Duties may include, but are not limited to:

General Duties

  • Assists in gathering and maintaining information and data necessary to meet internal and external requirements.
  • Prepares correspondence as required.
  • Purchasing of materials and supplies as needed while adhering to internal policies.
  • Performs any other department backup functions and other related duties as assigned.

GENERAL DEPARTMENT RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Ensures compliance to all Village policies, bylaws, agreements, contracts, and external regulations.
  • Provides input on modifications or improvements to policies, procedures and practices to improve the functioning of the Department; and provides input to written work procedures for own area of responsibility as requested.
  • Carries out safe work practices and adheres to safety and other work-related regulations; reports unsafe and/or insecure situations; and implements emergency procedures as directed.

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS

We may consider a combination of experience and education for an individual that is demonstrating sincere effort to complete a relevant post-secondary program.

Education:

  • Completion of Grade 12
  • Horticulture or Arboriculture Certificate (1yr)

Experience:

  • Two years’ experience in a similar role within the last five years

The ideal candidate will also have experience with:

o Maintenance of Municipal parks and grounds

The Ideal Candidate will have:

  • A diploma in Horticulture or Arboriculture from a recognized post-secondary institution
  • Completion of a WorkSafeBC-recognized basic chainsaw operator course
  • A Certified Irrigation Technician – Level 1
  • An ISA – Certified Arborist
  • An Occupational First Aid Level 1 ticket
  • Be experienced in operating various types of machinery on landscape sites
  • Have recent experience with landscaping and horticultural tasks
  • Knowledge and experience with restoration projects in natural areas
  • Demonstrated knowledge of irrigation system installation, operation, and maintenance
  • Self-motivated with excellent interpersonal skills
  • Ability to operate a variety of small equipment safely and efficiently
  • Sufficient physical strength, stamina and coordination to permit the performance of heavy manual outdoor work in all weather conditions
  • Strong interpersonal, communication, organizational, and time management skills.
  • Ability to deal with public in a courteous and tactful manner.
  • Ability to work well as a member of a team and independently.

REQUIRED LICENCES, CERTIFICATES AND ASSOCIATION MEMBERSHIPS:

  • Valid Class 5 Driver's License
  • Clear Driver’s abstract

POSITION SALARY:

The wage for this position is per Schedule A of the agreement between CUPE Local 556 and The Corporation of the Village of Cumberland.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 6 months

Salary: $30.49 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Terrestrial Ecologist
description:
How We Nurture:

  • Flexibility- remote work and flex hours options;
  • Variable Work Week- Option for Full or Part Time hours
  • Ownership opportunities- employee ownership is at the heart of our culture;
  • Professional development opportunities- we are committed to developing industry leaders;
  • Profit sharing;
  • Highly competitive compensation;
  • Company paid benefits including extended health care, dental, life insurance, EAP;
  • Performance-based annual bonus;
  • RRSP matching;
  • Flexible disciplines and career paths- work in the area that fuels your passion!

Our Next Hire
Ecologist – Full or Part Time (Guelph/Burlington/London)

Our Ecologists are experts in their field, bringing their combined technical and project management support to every project to help guide their teams and clients to success.

We are seeking a Terrestrial: a technical professional who thrives on bringing the pieces together and being a go-to project coordinator. An emerging leader, keen on transferring their knowledge and experience within their team.

Our team is known for our proactive approach, integrity, and quality product: we proudly stand by our high standards. We are a collective of dynamic individuals with high accountability to ourselves, our clients, and our teams, and our Ecologists are fundamental to this dynamic.

If you are looking for a chance to bring your energy and passion to a dynamic environment that will give your skills and potential the chance to truly shine - apply today and let's talk about how Beacon fits your life.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of five years of experience consulting in Terrestrial Ecology, or equivalent industry experience;
  • Experience with provincial and federal environmental regulatory procedures (environmental impact assessments/studies, due diligence studies, habitat restoration) and natural heritage policies in Ontario;
  • Strong written and verbal communication; and
  • Established terrestrial field skills including field investigations/inventories, monitoring assessment techniques, and/or habitat assessments.

Additional Bonus Variables (Not required, but good to have):

  • Ecological Land Classification training;
  • Ontario Wetland Evaluation (OWES) certification;
  • Certified Arborist;
  • Public and stakeholder consultation; and
  • Wildlife survey capability (e.g., amphibians, bats, birds, vegetation).

The Beacon Impact

Employee owned and operated for over 15 years, Beacon Environmental Limited is a steadily growing team of more than 40 dedicated and proactive environmental professionals with a collective mission to stand as the guiding light toward solutions to complex environmental challenges. We set the standards high, and our team delivers.

Joining our team is a journey into company ownership and with that comes the dynamic ability to carve your own career path within our community. We know our team is what makes Beacon Environmental Limited truly shine, and we provide the conditions for you to truly discover and develop the practice you want within our industry. We believe that a passion driven environment provides the highest quality project outcomes for our clients and the best possible opportunities for our growing team. We prioritize the development of our people into the experts and leaders of tomorrow.

Ready to Shine? How to Apply:

Apply directly through Indeed. We will respond to your application within three business days to advise you of the status of your application. Please take a moment to review our website http://www.beaconenviro.com/ or follow us on Linkedin https://ca.linkedin.com/company/beacon-environmental-limited

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Profit sharing
  • RRSP match
  • Wellness program
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Health and safety measures including mask-wearing are in place to protect staff and clients.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • consulting: 5 years (preferred)

title: newArborist - Utility Vegetation Management Coordinator
description:
Job Description:

West Country Energy Services is currently seeking individuals to fill a position to complete work throughout ALBERTA. Employment packages include a minimum of a 40-hour workweek, company vehicle, occasional opportunities for overtime and ample growth in the industry.

This field position will focus on assessing vegetation around powerlines and creating vegetation maintenance plans on Distribution or Transmission rights of way.

Preference will be given to applicants who have; 2 or 4-year diploma/ degree in forestry, horticulture, natural resources, or related field. ISA Certified Tree Worker, Certified Arborist, or Utility Specialist designation would be an asset. AND/OR at least 2 years experience related to herbicide application, mulching, tree falling, and tree trimming (climbing and/or from a bucket) is also considered an asset. Strong computer skills with a wide range of applications from Microsoft Excel to GPS technology will be used in this position.

Applications MUST include a covering letter and resume.

Shift schedules are 10 on & 4 off.

Required Tickets:

First Aid Class C

H2S Alive

Class 5 Drivers License

ISA Arborist and/or UUT-UTW

For more information please visit us at: www.westcountry.ca

Work Remotely

  • Company car

  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift

We have an in-depth Covid-19 response plan lead by our HSE Manager

title: newAssistant District Manager
description:
Additional Locations: na

Primary Locations: British Columbia, Vancouver, 1541 West 75th Avenue, V6P 6Z7

Requisition ID: 167113

Position Overview

In this role you will support the District Manager in team leadership and work execution in addition to building the customer base of the district in your territory. You will be relied on as an Arboriculture expert and be expected to provide insight and guidance to those on the team.

Job Duties

  • Oversee, direct and support several crews as well as office staff.
  • Be involved in all aspects of leadership including:
  • Recruitment
  • Employee Development
  • Training
  • Safety
  • Mentorship
  • Assist in the development of regional strategies in congruence with the Sales Arborist and District Manager to create and establish new business development opportunities.
  • Play an integral part in the sales of the district.
  • Equipment and asset management.

Qualifications


  • High School diploma with a minimum of 5 years’ industry experience.
  • 2 or 4-year post-secondary degree.
  • Certified Arborist an asset
  • Landscape Exterminator PHC License is an asset.
  • Valid provincial driver’s license. Licensed to drive a 5-ton vehicle and air brake endorsement considered an asset.
  • Strong leadership, interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills.

Additional Information

  • Company Vehicle Provided
  • Competitive Compensation Package with performance based bonus potential
  • Excellent Benefits package, RRSP and careers advancement opportunities.
  • Employee owned company with stock purchase available after 1 year of service.
  • Davey Tree Expert Co. of Canada, Limited is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
  • Davey provides ongoing training.
  • Continued advancement opportunities.

Company Overview

Davey Tree Expert Co. of Canada, Limited has been performing tree care and vegetation management services across Canada since 1930. With over 850 employees, we continuously pride ourselves on unmatched quality and safety. Davey Tree has numerous crews that are professionally trained to provide tree trimming and removal services to ensure the scope of this contracted work is completed safely, and well before any deadlines. Our relatable experiences and industries serviced include notably Utilities, Municipalities, Government, Rail, Commercial and Residential.

Divisional Overview

With residential tree service offices across Canada, Davey and our employees are dedicated to providing all aspects of professional tree care for our customers. Davey Tree arborists live and work in your community. Our widespread team allows us to build a relationship with our clients to provide an exceptional customer experience.


We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. As a service provider, our success depends upon our ability to attract and retain qualified personnel, regardless of their age, race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics as established by federal, provincial law.


If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please email canada.recruiting@davey.com.

title: newTree Trimmer - Bucket Operator
description:
Additional Locations: na

Primary Locations: Ontario, Pickering, 1661 Quigley Street, L1W 0A3

Requisition ID: 167132

Position Overview

As a Utility Tree Trimmer, you can rest assured that one day will never be the same as the other. In this role you will have a chance to travel to several work sites across a geographic area and put your certification as either a Certified Utility Arborist or Utility Tree Trimmer to work as you safely execute trimming for our utility clients; the work you do will ensure the ongoing and safe transmission of electricity.

Job Duties

  • Provide expert level tree trimming services and inspections to client properties.
  • Operate as an active crew member with supporting ground crew and crew leader.
  • Responsible for climbing, pruning, and removing trees as per work specifications.
  • Perform required general maintenance and daily inspection of equipment.
  • Removal or trimming of trees and brush encroaching onto utility or transportation rights of ways.
  • Properly maintain, prepare, and operate all tools and equipment including chainsaws, chippers, aerial lifts and more.
  • Manage customer service expectations, safely lead jobsite and crew operations.
  • Abide by Davey and industry safety policies and procedures.

Qualifications

  • Have a valid Utility Tree Trimmer/Certified Utility Arborist ticket.
  • 3 years experience performing pruning and removals from rope and saddle, and aerial lift.
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.
  • Advanced chainsaw and chipper operation.
  • Strong tree and shrub identification skills.
  • Valid provincial driver’s license. Licensed to drive a 5-ton vehicle and air brake endorsement considered an asset.
  • Ability to work safely as part of a team and possess the willingness to learn and progress.

Additional Information

  • Full time. Year-round employment.
  • Occasional overtime required.
  • Must be 18 years of age or older.
  • Excellent Benefits package, RRSP and careers advancement opportunities.
  • Employee owned company with stock purchase available after 1 year of service.
  • Davey Tree Expert Co. of Canada, Limited is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
  • Davey provides ongoing training.

Company Overview

Davey Tree Expert Co. of Canada, Limited has been performing tree care and vegetation management services across Canada since 1930. With over 850 employees, we continuously pride ourselves on unmatched quality and safety. Davey Tree has numerous crews that are professionally trained to provide tree trimming and removal services to ensure the scope of this contracted work is completed safely, and well before any deadlines. Our relatable experiences and industries serviced include notably Utilities, Municipalities, Government, Rail, Commercial and Residential.

Divisional Overview

We provide utilities, rail and road transport with safe and efficient right of way clearance services. Clients rely on us for timely resource mobilization during severe weather events and proactive planning services, such as system hardening and storm restorations.


We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. As a service provider, our success depends upon our ability to attract and retain qualified personnel, regardless of their age, race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics as established by federal, provincial law.


If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please email canada.recruiting@davey.com.

title: Landscaper
description:
We are looking for a professional Landscaper in Waterloo area. Knowledge and experience operating compact tractors/Skid Steerer are a must.


About iRestify

iRestify is a technology company that provides all-in-one cleaning and maintenance services.  Our culture is distinctively entrepreneurial, positive, and fun. We look for people who are curious, have ideas and want to contribute, and who want to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be collaborative, smart, hardworking and, above all, work as a team. If this sounds like a good fit for you, we would like to hear from you!


Scope of Work  
  • Schedule: Twice a week, Tuesday and Friday from 8 am to 11 am, (6 hours a week) 
If you are interested for extra hours, * Mon, Wed and Thurs - 8 am to 11 am (Day Porter job in the same building )*

  • Fixed term contract (3 Years)
  • Operate Compact Tractor/ Lawn care equipment for garbage disposal
  • Assist with general yard maintenance and clean up
  • Observe safe work practices or “safely transport and dispose the waste"
  • May perform some additional tasks as assigned by the company

Must-Haves to Be Considered  
  • Knowledge & Experience to operate Compact Tractor/ Heavy-duty Lawn care equipment (It is a requirement)
  • Physically able to carry and lift up to 100 lbs (Mandatory)
  • Previous work experience in maintaining Landscape is an asset
  • Willingness to work as a contractor
  • Willing to undergo a criminal background check for each team member working with us
  • Mobile phone with internet access
  • Be reliable, professional, on time and detail-oriented

How a contract will be assigned  
  • Only experienced professionals can be called by our operations team
  • If you are is selected, we will propose you a first test job. We will walk you through the required standards and see if the cooperation works for both parties.
  • We rely on a tight network of highly skilled subcontractors who grow their business with us and to whom we provide regular opportunities to provide services for our clients.

How you will get paid  
  • Perform service(s) as booked on a Mon-Sun cycle
  • The following week, you will be sent an invoice draft for you to confirm
  • Payment is done by direct deposit each Friday for the prior week

Why contractors love iRestify  
  • Competitive rates
  • Flexible schedule (accept services based on your availability)
  • Weekly payment
  • Opportunity to grow your business 
  
Job Types:  Fixed term contract (3 years),
Frequency: Twice a week (6 hours per week)
Wage Rate:  $20-$23/hour
 

We thank all the candidates who showed interest in the job posting. Only  shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Start Date: As soon as possible

title: Landscaper
description:
Hollywood Blvd landscapes is a Landscape Design/Build and Maintenance service business, operating in Oakville for over 30 years. Our team is close-knit, skilled, fun and friendly, and we're always looking for great people to join our team, and help us build toward our goal of being a premier landscape company in Oakville.

Our work environment includes:

  • Growth opportunities
  • On-the-job training
  • Lively atmosphere

Members of our Landscape crews are responsible for performing a variety of work tasks (generally physical labor) in order to assist with the completion of landscape construction projects and maintenance services. The landscape laborer will be required to operate a variety of tools and equipment to carry out specified job tasks.

We are looking for a candidate that will:

- Perform as team player with focus on optimism and a willingness to learn

-Efficiently complete landscape tasks according to instructions

-Maintains our goals of customer satisfaction and a job well done

Typical Tasks:

a) Assist a crew to construct walkways and patios, walls, fences, decks, gardens, lawn areas, b) Plant and maintain garden beds
c) cut, trim, blow and care for lawns
d) Load and unload materials, tools, and equipment required to complete landscape construction projects
e) Transport materials using shovels, wheelbarrows, carts, dollies, and hand lifting/carrying f) Operate various tools hand tools including: sod cutters, tamper, lawn mowers/trimmers, blowers, pruners/shears/shovels, etc.
g) Potentially drive trucks/trailers only as skill levels permit

Requirements:

The successful candidate will: Follow instructions • Perform work quickly and efficiently • Have the ability to walk, stand, crouch for long periods of time and carry out strenuous physical tasks - physical stamina is required • Valid driver’s license and safe driving record • Ability to work with hand tools, power tools, small engine equipment and with various materials with instruction • Ability to lift and carry during work shift • Ability to work in a fast paced environment 

Minimum Qualifications and Educational Requirements:

1. High School Diploma, GED or equivalent

2. Valid G license in good standing

3. Preference given to candidates with one or more years’ experience in the landscape maintenance/construction industry

Work Conditions:

Work is primarily on residential properties in the Oakville/Burlington area, and always in the great outdoors!

title: ARBORIST I (6-Month Contract)
description:
Job Description:

Exciting things are happening at the City of Brampton. Take a look at what employees are working on related to our Term of Council Priorities moving us forward towards The Brampton 2040 Vision.

 

 

ARBORIST I (6-Month Contract)

 

 

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

   

Reporting to the Foreperson, Urban Forestry, provide care and maintenance to the Cityâ€™s urban forest. Inspects, trims and prunes trees; identifies and diagnoses treatment for diseased/damaged trees. Operates equipment/tools; ensures safety in operations.

  • Efficiently carry out pruning or removal of trees, ensuring the safety of climber and ground crew. Ascends tree using rope and safety saddle, lifelines or aerial bucket truck as needed. Attaches lines to affected limb or wood, cuts and lowers limb/wood working in conjunction with assigned crew and equipment, i.e. crane, and truck. Chips and cuts fallen trees.
  • Tree maintenance in the vicinity of hydro wires and compliance with all procedures and guidelines.
  • Operates aerial truck with hydraulic lifting device, inspect the site for access and positioning of the truck
  • Operates 5-ton dump truck, brush chipper, and a variety of power tools. Ensures all equipment is safely maintained and operated, checks on a daily basis and performs preventive maintenance and minor repairs.
  • Respond to emergency tree concerns at any time â€“ this could include clearing storm damaged trees in inclement weather or poor lighting.
  • Respond to public complaints about a tree.
  • Inspecting properties to determine ownership of trees with the use of GIS.
  • Provide care and maintenance of all City trees.
  • Performs tree surgery under the direction of Arborist II (i.e. pruning, bracing, clearing and marking work-site for public safety. Responds to emergencies including on a yearly call-out basis, to perform tree surgery, remove trees, etc.).
  • Assists the Exterminator in spraying and feeding operations; mixing, applying chemicals, etc.
  • Assists in tree planting operations, operating trucks and equipment to plant, stake and tie trees.
  • Responds to complaints and investigates accident reports regarding damage to City trees.
  • Directs crew (part-time and seasonal staff) in the pruning of street trees and small surgery, with minimal supervision.
  • Responsible for the visual inspection and cleaning of all tools.
  • Performs snow removal duties, including sanding.
  • Performs additional similar and related duties as assigned.

SELECTION CRITERIA:

  • High School (Grade 12) graduation plus an additional program of up to one year in Urban Tree Maintenance or equivalent
  • Over two (2) years and up to and including four (4) years of experience in an urban forestry environment with proven tree climbing experience
  • Safety & Awareness for Line Clearing Certificate from the Infrastructure Health and Safety Association (IHSA)
  • Valid non-probationary Ontario class DZ driverâ€™s licence
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on customer service
  • Ability to work independently or as part of a team
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite

 

**Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the selection criteria.

 

Job status:   Contract

Job Type:      Union

 

Hourly rate:    $31.95

Applications must be received by July 1, 2022

Alternate formats will be provided  upon request.

 

   

If this opportunity matches your interest and experience, please apply online by clicking the button above, by July 1, 2022  and complete the attached questionnaire. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The successful candidate(s) will be required, as a condition of employment, to execute a written employment agreement. A Criminal Record Search will be required of the successful candidate at their own expense to verify the absence of a criminal record for which a pardon has not been granted.

 

Preference will be given to students that have a permanent residency in Brampton.

 

As part of the application process, applicants will be invited to complete a self identification survey. The survey is voluntary. Participation in the survey will have no impact on hiring decisions.   All information collected is confidential and will not be shared with the hiring manager. The surveys will be anonymized and will be kept separate from applicant or employee files, such that the individuals who completed the surveys will not be identifiable.   The results of the survey will assist in the analysis of disaggregated metrics for organizational planning purposes and our commitment to advance and foster diversity, equity, and inclusion. The City may use anonymized data to produce aggregate reports for internal or external use.

 

Please be advised, the City of Brampton uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicantâ€™s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the Job Competition and your application will be removed from the Competition.

 

The City is an equal opportunity employer.   We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If you require any accommodations at any point during the application and hiring process, please contact TalentAcquisition@brampton.ca or 905-874-2150 with your accommodation needs, quoting the job opening ID#, job title. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

title: Arborist Climber
description:
If you enjoy working outdoors in a professional and safe environment, consider a career with Bartlett Tree Experts! At Bartlett, we value a strong culture of excellence in safety, scientific research, lifelong learning, and career development.





As an Arborist Climber, you will be an integral member of a tree care crew with the primary responsibility of tree climbing and assisting Arborist Crew Leaders in performing all tree and shrub care services on residential and commercial properties.









We offer competitive compensation, as well as:



+ A safety-first culture and professional workplace


+ Advancement opportunities - we promote from within


+ Life, LTD, ADD, medical and dental


+ RPP Plan, Healthcare spending account, and paid vacation and holidays


+ Industry credential/license pay increases


+ Company-paid uniforms, PPE, gear, and equipment


+ Boot reimbursement up to $200


+ Access to training, continuing education programs, and a variety of resources provided by the Bartlett Tree Experts Research Laboratories






To find out more about what life is like at Bartlett, check us out on Instagram @LifeatBartlett.









As an Arborist Climber, you will play an important role in:



+ Performing ground, tree climbing, and aerial lift duties in support of specific job assignments, as directed by the Arborist Crew Leader and Local Manager


+ Safely performing all aspects of arboriculture, including:



+ Pruning


+ Cabling and bracing


+ Rigging


+ Removals


+ Properly maintaining and operating equipment (hand tools, chainsaws, chippers, and aerial lifts)




+ Learning, understanding, and adhering to all safety rules and company safety policies





+ A passion for nature, the environment, and the outdoors


+ At least one (1) year of tree climbing (DdRT or SRT) and aerial lift operation experience in the tree care industry


+ Valid driver's license and clean motor vehicle record (Class B CDL preferred)


+ Ability to work outdoors year-round in all weather conditions






The F. A. Bartlett Tree Expert Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer.








Summerland

BC

Production Arborist

5/5/2022

Regular Full-Time



ID: 2022-14562

External Company URL: https://englishcareers-bartlett.icims.com

title: Arborist I - Certified - (Job Number: 43065)
description:
Description43065
Qualifications

Looking for a great place to work? A place where our culture means safety, respect, quality and excellence and putting our customer’s interests ahead of our own? Then think City of Edmonton - City Operations. 


We strive to help our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone’s contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth and provides continuous opportunities for development. 


As an Arborist I, you will be maintaining our Urban Forest with best practices in pruning, maintenance and plant health care. Some key responsibilities will be to: 

  • Ensure safety, structural development and health of trees by utilizing hand, power, hydraulic tools and aerial lift units
  • Ensure trees are free of broken, crossing/rubbing branches, dead/diseased wood and damaged wood 
  • Remove and/or pile branches and brush 
  • Provide proper clearances above roads and sidewalks, from traffic signs, streetlights, buildings and other trees 
  • "Train" trees to maintain a shape that is consistent with characteristics of its species 
  • Ensure sidewalk and street clearance as well as accommodating park settings 
  • Attend to storm-damaged trees (usually broken or split limbs) 
  • Remove of tree stakes as necessary 
  • Remove adventitious growth (water sprouts & suckers) as required 
  • Bolt, cable and brace in non-complex situations 
  • Thin tree crown to limit stress on the portion of trunk weakened by the cavity or an injury 
  • Perform surgeries by tracing damaged wood with a surgery knife rounding the margins 
  • Remove small and large trees following directions from Parks Leader and Arborist II 
  • Chip trees as required 
  • Know how to use chipping equipment safely and how to maintain chipping schedules 
  • Complete structural risk assessments 
  • Identify tree pests and diseases and identify tree health care issues in the early stages 
  • Work on public complaints (tree problems and concerns) and attend to tree work generated by requests/complaints
  • Other related duties as required

title: Junior Certified Arborist
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

Our Waterloo office is looking to fill an Arborist / Field Technician position in our growing Canadian Operations.

Responsibilities:

  • Carrying out accurate and complete tree inventories in support of a range of projects according to applicable guidelines, by-laws, and best management practices (BMPs);
  • Assisting with the preparation of Arborist Reports, Tree Protection and Preservation Plans, and Restoration/Compensation Tree Planting Plans;
  • Providing accurate and complete field notes;
  • Data entry and data management;
  • Working with CAD and/or GIS teams to produce figures;
  • Collect point and topographic survey data to support tree inventory and arborist activities;
  • Providing field and office support to other members of the group as required (e.g., botanical inventories, Ecological Land Classification, amphibian calling surveys, benthic surveys, erosion and sediment control inspections, water quality sampling and flow measurements, sanitary and storm sewer monitoring, statistical analyses, data entry and table preparation, etc.);
  • Providing support to other groups or initiatives as required (e.g., construction oversite);
  • Travel (generally within the province) will be required – an estimated 70% of time will be out of the office (dependent on project and seasonal requirements);
  • Handling and disposing of samples and sampling equipment weighing up to 50 lbs;

Skills and Qualifications:

  • 0-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in a consulting environment;
  • Degree, Diploma or Certificate in Ecology, Biology, Forestry, Horticulture, Landscape Architecture, Arboriculture or related fields an asset;
  • Credentials as an International Society of Arboriculture (ISA) Certified Arborist or ability to acquire ISA certification within 3 months of employment;
  • Strong vegetation identification skills
  • ISA Tree Risk Assessment Qualification (TRAQ) an asset
  • Canadian Inspector of Sediment and Erosion and Control (CISEC) certification an asset;
  • Experience completing Site surveys using traditional survey methods and real-time kinematic (RTK) global positioning system (GPS) units
  • Detail-oriented, ability to provide accurate field and data records;
  • Familiar and proficient with electronic data collection;
  • Ability to read and understand engineering drawings/plans;
  • Ability to exercise good judgment;
  • Self-motivated and able to balance multiple tasks;
  • Strong organizational, interpersonal and communication skills;
  • Great teammate, collaborative with other staff;
  • Ability to meet challenging deadlines;
  • Comfortable working for extended durations throughout all seasons and during inclement/adverse weather conditions;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; and
  • Must own a reliable vehicle and hold a valid driver’s license;

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process..

title: Élagueur(euse)
description:
On vous surnomme « Maître castor » grâce à vos nombreuses connaissances sur les arbres et vos talents de coupe ? Venez rejoindre notre équipe composée de 36 élagueurs. Pour son Service des travaux publics, la Ville de Laval est à la recherche d’:

ÉLAGUEUR(EUSE)

Poste temporaire

Les défis qui vous attendent :

Vous serez appelé à effectuer divers travaux comportant l’élagage, le boulonnage, l’haubanage et la chirurgie des arbres afin d’en assurer le développement normal et la conservation. Aussi, vous effectuez l’abattage des arbres nuisibles et/ou dangereux.

Le profil recherché :

  • DEP en arboriculture-élagage
  • Permis de conduire classe 3 ;
  • Carte ASP construction (SST) ;
  • Excellentes aptitudes pour le travail d’équipe et les communications interpersonnelles ;
  • Bonne condition physique afin d’effectuer des travaux d’élagage par la méthode de la grimpe ;
  • Ne pas avoir d'empêchement judiciaire en lien avec l'emploi. 

Exceptionnellement, si aucun candidat ne répondait à l'ensemble du profil recherché, les exigences du poste pourraient être adaptées en fonction de l'état du marché de l'emploi.

Le processus de sélection :

  • Le processus de sélection inclut notamment une entrevue, la prise de référence ainsi qu’un examen médical. 

Horaire de travail :

  • 36 heures / semaine réparties du vendredi au dimanche, de jour
  • 36 heures / semaine réparties du lundi au jeudi, de jour (actuellement non disponible, possibilités éventuelles)

Salaire offert : 26.80$ / h

Lieu de travail : Garage municipale (2550 boul. Industriel)

La Ville de Laval est continuellement à la recherche de professionnels compétents et dynamiques qui désirent se joindre à une organisation entreprenante.  La Ville s’engage à vous offrir un milieu de travail stimulant !

Prenez part au changement dès maintenant !

La Ville de Laval applique un programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi. Elle valorise la diversité et invite les femmes, les minorités visibles, les minorités ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à poser leur candidature. Pour ces dernières, ne pas hésiter à nous faire part d’arrangements spéciaux nécessaires, advenant que vous soyez invité à un processus de sélection.
