Aussi, vous effectuez l’abattage des arbres nuisibles et/ou dangereux.', 'Salaire offert\xa0: 26.80$ / h']

title: Consulting Arborist
description:
The Opportunity 
McElhanney Ltd. has a rewarding opportunity for a Consulting Arborist to join our team in Langley, BC! Our arborists enjoy a diverse portfolio of work as part of a well-integrated technical consulting team. As a self-motivated individual, you will be a key player in creating efficiencies for our clients, our company, and our team. As the adaptable individual that you are, you speak the same technical language as our multidisciplinary consultants while bringing a unique twist. In this role, you will be responsible for conducting tree risk assessments, site monitoring, and reporting. 

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Tag bylaw-sized trees on site, document their condition, and coordinate locations with survey crews
  • Conduct tree risk assessments for private homeowners, municipalities, or other public entities
  • Assess tree retention suitability within and adjacent to land development/improvement projects, including protected environmental areas, to ensure Worksafe BC compliance
  • Supervise and monitor active sites to ensure tree protection guidelines are maintained throughout the construction phase
  • Conduct root and crown pruning using hand-held tools and methods
  • Produce technical reports to satisfy municipal requirements, Tree Preservation Plans, and Tree Replacement Plans
  • Use AutoCAD and GIS software to collect field data and produce tree drawings
  • Perform advanced diagnostics utilizing diagnostic equipment to detect and quantify internal flaws in trees, IML Resistograph is preferred.

What You’ll Bring 
  • Must possess ISA Certification and an ISA Tree Risk Assessment Qualification   
  • At least 5 years’ experience working as an Arborist in a consulting capacity
  • Experience reviewing civil grading/servicing plans, architectural plans, landscape plans, etc. is required
  • Experience estimating projects and demonstrated client liaison skills
  • Familiarity with Lower Mainland municipal tree protection bylaws is required, particularly Township of Langley and Surrey
  • Experience preparing reports to satisfy municipal or other agency requirements as applicable for specific projects
  • Proven competency in presenting to public and/or Councils and Committees as required 
  • Class 5 BC Driver’s License required.
  • Proficiency in AutoCAD, ArcGIS and other related mapping software is preferred.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle
  • Flexibility to work remotely
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching
  • Employee & Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support online or over the phone
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Competitive salary, participation in our generous performance bonus plan, and opportunity to join an employee-owned firm with potential share ownership
  • Financial assistance to support your relocation
  • Continuous support for your growth through professional development reimbursement, mentorship programs, and the opportunity to join numerous internal committees.


About McElhanney

Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As an employee owned and operated firm with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high level of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people

#Intermediate #Hybrid #LI-AM3
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Arborist
description:
Our thriving commercial tree care, law and property maintenance company in Waterloo region is looking for a hard working Arborist to join our team for full time, year round employment.

We work Monday to Friday, starting each day at our Shop in Waterloo.

We are looking for some who can:

  • Be motivated and self starting with the ability to follow direction and take initiative to get the job done
  • Maintain, prune, plant and remove municipal trees in accordance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act, our policies and procedures and industry Arboriculture best practices
  • Identify various woody plants, knowledgeable of the basic principles of plant function, arboricultural science, techniques and plant health care
  • Understand and document work orders while delivering excellent customer service
  • Ooerate chainsaws, chippers and other equipment
  • Properly maintain all tools and equipment
  • Install and inspect structural support systems
  • Safely prune or remove large limbs using advanced rigging techniques
  • Drive a truck with a trailer

 

Our Ideal Candidate has

  • Experience climbing with ropes and harness in the tree care industry
  • Has a valid “G” license required with a clean Driver’s Abstract- high licensing is a bonus however we are willing to train
  • Has or is working towards an ISA Certification or Ontario Licensed Arborist
  • The ability to lift and carry 50 lbs.
  • The bility to work safely as part of a team and possess the willingness to learn and progress

Our Company offers

  • Full time year-round work
  • Health Benefits
  • Training allowance
  • Uniform & boot allowance
  • Monday to Friday work schedule
  • $29 to $32 per hour

title: Arborist
description:
Experienced, Climbing Arborist

  • With a full G drivers license in good standing.
  • Applicants should have at least 2 years arborist experience and be ISA certified or prepared to write ISA certification test when eligible.
  • This position requires the candidate to perform all aspects of arboriculture.
  • Green Bird Horticultural is an established, growing arboriculture, horticulture and consulting business that puts its employee's first. In order to give our clients outstanding service, our staff need to be outstanding.
  • Looking for a great place to work and grow your career? Green Bird Horticultural could be just the place for you!
  • The owner has 35 years in the industry and is the primary consulting arborist and estimator.
  • We are looking to add keen, energetic professionals to our team that are committed to advancing their skill set and providing service excellence.

Reference ID: Arborist 2021

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $25.00-$30.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
We have responded to COVID-19 by traveling to job sites individually to comply with physical distancing. Our worksites are outdoors, which significantly reduces the risk of Covid-19 transmission.

title: Landscape Maintenance Crew Member/Labourer
description:
We are looking for hardworking, independent individuals to be a part of the company for the 2021 landscaping season (and beyond). The position begins as soon as possible. Qualified individuals have a chance at being part of our property maintenance division. Our maintenance division provides property services such as garden and lawn care, tree planting and sod laying.

Responsibilities of the job include:

  • General maintenance labour tasks such as weekly lawn maintenance, weeding, pruning, edging, hedge trimming, transplanting & planting, tree and shrub removal, spreading mulch, laying sod.
  • Being a hard, tough worker. Some days can be extremely hot and a lot of jobs are tough. Be prepared to work hard.
  • Attention to detail. We service high-profile clients and doing a detailed and quality job is very important.
  • Cleanliness and politeness
  • Must be able to punctually get to Dundas (near Hwy 6 and York Road) each work morning

Benefits:

  • Every day is spent outdoors.
  • You will work hard, but you'll get healthy, tan, and strong in the process.
  • Working with a crew of some awesome people.
  • Opportunities to advance within an expanding company
  • Opportunities to get industry certified through the Horticulture Technician Apprenticeship Program

Wage is dependent on experience (between $17-$20) for Landscape Labourer position.

Work experience & Requirements:

  • Experience in the landscaping field. You must be skilled at lawn maintenance (mowing, trimming, etc...).
  • Being familiar with plants, gardening, and landscaping.
  • Willingness to work hard and to learn

Education:

  • Enrolment or graduation in courses relating to horticulture, construction, or landscaping welcomed.
  • CHT and CLT Landscape Industry Certifications are a strong asset.

title: Gardener
description:
Job Description:

Part-Time; Casual (April â€“ August/September)

Date Posted: April 7, 2022

 

Who we areâ€¦

 

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 111-year old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of approximately $58 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams:   the 15 day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events.   The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance.   The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best we can be.

 

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organizationâ€™s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution.   With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to â€œDeliver Memorable Experiencesâ€ for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees, or the community.

 

We are looking for hardworking and passionate individuals in part-time and full-time capacities to ensure that our grounds are maintained and kept to a high standard for our guests and community. The Gardener of the PNE Tech Services Department will work under the direction of the Manager, Tech Services and garden, manage and cultivate various plants, flowers and shrubs that are on the PNE site.

 

Why join our Team?

 

  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Flexible work environment
  • Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more
  • Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to create lasting memories and friendships!

 

What will you do this year?

 

In your role as a Gardener, your primary accountabilities will be to:

 

  • Responsible for taking care of the various plants, flowers, and shrubs that are present on the grounds
  • Plant, cultivate, fertilize, and prune numerous varieties of plants, flowers, shrubs, bushes, and trees
  • Assign and supervise the work of one or more Gardenerâ€™s Helpers engaged in routine gardening tasks
  • Ensure projects are completed within specified time and notify supervisor if difficulties arise, while accurately completing timesheets and documentation of work
  • Operate and maintain gardening equipment and tools
  • Maintain a safe and clean work environment
  • Maintain clean hygiene and following company COVID protocols
  • Perform other related duties as assigned

 

What else?

  • Must have a valid class 5 BC Driverâ€™s License
  • Currently enrolled or have training/certification from a recognized horticultural, arboriculture and/or landscaping programs; or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Min. of 3+ years of gardening experience is preferred
  • Proven knowledge of planting, cultivating and care of a wide variety of plants, shrubs, trees and flowers; of methods, materials, tools and practices
  • Ability to perform continuous strenuous activity and able to work in physically awkward positions
  • Capable of working at heights and lifting heavy materials up to WCB restrictions
  • Possess knowledge of the hazards and proper safety precautions of the construction trades
  • Ability to communicate with the public and answer gardening related questions as required
  • Comfortable working in all weather conditions: rain, snow, and sun
  • Possession of the following certification is considered an asset: Certification in use of Aerial Work Platforms and Counterbalance Forklifts, Tree Risk Assessment Qualification (TRAQ), Pesticide Applicator Certificate, completion of a recognized chainsaw safety course
  • Candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check

 

Who are you?

 

  • Passionate
  • Horticulturist
  • Team player
  • Detail-oriented

 

Where and when to APPLY?

 

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

 

 

The PNE is proud to be an  equal  opportunity  employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at  

hr@pne.ca

.

title: Landscape Construction Crew Member
description:
• Assist in the construction of retaining wall systems, fences and stonework projects
  • Demonstrate best practices and GLS process standards in relation to jobs performed, including but not limited to: sodding, perennial, shrub, tree, planting, soil work and over seeding, seasonal urn displays, etc.
  • Operation, maintenance and transport of various landscaping equipment: excavator, stone saws, chain saws, destumper, chipper, vibro plate, drills and various hand tools
  • Occasional pickup and delivery of soft and hardscape materials

Qualifications: previous experience with landscaping/construction, valid G license an asset

title: Caretaker
description:
JOB POSTING #:    2022-0105

POSTING PERIOD:  Monday, May 9, 2022 at 8:30 a.m. to Friday, May 13, 2022 at 4:30 p.m. 

DEPARTMENT:       Security, Special Activities, City Hall Campus

UNION:   C.U.P.E. Local 543

JOB CODE: 543085

POSITION STATUS:  Regular Part-Time  

GRADE/CLASS: 0.06

# OF POSITIONS:   2

RATE OF PAY:         $22.03 to $25.93 per hour.

SHIFT WORK REQ'D:Yes.

DUTIES:

  • Reporting to Service Director, Security, Special Activities, City Hall Campus or designate, this position will perform all necessary cleaning duties in the facilities such as sweeping, mopping, dusting, cleaning washroom facilities, furniture, windows, walls, ceilings, floors, carpet cleaning, vacuuming, cleaning sinks and toilets, air vents, appliances, collect garbage, and replenish paper and chemical supplies. 
  • Incumbent will be required to write reports for stock, report maintenance and building repair issues. 
  • Will perform minor repairs as required. 
  • Will be responsible for minor repairs such as replacement of lights, perform outside duties related to entrances such as snow removal and cleaning, and perform security duties.
  • Will assist with furniture moving, set up rooms for special events, strip, wax and polish floors.
  • May be required to use a forklift to assist in deliveries and/or garbage bins.
  • May be required to use a golf cart to bring garbage to dumpster.
  • Incumbent will be required to perform all general tasks associated with the operation of caretaking division, including basic maintenance of all equipment used and keeping it clean.
  • Will be required to attend all mandatory in-service training and maintain professional relations with the public and fellow staff. 
  • Will perform Occupational Health & Safety duties as outlined in the Corporation’s Health and Safety Program. 
  • Will perform other related duties as required.

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must have an Ontario Secondary School Graduation Diploma or Ontario Ministry of Education equivalency;
  • Must have up to three (3) months of experience with current cleaning practices, WHMIS, operation and maintenance of cleaning equipment;
  • Must hold and maintain a current valid and lawful Class ‘G’ Driver’s License in accordance with the Highway Traffic Act, for the purposes of operating a City of Windsor vehicle and provide a driver’s abstract as a condition of employment;
  • Must be able to complete assigned duties with a minimum of supervision;
  • Must maintain good relations with corporate staff and general public;
  • Must be willing and able to work any shift;
  • General knowledge of operation and maintenance of cleaning equipment is a definite asset;
  • Proven commitment to ongoing professional development is considered an asset;
  • The physical demands analysis associated with this job indicates a light to heavy level of work;
  • Must complete a post-offer agility test in an effort to assist the successful candidate in completing the position tasks safely and to aid in minimizing injuries on the job.
     
    NOTE:
  • All City of Windsor employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment in accordance with the City’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy
  • Only those applicants selected for an interview will be acknowledged
  • We offer a smoke-free office environment
  • Personal information is collected under the authority of the Municipal Act, c. 25 as amended, and will be used to determine eligibility for employment.
  • The Corporation of the City of Windsor is an Equal Opportunity Employer

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, the City of Windsor will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities.  If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform the City of Windsor Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

title: Maintenance
description:
MAINTENANCE WORKER


Gold’s Gym B.C. is hiring full time Maintenance Worker, with potential to grow! Are you hard working, experienced, and driven? We would love to hear from you!About Gold’s Gym


Gold’s Gym has been the authority on fitness since 1965. It was then that fitness legend Joe Gold took the knowledge and expertise he gained from training at the world famous “Muscle Beach” and opened up the first Gold’s Gym on Pacific Avenue in Venice, California. At Gold’s Gym, our goal is simple: We’re here to help you Know Your Own Strength®. We are committed to helping people find their inner strength and reach their goals.Key Responsibilities


  • Performs routine maintenance and repair duties related to buildings and fitness equipment
  • Performs basic mechanical and electrical to equipment and systems
  • Performs basic drywall duties including boarding, mudding, taping and sanding
  • Maintains the general physical appearance of the buildings and grounds which may include landscaping and snow clearing when required
  • Completes general plumbing repairs, such as leaky taps, replaced and/or repair plugged toilets, drains, etc.
  • Documents any repair maintenance and inspection work carried out in the specified format
  • Completes all maintenance requests in a timely manner
Qualifications

  • Class 5 driver’s license and able to commute around Vancouver, Port Coquitlam and Langley as needed
  • Electrical and plumbing experience is an asset
  • A provincial, other vocational, and/or professional certificate/degree is an asset
  • Able to perform physical duties, including able to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Strong work ethic, punctual, reliable, and a team player
What We Offer


  • Positive, rewarding, and collaborative team environment
  • Competitive compensation
  • Complimentary club membership
  • Discount on Gold’s Gym products and services
NOTE: This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.Gold’s Gym British Columbia is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at https://goldsgymbc.ca/Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
The Sutton Place Hotel at Revelstoke Mountain Resort is a luxury 4-star hotel, located directly opposite the gondola and activities that provide experiences of a lifetime for our guests.

The Sutton Place Hotel and Revelstoke Mountain Resort (RMR) are a division of Canada's largest privately held hospitality company, Northland Properties Corporation (NPC), and since its inception in 2007, we have gained a reputation for big mountain riding, legendary powder and an authentic Canadian resort town. If you love to connect with people and have a passion for providing an exceptional hospitality experience, then we invite you to join our Sutton Place Family!


The Sutton Place Hotel at Revelstoke Mountain Resort is recruiting for the position of Maintenance Worker. The Maintenance Worker will be responsible for performing general building and property maintenance. The successful applicant must have good communication skills, be service oriented, efficient at planning and organizing work, critical thinking, a team worker who is responsible and accountable for own job performance.

Job Duties: • Respond to client requests for maintenance in hotel rooms. • Perform regular property inspections of the hotel including common areas, building exterior, and landscape. • Perform minor repairs on windows, doors, switches, desks, tables, plugs, equipment, appliances, sinks, toilets, blinds, electrical, plumbing etc. • Carpentry skills and experience pertaining to metal and timber framing, drywall installation, finishing and experience in cabinet making/joinery would be an asset.

  • Maintain heating and air conditioning systems, perform routine checks of boilers, pumps, fan units, control panels, thermostats, cooling towers, etc. • Maintain outside grounds (remove snow, ice, and debris, spray and remove weeds, sweep, and clean gutters, water and maintain sprinkling systems). • Use a variety of hand and power tools, electric meters, and material handling equipment in performing duties. • Detect faulty operations, defective material, and report those and any unusual situations to proper supervisor. • Prepare, paint, and decorate interior and exterior surfaces, as required • Regular Pool and Hot Tub Maintenance and Checks • Moving Furniture • Perform all other duties as assigned or needed.

Requirements • High school diploma/GED. • 2 years of maintenance experience or Trade background • Minimum 1 year of experience in the operation and maintenance of buildings. • Ability to perform small repairs (e.g., caulking, replacing washers, and replacing light fixtures, waterproofing and tiling). • Strong customer service orientation and skills.

Working Conditions: • Various indoor and outdoor weather conditions. • Interact with management, colleagues, and public • Ability to stand for long periods of time. • Must be able to lift, push, pull, and move a minimum of 25 pounds.

Benefits:

  • Complimentary Season's Pass to Revelstoke Mountain Resort
  • Reciprocal deals on lift tickets at other local mountains.
  • Third Party partnership discounts for all employees.
  • Group Life Insurance, Extended Health, Dental, Vision Care (after 6 months of full-time service)
  • Matching RRSP program (after 1 year of full-time service)

The Sutton Place Hotel Revelstoke offers competitive salary packages, an incredible work environment, and career advancement opportunities.

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.

**Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sutton Place Hotel, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Lawn Maintenance Labourer
description:
About the Job

Oakridge Landscape Contractors has a need for a Lawn Maintenance Labourer (Full-time) to join our dynamic team of talented individuals!

Overview:
  • With over 30 years of award-winning experience in landscape and landscape construction, we stand firmly behind our work and our employees.
  • Join a team that helps our clients realize their dreams.

Job Details:
  • Position: Lawn Maintenance Labourer
  • Location: Brantford, Ontario
  • Pay: $18 to $20/hr. depending on experience.
  • Benefits: after 3 months
  • Company events

Job Duties: 
The key job duties for this lawn maintenance position are:
  • Mow grass.
  • Weeding.
  • Flower bed maintenance.
  • Trimming.
  • Raking.

Job Requirements:
  • Have reliable transportation to and from the main yard.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Ability to work long hours.
  • Self-motivated.
  • Ability to think as a team player.
  • Ability to do physical work.
  • Respect for on-site safety.
  • Ability to work Saturdays as required.
  • Tolerance to various weather conditions.

Application Details:
Oakridge Group is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties.

If you are a person with a disability and have a question or require assistance with the application process, please contact me via email at  jobs@oakridgelandscape.com
About Oakridge Landscape Contractors

Oakridge Landscape Contractors specializes in landscape applications for industrial, commercial, institutional, parks, heritage sites, and highway road infrastructure restoration.

Our extensive landscape construction knowledge and installation abilities combined with our team, sub trade relationships and central location allow our company to complete both large and small scale successfully.
 




    About Oakridge Landscape Contractors:

    Oakridge Landscape Contractors specializes in landscape applications for industrial, commercial, institutional, parks, heritage sites, and highway road infrastructure restoration.Our extensive landscape construction knowledge and installation abilities combined with our team, sub trade relationships and central location allow our company to complete both large and small scale successfully.

title: Skilled Ground Worker (Fort Hills)
description:
Position Scope:

NACG is looking for a labourer to work on a remote mining site in the Fort McMurray area. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Site: Fort Hills

Schedule: 14x7- 12 hours (paid for 11.5 hours) (Days and nights)

Accommodations: Camp provided

Transportation: Flights are provided to and from Edmonton or Calgary. All individuals utilizing provided flights must be fully vaccinated as per federal transportation regulations. Bussing provided from Fort McMurray to site (before and after shifts)

Overtime:  Provided after 8 hours a day or 44 hours a week

 

The successful candidate  will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955.  

 

Qualifications:
  • Successful applicants must to be willing to help out in all tasks for general labourer duties.
  • Must be physically fit and be able to lift 50 pounds
  • Must have a valid driver's license.
  • High school diploma, GED, and/or post-secondary education is considered an asset.
Summary:

All successful candidates must:

  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  4. Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  5. Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

 

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  1. CSO or BSO Certification
  2. Copy of Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Copy of recent Driverâ€™s Abstract
  4. VOID cheque/direct deposit form
  5. Hydrogen Sulpjide Awareness
  6. Silica Awareness
  7. OHS Alberta Legislation Awareness

Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  1. Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  2. An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  3. After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

 

Overview:

North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.   In that time, weâ€™ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. Weâ€™ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers.  

In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

  • Significant Growth â€“ As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
  • Long Term Contracts â€“ With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
  • Commitment To Safety â€“ With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.

title: Yard Associate
description:
Company Overview:

Whether you are experienced in the green industry, a professional looking for a career change, or a new graduate or veteran transitioning into the workforce, we are confident you will find opportunity and reward with SiteOne.  

 

SiteOne Landscape Supply is the largest and only national wholesale distributor of landscaping products in the United States and Canada. With over 500 branches across the U.S. and Canada, we offer a comprehensive selection of products including:   irrigation supplies, fertilizer and control products, nursery goods, hardscapes, landscape lighting, drainage and erosion control products, tools, and other landscaping accessories and supplies.

 

Come grow with our associates who are customer obsessed, always safe, continuously improving, and having fun!

Position Overview:

Our Yard Labors help organize product for deliveries to job sites and help maintain the overall organization of the branch.

 

What youâ€™ll do:

  • Unload product from incoming truck
  • Load product to outbound vehicles
  • Restock product
  • Assisting customers
  • Other duties as needed
Skills We Are Seeking::
  • Must be able to lift 50 pounds
  • Be enthusiastic and dependable and work as a team player
  • Customer focused
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Safety minded; safety boots required

Perks:

  • Medical, Dental and Vision plans
  • Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays
  • Competitive Compensation
  • 401k with company match
  • Company paid life insurance, Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability Insurance
  • Product Discounts
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Opportunity for Advancement

 

THE INFORMATION CONTAINED HEREIN IS NOT INTENDED TO BE AN EXHAUSTIVE LIST OF ALL RESPONSIBILITIES, DUTIES AND QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED OF INDIVIDUALS PERFORMING THE JOB. THE QUALIFICATIONS DETAILED IN THIS JOB DESCRIPTION ARE NOT CONSIDERED THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS NECESSARY TO PERFORM THE JOB, BUT RATHER AS GUIDELINES. THEY MAY VARY FROM POSITION TO POSITION.

title: Landscape Labourer
description:
Landscape Labourer
$18-22/hour + over time

Who are we?

Our company, Earthscape, is recognized as an award-winning design-build firm that specializes in high-end residential landscaping.

We are a group of young, enthusiastic, creative dreamers and builders who work hard and are exceptionally proud of what we design and create. Our project managers aren't afraid to get their hands dirty and our installation crews know that we trust, and highly-value, their work. It makes for a positive, productive, fun and rewarding environment, with enough challenges and opportunities to keep us growing.

Our focus is on designing thoughtful, creative and innovative outdoor spaces that offer a unique vision for each client using a wide variety of materials (stone, concrete, wood, stone, etc.) For examples of past landscape design-build projects, visit our website at http://www.earthscape.ca/

Our main office and yard are located just outside of Elmira, Ontario; a second office/yard is located in Toronto.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for a Landscape Labourer to assist our crews in the construction of hardscape areas such as pavers, flagstone, natural stone, walls, steps, drainage/utilities installation. It also includes construction of softscape areas such as grading, sod, garden beds, planting. This is a full-time, seasonal position. This is a full-time, seasonal position starting as soon as possible.

To be the successful candidate you:

  • Align with Earthscape core values of integrity, hard work, team work, the pursuit of excellence and loving what we do;
  • Communicate effectively with supervisors, colleagues and clients;
  • Uphold high standards for safety, construction standards and quality control;
  • Thrive in a busy work environment and demonstrate initiate in meeting project goals;
  • Want to be proud of your employer and work for a highly regarded industry-recognized leader;
  • Demonstrate competency in specific materials, methods, tools, equipment, and techniques requested to complete tasks in a safe and responsible manner;
  • Have a minimum G class license.

What's in it for you?

This job will offer you the opportunity to work on some of southern Ontario's most beautiful residential landscape projects. The pace, challenges and problem-solving opportunities will mean you are never bored. You will have the chance to develop and refine a wide variety of skills in our rapidly growing business. Your colleagues are all highly skilled, with an impressive range of backgrounds and expertise. Above all they are dedicated to Earthscape's success.

We want you to be successful, and we believe in rewarding our staff for exceptional work. In addition to excellent on-the-job training in project management and site supervision, a safe and inclusive work environment for you and your colleagues, we offer:

  • the chance to work on award-winning projects and designs;
  • extended health and dental care, life insurance and AD&D
  • profit sharing and performance bonuses;
  • the chance to participate in our employee share ownership program (ESOP);
  • overtime pay;
  • company events & social hours.

Job Type: Full Time Seasonal

Compensation: $18-22/hour depending on experience

Location: Our office is located at 25 Esandar Dr Toronto, ON M4G 4C5

Accommodations: We are committed to treating all people in a way that respects their dignity and independence. Should you require any accommodation during the recruitment process or otherwise, please notify us of this when you apply and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Pre-employment checks: As part of our selection process, successful candidates may be required to consent to background checks relevant to the role, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, criminal offence and driver's license record. 

Safety protocols: During the COVID19 pandemic, Earthscape has followed the recommendations of public health authorities. For more information about our COVID safety protocols, please contact us.

title: Crew Member, Landscape Construction
description:
Landscape Crew Member

Reports to: Landscape Construction Crew Leader

Description: As a Landscape Crew Member, you love getting your hands dirty, working outside, and putting in a solid physical effort. You value quality workmanship, working together as a team, and building cool stuff out in the landscape!

JOB SUMMARY – THE 3R's

Role: Landscape Crew Member

Responsibility:

1. Project Execution

2. Quality Workmanship

3. Crew Truck and Trailer Cleanliness

4. Machinery, Tools, Small Equipment Care

Result: Quality landscape work is efficiently completed while growing in skill and professionalism, in a positive team environment.

METRICS TO MEASURE RESULTS

  • Estimated vs Actual Job Hours
  • 15 Minute Daily Clean/Grease

DETAIL OVERVIEW OF RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Project Execution

  • Demonstrate continuous growth through personal goal achievement
  • Demonstrate active participation in regular team meetings
  • Comply with all company policies and regulations and local health and safety regulations
  • Wear appropriate personal protective equipment at all times
  • Communicate to customer in polite and courteous manner
  • Work safely and in a responsible manner, with eager participation and initiative

2. Quality Workmanship

    • Assist crew with the following tasks:
      • Construct walkways and patios, walls, fences, decks, posts, etc.
      • Dig ditches or trenches and perform land clearing activities
      • Plant and maintain garden beds and lawns
      • Load and unload materials, tools, and equipment required to complete landscape construction projects
      • Transport materials using shovels, wheelbarrows, carts, dollies, and hand lifting/carrying
      • Operate various tools including: chainsaws, jackhammers, laser levels, measurement equipment, shovels, hammers, drills, etc.
      • Periodically operate heavy equipment, including skidsteer, excavator, and loader as directed by supervisor

    3. Crew Truck and Trailer Cleanliness

      • Maintain standards of cleanliness and organization in assigned trucks, trailers, equipment, jobsites, and shop/yard areas

      4. Machinery, Tools, Small Equipment Care

        • Perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment by conducting inspections, lubricating, and cleaning on a daily basis

        BEHAVIOURAL SKILLS

        • You value the Hutten Philosophy
        • You're willing to grow and learn
        • You enjoy physically demanding work
        • You're prepared to work in hot, cold and wet weather
        • You're a team player
        • You enjoy a fast pace

        TECHNICAL SKILLS

        • You're a hands on person
        • You're comfortable with power tools
        • You can work out general math problems
        • You can read landscape designs and instructions
        • You have a valid license

        BENEFITS

        • Boot Allowance
        • Employee Referral Program
        • Profit-Sharing
        • Flexible Health Spending Account
        • Fun Events and Company Parties
        • Employee Spotlight
        • Group RRSP
        • Milestone Awards
        • Educational Support

title: Gardener - Temporary Full-Time Contract
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Canadian Base Operators' Meaford team is growing! If you are a committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you.

The Temporary Full-Time Contract Gardener position starts May 16, 2022 and goes to September 16, 2022 and is located in Meaford at the 4th Canadian Division Training Centre. This position typically reports directly to the Roads and Grounds Supervisor. Their primary focus is to tend to the gardens and flowerbeds in the garrison as well as help with grounds down range under the direction of the Facilities Manager. Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  •  Keep work spaces and general areas clean, orderly and hazard free
  • Wear personal protective equipment
  • Be familiar with the maintenance of flowerbeds – planting, weeding, mulching
  • Recognition of common flowers and weeds
  • Operate various pieces of equipment  (string trimmers, edger, mowers) associated with grounds-keeping, as per instruction
  • Help maintain grounds both on garrison and down range
  • Working out of doors in various weather conditions; complete physically demanding work
  • Prepare personal timesheets

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

The following certifications/designations/experience are considered an asset:

  • Certificate in Horticulture
  • Similar horticultural experience

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Demonstrated ability in the following:

  • gardening
  • use of lawn equipment
  • hand tools and power tools
  • Hold a valid driver's licence, class “G”
  • Be physically fit and reliable
  • Able to complete physical work including, but not limited to:
    • lifting
    • pulling
    • pushing
    • able to work on uneven ground
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs
  • Provide own CSA approved work-boots in serviceable condition

Due to many mandatory vaccination requirements at client projects / facilities, in order to provide substantial employment by ensuring compliance with our clients' mandates, the successful candidate may be required to validate full vaccination prior to hire.

Please forward your application prior to close of business April 29, 2022

Canadian Base Operators welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
The Salvation Army is an international Christian church. Its message is based on the Bible; its ministry is motivated by love for God and the needs of humanity.

Mission Statement
The Salvation Army exists to share the love of Jesus Christ, meet human needs and be a transforming influence in the communities of our world.

Core Values
The Salvation Army Canada and Bermuda has four core values:

Hope: We give hope through the power of the gospel of Jesus Christ.
Service: We reach out to support others without discrimination.
Dignity: We respect and value each other, recognizing everyone’s worth.
Stewardship: We responsibly manage the resources entrusted to us.

Broadview Village has 40+ years of providing outstanding support to adults with developmental disabilities and mental health challenges. We are currently hiring a Full-Time Maintenance Worker. This position reports to the Director of Operation and is currently assigned to work in the East York (Broadview Avenue & O'Connor Drive) area. This is a full-time position that works 40 hours per week currently scheduled to work a combination of weekdays and weekends rotating as applicable, flexible to meet program needs.

The performance of the job requires operating equipment and tools, painting/plastering, bending/twisting/lifting, and occasional ladder work and fine motor skills (when working with small pieces of equipment in confined areas). The successful candidate is required to lift more than 20 pounds and carry out work throughout a specific portfolio of buildings and group homes, and external grounds.


RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE

  • Monitor and carry out general maintenance of vehicles. Report any problems to supervisor.
  • Meet with supervisor daily to discuss any priorities and maintenance concerns
  • Complete general plumbing repairs as needed or requested.  Report any other plumbing concerns to supervisor
  • Complete any repairs to electrical fixtures within scope of experience and knowledge.  Report any other electrical problems to supervisor.
  • Clean all exterior windows, eaves troughs, drains and spouts
  • Complete all minor carpentry, plastering, painting, glass/screen replacement and general repair
  • Identify materials required for repair/maintenance and submit to supervisor
  • Assist in the moving of furniture, appliance and household supplies as required
  • Maintenance of grounds as needed or requested
  • Inform supervisor of any maintenance requirements which require the use of outside service providers.  This includes, but is not limited to plumbing, electrical and vehicles.
  • Comply with the provisions of the Occupational Health & Safety Act and regulations
  • Adhere to agency’s Health & Safety Policies and program
  • Complete daily walkthroughs/inspections of site as assigned
  • Report accidents/injuries/workplace hazards in a timely manner
  • Responsible use of agency’s vehicles, equipment and property
  •  Follow the principles of nonviolent crisis intervention philosophy


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • General knowledge of repair and maintenance
  • An appreciation, sensitivity and respect for community living of persons with developmental disabilities
  • Valid First Aid Certificate, including CPR
  • Valid Driver’s License
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • General Computer skills – Microsoft office


LOCATION: East York (Broadview Avenue & O'Connor Drive) area.

HOURS: This is a full-time position that works 40 hours per week currently scheduled to work a combination of weekdays and weekends rotating as applicable, flexible to meet program needs

RATE OF PAY: $20.88 per hour

POSTING EXPIRES: May 15, 2022 at 11:59 pm

The Salvation Army will accommodate candidates as required under applicable human rights legislation. If you require a disability-related accommodation during this process, please inform us of your requirements.

At Broadview Village we are committed to living as an inclusive organizational culture by:

  • Purposefully cultivating and promoting equity, diversity, and inclusion of all persons regardless of their differences
  • Not accepting any discrimination, intolerance or inequitable treatment and committing to working together to combat these actions wherever they may be found
  • Valuing the unique differences inherent in all of us
  • Gaining inspiration and support through the collective voices and actions of all of us

In support of our commitment to a healthy and safe workplace and community, The Salvation Army (TSA) has a vaccination requirement for all employees in Canada. The successful candidate will be made an offer of employment on the condition of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and will be required to provide proof of full vaccination, prior to their employment start date. The requirement to be fully vaccinated is subject to provincial/territorial human rights legislation. If the candidate is unable to vaccinate for a reason protected by the Human Rights Code, a request for accommodation can be submitted and written proof satisfactory to TSA will be required.

We thank all applicants, however, only those candidates to be interviewed will be contacted.

Internal Applicants, please advise your managing supervisor of your intentions prior to submitting your application.

This is a Bargaining Unit position represented by OPSEU Local 550

title: Landscaping -General Labour
description:
Description:
Are you a plant lover? This position is for you!
Agilus is recruiting for a Landscaping -General Labour in the Interior Plant Service in Calgary, Alberta.

A typical day:
  • Working outdoor
  • Tree & shrub planting
  • Moving soil & sod
  • Assist with hand leveling/grading loam (shoveling/raking)
  • bending, lifting, digging

Successful candidates will have:
  • 3 month plantation experience
  • Able to lift 50lbs
  • Able to work in all weather conditions
  • Ability to work independently and as a part of a team

Total rewards:
  • Shift: 7:30 am - 5 pm
  • Location: NE area
  • Weekly Payment
  • Pay Rate $17
  • Period – 3 Weeks from May 24-June 10

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email ktejeda@agilus.ca or by text 403.777.9000
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Groundskeeper/Landscape Labourer- Canada Summer Jobs 2022
description:
Groundskeeper/Landscape Labourer- Canada Summer Jobs 2022

This position is created specifically for applicants to the 2022 Canada Summer Jobs program, and all applicants must meet eligibility guidelines as specified by Service Canada in order to be considered for the above position: be between 15 and 30 years of age at the beginning of the employment period*; be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act for the duration of the employment**; and, have a valid Social Insurance Number at the start of employment and be legally entitled to work in Canada in accordance with relevant provincial or territorial legislation and regulations.

Pay rate: $ 15.00/hour

Working period: May - September 3, 2022

Length: 8 weeks

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

Under the supervision of the Director, Facilities, the Landscape Labourer is responsible for providing regularly scheduled maintenance to facility grounds. This position is an excellent opportunity for a reliable, hard working individual who enjoys working outdoors, using various trimming, cutting, and gardening tools.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES:

  • Provides assistance to the Director, Facilities, or his designate, in ensuring the Village grounds are maintained and orderly.
  • Duties to include, but not limited to:
    • Bush / edge trimming, cutting and or pruning
    • Weeding, soil and mulch work
    • Planting
    • Cutting/trimming grass
    • Designing landscaping including cultivating, trimming, pruning, planting, etc.
    • General cleaning and garbage removal
    • Other duties as assigned
  • Responsible for managing own workload, ensuring deadlines are met and requests are dealt with in a timely manner. Addresses concerns with appropriate personnel in a timely manner.
  • Consideration and adherence to health and safety is mandatory
  • Performs other related duties as required.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must enjoy working outdoors in a team atmosphere is essential, as are effective English communication skills
  • Flexible availability is an asset
  • Ability to work together with all staff members; ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  • Detail orientated and time management skills are essential
  • Previous experience in landscaping or general grounds maintenance an asset
  • Preference will be given to students in Landscaping or similarly related programs

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please inform us if you require accommodations during the interview process.

We are committed to accessibility in the candidate application and selection process. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process, providing the applicant has met the bona-fide requirements of the vacant position. Applicants are asked to please make their accommodation requirements known when contacted.

Successful candidates must provide a complete and current (i.e. within six months prior to hire date) Vulnerable Sector Check (including a Criminal Background Check) or be willing to obtain one.

As a condition of employment, all new hires must have received a minimum of three (3) doses (or such other dosage amount as recommended by federal or provincial health authorities) of approved COVID-19 vaccine, prior to date of hire. Shepherd Village will comply with its duty to accommodate under the Human Rights Code ("Code").

title: Lawn and Garden Maintenance Crew Leader/Foreperson
description:
Assign tasks based on work schedules, keep workers on task, complete timesheets and inspect the quality of work to ensure job requirements are met. Instruct crew members on proper work standards. Interact with customers to resolve issues or answer questions. Crew leaders, also called foreperson, work along with crew members in completing all landscaping installations/maintenance. Operate a variety of hand tools and equipment such as packers, chain saws, hedge shears, sod cutters, pruning saws, mowing equipment, etc. to complete landscape and garden projects.

All PPE and uniforms provided, on the job training, Health Benefits package after 3 months, Paid Stat Holidays, Team building events, seasonal or full-time employment options.  All crews dispatch from our ancaster location, but arrangements can be made to pick up employees at a pickup point if required.

title: Gardener Assistant
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a full-time seasonal Gardener Assistant. The Gardener Assistant position will be responsible for assisting in the care of flowers, shrubs and trees for residential and commercial landscaping job sites. Additional duties include weeding, hedge and shrub pruning and edging, maintaining garden areas (sweeping, leaf blowing), spring/fall cleanup, and other duties as assigned.This is a seasonal full time position available in the summer. The ideal candidate will be friendly, professional, able to work independently as well as on a team in all weather conditions, and possess in-depth knowledge of effective gardening techniques.

  • Prior gardening experience considered an asset.
  • The ability to remain on your feet for long periods of time.
  • A love of the outdoors and plant life.
  • Preference will be given to those candidates who have theability to work some Saturdays.

title: Groundskeeper
description:
Ã‚  :

 

Are you an outdoor enthusiast with a passion for  maintaining grounds?  

Are you looking for seasonal employment with a residential property management company listed as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada?

 

Read on!

 

Summary:  

Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Groundskeeper will work closely with the Community Manager,  maintain grounds, participate in grounds construction activities and ensure proper operation of all necessary equipment.

 

This role is ideally suited to candidates located in or around Riverview, New Brunswick, to travel to communities nearby. If you take pride in maintaining a functional, inviting, and aesthetically pleasing environment and are able to handle multiple jobs in an organized fashion, we want to hear from you!

 

Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate with Operations Manager and or Community Manager by appropriate methods to resolve site issues and report all issues
  • Distribute notices and letters to tenants as required
  • Work at multiple Mobile Home Communities, on an as-need basis
  • Be on call as necessary
  • Participate in safety training
  • Follow up on tenant issues as assigned
  • Assist with, set up, general repairs and maintenance of CAPREIT owned homes
  • Request material for the items required for work orders
  • Other duties as assigned

 

Maintenance of Site

  • Repair and maintenance of common areas
  • General grounds keeping including mowing, pruning, whipper snipping, and clearing catch basins
  • Cleaning of vacant lots
  • Salting, sanding and snow removal (where applicable)

Qualifications:

  • 1+ years of relevant experience preferred
  • Qualifications in one of the mechanical trades a strong asset
  • Organized and able to oversee multiple projects simultaneously
  • Excellent communication skills

title: Maintenance
company: Northview Canadian High Yield Residential Fund
description:
At Northview, we are a passionate, community-focused team dedicated to making our properties the best they can be. We are proud to live, work, and play in the neighborhoods we serve, next to our residents, hotel guests and commercial tenants across Canada.

We are looking for a Maintenance team member to join our Hotel team in Yellowknife, NT. Reporting to the Operations Manager, Hotel you will play a key role in ensuring that Northview’s Hotels show pride of ownership and respect for our Customers, by making sure they are kept in good repair, and that maintenance issues are resolved in a timely and cost efficient manner.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensuring the safety of common areas, and complying with Northview’s Health and Safety requirements
  • With a  focus on customer service, troubleshoot and prioritize work orders and handle emergency situations
  • Drywall repairs, painting prep and painting
  • Minor electrical repairs
  • Minor plumbing repairs, including boiler checks and hot water tank replacements where applicable
  • Perform water and sewer line repairs where applicable
  • Dealing with subcontract labour
  • Maintain company vehicle where applicable
  • Assisting with and or performing suite renovations and other upgrades
  • Moving furniture, equipment, materials and supplies, including clearing of vacant units
  • Maintain clean vacant lots, removal of garbage and debris from building and grounds
  • Maintain tools and equipment
  • Snow removal and ice control from all entrances/exits and walkways as required
  • Completion of suite inspections
  • Assisting with the development and implementation of preventive maintenance programs
  • Other related duties as assigned by the manager

Qualifications:

  • Able to work independently, is a self-starter an takes pride in a job well done
  • Three years previous experience in building maintenance
  • Proven ability to work productively and safely while under pressure
  • Good customer service skills and pleasant demeanor
  • An ability to speak and write English fluently
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs
  • Able to provide a criminal record check free of relevant convictions
  • Hold a valid driver’s licence  with a clean drivers abstract
  • Flexible schedule, able to work on call and weekends as needed

Benefits

    • Competitive pay
    • Extended health care including medical, dental and vision coverage
    • Life insurance, drug coverage and wellness programs
    • Discounts on rent at Northview properties
    • Vacation travel subsidization for northern employees

    About Northview

    Northview is a leading property management company operating in six provinces and two territories. We manage over 11,000 multi-residential units, 1.1 million sq. ft. of commercial space, three hotels and 200 executive suites. We are proud to live, work, and play in the neighborhoods we serve.

    As a condition of employment, all Northview employees are expected to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or can provide reason for exemption based on a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation. The successful candidate will be required to demonstrate their vaccinated status or reason for exemption before they start work with Northview. Northview will review and consider requests for exemption and will accommodate where required. Personal preference is not sufficient grounds for an exemption.

    If your background matches the qualifications listed above and you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference in the communities we serve, please submit your resume in confidence to www.rentnorthview.com/about/careers. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue through the selection process will be contacted. Northview welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require a specific accommodation, please contact

    hr@northviewfund.com

    .

title: Yard Person
description:
Company:

Finning Canada

Number of Openings:

1

Worker Type:

Permanent

Position Overview:

Join the Finning family! Finning Canada is seeking a Yard Person to join our growing team in Surrey, BC. As the Yard Person you are responsible for assisting with the day to day yard duties for the Branch.

The successful candidate will follow approved shipping and receiving protocols to safely load/unload customer parts and components and accurately handle incoming and outgoing paperwork.

We look forward to you joining our team!

Job Description:

  • Loads and unloads company trucks, inspects equipment prior to shipment and on return for serviceability
  • Notifies the shop foreman on damaged or missing equipment
  • Assists rental counter personnel in selection of “rental ready” equipment for each transaction
  • Processes equipment returns and closing rental contracts
  • Performs other equipment inquiries through the company’s computerized programming
  • Verifies fuel consumed and inspects all details of equipment when returned
  • Installs service tags on equipment returned from rental
  • Moves rental ready equipment back to proper storage areas following routine maintenance procedures by service shop
  • Presents ready-to-rent equipment in an orderly fashion
  • Performs general house-keeping of both the warehouse and yard
  • Greets customers in yard, helping direct them to office or unloading areas
  • Assists customers and delivery drivers in loading and unloading rental equipment
  • Gives customers start/stop and general operating instructions on rental equipment

**Hours and shift schedule may be subject to change to meet customer and/or Finning (Canada) requirements. Please note that any future shift changes that may occur will be made in accordance with the Terms & Conditions of the current Collective Agreement**

Qualifications:

  • High School graduate
  • Minimum three months of operating experience of rough terrain forklift, counterbalance forklift, compact construction equipment, large construction equipmentFamiliarity with heavy equipment or a similar industry would be considered an asset
  • Team player with a keen attention to detail
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with effective verbal and written communication abilities

**Candidate selection will be in compliance with the Terms & Conditions of the current Collective Agreement**

We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

title: Landscape Construction Foreperson (Clone)
description:
PRE-REQUISITES

  • Industry experience is required
  • G Class drivers license
  • Ability to operate heavy machinery
  • Ability to manage crew and projects effectively



RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Assign tasks based on work schedules, keep workers on task,
  • complete timesheets
  • Inspect the quality of work to ensure job requirements are met.
  • Instruct crew members on proper work standards.
  • Interact with customers to resolve issues or answer questions.
  • Crew leaders, also called foreperson, work along with crew members in completing all landscaping installations.
  • Operate a variety of hand tools and equipment such as packers, chain saws, hedge shears, sod cutters, pruning saws, mowing equipment, etc. to complete landscape and garden projects.
  • Could be responsible for multiple projects on the go at various stages of completion
  • Ensure all appropriate materials are available to meet construction schedule
  • Ensure that all safety checks and regular maintenance is performed on all equipment including rentals.
  • Continual commitment to training crew members
  • Position includes snow removal in addition to standard responsibilities in winter months

title: Landscape Crew Member
description:
Are you Self motivated? Detail oriented? Reliable? A team player? Customer focused?

We are looking for experienced landscapersto work with us in the position of Landscape / Water Feature Crew Member, starting end of April. (No prior experience necessary) You would assist in the day to day landscaping project tasks. It is your job to ensure quality work is completed, procedures are being followed and ensure tasks are being completed in a timely and safe manner while working with co workers.

Join a fun growing company with competitive wages and lots of room for growth. We are a full service landscaping company which means there are different projects each day requiring knowledge in each project. We will work with you, have weekly meetings and provide training to ensure tasks are completed properly and to our high company standards.

title: Greenskeeper II (year-round and seasonal)
description:
TITLE:             Greenskeeper II (we have openings for both year-round and seasonal full-time team members)

 

REPORTS TO:          Golf Course Superintendent 

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTION:

 

As a member of the Golf Course Maintenance Team, the Greenskeeper II is responsible for maintaining our Jack Nicklaus Signature golf course and providing world-class playing conditions daily. Following directions and performing tasks under the supervision of the Superintendent, they will ensure daily standards for the course are met with precise detail.

 

The Greenskeeper II is a mid-level operator with experience in golf maintenance and a passion for the industry. They are dependable, enthusiastic, and exhibit a strong work ethic. This individual is interested in increasing their knowledge and expanding their skillset.

 

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

  • In addition to Greenskeeper I responsibilities, participate in course set up; greens rolling; and rough, approach and fairway mowing
  • Assist the aerification and verticutting teams
  • Communicate daily with supervisor to report concerns/observations about the golf course quality or to provide maintenance suggestions to improve efficiency
  • Be aware of safety requirements and report unsafe conditions or accidents to supervisor
  • Perform daily vehicle and equipment refueling/cleaning and immediately report problems and failures to the Equipment Manager or Superintendent
  • Attend department meetings and trainings as necessary
  • Support other departments to ensure an excellent overall Member and guest experience
  • Ensure appearance is in keeping with Handbook
  • Additional duties may be assigned as required

 

SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS:

  • Ability to closely follow all instructions given by their supervisor
  • Comfortable with independent decision-making and able to complete work assignments both with and without supervision
  • Ability to work in a team environment, maintain good working relationships with other employees, and operate in a safe, professional manner
  • Possess a valid driver’s license and the ability to operate vehicles
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, and holiday and a shift greater than eight (8) hours in length
  • Ability to meet the physical demands of the position including, but not limited to, working outdoors in all weather conditions, standing, walking, and moving for periods of greater than four (4) hours, and lifting and carrying items sometimes greater than 50 pounds
  • Ability to stay calm and focused during the busiest of times
  • Playing knowledge of the game preferred but not required

 

COMMITMENT TO COMMUNITY AND THE ENVIRONMENT

 

Two of the primary principles with which James Island Golf and Ocean Club conducts business are its commitment to the environment in which we live and the community of which we are a part. At all times you will be conscious of the treatment of our daily environment and will share responsibility for the environmental stewarding of James Island. You will also honor the responsibility we each have to be respectful of our community and to look for ways to support our community. 

 

WORKING ON ISLAND

 

We don’t think there’s a more beautiful, special place to spend your days than on James Island. In addition to a great setting, we offer:

  • An employee meal program
  • Competitive wages
  • A fun, unique and collaborative work environment
  • The opportunity to grow with the club through ongoing training and support (whether you’re joining us year-round or hope to return next season)
  • Shuttle boat transportation to/from Island (about a 5-minute trip)

 

About Discovery Land Company 

 

Founded in 1994 by Michael S. Meldman, Discovery Land Company specializes in building luxury residential private club communities and resorts throughout North America. We have grown to be the premier player in the high-end resort residential niche with 20 world-class projects in our portfolio. Our communities are distinct with their own architectural styles, world-class amenities, and high levels of service.

We don’t build buildings, but rather we build settings where families can create intergenerational memories and enrich their lives in exquisite and untouched sanctuaries. These settings offer a casual and comfortable sense of community through outstanding clubhouses, premier golf courses, welcoming staff, world-class culinary offerings, and outdoor pursuits. To ease and enrich your experiences, Discovery holds itself to the highest of service standards. Every decision we make is driven by one fundamental objective: to make the time you spend with the people you care about most not merely enjoyable, but memorable.

title: Landscape - Foreman
company: The Grounds Guys of South Surrey
description:
We began with a single vision shared between 10 brothers. Originally, we opened our doors as Sunshine Grounds Care in 1987. As time passed and more brothers joined in the project, it became a widely recognized brand built on the principles of excellent workmanship, customer satisfaction, and real care. We abide by the simple values outlined in our company acronym "C.A.R.E.", which are: Customers first, Attitude, Respect, and Enjoy life in the process!As Team Leader, you are responsible for managing a team up to 6 people while performing the delivery of services. Our clients trust to us to provide quality services and you are key in helping us live out our values every day.You are a proactive leader and self-starter who can interact with the public and our employees. You have a strong work ethic and are able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines. You have experience in landscaping and previous supervisory experience, as well as proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.Specific Responsibilities:
  • Manage team  while performing services;  motivate, coach, and mentor team

           Address clients' questions, comments, and concerns
  • Prepare daily team performance reports
  • Assist with employee recruiting and selection
Job Requirements:
  • Current and unrestricted Driver's license.
  • One year experience in this or a related field is required
  • Previous leadership experience
  • Willingness to work occasional (paid) overtime
Benefits: Benefits package varies by locationWe are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow up!

Notice

The Grounds Guys LLC is the franchisor of the The Grounds Guys® franchised system. Each The Grounds Guys® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, The Grounds Guys LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. The Grounds Guys LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent The Grounds Guys® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither The Grounds Guys LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. The Grounds Guys LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Landscape Maintenance Crew Foreman/Manager
description:
Here we grow again, if you like working outdoors, really enjoyed your summer job mowing lawns in middle school then a job in Horticultural Industry is for you. Horticultural companies work to preserve and enhance a client’s landscape.

Horticultural Projects can be as simple as caring for grass and shrubs, or as elaborate as tending to turf, trees, and other landscape elements at a luxury resort.

Since maintaining the “attractiveness” of landscapes is so popular, there is rarely a shortage of work as a horticultural professional. This isn’t your simple summer lawn-mowing job anymore!

We at Mr. Lawnmower are looking for energetic and motivated individuals that have tremendous leadership qualities and are attention to detail-oriented. Mr. Lawnmower is based in Scarborough, and currently has an opening for a Lawn Maintenance/Landscape Construction Foreman and Landscape/Lawn-care Technicians. Candidates must be dependable, Honest, and Trustworthy. References will be mandatory.

Descriptions:

Landscape Maintenance Crew Foreman/Manager
A qualified landscape foreman will be expected to have experience in and required to do the following:
  • Oversee the work and keep the workers in the field on task.
  • Coordinate jobs, make assignments, deal with the customers on-site and take advantage of sales opportunities that may arise.
  • Must have a valid G license and a mode of transportation
  • Train and supervise lawn technicians and assist with marketing projects.
  • Will be directly responsible for the overall quality of the work.

Education:
  • High school diploma • CLT/CLP or Two-year technical college certificate in horticulture an asset • Valid first aid certificate an asset • WHMIS training an asset • 2-4 years of experience Landscape Maintenance Technicians A qualified Landscape Maintenance Technician will be expected to have experience in and required to do the following:
  • General Lawn Maintenance including grass cutting, trimming and blowing.
  • Spring and Fall Property Cleanups.
  • General Garden Maintenance including weeding, soil turning, edging, pruning, and planting.
  • Garbage removal.
  • Winter work including snow removal.

Please be advised that due to the anticipated high volume of response to this ad, Mr. Lawnmover is not able to respond to every applicant. Someone from Mr. Lawnmover will contact qualified applicants that meet the requirements of the position and match the background and professional experience.
