title: Golf Course Maintenance Staff
description:
We are hiring for motivated individuals to join the Golf Maintenance Department
This team strives to deliver the best possible playing conditions for the membership on a daily basis
Positions that are available are full-time or part-time
Who we are looking for: - Individuals who enjoy working in a team environment in varying weather conditions - Early risers who are extremely punctual - People who like being physically active - Individuals who show safety for themselves and their co-workers as a priority - Attention to detail and the drive to complete tasks to high expectations - Bringing positivity and energy to work everyday - Previous work experiences an asset but not required About the job: - Early mornings: Weekdays start at 6:00am and weekends start at 5:30am
- Schedule: Our schedule is 7 days a week, your schedule may vary based on your availability - Physically demanding: Majority of tasks require you to be on your feet using a variety of tools to complete such as shovels, rakes and power equipment
- Working outside: Our team takes advantage of working in all weather conditions
Enjoying the great outdoors is part of why we love doing our job
Outerwear is provided to allow our team to be comfortable while working in such conditions
- Team-Focused: Working together individually and as a team to complete our daily goal of providing members and guests with the best possible club experience
- Equipment usage: We have a variety of mowing equipment, and the ability to learn equipment comes with time and success in primary tasks
We go through an extensive training program to ensure staff is comfortable with the equipment and they understand all safety policies and procedures
- Variety: We rotate tasks between staff, and with a variety of tasks that need to be completed, we try to make each day unlike the last
Tasks could include but are not limited to: - raking bunkers - mowing - course set up - line trimming - garden maintenance Pay: Between $18 and $26 hourly based on experience
Please apply today

title: Landscaper
description:
Weâ€™re growing!! And looking for a detail-oriented and enthusiastic candidate to join our team for the position of Landscaping Associate located in Windsor, Ontario. This is an ideal full-time, temporary contract opportunity for someone who loves working with their hands and being outside! 

Duties include:

  • Cutting, watering and weeding of lawns;
  • Trimming of bushes and hedges;
  • Maintaining flower bed and mulching as needed;
  • Snow and ice removal, sanding and salting of city and company owned sidewalks;
  • Keeping the outdoor property ground free of garbage and debris;
  • Maintenance requests such as painting halls, and suites and minor repairs; as well include the removal of heavy furniture and appliances;
  • Ensure work is being completed safely and efficiently;
  • Conduct all activities in accordance with the specifications of Skyline Living and in line with all applicable legislation including the Provincial Occupational Health and Safety legislation.

Qualifications:

  • Exceptional decision-making capabilities with the ability to troubleshoot and problem solve effectively;
  • Good maintenance and cleaning skills;
  • Proper operation and maintenance of lawn care equipment, specifically Bobcats, and their attachments (truck and trailer);
  • Demonstrate enthusiasm and energy;
  • Multi-task, organize work flow and remain detail oriented;
  • Work independently as well as with a team;
  • Negotiate and demonstrate good customer service skills;
  • Work a flexible schedule to complete all lawn care and maintenance as needed.

Education & Experience:

  • High School diploma or 2 years of landscaping service related experience;
  • Valid driverâ€™s license with satisfactory driving record and automobile insurance required.
  • Be comfortable driving a truck with trailer and also a Â¾ ton (4 x 4) Supercab truck with a trailer (up to 20 feet in length)â€”subject to successful required driving test. 
  • Small engine repair training or certification an asset.
  • Professional training and experience in all aspects of equipment operation, lawn maintenance, and winter landscaping responsibility.
  • Previous experience using outdoor lawn care and maintenance equipment is required, such as sweepers, lawn mowers, snow blowers and small tractors.

Why you want to work here:

  • Providing great customer service is something you thrive on.
  • You get a thrill from staying organized and details are your â€œthingâ€.
  • Being part of a great team has been your dream.
  • Working for a growing company that supports environmental stewardship and social responsibilities is a must for you.
  • You love being active and working outside!

*Please note that all Skyline buildings, apartment units, and premises are smoke free, with the exception of a designated outdoor smoking area*

How to Apply:
Online: www.skylineonline.ca/careers
Fax: 519 341 0178

The Skyline Group of Companies is comprised of four primary entities to oversee its real estate investment, development, asset management and property management interests. The Skyline Group prides itself on its continuous ability to achieve its objective of owning and managing viable, reputable and accretive commercial and multi-residential real estate. We offer our employees competitive pay, benefits, paid volunteer day, on-going training, growth potential and so much more. Our workplace culture empowers staff at all levels of Skyline to become involved in supporting and building vibrant communities.

Building Careers and Communities!

title: Service Tech (yard) (Ottawa, Ontario, CA)
description:
ABOUT THE JOB:

Our Service Technicians are multi-functional, inspecting buildings, performing repairs or readiness work including framing and finish carpentry, light electrical, flooring, plumbing, painting, running gear, and more to our fleet of modular buildings. An eye for quality and a commitment to safety is critical for this role!

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:

Safety/Environment:

  • Act in accordance with Williams Scotsman Safety, Transportation, and Environmental Policies.
  • Lead and act to promote employee health and safety results through creating a safer workplace, DuPont STOP™, training and observations, and regularly scheduled assessments of the branch.
  • Attend periodic safety meetings
  • Maintain a clean and organized work area.
  • Operate a company vehicle safely and maintains a valid driver’s license and excellent driving record free from points 

Fleet & Efficient Use of Resources:

  • Perform repairs to mobile office trailers including framing and finish carpentry, electrical, flooring, plumbing, painting, running gear, and all other facets of modular building repair.     
  • Perform check-in/out (off/on rent) inspections of off rented buildings by physically inspecting to determine repair scope of work, as well as damages for invoicing the customer. Create floor plan drawings as needed.
  • Perform modifications as requested by customers.
  • Maintain proper inventory levels of all equipment/tools/parts/VAPS needed for service tasks.
  • Provide courteous customer service as needed over the phone and in person. Explain all repairs and services to customers.
  • Ensure trailers are ready for scheduled delivery dates at stated quality levels.
  • Perform service related tasks in the yard as requested.
  • Complete appropriate paperwork for deliveries, pick-ups and service calls.
  • Perform HVAC system checks and maintenance per company guidelines.
  • May be assigned duties at field locations as business needs.

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High School diploma or GED
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment is a must.
  • Some knowledge of computers is necessary and good communications skills are required for dealing with customers, salespeople, contractors, shop personnel as well as Williams Scotsman employees at various branch locations.
  • Must have carpentry knowledge and experience.
  • Electrical, plumbing, and welding experience is a plus.
  • A current valid driver’s license and a clean record are required.

The opportunity to advance your career is ready for the taking at WillScot; if you’re READY TO WORK, apply today!

WillScot is veteran-friendly. If you have military experience, we want to hear from you!

WillScot, is committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected status with respect to recruitment, hiring, promotion and other terms and conditions of employment. Disclaimer:  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

WillScot will make accommodations available to applicants with disabilities upon request and throughout the entire recruitment process.

title: Yard Labourer - Days
description:
Powell Contracting was established in 1967. With over 50 years experience, we are the industry leader in providing Ontario with the supply and installation of temporary concrete barriers, noise barriers, crash cushions, guide rails, ground mount signs, overhead signs and sign structures. Our integrated solutions and project delivery strategies improve project timelines and processes, generating increased capabilities for projects including outfitting highways, transit systems, airports and municipal contracts.

We are looking to add a Day Labourer to our Yard team in Aurora.

  • Monday to Friday: Day shift is 6:30am to 5:00pm
  • Benefits and Pension with the union
  • Awesome kitchen/food program

Duties/Responsibilities

  • Communicate well with co-workers, supervisors, other employees, and clients
  • Demonstrating problem solving, planning, and organizing skills required
  • Assembling parts, big and small, for finished goods
  • Process materials to prepare for shipment using different types of tools and equipment
  • General maintenance of the yard/warehouse
  • Perform duties in a safe manner and in compliance with all labour regulations and company policies
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

  • Experience as a Labourer, in construction industry is ideal
  • Able to work in all types of weather
  • Must be physically fit and able to lift up to 50lbs regularly
  • Perform a wide variety of jobs and duties as assigned, with a high level of proficiency and accuracy
  • Ability to work year round in all types of weather which may involve muddy, slippery or icy surface conditions, and uneven terrain
  • Valid Ontario driverâ€™s license with a clean driving record
  • Skid-steer loader experience is an asset

Powell Group of Companies is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of persons with disabilities in an effective and timely manner in accordance with the applicable standards set out in the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), the provisions of the Ontario Human Rights Code, and any other applicable legislation. Powellâ€™s goal is to foster an inclusive organizational culture.

#applypowell

title: Landscape Maintenance Laborer
description:
CSL Group Ltd. is a family-based company committed to our company values (SHARING â€“ Safety, Humility, Accountability, Respect, Integrity, Nurturing, Growth).  We invest a phenomenal amount into our employees, which is one of the things that makes us so fantastic to work for. Our focus is on career development and promotion - people are at the core of everything we do. If you are looking for a career, not just a job, youâ€™re in the right place!

 

Job requirements:

  • 30 hours a week minimum
  • Winter Requires On-Call availability including nights and weekends.
  • Languages Strong English
  • Education Completion of secondary school
  • Experience 1 year of experience in landscaping and property maintenance
  • Drivers License and Clean abstract required

 

Job Duties

  • Spread topsoil, lay sod, plant flowers, grass, shrubs, and trees and perform other duties to assist with the construction of a landscape and related structures.
  • Cut grass, rake, aerate, dethatch, fertilize, and water lawns, weed gardens, prune shrubs, cleaning up beds, sodding, turf management and perform other maintenance duties as directed by supervisor.
  • Maintain lawns and grass along roadsides such as pruning, mowing, edging, trimming, and fertilizing.
  • Operate and maintain power mowers, tractors, chain saws, electric clippers, sod cutters, pruning saws, snowblowers, and other landscape maintenance equipment.
  • Spray and dust trees, shrubs, lawns, and gardens, as directed, to control insects and disease.
  • Perform other manual duties to clean and maintain landscaped environments.
  • Perform other activities at construction sites, as directed.
  • In the winter, responsible for removing snow with a hand shovel, from commercial properties: pathways, sidewalks etc.
  • In the winter, responsible for spreading sand/salt as necessary.
  • Able to perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment by conducting inspections, lubricating, and cleaning daily
  • A willingness to learn, demonstrated initiative, ability to make decisions based on sound judgment

Benefits

  • Year-round employment
  • Competitive wages
  • Employee appreciation events
  • Company paid uniforms & safety boot allowance

#CSLL

 

Other companies may call this job: #Full Time, #Landscape, #Landscaper, Labour,

title: Maintenance Worker 5
description:
Job Description:
Job Title: Maintenance Worker 5
Work Site: Plant Maintenance, Squamish Hospital - Squamish, BC
Status: Regular Full Time  
Start Date: Approximately July 2022
Salary: $26.22 per hour
Hours:

0730-1530

Days off: Saturday, Sunday, and statutory holidays

Reference#: 163310-lba

 

Come work as a Maintenance Worker 5 with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Maintenance Worker 5 to join the Plant Maintenance team at the Squamish Hospital in Squamish, BC. Apply today to join our team!

As a Maintenance Worker at Vancouver Coastal Health you will:

  • Perform trades duties approaching the journeyman level in a variety of tradesâ€™ areas such as electrical, mechanical, plumbing, carpentry, painting, and welding.
  • Perform maintenance and repair duties related to buildings and equipment and perform mechanical and electrical repairs to equipment and systems.
  • Participate on the Rapid Response Team and as a member of the Maintenance team.
  • Assist other team members in their duties to ensure a timely and complete delivery of service to our clients.
  • Act in various capacities, supporting maintenance in general terms.
  • Act as a customer service advocate, accelerating the resolution of customer concerns.

This position may require inter-site work assignments, and working in a support role to trades personnel.

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Experience

  • Grade 10, plus four (4) yearsâ€™ recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Knowledge & Abilities

  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.

The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?


VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.

  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff

Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.


***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Groundskeeper/Maintenance Worker
description:
Job Description:
Job Title: Groundskeeper/Maintenance Worker

Work Site:

Additional Sites:

Plant Maintenance, Sechelt Hospital - Sechelt, BC

Shorncliffe Intermediate Care Home and Sumac Place - Sechelt, BC

Status: Regular Part Time (0.6 FTE)
Start Date: As soon as possible
Salary: $22.16 per hour
Hours:

0730-1530

Days off: Monday, Tuesday, Saturday, Sunday, and statutory holidays

Reference#: 163173-lba


Come work as a Groundskeeper/Maintenance Worker with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Groundskeeper/Maintenance Worker to join the Plant Maintenance team at Sechelt Hospital, BC   This position will work primarily out of the Sechelt Hospital, Shorncliffe Intermediate Care Home and Sumac Place in Sechelt, BC.   Apply today to join our team!

 

As a Groundskeeper/Maintenance Worker at VCH you will perform duties related to the routine maintenance of grounds, equipment and the exterior and interior of the building.

 

ABOUT SECHELT, BC

 

The District Municipality of Sechelt is located on the lower Sunshine Coast of British Columbia, approximately 50 km northwest of Vancouver. It is accessible from the mainland by a 40-minute ferry trip between Horseshoe Bay and Langdale, followed by a 25-minute drive along Highway 101, also known as the Sunshine Coast Highway. This charming seaside community is known for its natural beauty and is a popular destination for outdoor activities including sightseeing,  boating, diving, camping and mountain biking. There are also several municipal parks, plenty of eateries, locally owned shops, boutiques and galleries, and a golf course. Imagine a lifestyle where you are only a short walk or bike ride to work, you go home for lunch and you are home again in time for an activity or go for a hike AND watch the sunset - all before dinner. That is what Sechelt has to offer you!

 

ABOUT SECHELT HOSPITAL

 

Sechelt Hospital is an acute care, 46-bed facility located in Sechelt, British Columbia and serves over 30,000+ residents of the Lower Sunshine Coast. Sechelt Hospital provides a full range of services to the community, including Emergency care, Renal program â€“ community dialysis units, Mental Health and Substance Use Services, surgical services, birthing for low-risk pregnancies and imaging services.

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Experience

  • Grade 10, plus one yearsâ€™ recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Valid Applicatorâ€™s Certificate.
  • Valid Class 5 vehicle license if applicable.

Knowledge & Abilities

  • Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.

The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?


VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.

  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff

Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.


***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Labourer/Landscaper
description:
Goals & Outcomes:
Effectively perform any combination of receiving, storing, and moving parts and equipment to assist the warehouse and service operations of Paramount. As well as maintain and update commercial landscape projects for clients.

Essential Functions:
  • Load and unload trucks and moves items to assigned areas.
  • Loads/unloads equipment and moves items to assigned areas.
  • Completes all required paperwork in an accurate and timely manner.
  • Ability to maintain a valid forklift license issued by the Company.
  • Maintains a clean, sanitary and safe work area.
  • Follow all required work-safe practices. This would include wearing all required PPE in designated areas, confined space safety, safe chemical handling, fall restraints, etc.
  • Duties are related to parking lot maintenance and repair.
  • Mowing, edging, and fertilizing lawns
  • Weeding and mulching landscape beds
  • Trimming small trees, hedges, and shrubs
  • Removing unwanted, dead, or damaged trees
  • Planting shrubs, flowers, and trees
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements:
  • High School Diploma or equivalent preferred.
  • 1 year of experience required.
  • Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs, frequently lift and/or move above shoulder height, stand, walk, kneel.
  • Be able to effectively work in a team environment.
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills.
  • Familiarity with asphalt repair a plus.
  • Valid Class 3 Driver’s License is a plus.
  • Experience with operation and basic maintenance of any and all equipment related to landscape work, lawnmower, sod cutter, edger, etc.
  • Must be able to pass all pre-employment screens (including drug, background, and criminal checks).

title: Yard Crew
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Job Summary
This position performs general yard quality control. This position will be responsible for maintaining adequate egress in and around the yard. They will work directly with shifters and drivers in preparation of trailers for staging and dispatch to customer locations and general equipment flow. This position may include other work as directed.
Responsibilities:
Prepares work zone with suitable equipment in accordance with current guidelines.
Assists with organizing specified set-up.
Checks the quantity and condition of delivery units.
Fills out documentation or records and validates information on the appropriate media. ie. yard check
Cleans work environment during or after operations.
Reports any malfunctions to the supervisor.

The position requires lifting up to 70lbs unassisted.

Position will include the use of heavy machinery.
Multiple part-time shifts available, starting at 11:00, 16:00, and 21:00.

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: Maintenance Staff
company: Atlas Coal Mine National Historic Site
description:
Summer Maintenance Staff 2022.

Responsibilities:
  • Clean and maintain the Atlas’ public buildings and property. Including mopping, dusting, washroom cleaning/supply, upkeep, sweeping, sanitizing, lawn care (including the use of lawnmowers and weed whippers), litter removal, painting, ditch maintenance, and rail track maintenance. As necessary, work will be done in compliance with the Standards and Guidelines for the Conservation of Historic Places document.
  • Keep a clean, safe, and welcoming workspace.
  • Complete work logs and work with plans.
  • As we are a small team at the Atlas, assisting others with tasks may be required throughout the job term.
Qualifications, Experience, and Competencies:
  • Required:
    • Basic first aid certification.
    • CSA-approved steel-toed footwear.
    • Valid driver’s license.
    • Proof of COVID-19 vaccination.
    • A positive, flexible and caring attitude.
    • Ability to effectively take direction.
    • Ability to work unsupervised as necessary.
  • Asset:
    • Previous experience with hand/power tools and lawn equipment.
    • An interest in Drumheller Valley history!
We thrive in a diverse work environment and encourage all qualified applicants to apply. We warmly encourage applicants from equity groups (such as Indigenous youth, youth with disabilities, visible minorities, members of the LGBTQ2+ community, and new Canadians).

Work Environment and Compensation:
  • The Atlas is an outdoor historic industrial site in a rural location. All site buildings are designated historic resources. 
  • Work conditions can be challenging at times, due to the nature of the site and the Drumheller environment (extreme heat during the summer, difficult local terrain, historic buildings). 
  • The job requires working mostly outdoors over rough terrain, crouching, stretching, and lifting up to 25kg.
  • Summer maintenance staff will work a rotating schedule, including weekends. 
  • Outdoor collections technician will work 37.5 hours a week, and hours per week will not normally exceed 44.
  • Rate of pay is $17.00/hour. 
  • The post term is from the beginning of May through Sept 5, 2022.
To apply, please send a cover letter and resume to Jay Russell (Curator): recruitment@atlascoalmine.ab.ca. 
Applications will be reviewed until position is filled.

Including mopping, dusting, washroom cleaning/supply, upkeep, sweeping, sanitizing, lawn care (including the use of lawnmowers and weed whippers), litter removal, painting, ditch maintenance, and rail track maintenance. As necessary, work will be done in compliance with the Standards and Guidelines for the Conservation of Historic Places document.']

title: Golf Course Worker
description:
GreyHawk Golf Club is Hiring!

You will enjoy working outdoors whatever the weather as part of a team responsible for the maintenance of the golf course. This includes, but not exclusive of functions such as grass cutting, bunker maintenance, raking, debris removal, divot filling, mulching, leaf blowing, and other course maintenance functions. You must be a morning person as often your day will begin before the sun rises.

ClubLink is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace. Please contact

jobs@clublink.ca

if a workplace accommodation is needed throughout the selection process. Thank you for your interest in ClubLink.

title: Maintenance Worker III
description:
Why Fraser Health?:

We invite you to apply today and find out why more than 95% of new employees recommend Fraser Health to their friends as an exceptional place to work. A 2022 BC Top Employer, we value diversity in the work force and seek to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.

 

We hire great people for outstanding jobs and need your help to expand the ability to deliver prompt and professional service. We currently have an exciting Relief Full Time opportunity for a Maintenance Worker III to join our Plant Services and Construction team at Surrey Memorial Hospital located in Surrey, B.C.This Relief Full Time position is available until July 1, 2022 or return of incumbent.

 

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlakaâ€™pamux Nations. Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.  

 

Effective October 26th 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization â€œWHOâ€ approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines).   Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.

 

Curious to learn what itâ€™s like to work here? Like us on  Facebook  (@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on  Twitter  &  Instagram  (@FHCareer), or connect with us on  LinkedIn  (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights.

 

Detailed Overview:

Under general supervision, performs maintenance and repair duties related to buildings, equipment, furnishings and grounds in one or a variety of areas such as electrical, plumbing, carpentry, and painting.

Responsibilities:
  1. Repairs furniture such as tables, cupboards and shelves; constructs items such as shelves and cupboards.
  2. Performs carpentry maintenance such as replacing glides on furniture, curtain tracks and other related building fitting.
  3. Replaces plumbing fixtures such as sinks and toilets; repairs plumbing fixtures such as water supply lines and waste lines, replaces flush tank mechanisms and faucets.
  4. Identifies nature of malfunction of equipment and appliances such as beds, wheelchairs, carts, paging systems, toasters, food mixers and blenders; performs electrical and mechanical repairs by disassembling motors and equipment, cleaning, oiling, greasing and replacing parts such as brushes, elements, bearings, casters, filters and wires and soldering connections; replaces items such as timers, switches, electrical plugs, extension cords, sockets and receptacles, and changes circuits; performs safety checks on electrical appliances for defects such as faulty wires and improper grounding.
  5. Performs repairs to electrical equipment such as breakers and panels; wiring and plugs; connects electrical equipment such as motors.
  6. Applies paint and other finishes by brush, roller and/or spray; removes and replaces coverings such a tiles, linoleum and carpets.
  7. Performs maintenance to heavy duty equipment such as sterilizers, washers, dryers and extractors by disassembling equipment, cleaning, oiling, greasing and replacing items such as filters and reassembling equipment as required.
  8. Establishes and monitors preventative maintenance procedures for related equipment, recommends repairs and purchases as required.
  9. Performs other related duties as assigned
Qualifications:

Education and Experience

Grade 10, plus 2 years recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.  
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.  
  • Ability to organize work.  
  • Ability to operate related equipment.

title: Yard Labourer
description:
Inland Concreteis currently looking for a responsible, safe, and dependable Yard Labourer/Loader Operatorto join our local team in Red Deer. You will support plant needs by ensuring a safe and productive work environment. In this position, you will have the opportunity to use different skills every day as you learn the industry and fill in for vacancies in various areas of our plant.

What You Will Get to Do:
  • Assist with plant tasks including lubrication, maintenance, repairs
  • Operateopen wheel loader on plant property when needed
  • Maintain cleanliness of plant work areas
  • Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental regulations, as well as company policies and procedures; assist with physical inspections of plant property/departments.

    Who We Are Looking For:
  • High school diploma or GED required
  • Previous experience operating loader and offloading barges an asset
  • Experience using (or ability to learn) plant mobile equipment
  • Desire to work cooperatively as part of a productive team
  • Ability to work safely, and independently without constant supervision
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Capable of learning through on the job training
  • Able to work inside and outside in year-round weather conditions
  • In good physical condition, able to lift and carry up to50 lbs., sit and stand for extended periods of time, kneel, climb ladders, and walk on varied terrain
  • Ability to work different extended hours, holidays and/or overtime required

    Who We Are:
    Lehigh Hanson Materials is part of the Lehigh Hanson group of companies. Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.
    With our diverse product lines and locations across North America, there are opportunities to explore different roles and work on a variety of exciting and interesting projects. At Lehigh Hanson, we believe our employees play a key role in the company’s success and future growth.
    Lehigh Hanson is a drug free workplace. Our pre-employment process includes reference checks, medical screening, drug & alcohol testing and a drivers abstract may be required

title: Maintenance Worker/Groundskeeper
description:
Why Fraser Health?:

We hire great people for outstanding jobs and need your help to expand the ability to deliver prompt and professional service. We are looking for a Relief Full Time Maintenance Worker/Groundskeeper for our Plant Services and Construction team at Royal Columbian Hospital  located in New Westminster, B.C. Reporting to the general supervision of the Mechanical Supervisor, you will perform maintenance and repair duties related to equipment, buildings and grounds.

 

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlakaâ€™pamux Nations. Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.

 

Effective October 26, 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization â€œWHOâ€ approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines).   Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.

 

Detailed Overview:

Under the general supervision of the Mechanical Supervisor, performs maintenance and repair duties related to equipment, buildings and grounds.

Responsibilities:
  1. Identifies the nature of the malfunction and performs repairs on equipment such as: electric beds, wheelchairs, patient lifts, carts, small appliances, floor polishers by disassembling motors and equipment, cleaning, oiling, replacing defective parts, adjusting, calibrating, reassembling, and checking for safe operation.
  2. Performs  maintenance on equipment by disassembling equipment, cleaning, oiling, greasing,   and replacing items such as filters and reassembling equipment as required.
  3. Establishes and monitors preventative maintenance procedures for related equipment, recommends repairs and purchases as required.
  4. Performs safety checks on new equipment, completing records as required.
  5. Assists journeyman as required.
  6. Performs grounds maintenance using equipment such as a power mower; digs holes, prunes and provides basic care of shrubs and trees as directed;  cleans roofs, gutters and drains; picks up garbage.
  7. Assists in maintaining grounds and parking lots in winter by removing snow and ice. Operates tractor and applies salt and sand to sidewalks and roadways.
  8. Performs other related duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Education and Experience

Grade 10, plus two years' recent related experience, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to  carry out  the duties of the position.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
  • Ability to organize work.

title: Landscaping Assistant ( Canada Summer Jobs)
company: Bob Rumball Centre of Excellence for the Deaf
description:
INTERNAL JOB POSTING (#2022-56)

 

 

 TITLE:                             Landscaping Assistant  

 

 POSITION STATUS:     Full Time – Temporary (9 weeks- Canada Summer Job) (Non-Union)

 

 SCHEDULE:                   30 hours per week (flexibility required as needed)      

 

 REPORTS TO:                Community Gardens Supervisor and Program Manager

                                                               

 

 

POSITION SUMMARY:

 

The Bob Rumball Canadian Centre of Excellence for the Deaf (BRCCED) is a multi-purpose, multi-program facility that functions as a community centre for the Deaf and as a non-profit charitable provider of services for the Deaf.  The organization exists to provide care and opportunities in a communication-rich environment that enhances the quality of life of those we serve.

 

Reporting to the Community Gardens Supervisor and Program Manager, the Landscape Associate is responsible for providing landscape maintenance services. This position will be working in our Landscape department located in Milton.

 

 

 

PRIMARY DUTIES

 

  • Mowing lawns, trimming brush, blowing, raking and picking up debris
  • Regular cleaning and maintenance of equipment
  • Weeding and mulching of gardens
  • Planting of flowers, shrubs and trees
  • Assist in loading and unloading of equipment

 

 

 

QUALIFICATIONS
 

  • Knowledge and experience working within the deaf community and fluency in ASL OR strong commitment to engage in professional development to build skill and knowledge in ASL, Deaf culture and supporting Deaf or hard of hearing individuals and their community
  • Able to work independently and as part of a team
  • Professional demeanor and attire
  • Motivated to learn new skills
  • Hard working and energetic
  • Able to multitask and adapt to changing priorities
  • Reliable and courteous
  • French language/LSQ an asset

 

Canada Summer Jobs Requirements

  • Must be within 15 to 30 years of age (as per Canada Summer Jobs requirements)
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada with a valid Social Insurance Number
  • Must be able to commit to full 9 weeks at 30 hours per week

 

 

Interested candidates please visit https://www2.bobrumball.org/careers/ or fax resume to 855.492.1612

We thank all applicants in advance, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

 

 

 

               Posting Date: April 26, 2022                         Closing Date: May 10, 2022                             Start Date: June 27, 2022

title: Yard Associate
description:
Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.

As a Yard Associate/ Equipment Associate at United Rentals, you will perform a variety of manual tasks to ensure smooth branch operation. Your primary objective will be to provide labor assistance to service technicians, sales staff and other branch personnel engaged in meeting the needs of customers.

Your strong work ethic, reliability and positive attitude will make you an asset to our branch and entire organization. If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world's largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. You will be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals. Excellence in this challenging and rewarding position paves the way for advancement opportunities into our Driver and Service Technician development programs.

Additional duties include the following:

  • Check equipment for damage, hours used, mileage, and fuel level upon return to the branch

  • Inspect rental equipment for safety decals, safety compliance, and ensure that equipment is in good working order

  • Clean all equipment and maintain a clean work area

  • Load and unload rental equipment, and prepare equipment for rental

  • Checkout and demonstrate equipment for customers as well as drive a delivery truck to pick-up and drop-off equipment

  • Other duties assigned as needed

Job Requirements:

  • High school diploma or equivalent

  • Valid driver's license with acceptable driving record

  • Effective communication, multi-tasking and strong teamwork skills

  • Diligent attention to safety

  • Superior customer service skills

  • Ability to frequently lift items up to 45 lbs

At United Rentals, the largest equipment rental company, we believe that it takes great employees to build a great organization – and we’re passionate about helping our people grow professionally and embrace teamwork in everything they do. Our culture is based on our corporate values and centers on mutual respect, job satisfaction, diversity and a shared responsibility to build a better future.

What's in it for you?

U.S. Full Time roles:  Best in class benefits offering includes medical, dental, vision, flex spending and health savings accounts;  401(k) retirement with company match; life and disability insurance; and paid time off including sick, vacation, holidays, and paid parental leave.  Comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

U.S. Part Time roles: Benefits offering includes 401(k) retirement with company match/RRSP; paid time off including sick, vacation and holidays; and comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

Canada: Best in class benefits package which includes medical, dental & vision, RRSP/DPSP*, paid time off, comprehensive training and development, and career growth opportunities.

*Offered for full time roles, part time eligibility in select provinces

United Rentals, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Caretaker
description:
Position: Caretaker (Part Time, Permanent)
Location: Nelson, British Columbia
Start Date: ASAP

About Us
Tribe Management is part of the Tribe Property Technologies family. Together we are the sixth largest strata/condo and rental management company in Canada with offices in downtown Vancouver, Delta, Victoria, Kelowna, Kamloops, Calgary and Cambridge. Our Tribe Management division specializes in strata and rental management services. We are responsible for the day-to-day operation and management of residential & mixed-use properties in our portfolio. Combining our obsession with technology and an unwavering passion for creating vibrant strata communities, we provide community management with heart. 

Job Responsibilities
The position will be responsible for assisting with the operations of a rental property, which include but are not limited to:

  • Administrative work involved in the operation of the property
  • When necessary, deal with emergencies on a 24hr basis during the workweek
  • Book viewings of suites and interview potential tenants
  • Complete accurate detailed move in/out reports for each tenant and supervise moves to ensure security is maintained
  • Collect, deposit and record all rents
  • Issue notices/ letters to tenants when applicable
  • Comply with regulations as contained in the Residential Tenancy Act
  • Supervise contractors and process invoices in a timely manner
  • Request Purchase Orders for all work and/or supplies being undertaken at the property
  • Prepare detailed Incident Reports related to accidents, altercations and damage to the property and/or other applicable incidents,

Qualifications

  • Motivated and professional
  • Excellent organization and communication skills
  • Detail-oriented
  • Computer literate
  • Able to take direction and work well with minimal supervision
  • Working knowledge of the Residential Tenancy Act an assets

If you are currently exploring a new career challenge in property operations, apply online now. Due to anticipated response, only those candidates who will be interviewed will be contacted.

title: Lead Gardener (full-time seasonal)
description:
The Grounds Guys Barrie is looking for an experienced gardener who has a passion for the horticultural world. The ideal candidate must be reliable, have an exceptional attention to detail and quality, time management and client relation skills. 

 Specific Responsibilities:
 
 
  • Manage team of up to 4 people while performing services; motivate, coach, and mentor the team
  • Perform garden maintenance duties for residential and commercial clients, such as garden edging, cultivating, hand weeding, trimming, pruning, spring and fall clean ups. 
  • Operate a variety of mechanical equipment including but not limited to bed edger, commercial mowers, blowers,, chainsaws, line trimmers, and tillers
  • Perform landscape enhancement activities such as mulch application, plantings, topsoil application, lawn seeding
  • Address clients' questions, comments, and concerns
  • Complete daily paperwork ie: vehicle and trailer checklist, work orders, fertilizing sheets, and other required documents

Job Requirements:
 
 
  • Current and unrestricted G Driver's license with a clean driver's abstract
  • Background check
  • Experience in the horticulture field 
  • Previous leadership experience
  • Flexible hours, the ability to work Monday to Friday, and the occasional weekend 
  • Willingness to work occasional overtime
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds to waist level and perform all other physical requirements associated with a position of this nature
  • Steel toe boots/shoes 
Rate of pay negotiable depending on experience and skill level. 

We are actively interviewing for this position - Please call (705) 623-5576 to arrange an interview!

title: Team Member Landscape Maintenance Salmon Arm BC
company: The Grounds Guys of Okanagan Shuswap
description:
We began with a single vision shared between 10 brothers. Originally, we opened our doors as Sunshine Grounds Care in 1987. As time passed and more brothers joined in the project, it became a widely recognized brand built on the principles of excellent workmanship, customer satisfaction, and real care. We abide by the simple values outlined in our company acronym "C.A.R.E.", which are: Customers first, Attitude, Respect, and Enjoy life in the process!

As a member of the Ground Guys team you perform landscape maintenance and design at high levels of quality and service. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.  

You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and are able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines. You have at least one year of landscaping experience and proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Performs landscape maintenance duties such as mowing, fertilizer application, weed control, aeration, spring clean-up, fall clean-up, trimming, and pruning
  • Operates a variety of mechanical equipment including but not limited to bed edgers, commercial mowers, blowers, dump trailers, chainsaws, line trimmers, and tillers
  • Performs landscape enhancement activities such as mulch application, plantings, top soil application, lawn seeding
  • Addresses clients' questions, comments, and concerns or refers clients to the Team Leader as appropriate
  • Assists Team Leader with route and job planning and organization, thereby ensuring sufficient resources and materials are readily available
  • Assists with equipment maintenance and repair under supervision of the Team Leader
  • Applies chemicals under the direction of a licensed applicator, and with all required protective equipment
  • Performs other duties as required
Job Requirements:

  • High school diploma/GED (or current student status)
  • One year experience in this or a related field is required
  • Valid Driver's License with clean record
  • Willingness to work occasional (paid) overtime
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds to waist level and perform all other physical requirements associated with a position of this nature
Benefits: Benefits package varies by location

title: Seasonal Groundskeeper
description:
About MRU

Founded in 1910 and located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, Mount Royal University grew into a vibrant college in the 1930s and became a mid-sized university in 2009. Mount Royal has carved out a distinct niche by offering smaller class sizes, a robust liberal education and unique undergraduate programs. Currently, more than 15,000 credit students choose from 13 bachelor degrees and 38 majors.

Mount Royal University is located in the traditional territories of the Niitsitapi (Blackfoot) and the people of the Treaty 7 region in southern Alberta, which includes the Siksika, the Piikani, the Kainai, the Tsuut'ina and the Iyarhe Nakoda. We are situated on land where the Bow River meets the Elbow River. The traditional Blackfoot name of this place is "Mohkinstsis," which we now call the city of Calgary. The city of Calgary is also home to the Métis Nation.

Mount Royal University is committed to removing barriers and fostering the inclusion of voices that have been historically underrepresented or discouraged in our society. In support of our belief that diversity in our faculty and staff enriches the work, learning and research experiences for the entire campus community, we strongly encourage members of the designated groups (women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and diverse sexual orientation and gender identities) to apply and self-identify.

 

About the Department of Facilities Management

Mount Royal University’s Facilities Management department is responsible for the planning, development, construction, design, operation, maintenance, safety, security and stewardship of all the buildings, infrastructure, sites and services within Mount Royal's campus community. Through efficient and environmentally sustainable operation, we offer grounds, custodial, building operations, facilities planning, security services and engineering professional services to provide a physical environment that supports and enhances our academic space for students and staff. Our team of professionals are dedicated to providing customer service excellence. Our staff respond to daily service requests and emergency / priority situations as needed.

 

About the Role

We are looking for energetic and motivated individuals to be part of our Groundskeeping team for the months of May through August. 

 

Responsibilities                            

  • Grass cutting, sidewalk edging
  • Cultivating beds, watering, weeding and pruning
  • Landscape construction, painting, equipment care
  • Underground irrigation installation and repair
  • Sweeping and litter pick-up

 

Qualifications

  • Previous related experience an asset
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills as well as the ability to work in a team environment
  • Salary to commensurate with experience

 

If you like working outdoors and get satisfaction from a job ‘well done’, we’d like to hear from you.

 

MRU supports full immunization as the best way to protect yourself and our campus community and strongly recommends vaccination against COVID-19.

 

Hours:                               Monday to Friday, 6:00 a.m. - 1:30 p.m.

 

Salary:                               $15.00 to $22.00 per hour

Closing date:                    Open until suitable candidates are found

 

A cover letter and resume should be submitted in one .pdf formatted document. Please title your .pdf document as follows: [Last Name], [Requisition Number].pdf (ex. Smith, Coordinator, 999999.pdf).

title: Landscape Construction Foreman
description:
Landscape Construction Foreman

Blue Grass Nursery, Sod, and Garden Centre – Calgary, Alberta

Job Description

Job Summary

Blue Grass Ltd is currently seeking a qualified, self-motivated landscape construction foreman to oversee our commercial landscaping projects. We require a person who has an attitude of quality and excellence and who takes pride in their work and the company they work for. We require a person who enjoys leading and teaching people, can effectively communicate with customers, crews, peers, and management, solve problems in real-time, and thrive under the pressure of meeting timelines and budgets.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Organize and plan work daily for the landscape crews to meet customer requirements, timelines, and budgets (minimum 3 crews at different job sites).
  • Supervise crew members and tasks while being an active member of the crew including disciplinary action when required. Attention to detail and quality control is essential.
  • Set expectations for quality and excellence with the landscape crews.
  • Train employees in equipment operation and landscape construction best practices; including site grading, and installation of sod, mulch, trees, site furnishings, and hardscape products.
  • Effectively communicate with customers to ensure requirements, expectations, and timelines are met. Document any special agreements or changes.
  • Ensure the daily documentation of crew work plans, OH&S paperwork, equipment inspections, progress reports, and crew hours.
  • Manage subcontractor deliverables and quality.
  • Read drawings and specifications and translate them into tasks for the landscape crews.
  • Estimate material, equipment, and labour costs for change requests and potential opportunities.
  • Perform snow removal and coordinate snow removal crews in the winter season.

Qualifications and Skills

  • 5 years experience in commercial landscape construction; soft and hard landscaping.
  • 3 years experience as a foreman or crew lead.
  • Class 5 Drivers License.
  • Experience operating skid steer and mini-excavator equipment.
  • Experience and knowledge of OH&S policies and procedures.
  • Horticulture diploma, LGAP, or proven industry experience.
  • Able to work outdoors in all weather conditions; 6 days per week in the peak summer season.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in time management and task prioritization.

Benefits

  • Compensation range $25-$35 negotiable hourly or salary; year-round position.
  • Company truck.
  • Health benefits are available.
  • A bonus plan is available.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Landscape Horticulture/Gardener
description:
Job description

Cobble Beach Golf Links is located in Kemble ON, which is 10 minutes north of Owen Sound. We are a community based, award winning, four-season resort that includes an 18 hole championship golf course, several communal amenities, dozens of homes and condominiums and a growing population. It’s an exciting time within the community as the second phase of residential construction is underway. The addition of homes and members will continue to boast the Cobble Beach club experience. The Turf Department responsibilities extend into various aspects of the property. The maintenance of the golf course, home lawns, communal and personal gardens, tennis courts, an industrial dock, a year round trail system, a beach club and winter snow removal. We are looking for an individual to help grow the department and fill the role of Head Horticulturalist.

Job Description:  Head Horticulturalist/Gardener

Under the supervision of the Golf Course Superintendent (GCS), the Assistant Golf Course Superintendent (AGS) and the Assistant Property Manager (APM) the horticulturalist will adopt the following responsibilities:

  • Work closely with all facets of the turf department team to ensure all plants and gardens on the golf course, clubhouse and boulevards are well maintained
  • Ensure that applicable homeowner’s gardens are upheld to the requirements as stated in the maintenance contracts
  • Lead, direct and motivate a small horticultural team
  • On occasion, required to address members and guests’ questions within the topic of gardening/horticulture and provide minor consultation
  • Educate the horticultural team on, and perform routine duties to maintain the plant life at the property including watering, weeding, trimming, applying fertilizer, etc.
  • Assist in the creation and construction of new gardens to aid in the completion of new homes and the improvement of Cobble Beach’s communal grounds
  • Maintain the onsite nursery to not only meet the requirements of the current season, but also those of the future and the property’s expansion
  • Frequently monitor gardens to ensure plant health and provide brief training to other employees so that the plants may be monitored in your absence

Physical Duties:

  • Follow direction from the GCS/AGS/APM and efficiently carry out tasks such as:
  • Common area maintenance of planting beds to include weeding, pruning and cultivation.
  • Soft Landscaping (planting, mulching, sodding etc.) as required.
  • Operate various tools and equipment i.e.) handheld blowers, gas powered pruning equipment, shovels, rakes etc.
  • Perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment by conducting inspections and cleaning on a daily basis
  • Assist with loading and unloading of materials, tools, and equipment required to complete projects
  • Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) at all times and comply with all company policies, procedures and regulations. Work in accordance with all local health and safety laws and regulations.
  • Assist in daily record keeping and work orders
  • Assist in shop organization and cleanliness
  • Perform any other work related duties required on the Cobble Beach property and/or the golf course as directed by management

Qualifications:

  • First and foremost; a positive attitude, open mind and strong work ethic
  • Integrity
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, physically demanding work environment
  • Ability to work independently and with others
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Problem solving abilities
  • Prior knowledge or education in horticultural is an asset
  • Must be willing to work in all reasonable types of weather
  • Must be willing to work some weekends
  • Preference will be given to candidates with previous experience in the horticultural maintenance/bed maintenance field
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints and specifications an asset
  • Knowledge of specific materials, methods, tools and equipment required to complete various landscape practices

Schedule:

  • Monday through Friday
  • Weekend work when required
  • Season typically runs from mid-April to early November

Compensation:

  • Hourly rate of $16-$20 an hour depending on experience
  • Bonus potential for appropriate applicant
  • Overtime pay
  • Inclusion of staff uniform
  • Inclusion in staff events and activities
  • Golf privileges

Contact Us:

  • Check out our website for more information www.cobblebeach.com
  • email: propertym@cobblebeach.com

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Salary: $16.00-$20.00 per hour

title: Yard Coordinator
description:
Westerra Equipment has been selling, renting, and fixing equipment for over 100 years. We also train people in all corners of British Columbia on how to operate machinery safely and effectively. From forklifts to skid steers, excavators, loaders, and dump trucks, Westerra Equipment services industries such as warehousing, milling, construction, forestry, recycling, and more with their equipment needs. Join our award-winning company and experience working at Gold Certified Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Company, A Great Place to Work, and one of BCâ€™s Top Employers.

An opportunity has been available to join our friendly and hard-working team in Abbotsford, BC, for a â€œYard Coordinator.â€ The Yard  Coordinator will work with the local branch to maintain the Yard, respond to customer inquiries, and provide exceptional customer service.

 

Key Responsibilities:  

  • Maintain accurate location of equipment in the database;
  • Maintain records of all transactions in the yard;
  • Wash and clean equipment as needed;
  • Inspect equipment upon arrival and prior to departure from the yard;
  • Prepare and stage equipment in the yard;
  • Load/unload equipment on trailer;
  • Spotting Heavy Machinery Operators;
  • Clean Work Area & Tools;
  • Provide exceptional customer service;
  • Employ workplace health and safety practices at all times;
  • Other related duties, as assigned.

 

Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:  

  • High school diploma;
  • Valid driver's license required;
  • 1-2 years of work experience in an Industrial environment using or organizing equipment;
  • Experience operating equipment would be an asset;
  • Operate forklifts, Bobcat, pallet jacks in an indoor and outdoor environment (training will be provided);
  • Familiarity with Compact Construction equipment a plus;
  • Physical exertion required, including, but not limited to: walking, standing, stooping, bending, and lifting up to 50 pounds;
  • Strong Computer Skills;
  • Ability to multitask and stay organized in a fast-paced environment;
  • Positive attitude & high attention to detail;
  • Excellent communication abilities â€“ verbal and written.

 

Who We Are: Our people are at the core of what we do. We take the time to hire the right people who share our five core values, train them, coach them, and reward them for their successes.

  1. Build Trust â€“ Build trust with others and & each other.
  2. Be a Team Player â€“ Commit to working together to win.
  3. Be Customer Focused â€“ â€œWowâ€ customers, so they become â€œRaving Fansâ€.
  4. Support Community â€“ Care for our people, our community, and the planet.
  5. Deliver Results â€“ Know what you need to do and get it done.

 

Due to the volume of applicants, only those candidates shortlisted will be contacted. Thank you for exploring career opportunities with Westerra Equipment.

title: Yard Labourer
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

Lafarge is recruiting a  Yard Labourer  at our  Exshaw AB cement plant.  Labourers are responsible for aiding in all areas of the plant. They participate in housekeeping, maintenance and other various tasks throughout the plant. A high level of safety practices must be used at all times.  

Responsibilities:
  • Receive oral instructions to determine work assignments.
  • Perform physical activities that require considerable use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling of materials.
  • May assist with minor repairs and maintenance.
  • Remove rubble and other debris in the facility.
  • Complete Field Level Risk Assessments before beginning each task.
Qualifications:

Education Required:  

  • High School Diploma

Years of Experience:  

  • 1-2 years is preferred

 

Specific Experience:

  • Prior experience in and industrial setting would be an asset
  • Comfortable working indoors and outdoors and in a noisy plant setting
  • Safety Oriented
  • Able to lift 50 lbs
  • Able to work in a fast paced, high production environment
  • Willing to work overtime and shifts when needed
  • Able to work unsupervised
  • Able to work well with others
  • Good communication skills

 

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Red Seal Landscaper
description:
Originally, we opened our doors in Abbotsford in January of 2012. Over time, the Ground Guys of Abbotsford has become a widely recognized company built on the principles of excellent workmanship, customer satisfaction, and real care. We abide by the simple values outlined in our company acronym "C.A.R.E.", which are: Customers first, Attitude, Respect, and Enjoy life in the process!
As Team Leader, you are responsible for managing a team up to 4 people while performing the delivery of services. Our clients trust us to provide quality services and you are key in helping us live out our values every day.  Our goal is to make another person's day better having interacted with us!

You are a proactive leader and self-starter who can interact with the public and our employees. You have a strong work ethic and are able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines. You have experience in landscaping and previous supervisory experience, as well as proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.
Specific Responsibilities:
  • You are a brand champion - of our culture, your skills and staff
  • Manage team of up to 4 people while performing services; motivate, coach, and mentor team
  • Perform landscape maintenance duties, such as mowing, fertilizer application, weed control, aeration, spring clean-up, fall clean-up, trimming, and pruning and snow plowing
  • Operate a variety of mechanical equipment including but not limited to bed edgers, commercial mowers, blowers, dump trailers, chainsaws, line trimmers, and tillers, plow truck
  • Perform landscape enhancement activities such as mulch application, plantings, top soil application, lawn seeding
  • Address clients' questions, comments, and concerns
  • Ability to record all services in our app including notes and pictures while keeping hourly budgets as top of mind
Job Requirements:
  • Current and unrestricted Driver's license with a clean record
  • One year experience in this or a related field is required
  • Previous leadership experience
  • Willingness to work occasional (paid) overtime
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds to waist level and perform all other physical requirements associated with a position of this nature
Benefits:  Red Seal sponsor, education budget, personal wellness benefit, profit sharing

We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow up!

Notice

The Grounds Guys LLC is the franchisor of the The Grounds Guys® franchised system. Each The Grounds Guys® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, The Grounds Guys LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. The Grounds Guys LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent The Grounds Guys® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither The Grounds Guys LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. The Grounds Guys LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Yard Associate (Mon-Fri)
description:
Overview:

This is your opportunity to join the Fence industry leader!

 

Master Halco, North Americaâ€™s leading manufacturer/distributor of fencing and perimeter security products is seeking a Yard Associate.  

This position performs an array of functions including pulling and preparing accurate orders for customers, safely using a forklift to load/unload trucks, and maintaining yard stock in a clean and organized manner.

 

This is a very exciting time to join our company. We are continuing to grow (70 locations), introducing new products, making technological investments, and implementing innovative marketing strategies.  

We are also focused on our people -- our most important resource.  

At Master Halco, we believe in transparency, open communication, and rewarding success with a path to fully develop your potential while building a career.

 

If you enjoy a fast-paced work environment and the opportunity to show us your best customer service skills, this is the right place for you!

 

Working With Us Has Its Rewards:

  • Competitive hourly wage starting at CA$22.95
  • Eligible for a wage progression plan with pay increases every 6 months over a 3 year period.
  • Monday through Friday schedule, day shift
  • A competitive health care plan starting the 1st of the month following 30 days of employment (over 30 hours a week)
  • A generous matching 401(k) plan
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Bonus Opportunities
  • A generous paid-time off (PTO) package, company paid holidays, and more

Master Halco offers advancement opportunities at every level. We are always looking for people with the drive to learn and determination to succeed.

 

Responsibilities:
  • Works inside the warehouse and or outside in the yard depending on need
  • Accurately loads trucks for outgoing shipments
  • Inbound material receiving and put away
  • Able to complete work orders and receiving documents accurately
  • Pulls and prepares orders, packaging for shipment
  • Rotates yard stock and safely moves materials using a forklift
  • Maintains clean and safe working environment
  • Works with team to ensure branch success and provides excellent customer service
Qualifications:
  • 1+ year experience in a warehouse/yard position
  • Able to lift/move heavy materials (up to 60lbs) on occasion
  • Forklift experience highly desired
  • Ability to read, write and perform basic math functions
  • Must be able to work overtime as needed
  • Experience with building materials a plus

 

MASTER HALCO IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

title: Journalier (ère) en tonte de pelouse
description:
Description du poste

Ton travail consiste à tondre la pelouse en équipe chez nos clients résidentiels et commerciaux avec des équipements comme une tondeuse, tracteur à gazon et taille bordure.
Caractéristiques de l’emploi

* Taux horaire compétitif de 18$ à 21$/heure selon expérience
* 40 à 50 heures par semaine de mi-avril à juillet et septembre à mi-novembre, 35 heures sur 4 jours par semaine de juillet
* Contrat de mi-avril à mi-novembre
* 1 semaine de vacances payées, si tu as de l’expérience elle sera reconnue et tu auras plus de semaines de vacances qui te seront payées à la fin de l’été comme tu ne pourra pas les prendre durant l’été
* Aucune expérience requise, formation rémunérée
* Possibilité d’emploi à l’année avec le déneigement au salaire de 20$ à 25$/heure
* Permis de conduire non obligatoire mais un atout
* Lieu de travail : région de Québec

title: Landscape Crew Member/Labourer
description:
Do you love working outdoors?  Helping to improve your client's outdoor living space?  Being part of a creative team that gets things done? Royal City Nursery invites you to join our landscape and maintenance crews as we create beautiful and fulfilling outdoor spaces.  We are a dynamic third-generation horticulture based business, where we cultivate an open inclusive employee culture that is outdoors, physically active and dedicated to providing clients with the information and experience to create a successful lifestyle.

Our Mission: to make life beautiful naturally.

The position: Ideal candidates have a passion for being part of a team, with experience (or the willingness to learn) planting, installing patios and water features on residential level. 

Skills and Responsibilities:

Completion of landscape tasks including: Our landscape crew: Demolition of existing, layout and planting garden beds, sodding, installing hardscapes, performing deliveries, maintaining timesheets and ensuring a high quality of work to ensure job requirements are met.    Our maintenance crew is responsible for pruning a variety of shrubs and small trees, mulching, and overall manentance of gardens.
