title: Yard Labourer
description:
Company Background and Culture

Geotech Drilling is a dynamic international drilling company headquartered in Prince George, Vernon & Delta. Our strategy is to grow our company through developing our pipeline of high-quality advanced-stage projects.

Geotech owns and operates state-of-the-art Drilling Equipment throughout western Canada. Geotech is one of the larger exploration and geotechnical Drilling companies in Canada, with a fleet of over 50 rigs. One of the large advantages Geotech has over its competition are the long-term contracts in place throughout Western Canada. In addition to the long-term contracts, Geotech also has various other Geotechnical, Exploration & CPT work throughout the Territories & Western Canada.

The company has recently established permanent operations in Grand Prairie, AB. Since setting up shop in Grand Prairie, our team has been focusing on projects associated with abandoned wells and site investigations for pipeline alignments in Alberta and Northeast British Columbia.

In addition to the activities underway throughout Canada, Geotech continues to commit to professional development, partaking in a variety Geotechnical & Mining conferences to ensure our employees have the knowledge to maintain our place as a leader in the industry. For more information on Geotech, visit our website at https://www.geotechdrilling.com.

Key Responsibilities

  • Perform routine labour tasks daily.
  • Filling out requisitions for project work.
  • Operating a forklift & other hand-held equipment.
  • Ensure outgoing loads are organized, complete and secure for transport.
  • Maintain constant communication with yard and operations staff.
  • Exert excellent prioritizing skill to meet and exceed project timelines.
  • Understand and follow all company safety policies and procedures.
  • Other related duties as required.

Professional Experience / Qualifications

  • Must possess and maintain a valid Canadian Driver's License.
  • Must be physically fit and able to lift 30-50 lbs. to shoulder height 2-4 times/shift and able to work primarily outdoors in various weather conditions.
  • Forklift experience considered an asset

Education

  • High School Diploma or equivalent.

Compensation

At Geotech, we pride ourselves in offering a challenging and rewarding work environment. Our employees have the opportunity for career and professional growth through development and education.

In addition, our compensation benefit package includes competitive salaries and vacation packages, Health and Insurance benefit program, and Retirement Savings Plan.

If you are qualified for the position posted and are interested in being part of reshaping the future of Geotech Drilling, please contact us through our website at https://www.geotechdrilling.com/geotech-careers/job-opportunities/

title: Irrigation and Landscaping Technician
company: Canadian Grounds Landscaping and Snow Removal
description:
About Us:

Canadian Grounds Landscaping and Snow Removal (“Canadian Grounds”) was started in 1996 with the goal of being an owner-operated company that could provide educated and competent service to its customers. We have established a reputation as a leader in quality, services, experience, and value.

Our client list includes large hospitals and health facilities, major hotels, commuter train depots and parking lots, downtown business complexes and large industrial properties within Greater Toronto.

About the Position:

Canadian Grounds is looking for an irrigation technician to seasonally open and close irrigations systems at the commercial properties with service.  In addition, this person will need to have a passion for landscaping and want to assist with other property management-related tasks. 

Work Location:

  • 69 Advance Road, Etobicoke

Responsibilities:

  • Spring start-up and fall winterizations of irrigation systems, i.e., checking all heads/nozzles are working correctly, checking all timers are set, and sensor batteries are working.
  • Checking for leaks and making any recommendations for a more efficient system.
  • Other duties include assisting with landscaping duties, such as grass cutting and other general property maintenance tasks. 

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 2 years experience in irrigation openings, closing and basic maintenance 
  • Must have a G drivers license with clean drivers license abstract
  • Able to work under adverse weather conditions

Wages and Benefits:

Salary: $20-30 an hour depending on experience 

Health and Dental Benefits: Yes

Other: Paid training and career development opportunities, such as DZ training.

title: Landscaper and Supervisor
description:
Description:
Landscapers and Supervisors needed in Coquitlam! Up to $40/hour – permanent role
Agilus is recruiting for several Landscaper and Supervisors in the construction industry in Vancouver, British Columbia.
Our construction client is looking to add a few Landscapers and Landscaping Supervisors to their team permanently. Their office is in Coquitlam, but they have work sites across Vancouver and the Lower Mainland. The perfect person for this role is compassionate, eager to learn and grow, and cares deeply for their community.
Responsibilities:
  • Building concrete retaining walls and paving stones
  • Hard and soft landscaping installations
  • Daily reporting and data entry
  • Driving the company vehicle and trailers

Successful candidates will have:
  • 1 year of direct experience in hardscape landscaping or civil construction
  • Class 5 license preferred
  • Experience with excavation and building retaining walls
  • Experience with skid steer, backhoe, and compaction equipment
  • Able to read construction drawings
  • For the supervisor role – experience overseeing a team of 4 + people

What's in it for you:
  • Junior Landscaper wage: $25 - $27/hour
  • Experienced Landscaper wages: $27 - $30/hour
  • Supervisor wage: $30 - $40/hour
  • Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8am to 5pm
  • Permanent opportunity with room to grow and learn
  • Great training program and an awesome management team

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email chollingsworth@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Lawn Maintenance Team Lead
description:
Are you looking for a career that allows you to work with a great team and grow your knowledge and skills in landscaping and gardening?

We are located in Barrie, Ontario and are looking for a Team Lead to join our growing team. Our clients expect great service and we pride ourselves on providing it. We offer great wages and a personable work environment. We are looking for someone who is hardworking, organized and who can not only lead a team but also interact with clients in a professional manner. 

Job Responsibilities:

Assign tasks based on work schedules, keep workers on task, complete timesheets and inspect the quality of work to ensure job requirements are met. Instruct crew members on proper work standards. Interact with customers to resolve issues or answer questions. Crew leaders, also called foreperson, work along with crew members in completing all landscaping installations/maintenance. Operate a variety of hand tools and equipment such as packers, chain saws, hedge shears, sod cutters, pruning saws, mowing equipment, etc. to complete landscape and garden projects.

Job Requirements:

  • Highschool Diploma
  • Full G License
  • Clean driving record
  • Experience driving truck and trailer
  • Experience using lawn maintenance equipment (zero-turn, large property equipment)
  • great communication skills
  • organized team player
  • punctual and eager to learn
  • detail orientated

title: Landscaper - $22+
description:
We are searching for a talented and dedicated Landscaper to join our team
You will perform a range of general lawn maintenance duties including applying fertilizers, maintaining the landscape design, removing weeds and dead plants, and supervising repairs
As the Landscaper, you will ensure the growth and vibrancy of our plants, flowers, lawn, and garden structures
The ideal candidate will be creative, with excellent problem-solving and organizational skills
Responsibilities:Apply pesticides to remove harmful insects such as mosquitos, wasps, and ticks
Conduct general maintenance duties such as cleaning walkways, fixing fountains, and other duties
Apply fertilizer to help enhance growth
Take out weeds and dead plants
Trim overgrown limbs, hedges, and leaves
Uphold the landscaping design and ensure plant growth
Plant new decorative bushes, flowers, plants, and shrubs
Supervise maintenance repairs to equipment, landscape structures, outdoor furniture, and walkways
Advise clients on how to look after the landscape
Coordinate with garden designers and landscape architects to ensure the garden meets the client's expectations
Requirements:High school diploma or equivalent qualification
A minimum of 2 years’ experience in a landscaping or groundskeeping role OR a drive to succeed Must be able to operate maintenance equipment including lawnmowers, leaf blowers, and hedge trimmers
Strong knowledge of pest management and basic lawn maintenance
High attention to detail with excellent organizational skills
Good stamina and physical health
Why Work Here:We are offering a base of $22 per hour and more based on experience
Apply today !

description:

Our Maintenance People,

title: Ground Maintenance/Irrigation (evenings)
description:
POSITION: Ground Maintenance/Irrigation (evenings) DEPARTMENT: Golf STATUS OF POSITION: Seasonal WHO WE ARE: At Horseshoe Resort, we are a team that loves to serve people, priding ourselves on the service that our colleagues deliver to our guests
Horseshoe Resort is always looking for talented individuals to join our growing team of hospitality professionals and recreation enthusiasts
If you are outgoing, friendly and love adventure and the outdoors, you may be the person we are looking for! Position Summary Grounds maintenance/Irrigation is responsible for maintaining and watering the Horseshoe Resort golf course grounds after resort operating hours
Duties and Responsibilities: Watering the golf course at night Planting and maintaining flower beds, shrubs, plants, and trees throughout course Lawn mowing, pruning, trimming, and edging various plants Proper operation of hand and power tools & light and heavy equipment Minor equipment repairs such as sharpening blades Debris and garbage removal from walkways, pathways, course, patios, and parking lots Other duties as assigned Qualifications: Must have previous landscaping experience Good working knowledge of landscape maintenance and equipment Must be able to lift 50 lbs
and stand for long periods of time Ability to work outdoors at night (evenings and overnights) Knowledge of irrigation repairs, operation, and application Join our team today, and enjoy employee perks such as Resort staff pass for yourself and your dependents, retail, lodging, and restaurant discounts, along with additional perks and discounts at our other affiliated resort – Deerhurst Resort in Muskoka

title: Student Gardener (Summer Student 2022)
description:
About GWL Realty Advisors

GWLRA is a leader in both the commercial and multi-residential real estate industries. Driven by our values of Integrity, Ambition, Creativity, and Empathy, our vision is to be a sustainable company known for exceptional real estate management, trusted advice, and outstanding service by consistently fulfilling our mission to deliver strong, long-term results for our clients. 
 

We’re looking for a gardener to join our team! This role maintains both interior tropical plants and exterior grounds at the GWL Corporate Office!

 RESPONSIBILITIES
  • General maintenance of all exterior plants, shrubs, trees and lawns, consisting of planting, watering, fertilizing, trimming, edging, mowing
  • Indoor tropical maintenance, plant I.D., watering, general plant grooming, pest identification and IPM
  • Safe operation of electric/gasoline powered grounds equipment.
  • Control weeds using mechanical and chemicals methods
  • Maintain shop and work areas in a clean and safe condition, which includes exterior daily cleaning of courtyard, entrances and general litter collection of the entire grounds
  • Adhere to health and safety policies, regulations and safe work practices
  • Responsible for snow and ice removal from building entrances, walkways and parking lots during the winter months
  • Working outdoors in various weather conditions including extreme heat and extreme cold

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Experience with all types of grounds maintenance equipment, such as snow-blowers, lawn tractors, mowers, lawn sweepers, leaf blowers, hedge trimmers, power brooms, power edgers, grass trimmers, sprinkler systems
  • Previous horticultural training and experience
  • Familiarity with the operation and maintenance of grounds keeping equipment.
  • Successful completion of work requires continuous heavy physical effort including extensive climbing and using heavy materials
  • Responsible with an exceptional work ethic

Safety wear, personal protection equipment (PPE), and training will be provided.
What we Offer
  • 3 Weeks of Vacation per year
  • 3 Paid Personal Days per year
  • Up to $2,000 annual Education Allowance
  • Up to $5,000 annual Mental Health Coverage, plus other comprehensive benefits and savings programs
  • Up to $400 to use towards wellness annually to help support your financial, physical, and mental wellness

Our Business
Learn more about our commercial and residential businesses, our values, and careers at GWLRA.

Our Commitment to Diversity
GWL Realty Advisors is an equal opportunity employer. It prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

title: Groundskeeper
company: Northview Canadian High Yield Residential Fund
description:
Description: The Groundskeeper makes sure that Northview's buildings show pride of ownership and respect for our residents, by ensuring that the grounds and buildings are maintained, in good repair, with pleasant curb appeal.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensuring safety, complying with Northview's Health and Safety requirements;
  • Delivery and collection of household appliances;
  • Moving furniture, equipment, materials, and supplies including removal of items from vacant suites;   Maintain clean buildings and grounds, including removal and disposal of garbage and debris as required;
  • Driving and maintaining the company vehicle;
  • Snow removal and ice control from all entrances/exits and walkways as required;   Conduct building inspections;
  • Promptly respond to issues and work orders, troubleshoot, and prioritize work and handle emergency situations in a timely manner;
  • Delivery of notices to building residents & posting of notices in common areas where applicable;  Maintain tools and equipment;
  • Assist in the implementation of preventative maintenance programs;
  • Resident services and assistance as required and maintaining good resident relations.

Qualifications:

  • Able to work independently, is a self-starter and takes pride in a job well done;
  • Previous experience working in environments that can be very dirty;
  • Excellent customer service skills and pleasant demeanor;
  • A valid driver's license and reliable transportation, including an annual copy of drivers abstract; 
  • Able to lift 501bs, work with industrial strength cleaners and climb stairs with equipment and supplies;
  • Able to provide a criminal record check that is free of relevant convictions.

Why Northview

Northview Fund (“Northview”) owns and operates real estate properties across six provinces and two territories with a portfolio of approximately $1.9 billion in assets consisting of approximately 11,000 multi-residential units, 1.1 million sq. ft of commercial space, and 200 executive suites. Northview’s Class A Units trade on the Toronto Stock Exchange (“TSX”) under the symbol “NHF.UN” along with two classes of unlisted units.

At Northview, we are a passionate, community-focused team dedicated to making our properties the best they can be. We are proud to live, work, and play in the neighborhoods we serve, next to our residents, hotel guests and commercial tenants.

Northview is committed to health and safety in the workplace for the protection of its employees, residents, tenants, and guests. As a condition of employment, all Northview employees are expected to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or can provide reason for exemption based on a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation. The successful candidate will be required to demonstrate their vaccinated status or reason for exemption before they start work with Northview. Northview will review and consider requests for exemption and will accommodate where required. Personal preference is not sufficient grounds for an exemption.

title: Custodial Manager (61620001)
description:
Company Description

Sodexo is committed to providing a safe and healthy working environment for our team members, customers, clients, contractors, business partners, guests and members of the public with whom we regularly interact.  As a provider of services in many client locations, including campus residences, hospitals, long term care facilities, and senior homes, we require that all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Grow your career with a company that shares your passion! Our Campus Division has an exciting new opportunity to join the Sodexo team as our  Custodial Manager.   

Sodexo is the global leader in services that improve Quality of Life, an essential factor in individual and organizational performance. Operating in 67 countries, we serve over 100 million consumers each day through our unique combination of services. We pride ourselves on being committed to the highest standard of Employment Equity and Diversity. By partnering with the Stop Hunger Foundation, we have dedicated ourselves to a corporate responsibility by fighting hunger worldwide. Start your journey with Sodexo, as we continue to grow across Canada! 

 

Job Description

How You’ll Make an Impact:  

  • Responsible for overseeing a team of employees and successfully coordinating and directing Environmental Service activities including Building Maintenance
  • Establish and maintain a solid and mutually beneficial business relationship with the client
  • Ensure high levels of client and customer satisfaction and account retention
  • Manage strong employee relations
  • Create a safe work environment through provincial regulations and Sodexo policies and procedures
  • Ensure the achievement of financial goals particularly around labour costs
  • Strategically develop efficiencies in the operation
Qualifications

What You’ll Need to Succeed: 

  • Minimum 2 years of Environmental Services experience in a hospitality/hotel  environment
  • Ability to manage 20-30 employees with proven success in managing service operations in a campus or busy janitorial/custodial setting
  • Management experience in a unionized environment
  • Effective oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to manage and promote a safe work environment and lead a safety culture


Additional Information

 What Makes Sodexo Different:   

  • Flexible work environment   
  • Competitive compensation & great employee benefits  
  • Training and development programs   
  • Countless opportunities for growth   
  • Corporate responsibility & sustainability   
  • Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2019  
  • Canada’s Best Employers by Forbes 2019  
  • Diversity Inc. Top 50 employer 2019  
  • And so much more!   

Sodexo is committed to Employment Equity and Diversity. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of national origin, race, religion, ethnic group, age, disability, gender, sexual preference, sexual or gender identity, status as a veteran or any other federal, provincial or local protected class. 

 We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request from candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. 

Thank you for your interest in Sodexo.

Please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Follow us on social media to see first-hand what we are all about!

Instagram: @SodexoCanadaCareers

Twitter: @SodexoJobsCA

LinkedIn: Sodexo Canada Careers

Facebook: Sodexo CA Jobs

 

Sodexo SJS

title: SUMMER STUDENT - MAINTENANCE WORKER 2022
description:
Vision statement:  Every person we support will have a full and meaningful life, which means having a home, relationships of all kinds, and a variety of socially valued roles.

 

Mission statement: Rygiel Supports for Community Living serves people who have a developmental disability and multiple handicaps.  The services are determined by a personâ€™s individual needs and are designed to enable each person to be a fulfilled participatory member of the community.

 

SUMMER STUDENT - MAINTENANCE WORKER 2022  

Period: June 6, 2022 â€“ August 26, 2022

Number of positions: 3

Hours/week: 30-35 hours/ week

Wage:  $17.00 per Hour

 

 

The Student Maintenance Worker will be responsible for assisting Maintenance staff. Functioning as a student, the successful applicant will assist in performing repairs and upkeep in residential homes and in the administrative office (COVID-19 permitted). Duties will include assisting maintenance in household repairs, painting, plumbing, carpentry, dry wall, etc. The student will be accountable to the Manager of Properties & Facilities and support the Maintenance Team by adhering to Health and Safety regulations, and preserving a pleasant home environment when attending to maintenance tasks in homes. The summer student will work in a manner which effectively models and reinforces RYGIELâ€™s established Vision, Mission, Values, attitudes and standard of support.

 

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Current Criminal Reference Check â€“ vulnerable sector
  • Currently a full time student in a relevant post-secondary education (University or Community College) and/or returning to full time school in the fall of 2022
  • Meets the eligibility criteria to qualify for wage subsidy with the Canada Summer Jobs program for the 2022 year
  • Ongoing commitment to and participation in continuous learning
  • Relevant training/experience in maintenance duties, and/or an interest in maintenance support
  • Valid driverâ€™s license and availability of a reliable vehicle with appropriate insurance coverage, an asset
  • Proof of Vaccination is required

 

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

Interpersonal Communication

  • Maintaining constructive, open, honest, two-way communication with the Maintenance team
  • Demonstrated oral and written English language proficiency appropriate to the language requirements of the position. Fluency in French is an asset.
  • Establishing and working according to appropriate work priorities reflecting all areas of responsibility and to carry out effective, ongoing self-monitoring of job performance

Problem Solving/Decision Making

  • Systematically seeking alternative solutions to identify or anticipate problems, and to respond to emerging opportunities or needs
  • Making appropriate decisions regarding actions to be taken in consultation with other team members

Interpersonal Skills

  • Works within and nurtures a team environment as well as working independently
  • Relates to and ensures a positive, nurturing and effective manner with the individuals being supported, the support staff and other team members
  • Organizes and completes tasks independently under the supervision of Maintenance workers and the Manager of Properties and Facilities.

Availability

Available for various hours including weekends and willingness to be flexible and adjust working schedules according to the needs of the role.

 

Interested applicants, please apply with cover letter and resume (please quote Summer Student â€“ Maintenance Worker 2022) to:

Rygiel Supports for Community Living, Attention: Human Resources, 220 Cranbrook Drive, Hamilton, ON  L9C 5V7 

Email:  humanresources@rygiel.ca

 

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we will contact only those selected for an interview.

RYGIEL Supports for Community Living is an Equal Opportunity Employer

and will provide reasonable accommodations, accessible formats and communication supports upon request to persons with disabilities who take part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Ground Service Attendant - Full Time
description:
Ground Service Attendant

Saskatoon, SK

Full Time / Permanent

Job Purpose

Snowbird Aviation Services is Saskatchewan's largest full-service aviation ground support company, providing safety focused service to Saskatchewan's largest regional airline, Rise Air. Devoted to being an employer of choice, Snowbird Aviation Services offers rewarding careers for self-motivated team players. Snowbird Aviation has opportunities as a Ground Service Attendant within Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Assist flight crews and customers requiring assistance to enplane/deplane.
  • Safely and efficiently operate and maintain ground support vehicles and equipment required to service aircraft.
  • Perform custodial duties in and around all company managed facilities e.g., recycling, garbage, cleaning hangars and maintaining grounds.
  • Marshall, de-ice and anti-ice aircraft.
  • Groom and detail aircraft interiors/exteriors as required.
  • Handle baggage and cargo, load, and unload aircraft.

General Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain knowledge of the company's vision, mission, and values.
  • Ground service attendants will be cross-trained with customer service attendants, detailers, and cargo agents, where applicable, to provide those duties/coverage when necessary.
  • Safety responsibilities as outlined in the Safety Management System (SMS) manual.
  • Carry out duties in accordance with health, safety and environment legislation and regulations.

Qualifications

Typically, the knowledge and skills required for this position include a high school diploma, with one to two years' progressive customer service experience. Previous work experience or training in aviation is considered an asset. A combination of education and experience may be considered.

Skills, knowledge, and abilities include:

  • Demonstrated experience in serving a diverse and complex customer base.
  • Professional judgement and well-defined conflict resolution skills in handling sensitive situations with tact, diplomacy, and high ethical standards.
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to organize, multi-task and prioritize.
  • Able and willing to work on modified schedules, including early mornings, late nights, and holidays.
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a Provincial driver's license, Restricted Area Identification Card (RAIC) and an Airside Vehicle Operators Permit (AVOP) where required at a base.
  • Complete WHIMS and Dangerous Goods Awareness Training.

Equipment Used

  • Ground power unit, lavatory cart.
  • Tractor tug and related ground handling equipment.
  • Forklift, de-icing equipment, aircraft fuelling equipment, radio base unit.

Typical Physical and Cognitive Demands

  • Required to be on call for evening and weekend shifts and may be required to respond to callouts as required.
  • Able to work long and sometimes irregular hours under different weather conditions.
  • Ability to lift 70 pounds and to handle customer luggage and freight.
  • Able to safely move and provide varied ground services to aircraft and equipment.
  • Able to work on elevated work platforms.
  • Ground and/or air travel required.

As this is a Safety Sensitive Position, selected candidate(s) must test negative for impairing substances and alcohol prior to employment.

title: Night Maintenance Associate (FT)
description:
Do you love hospitality? Love to meet and interact with fun and diverse people? Love to work in a friendly environment? If so, come be a part of our Boulevard Club family.

We take pride in providing safe and inclusive communities;
that inspire wellness, growth, and excellence.
We create exceptional, social, athletic, and recreational
environments; celebrating memorable experiences
and positive connections.

For over a century, The Boulevard Club has built a reputation around time honoured traditions, exemplary service, and unrivalled athletics programs for all ages and abilities, including tennis, badminton, water sports, fitness, swimming, basketball, pickleball, and more.

We pride ourselves on creating an exceptional Member experience thanks to an equally diverse and inclusive team. We know that our team members are vital to the success of the Club, which is why we hire well and enjoy developing and rewarding our team.

If you would like to work and learn from a team of professionals and build your career at one of Toronto’s top private clubs, The Boulevard Club may be a good fit.

As an employee of The Boulevard Club, you will enjoy a high quality pleasant working environment and the following benefits:

  • Education & Professional Development Assistance
  • Employee Health & Wellness Program
  • Extensive medical and dental benefits for Employees and their families
  • Summer and Holiday Bonus (eligibility criteria applies)
  • Meal Plan
  • Bike Share TO
  • Night Transportation Assistance
  • Summer Recognition Program
  • Complimentary Parking (subject to availability)

Job Overview

Reporting to the Facilities Manager and Night Supervisor, this person will perform tennis court maintenance and repairs as well as will ensure the Club property and equipment are maintained in good working order and well presented for the benefit of Members and Staff. Specific duties would include, but are not limited to:

  • Maintains tennis courts (including watering, dragging, sweeping, rolling, court amenities, etc.) and grounds within and around the tennis courts, including the tennis patio (cleaning, tidying, set up/take down of the patio).
  • Monitors air temperatures and pressure readings of the tennis bubbles and takes immediate action to correct incorrect conditions.
  • Performs nightly walk rounds within the Club’s property.
  • Clears snow from doorways, walkways, around structures and applies salt/ice melter product to outdoor surfaces as required.
  • Performs general cleaning tasks such as windows, spider webs, doors, handles, etc. as required.
  • Provides support (physical and/or skilled labour) to other departments as directed.

Job Qualifications

  • Related post-secondary education and/or skills and experience
  • Awareness of health and safety
  • Private Club industry experience an asset
  • Ability to speak, read and write English
  • Pleasant personality appropriate for a hospitality environment

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

The Boulevard Club is an inclusive work environment and as such, has a workplace accommodation policy in place. Accommodations are available, upon request, for the interview process and other selection stages for job applicants with accessibility needs. Please contact Human Resources to discuss further.

title: Landscape Maintenance Foreman
description:
Landscape Maintenance Foreman

Alladins Landscape Design Ltd.

 

Position : Landscape Maintenance Foreman 

Location : Charleswood, Winnipeg

Status : Full-time, Permanent

 

The Company

Alladins Landscape Design is currently seeking candidates passionate about building a career in the green industry. Our growing team of professionals allows us to provide exceptional services to our clients. Services include comprehensive landscape maintenance, softscape & hardscape installation, and arboriculture.

 

The Position

Landscape Maintenance Foreman demonstrates the knowledge and skills required to lead a passionate landscape crew.  Perform various gardening and lawn maintenance duties and install outdoor enhancements to residential and commercial spaces. 

  • Plan and organize daily tasks
  • Ensure quality control
  • Train, Develop and coach teammates
  • Enforce safe work practices
  • Perform landscape maintenance tasks (plant and bed maintenance, pruning, lawn care…)
  • Assist landscape installation crews

 

Qualifications

  • Industry Certification (beneficial)
  • First Aid Certificate (preferred) 
  • Valid Class 5 Drivers License (class 3 beneficial) 
  • Client focused
  • Results driven
  • Attention to detail, organized
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills 
  • Punctual, dependable, ethical
  • Ability to work in all weather conditions 
  • Physically fit (standing, walking, bending, lifting)
  • 2 year Experience Required

 

Compensation

  • Competitive wage ($16.00 - $21.00 hourly) based on relevant skills, experience and credentials
  • Uniform and Person Protective Equipment provided
  • Seasonal performance bonus
  • Education sponsorship (Apprenticeship, Arborist Certification)

title: Landscape Maintenance Worker
description:
Ottawa Community Housing Corporation (OCH) is a landlord who provides 15,000 homes to 32,000 residents including seniors, parents, children, couples, singles and persons with special needs within many communities across the City of Ottawa. As the largest social and affordable housing provider in Ottawa and the second largest in Ontario, we manage two-thirds of the City’s social housing portfolio.

But we are no ordinary landlord. We are partner, supporter, and cheerleader in the lives of some 32,000 residents who live in affordable and social housing in Ottawa. Through our vision, mission and values, OCH provides homes that link people in need to supports and services that can help them lead healthy, safe and fulfilling lives. Call Centre, maintenance and community safety services are available to the tenants 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. While we are a non-profit organization, funded by and operating at arm’s length from the City of Ottawa, OCH operates a lean, high-functioning business model, with a social purpose that is well regarded across the social housing sector in Canada and abroad.

The work we do at OCH enables our tenants to fully participate in the socio-economic opportunities of the City.  By joining our team, you will play a vital role in the development of safe and healthy communities.  Together, we build homes and communities that embrace diversity inclusion.

At OCH, we strive to represent the diversity present within the communities we serve. We are committed to engaging employees in creating a workplace culture of inclusion and belonging, where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and feel valued. Our employees come from all different backgrounds, age groups, sexual orientations, speak a multitude of languages, and share different experiences and perspectives. We would not have it any other way.

OCH has also been recognized as one of the National Capital Region’s top Employers for five years in a row. Click here to learn why: https://reviews.canadastop100.com/top-employer-ottawa-community-housing

We are proud because every day we make a difference!

 

SCOPE OF POSITION

Reporting to the Property Manager, the Landscape Maintenance Worker is responsible for the repair and maintenance of properties within the OCH portfolio. The scope of this work will involve the landscape in common areas and the yards of units. The primary duties include the requirement to:

  • Maintain OCH properties based on assigned work orders and in accordance with industry and OCH standards.
  • Prepare yards of vacant units for occupancy by tenants.
  • Ensure general safety and security for assigned areas at all times.
  • Maintain good tenant services and public relations.

 

STATEMENT OF QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

A typical candidate will have the following qualifications and experience.  Exceptional candidates with different qualifications will be considered at the discretion of the employer if demonstrated experience, knowledge and ability warrant.

  • Minimum Grade 10 or equivalent plus relevant training in landscape maintenance.
  • A minimum of 12 months experience in landscape maintenance which includes experience operating a vehicle with trailer.
  • Health and safety training required by legislation and by OCH.

 

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY REQUIREMENTS

  • Demonstrated knowledge of methods and techniques of landscape maintenance as illustrated by previous work experience and practical testing.
  • Working knowledge of applicable Occupational Health and Safety legislation.
  • General knowledge of corporate policies and procedures related to health and safety.
  • Working knowledge of hand and power tools and tractor operation.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with tenants and all work related contacts.
  • Ability and skills to perform routine maintenance tasks
  • Ability to work as part of a team.
  • Ability to follow instructions and work without close supervision.
  • Must possess the physical and technical capabilities to perform the duties of the position

 

COMPETENCY PROFILE

The core competencies to effectively perform in this position are Delivers Great Service, Builds

Strong Work Relationships and Puts Learning to Work. It is expected that these behaviours are demonstrated up to and including the specified level for

each competency.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Security Clearance is required
  • Drivers abstract
  • Proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 as approved by Health Canada or listed for emergency use by the World Health Organization, a valid medical or other consideration under the Ontario Human Rights Code

 

WHY WORK WITH US

Ottawa Community Housing (OCH) has been named the National Capital Region’s Top Employer for the past four years in a row and Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures in 2020.

OCH provides a comprehensive compensation and benefits package to our employees, including:

  • A commitment to work-life balance and access to alternate work arrangements
  • 100% employer paid medical and dental benefits including a healthcare spending account for flexibility in benefit coverage
  • A defined benefit pension with the Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System (OMERS) where the employer matches the contributions of eligible employees
  • 33 days off in your first year of employment, including a combination of:
    • Vacation leave
    • Special leave
    • Personal day
    • Designated holidays
  • Pregnancy and Parental Leave top up for eligible employees
  • Access to a comprehensive employee discount program including corporate Good Life membership
  • Career development opportunities

Midnight EST, April 17th, 2022

OCH is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, please notify Human Resources and we will work with you to jointly address your needs.

title: Concierge
description:
Description

Appartenir à Air Canada, c’est appartenir à un symbole canadien, Air Canada récemment élue meilleur transporteur aérien en Amérique du Nord. Faites décoller votre carrière en vous joignant à notre équipe novatrice et diversifiée à l’avant-garde du transport aérien de passagers. 
 
Le poste se situe près de lAéroport international de Montréal.
 
Un emploi permanent à temps plein est de 40 heures par semaine et un emploi permanent à temps partiel peut être programmé pour un minimum de 20 heures et un maximum de 32 heures par semaine. Le salaire actuel est de 16,56$ l'heure, conformément à la convention collective.

Résumé des fonctions
  • La principale fonction d'un agent du Service Concierge à Air Canada consiste à permettre à nos clients à forte valeur de vivre une expérience des plus agréables à l'aéroport.
  • Ce rôle englobe tous les points essentiels du service offert aux clients à forte valeur, comme l'enregistrement, les salons Feuille d'érable et les services personnels traditionnels.
  • Le poste s'inspire du service de conciergerie d'un hôtel cinq étoiles.
  • Les tâches qui seront confiées au titulaire du poste varieront d'un jour à l'autre, selon les divers besoins de nos clients à forte valeur de statut supérieur.
  • Un agent du Service Concierge se montre toujours serviable, donne toujours suite à une demande et adopte toujours la bonne attitude. L'agent du Service Concierge veille au confort de nos clients à forte valeur et les traite avec tous les égards voulus, simplement en faisant tout le nécessaire pour eux.
Activités principales de l'agent du Service Concierge
  • Relever et examiner les réservations des clients de statut supérieur et de Classe affaires internationale, avant le départ ou l'arrivée de leur vol, pour s'assurer que toutes leurs demandes de services spéciaux ont été traitées.
  • Assurer la parfaite continuité des services pendant tout le voyage en communiquant par le réseau mondial des agents du Service Concierge d'Air Canada.
  • Accueillir et aider tous les clients à forte valeur ou de prestige.
  • Apporter son aide aux clients qui ont des besoins spéciaux.
  • Faire le suivi des correspondances et prendre des mesures proactives pour modifier les réservations, au besoin.
  • Collaborer étroitement avec le service de réservations Air Canada Super Élite et les Relations clientèle pour répondre aux besoins des clients Air Canada Super Élite et régler les manquements au service.
  • Tenir à jour la bibliothèque de documents de référence des agents du Service Concierge et le registre quotidien.
  • Établir un réseau de spécialistes et de ressources pouvant contribuer à répondre aux diverses demandes de nos clients de statut supérieur.

Qualifications

Les candidats doivent avoir le droit de travailler dans le pays choisi au moment où un emploi leur est offert. Il incombe entièrement aux employés posant leur candidature d’obtenir les permis de travail, les visas ou toutes autres autorisations requises pour le poste.
 
Technique :
  • La connaissance et l'expérience en tant qu'agent de vente et de service à la clientèle d'un aéroport seraient considérées comme un atout.
  • Une connaissance supérieure de l'information sur les services des compagnies aériennes et des procédures aéroportuaires serait considérée comme un atout.
  • Connaissance approfondie des attractions, événements, hôtels, restaurants et services de la ville.
  • Une expérience de la billetterie serait considérée comme un atout.
Comportemental :
  • Excellentes compétences en matière de service à la clientèle.
  • Forte volonté de dépasser constamment les attentes des clients tout en offrant un service personnalisé.
  • Attitude proactive et responsable dans la résolution de problèmes avec des solutions créatives.
  • Bon sens du jugement pour trouver un équilibre entre les intérêts des clients et la politique de l'entreprise.
  • Compétences supérieures en matière de leadership et de relations humaines, avec une capacité avérée à travailler en équipe.
  • Motivé(e) et capable de travailler sous pression tout en gérant plusieurs tâches en même temps.
  • Toilette impeccable, excellent sens de l'organisation, grand souci du détail.
  • Excellente fiche de présence.
  • Volonté et capacité de travailler en équipe.
Exigences linguistiques
  • Ce poste exige une bonne maîtrise de la langue.  La priorité sera accordée aux candidats maîtrisant parfaitement l'anglais et le français.
  • Les candidats parlant couramment l'anglais, le français et une ou plusieurs des langues suivantes seront également considérés : Japonais, coréen, cantonais, mandarin, espagnol, italien, allemand, arabe, hébreu, portugais ou grec.
Diversité et inclusion
 
Air Canada est fermement engagée à l'égard de la diversité et de l'inclusion et vise à créer un milieu de travail sain, accessible et enrichissant qui met en valeur les contributions uniques des employés au succès de notre entreprise.
 
En tant qu'employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi, nous accueillons les candidatures de tous pour nous aider à constituer un effectif diversifié qui reflète la diversité de nos clients et des collectivités dans lesquelles nous vivons et que nous servons.
 
Air Canada remercie tous les candidats de leur intérêt ; toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les personnes sélectionnées pour poursuivre le processus.
skills: ["Ce poste exige une bonne maîtrise de la langue. \xa0La priorité sera accordée aux candidats maîtrisant parfaitement l'anglais et le français.", 'Attitude proactive et responsable dans la résolution de problèmes avec des solutions créatives.']

title: Landscape Labourer
description:
We're looking to add experienced (preferred) landscapers to our growing team.

Duties include:

  • Operating lawn equipment and small garden equipment
  • Cutting and trimming grass
  • Planting flowers, trees
  • Mulching, pruning, etc. as needed
  • Edging and weeding garden beds
  • Other duties, as required

The ideal candidate would have experience in some form of landscape maintenance, but we are willing to provide training. 
Valid driver's license would be considered an asset and would increase hourly rate.

Wage is negotiable and based on experience.

Snow positions available in the winter.

title: Landscape Team Member
description:
Are you looking for a company that offers career advancement, values family and having a healthy work life balance, offers benefits to help you grow professionally and financially, and has strong core values? 

The Grounds Guys are hiring for spring and looking for people with a great attitude to join our high energy team of professionals. 

We abide by the simple values outlined in our company acronym "C.A.R.E.", which are: Customers first, Attitude, Respect, and Enjoy life in the process! 

As a member of the Ground Guys team you perform landscape maintenance and design at high levels of quality and service. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.  

You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and are able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines. You have a proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.

Benefits 
  • Flexibility - We value having a healthy work life balance, so every other Monday is a scheduled day off!
  • Benefits package available after 3 months
  • Bonus program which is activated your first day of work and paid out semi annually 
  • RSP matching program available after 1 year of employment
  • We love to see you grow! All recourses provided to advance throughout the company and mould your career
  • Interested in pursuing a career in horticulture? We have apprenticeship opportunities available! 
  • Paid training 


Specific Responsibilities:

  • Performs landscape maintenance duties such as mowing, fertilizer application, weed control, aeration, spring clean-up, fall clean-up, trimming, and pruning
  • Operates a variety of mechanical equipment including but not limited to bed edgers, commercial mowers, blowers, dump trailers, chainsaws, line trimmers, and tillers
  • Performs landscape enhancement activities such as mulch application, plantings, top soil application, lawn seeding
  • Addresses clients' questions, comments, and concerns or refers clients to the Team Leader as appropriate
  • Assists Team Leader with route and job planning and organization, thereby ensuring sufficient resources and materials are readily available
  • Assists with equipment maintenance and repair under supervision of the Team Leader
  • Applies chemicals under the direction of a licensed applicator, and with all required protective equipment
  • Performs other duties as required
Job Requirements:

  • Have a great attitude!
  • Valid Driver's License with clean record
  • Willingness to work occasional (paid) overtime
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds to waist level and perform all other physical requirements associated with a position of this nature
Rate of Pay: $14 - $17 

We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow up!

Notice

The Grounds Guys LLC is the franchisor of the The Grounds Guys® franchised system. Each The Grounds Guys® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, The Grounds Guys LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. The Grounds Guys LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent The Grounds Guys® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither The Grounds Guys LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. The Grounds Guys LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Landscape Maintenance Crew Members: Crew Leaders, Lead Hands, Crew Members
description:
Job description

Landscape Maintenance Crew Members 2022

Green Collar Landscaping is a well-established company located in Hamilton. Our team has been providing top quality services in maintenance and landscape construction for our residential and commercial clients since 2009. We are currently searching for motivated, reliable, punctual, and courteous individuals to join our team. The applicants must be willing to work full-time; five days a week.

 

Available positions include:  Crew leaders, Lead hands and Crew members

 

Duties include:

  • spring and fall clean-up of lawns
  • mowing commercial properties
  • pruning shrubs and small trees
  • operating machinery such as; zero-turn mowers, stand-on mowers, grass trimmers, hedge trimmers & backpack blowers

 

Requirements:

  • experience working in the landscape industry (an asset but willing to train)
  • valid driver's license an asset (clean abstract)
  • snow removal experience an asset
  • diplomas/certification in the industry will be considered an asset
  • must have own transportation to shop

 

What We Will Provide:

  • Uniform and PPE provided
  • Training – both on the job and personal development
  • Health Benefits package after three months
  • Profit Sharing
  • Paid Stat Holidays
  • Incentive Programs
  • Boot Allowance
  • Team Building and Company events
  • Seasonal and Full-Time employment options

 

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

 

Salary: $16.00-$30.00 per hour depending on experience.

title: Landscape Lead Hand
description:
Here we grow again: We are a busy Design/Build Landscape construction company working throughout Durham Region and Toronto. We are looking for motivated individuals who would like to join our industry.
 
 
Position: Landscape Crew Member/Driver
  • Valid driver’s licence and own transportation to shop
  • Experience in Landscaping or Construction an asset
  • Physically fit, punctual and hard working
  • Enjoy working outdoors 
  • Enjoy working on different projects, being creatively challenged 
  • Great communication skills and willing to work as part of a team
  • Eye for detail and taking pride in everything you do
  • Meet daily timelines as outlined by project manager

  • Health & Safety, WHIMS and First Aid Training provided

Shop located in Sunderland, Ontario

title: Landscape Construction Crew Member
description:
Cressman Tree Maintenance & Landscaping Ltd. is a family-owned and operated company which has grown in the Cobourg area since February 1984. With close to 40 years in the business, we are an established company with steady growth and are looking for a qualified people who can help us continue that trend.  We are seeking Full-Time (Seasonal) Landscape Construction Crew Members who work well with others, take pride in their work, and can deliver a high standard of workmanship in an efficient manner. This is seasonal work with the possibility of winter snow removal work.

Job Duties:

  • Spread top soil, lay sod, plant – flowers, grass, shrubs and trees, and perform other duties to assist with the construction of a landscape and related structures
  • Cut grass, rake, fertilize and water lawns, weed gardens, prune shrubs and trees, and perform other maintenance duties as directed by supervisor
  • Construct landscaped environments which may include trees, shrubs, lawns, fences, decks, patios and other landscape structures, as directed by supervisor
  • Safely operate and maintain power mowers, tractors, chainsaws, sod cutters, pruning saws and other landscape maintenance equipment (skid steers, mini-excavators, tampers)
  • Perform other manual duties to clean and maintain landscaped environments

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma is an asset
  • Practical experience in hardscaping/soft scaping is an asset 
  • Must be able to lift 50lb+ consistently 
  • Physically fit with the ability to perform vigorous and repetitive tasks such as tree, shrub, and perennial planting/care, mulching, weeding, garden bed creation, etc.
  • Positive problem-solving attitude is important
  • A valid driver’s license is an asset and clean drivers abstract is required
  • WHMIS an asset, but will train

Work Conditions:

  • Outdoors 
  • Successful candidate should be prepared to work in all weather conditions

Type of work: Sodding, planting, lawn and property maintenance, soft scaping and hardscaping work, as well as some carpentry and demolition

Work Experience: 1-3 years

Work Week:   Monday to Friday (40-50 hours per week).  April through to December is typical.  (may be required to work the occasional Saturday)

Wage:  will be based on experience

Please send your resume to us by email:  

cressmantree@cogeco.ca

landscape.ca   We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Stoneco Landscaping is looking for General Labourers with 1 -2 years experience in landscape construction and/or maintenance.  You will be assisting our foremen with construction projects; ie: interlock patios and walkways, retaining walls, decks, fences, as well as garden bed preparations, tree planting, and property maintenance work.  

Requirements: Lift 50+lbs repetitively, work long hours outdoors, be a motivated self-starter, and have transportation to our morning meeting point in Georgetown.

This is a full-time, seasonal position with an opportunity to grow with us.  Salary: $16 - $18 per hour, based on experince /skill - with a raise after a 1 month probationary period.

title: Landscape Gardener (Clone)
description:
Be part of a great team!

Winner of the Awards of Distinction ‘Employer of the year’

We are looking for: a talented person to join our dynamic gardening team

Life at Hansen:

  • Positive and inclusive work environment
  • Dedicated career coach to help guide you on your path and education in the landscape industry
  • Opportunity for year round employment
  • Embrace cutting edge technology to enhance your work experience
  • Competitive wages and options for health benefits and retirement plans

What you can expect:

  • Perform garden maintenance tasks such as weeding, edging, and cultivating
  • Split and transplant overgrown perennials
  • Work outside through inclement weather (rain, heat, etc.)
  • Work independently and as part of a team
  • Collection and removal of plant debris and litter.
  • Planting of bulbs, plants, shrubs, and trees.
  • Provide excellent customer service

What you need to have:

  • Excellent oral communication and listening skills.
  • A full G driver's license with a clear driving abstract.
  • Previous experience in gardening
  • Some plant identification knowledge
  • Ability to distinguish between weeds and desirable plant

About Hansen

Hansen Lawn and Garden Ltd. was founded in 1988 by the current president of the company, Ed Hansen. Since 1988 Hansen has taken a leading role in the landscaping industry, providing quality, professional and reliable service to all our clients, because we truly believe they deserve it. At Hansen we believe in being the best and doing what it takes to prove it in whatever we do. We pride ourselves on the professionalism of our staff and the high-quality work we produce.

$20/hr with the possibility of a Full-time salary.

  • Must have experience with small engines, landscaping and lawn maintenance.
  • A knowledge of plants is a plus.

Job Responsibilities include:

title: Yard Worker
description:
We are looking for a passionate, enthusiastic, and hardworking Yard Worker/General Labourer for a busy warehouse located in Delta, BC

This will make a great fit for you if you have a background in manual order picking and loading/unloading merchandise. It is an excellent opportunity for you if you thrive in a fast-paced environment and possess strong communication skills.

What you need to know:

* Monday - Friday (7:00 am - 3:30 pm)
* $19/hour
* Full-time; 40 hours per week with an immediate start date
* Transit friendly location in Delta
* Working 80% of your shift Indoor & 20% Outdoors
* You will be responsible for maintaining and packing merchandise, ensuring they are prepped for shipment
* Maintain accurate records of inventory levels and location; replenish as needed
* Conduct physical inventory count as required

If you consider yourself a team player, adaptable, energetic, and maintain a positive attitude we want to hear from you!!

Two easy ways to apply:

1. E-mail resume to Meg at meghna.kashyap@randstad.ca or Holly at holly.benoit@randstad.ca
2. Apply online: http://www.randstad.ca

Advantages
-$19/Hour
-Full-time opportunity with an immediate start date
-Monday - Friday (7:00 am - 3:30 pm)
-Weekly Paychecks
-4% Vacation Pay
-This is a great opportunity leading to a permanent placement within the company for the ideal candidate
-This is a growing company with opportunities for promotions and improvement
-Safe Working Conditions
-Team working environment

Responsibilities
-You are comfortable working 80% of your shift Indoor / 20% Outdoors
-You will be responsible for maintaining and packing merchandise, ensure they are prepped for shipment
-Maintain accurate records of inventory levels and location; replenish as needed
-Conduct physical inventory count as required
-Ensures compliance with health and safety standards and company policies and procedures
-Ensures proper use of the equipment and ensures a clean and organized work environment
-Lifting Requirements: 45-55 lbs (occasional lifting)
-Willingly performs any other related task, maintain the cleanliness of the yard and work station

Qualifications
-You are comfortable in manual order picking, loading/unloading, and inventory counting
-You can commit to the Monday-Friday / 7 AM-3:30 PM schedule
-Ability to work in a high-paced environment
-A reliable means of transportation is an asset
-Attention to detail and ability to maintain a high degree of accuracy
-Ability to follow company policies, procedures, and regulatory compliance
-Ability to communicate effectively in English
-Ability to work efficiently and in an organized manner

Summary
Two easy ways to apply:

1. E-mail resume to Meg at meghna.kashyap@randstad.ca or Holly at holly.benoit@randstad.ca
2. Apply online: http://www.randstad.ca


Randstad Canada is committed to building a diverse workforce reflective of the diversity of Canada. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage candidates, especially those who identify as a woman, an Aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group, and any others who may contribute to the diversification of our workforce, to apply.

Randstad Canada is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise your Randstad Representative or your local Randstad branch in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

For all feedback on equity and accommodation needs, please contact your local Randstad Canada Branch.

Meg
Holly

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: MAINTENANCE WORKER (Various Availabilities)
description:
MAINTENANCE WORKER (Temporary Full Time and Part Time Opportunities Available) – Extendicare Oshawa

Extendicare is a leading provider of care and services for seniors throughout Canada. Through our network of over 115 operated senior care and living centres, as well as our home health care operations, we are committed to delivering care throughout the health care continuum to meet the needs of a growing seniors’ population in Canada. Our qualified and highly trained workforce of 23,700 individuals are united by a dedication to quality care and by our vision of being the best provider of senior care and services in Canada.

Candidates are invited to apply for the part-time position of Maintenance Worker at our Extendicare Oshawa home, a 175-bed long-term care facility, located in Oshawa, Ontario. Reporting to the Administrator, the Maintenance Worker performs general, routine maintenance and servicing operations throughout the facility, reports unsafe conditions/situations in accordance with applicable codes and regulations and as directed.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Performs a variety of routine maintenance, servicing and repair operations to maintain facility, equipment, furnishings, fixtures, and grounds in proper condition.
  • Observes and monitors all areas of the facility for ongoing maintenance requirements and carries out repairs as required. Documents and implements the preventative maintenance programs. Maintains adequate inventory of tools and spare parts.
  • Performs mechanical maintenance and repairs to equipment such as replacing drive belts, lubricating motors and hinges, repairs to heating and ventilation systems, repairs to kitchen and laundry equipment, repairs to beds, chairs, tables etc.
  • Performs general maintenance and repairs to plumbing and electrical systems such as replacing water valves, clearing drains and removing stoppages, repairing or replacing fixtures, replacing switches, replacing fuses and light bulbs, repairing Emergency Nurse Call and Fire Alarm Systems
  • Performs general carpentry work and repairs such as installing floor and wall tiles, repairing drywall, replacing doors and door hardware, repairing roof leaks, painting, installing wallpaper and other redecorating tasks.
  • Following approval, refers problems requiring specialized work such as electrical or plumbing, to outside contractors and monitors work performed; provides general assistance to skilled trade persons such as mechanics, electricians, carpenters, plumbers, etc. as required.
  • Adheres to established policies and procedures regarding quality assurance, fire, safety, environment and infection control.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3-5 years experience and/or knowledge of mechanical and electrical systems, plumbing, carpentry and heating and ventilation systems. Technical training in building maintenance is preferred.
  • Ability to read and interpret manuals related to equipment and systems.
  • Ability to work safely, following established safety practices and procedures.
  • Ability to read and write English and understand moderately complex oral and written instructions.

CLOSING DATE: March 30, 2022

Interested applicants may forward their resume in confidence to the attention of:

Christa Gritths

Extendicare Oshawa

82 Park Road North

Oshawa, Ontario

L1J 4L1

905-579-0011

Christa.Griffiths@extendicare.com

 

In Ontario, Extendicare and affiliated organizations including our partner homes in Extendicare Assist, accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodation needs must be provided in advance.   To discuss your needs, please contact the individual noted in the posting.

Extendicare recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, patients, team members and visitors from COVID-19. As such, subject to medical exemptions, a condition of employment with Extendicare is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

title: Concierge
description:
No de la demande d’affichage de poste : 110887

Cintas est à la recherche d’un Concierge pour effectuer le nettoyage de ses installations, à l’intérieur comme à l’extérieur. Le titulaire du poste devra notamment assurer le nettoyage des espaces de bureau, salles de toilettes, salles de repos ainsi que de la section des opérations. La précision et la productivité du travail au quotidien sont nécessaires pour assurer le contrôle des stocks et établir la responsabilité. Le Concierge sera également chargé d’exécuter les travaux d’entretien ménager, de respecter les normes en matière de santé et de sécurité et d’effectuer toute autre tâche jugée nécessaire par la direction.

Exigences

  • Avoir la capacité de se tenir debout et/ou de marcher jusqu'à 7 heures par jour

 

Formation

  • Aucune


Cintas, dont le siège social est situé à Cincinnati, est une entreprise cotée en bourse et négociée sur le Nasdaq Global Select Market sous le symbole CTAS et inscrite aux indices Standard & Poor’s 500 et Nasdaq 100.

Cintas Corporation aide plus de 900 000 entreprises de tous types et de toutes tailles à être PRÊT™ à ouvrir tous les jours leurs portes avec confiance en leur fournissant une large gamme de produits et de services qui rehaussent l’image du client et qui permettent de maintenir leurs installations et leurs employés propres, en sécurité et à leur meilleur. Avec une gamme de produits comme des uniformes, des tapis, des vadrouilles, des fournitures pour salle de bain, des produits de premiers soins et de sécurité en plus de services comme la vérification d’extincteurs et une formation en sécurité et en conformité, Cintas aide les clients à être Prêt pour la Journée de Travail®.

Afin de soutenir notre croissance dans toute l’Amérique du Nord, nous sommes à la recherche de professionnels dynamiques qui souhaitent gravir les échelons organisationnels. Notre culture professionnelle, notre engagement envers nos employés-partenaires et nos occasions de carrière illimitées ne sont que quelques-uns des avantages que nous sommes fiers d’offrir. Nos employés-partenaires savent que chaque rôle est essentiel et que le travail d’équipe stimule l’innovation. Discutons de la façon dont votre intégration au sein de l’équipe ainsi que votre travail acharné seront reconnus par un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages de première classe et de perpétuelles occasions d’avancement de carrière. Êtes-vous Prêt™ pour les occasions illimitées que vous offre Cintas?

En vertu des lois applicables (y compris les droits de la personne et la législation en matière d’accessibilité), des accommodations seront fournies tout au long du processus d’embauche. Les candidats sont requis de faire connaître leurs besoins à l’avance.

Statut de l’employé : Permanent
Horaire de travail : Temps plein
Quart de travail : 1er quart

title: Maintenance
description:
Company Description

We are more than just your local restaurant. We are a collection of hardworking small-business owners.

Did you know that from coast to coast, we serve delicious choices to more than 2.5 million people in over 1,400 locations every day, or that we have proudly helped more than 387,000 Canadian families with sick children through Ronald McDonald House Charities?

 

Job Description

Our offer

Working with us means that you will have the opportunity to earn and learn, flexibility, and a safe and inclusive work environment. What this means in practice is:

·       Access to education and skills development opportunities that take you further

·       A total rewards package that includes discounts, incentives, and recognition perks

·       Flexible hours/shifts that suit your needs

·       A safe, respectful and inclusive workplace

·       Bring your authentic self to work – welcoming people of every age, background, and culture – just like the guests who visit our restaurants every day

The job

We are sure that you have an idea about what working with us is like, but just in case here are some of the highlights on what your job will entail:

·       Maintaining a clean, safe, and secure work environment for guests, coworkers, and yourself, leveraging your knowledge of safety regulations and equipment.

·       Multi-tasking in between troubleshooting, tending to store areas and appliances during your shift, and repairing décor and equipment, whether it’s during the day or throughout the night.

·       Managing priorities, staying organized, and keeping on top of the various tasks with limited supervision.

Your vibe and experience

You are trustworthy and have trust in others. You’re a curious mind. You love to see how things work and are fascinated by the intricacies of objects. You’re good with your hands and mechanically adept. You’re always willing to learn and grow. You remain cool, calm and collected in a fast-paced environment. You’d rather do a job right the first time, than do it twice.

Additional Information

About us

In 1954, an enterprising salesman named Ray Kroc discovered a small burger restaurant in California, and wrote the first page of McDonald’s history. In 1967, the first McDonald’s Canada opened in Richmond, B.C. and we’ve been growing with our communities and serving quality food at great a value ever since. Today, McDonald’s Canada is proud to be one of the world’s leading foodservice retailers, offering job opportunities at corporate-owned restaurants or restaurants owned by independent franchisees.

McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Landscape gardener
description: My clients are located in Ottawa and we drive from site to site on a daily basis. I am looking for an individual to assist with garden maintenance (weeding, pruning and edging), installing gardens (digging and planting), and moving soil and/or mulch. If you are keen to work out doors in all weather (cool, hot, humid or wet) and are keen for a physically demanding job, this may be a good fit. It is very busy in spring time and early summer however, the hours will likely decline as the summer progresses.

title: Landscape Construction Crew Leader
description:
SERVICE WORLD-CLASS CLIENTS AND SUPPORT A ROCK STAR TEAM!

Soares Landscaping is a family-owned and operated business that offers a white-glove service for landscape design & construction. Founded in 2006, we are known for our customer experience and quality backed by our industry-leading warranties. Our goal is to provide the best customer experience, paired with the highest quality installs. 

Benefits of Working with Soares Landscaping:

  • Profit-Sharing & Performance Bonuses
  • Health Spending Account
  • Industry Training & Education Reimbursement
  • Lastest Tools & Equipment
  • Regular Lunches & Annual Appreciation BBQ
  • Statutory Holidays Off
  • Build Projects That Change Lives And Better The Community!

Position: 

  • Landscape Construction Crew Leader (Foreperson)

Who are we looking for?: 

We seek a detail-oriented individual who can build incredible landscapes for our clients. This individual should be a specialist in technology, equipment, installation and communication. This individual will also be responsible for managing their crew members and providing daily on-the-job training.

Responsibilities:

  • Management
    • Ensure accurate timesheet entries for your crew daily.
    • Assist the office with job costing
    • Schedule material deliveries
    • Manage your sub-contractors to ensure the scope of work is completed and meets our quality standards
    • Manage your crew and provide daily on-the-job training
  • Customer Service
    • Manage the client experience from the start of a project to the final inspection
    • Ensures consistent updating of client interactions in our timesheets which are transferred to our Company CRM by the office
    • Installation
      • Complete installations that match the design and/or are modified to still provide the design intent that our projects are known for
      • Aim to complete an installation exceptionally well the first time, to the highest standards possible
      • Communicate with the Designer/Project Manager to brainstorm changes or issues that need to be resolved
      • Encourage a safe work environment for yourself and your colleagues
      • Fosters an enthusiastic, creative, "can do" attitude and shares the responsibility for the success of the Company in reaching its goals
      • Operate all types of equipment and machines required to complete installations
      • Other duties may be assigned
    • Fleet Management
      • Provide essential equipment maintenance and provide records to the office
      • Schedule and/or facilitate major equipment maintenance/repairs with our vendors
      • Organize and maintain the shop & yard

    Qualifications:

    • 5+ years experience in landscape construction
    • Post-secondary diploma/certificate preferred
    • Industry certifications preferred
    • Must own a reliable vehicle
    • Must have a G driver's license or higher
    • Must have a clean driver's abstract

    Skills:

    • Proven ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple competing priorities in an efficient and timely way
    • Highly motivated with the excellent time management discipline
    • Excellent interpersonal, presentation and relationship development skills
    • Strong oral and written communication skills
    • Strong knowledge of business software; Timesheet App, CRM, etc
    • A strong sense of empathy and understanding towards others while not deviating from the desired business outcomes
    • A passion for building outdoor spaces
    • A craftsman at heart; little details matter

    Our Commitment: 

    Soares Landscaping is committed to honouring people's rights and freedoms. Please let us know if you need accommodations in your application, and we'll work with you to meet those needs.
