title: Golf Course Turf Technician - Full-time Seasonal (March through December)
description:
Company Description

Located on over a mile of sandy beach along the coast of Cape Breton, Nova Scotia—and nestled between the Atlantic Ocean and the picturesque town of Inverness—Cabot Cape Breton is Canada’s first and only authentic links golf resort. Featuring 46 holes of exhilarating golf, including two acclaimed World Top 100 courses, 72 rooms of award-winning accommodation, 19 luxury Golf Villas, with 22 additional homes currently under construction, and exquisite dining in three on-site restaurants, Cabot Cape Breton is intended to excite and inspire at every turn.

Job Description

Position Overview

Are you someone who loves operating machinery, working hard outside, and being inspired to create and maintain pristine turf at a world class golf property? A vital role to Cabot’s world class success, you add value by operating and maintaining our large & small equipment, including riding & push mowers, utility & passenger vehicles, as well as other maintenance equipment. You expect to work flexible hours – mornings, evenings, weekdays and weekends as required. You are proud to represent the Cabot brand, and proactively act as an ambassador and role model.

A strong WORK ETHIC, you are energized by the variety of challenging tasks involved in world class golf course maintenance, grounds construction and landscape work and are eager to help those around you develop skills and learn key industry skills that result in world class turf. 

You are an INSPIRING LEADER who is energized building, leading and training other team members on safe equipment operation and overseeing on-course maintenance activity to ensure Cabot’s world class standards.

 

You COMMUNICATE TO CONNECT with a positive and team-oriented communication style with the intent of winning together. Whether verbal or written, you are consistent, clear and proactive always acting in a professional manner with guests, suppliers and associates.

Your LEARNING MINDSET, AGILITY and ability to think on your feet enables you to quickly learn golf terminology and the importance of each playable areas such as green, tees fairway, bunker. You enthusiastically participate in all Cabot training programs, assignments & activities and develop proficiencies with all equipment while gaining thorough knowledge in the grooming practices for fine fescue. 

 

Executional Excellence

Under the guidance of the Superintendent and Assistant Superintendent you will:

  • Implement world-class presentation of daily course set up and golf course conditions are achieved prior to the first tee time each day.
  • Ensure a safe, clean and productive work environment at all times.
  • Safely operate heavy duty and maintenance equipment.
  • Accurately complete equipment daily check in records. 
  • Complete topdressing, aerating, verti-cutting, grooming/brushing and fertilizing tasks.
  • Perform irrigation, fertilizer and product applications while displaying responsible environmental protection practices.
  • Use proper PPE when operating equipment for self and others.
  • Operate gasoline, diesel and electric utility vehicles and other maintenance equipment in a safe, non-destructive manner.
  • Complete pre-shift staging of equipment and resources daily, as required by other team members.
  • Identify unsafe areas and activities and report hazards immediately.
  • Continuous debris and garbage collection throughout the golf resort.
  • Inspect diesel, gasoline, oil and other equipment fluid levels daily; reports any equipment problems, failures or damages to the Assistant Superintendent and/or Mechanic immediately.
  • Reports golf course conditions and all disciplinary issues to the Assistant Superintendent.
Qualifications

  • Knowledge of the safe operation of motorized equipment.
  • Knowledge of the principals to safely operate gasoline and diesel engines. 
  • Mechanical aptitude and the ability to operate hand blower, trimmers, and other various hand tools and equipment. 
  • Ability to follow oral and written directions in a timely and efficient manner.
  • Positive attitude and excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skill.
  • Learn golf terminology and the importance of each playable areas such as green, tees fairway, bunker and understand the game of golf. 

 

Physical Demands 

  • Work outdoors in varying environmental conditions such as heat, cold, rain, snow and wind.
  • Communicate verbally with staff members and/or customers with or without the use of two-way radios.
  • Ability to spend long hours moving around, walking, sitting, standing, kneeling, reaching, shoveling and/or raking.
  • Exerting up to 100 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 25 pounds of force frequently or constantly .lift, carry, push, or otherwise move objects.
  • Give and/or follow verbal and written instructions.
  • Ability to work with and around motorized equipment movement hazards, and misdirected golf balls.


Additional Information

  • Staff Accommodation available
  • Staff Golf Rate
  • Retail Discounts
  • Food & Beverage Discounts
  • Friends & Family Accommodation Rate

title: Landscape labourer
description:
We're Hiring!!
 
Landscape Labourer
 
Job Description: 
 
Full Time seasonal landscape labourer
 
A residential farm property in Dufferin county, twenty minutes from Orangeville in Mono. Our property is situated on 125 acres and includes both forests and meadows, as well as a young fruit orchard, vegetable gardens, and native tree re-planting.
 
We are looking to add to our skilled crew to assist the Property Manager and will work together to improve and maintain the property.
 
Previous experience an asset.
- operating and maintaining medium-sized farm equipment (tractors, skid steer, etc.)
- ‎chainsaw experience including tree felling an asset; pruning and tree health; hiking trail maintenance
‎- light carpentry, building/ mechanical repairs
- general gardening, landscaping and hardscaping
- operation of small landscape equipment(mowers, line trimmers, blowers)
 
 
You are interested in natural conservation and restorative agriculture and believe in healthy/ safe working conditions. You are trustworthy and well-organized.
 
You also have a valid driver's license, are permitted to work in Canada, and are a non-smoker.
 
Salary $18-22 based on experience. 40 hrs/week Monday-Friday
 
Email resume to karen@bighat.farm

title: Landscape Maintenance Team Members-Softscape/gardeners.
description:
We began with a single vision shared between 10 brothers. Originally, we opened our doors as Sunshine Grounds Care in 1987. As time passed and more brothers joined in the project, it became a widely recognized brand built on the principles of excellent workmanship, customer satisfaction, and real care. We abide by the simple values outlined in our company acronym "C.A.R.E.", which are: Customers first, Attitude, Respect, and Enjoy life in the process!As a member of the Ground Guys team you perform landscape maintenance and design at high levels of quality and service. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.  You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and are able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines. You have at least one year of landscaping experience and proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.Specific Responsibilities:
  • Performs landscape maintenance duties such as mowing, fertilizer application, weed control, aeration, spring clean-up, fall clean-up, trimming, and pruning
  • Operates a variety of mechanical equipment including but not limited to bed edgers, commercial mowers, blowers, dump trailers, chainsaws, line trimmers, and tillers
  • Performs landscape enhancement activities such as mulch application, plantings, top soil application, lawn seeding
  • Addresses clients' questions, comments, and concerns or refers clients to the Team Leader as appropriate
  • Assists Team Leader with route and job planning and organization, thereby ensuring sufficient resources and materials are readily available
  • Assists with equipment maintenance and repair under supervision of the Team Leader
  • Applies chemicals under the direction of a licensed applicator, and with all required protective equipment
  • Performs other duties as required
Job Requirements:
  • High school diploma/GED (or current student status)
  • One year experience in this or a related field is required
  • Valid Driver's License with clean record
  • Willingness to work occasional weekends and holidays. 
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds to waist level and perform all other physical requirements associated with a position of this nature
Benefits: Benefits package varies by locationWe are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow up!

Notice

The Grounds Guys LLC is the franchisor of the The Grounds Guys® franchised system. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither The Grounds Guys LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. The Grounds Guys LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Groundskeeper Specialist
description:
Traine Construction & Development is based in Kelowna, BC and works throughout Canada, primarily on multi-family residential construction projects for our property management division, Mainline Living to operate. We create communities that residents are proud to live in and we are proud to operate. From Ontario to British Columbia, Traine prides itself on building excellent multi-family communities and great careers!

We currently have a unique full-time role as a Groundskeeper Specialist in Kelowna, BC.

As the Groundskeeper Specialist, you will be required to plan and perform tasks involving maintenance of estate landscaping and orchard. You must be self-motivated, resourceful, and reliable. The Lead Groundskeeper will lead a team of workers and support the owner with tool maintenance and equipment. Responsibilities will include lawncare, landscaping, painting, irrigation repairs and light mechanical maintenance.

This position plans work, assigns tasks, provides priorities and is available to answer questions or troubleshoot problems on a daily basis. Ability to operate a variety of hand tools, such as saws and drills is required.

  • Maintain and manage the maintenance schedule and preventative maintenance plan for all mobile equipment
  • Soil management
  • Light duty mechanics (tractor, vehicle and skid steer maintenance and repairs)
  • Basic electrical, welding, fabricating and plumbing
  • Diagnose malfunctioning systems and correct the problem
  • Seeding, transplanting, pruning and harvest
  • Building and repairing on-site shelters

Come and grow your career with Traine!

If you have:

  • High school diploma, GED or equivalent
  • Previous experience as a landscaper or farmer an asset
  • Knowledge of workplace safety and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Knowledge of first aid and CPR preferred (OFA1 or OFA2 in BC)
  • Certified in the use of:?Skid-Steer?(Bob-Cat), forklifts an asset
  • Ability to operate required equipment in a safe and responsible manner (tracker and/or large mowers)
  • Must possess and maintain a valid Driver's Licence as a condition of employment
  • Strong working mechanical knowledge of machines and tools including their designs, uses, repair and maintenance
  • Ability to lift heavy objects, walk and stand for extended periods of time and perform strenuous physical labour under adverse field conditions
  • Ability to work independently and complete daily activities according to work schedule
  • A strong communicator
  • Must be able to pass a criminal record check
  • Basic computer skills (email, use online apps, etc.)
  • Mechanical skills

Work Conditions

  • Physical ability to lift up to 75-pounds repeatedly throughout the day
  • Hazards associated with the trade
  • Outdoor conditions
  • Overtime as required
  • Option for part time in the winter if wanted

This is a full-time position with the possibility for compress work weeks for the right person.


In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with a very competitive salary (based on experience) and a full range of benefits, including:

  • Robust performance bonus program
  • Opportunities to be involved in life changing charitable projects
  • Extended Health and Dental
  • Investment opportunities in real estate
  • Professional development and ongoing training
  • Long term employment

By joining the Traine family, you'll find yourself working amongst a group of friendly, team-oriented individuals who strive to deliver exceptional results.

Work somewhere awesome – apply now!

title: Landscape Design and Outside Field Work
description:
CREATIVE PART TIME LANDSCAPE DESIGNER,  IN-FIELD ASSISTANT

 

  Are you a creative, career-minded professional in the Landscape Industry ? We are, and we’re looking to add one more expert, like you, to our team.

 

Here’s why: Our Part Time Landscape Designer, and Field Assistant, are dependable, motivated, and passionate members of a close team. They use their creativity and expertise to deliver detailed, and high quality projects on and off site. This person ensures that all projects are being created in a timely and professional manner, both efficiently and effectively. They have a strong eye for detail, and are passionate about creating beautiful landscapes. They are eager to continually improve and adapt to both aspects of the job.

 

Here’s what it looks like: Our Part Time Landscape Designers, and Field Assistants, create and collaborate with the head Designer to ensure that projects are met to our highest standards of detailed attention. They have excellent knowledge in Plant Identification, and Design software.

This person uses their skills to easily transition and assist where needed, on and off site.

The Qualifications:

  • At least 2-3 years experience in the Landscape Industry.
  • Landscape Design Program Graduate
  • Must have a valid driver’s license and a valid First Aid/ CPR certificate.
  • Strong time management skills
  • Strong knowledge with AutoCAD

 

 

Personal Traits:

  • Passionate about working with others in a group
  • Dependable, respectful
  • Enjoys challenges and learning new skills.
  • Takes pride and is passionate about creating high quality work.

 

Hill’ N Dale Landscaping is an award winning design/build company that focuses on installations of high-end residential projects. Located between Creemore and Shelburne, we are looking for persons with a passion for landscaping and who take pride in the work they do. Established in 1994, with continued success, we continue to grow each year. 

 

At Hill’N Dale, we encourage our employees to further their growth and education in this industry. We offer competitive wages and a safe and friendly work environment. If you are interested in this position with our company, please email your resume ‘Attention – Part-Time Designer to james@hndland.com (must include three past employer references) or visit our website:

hillndalelandscaping.com

title: Maintenance Groundskeeper Summer Student
description:
We are a major energy infrastructure business that has experienced tremendous growth over the past decade. This growth has provided our employees with stability, positive challenges, new career paths and opportunities to work in a dynamic team environment. As one of Alberta’s Top 75 Employers we are proud to say no matter where your role at Inter Pipeline may lie, you are provided ample opportunities for valued contribution and innovation, with a strong emphasis on employee growth.

Located out of our Cochrane Extraction Plant, the Maintenance Groundskeeper Summer Student will report to the Maintenance Senior.

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Currently enrolled in a post-secondary program, having completed a minimum of one year

Skills:

  • Experience with the safe use of hand tools/power tools
  • Working at heights
  • Forklift/Manlift/Telehandler operation experience
  • Safety conscious
  • Punctual
  • Communication skills verbal/written
  • Pleasant personality and positive outlook
  • Positive attitude, self-motivated and dependable with a strong work ethic
  • Demonstrated commitment to safety and compliance to processing facility procedures

Key Activities and Responsibilities:

  • Mowing the grass throughout the facility
  • Raking grass, leaves, and branches
  • Planting flowers, picking weeds, and spreading mulch
  • Sweeping sidewalks
  • Pruning trees
  • Picking garbage
  • Various string-trimming detail work
  • Any other work associated with general appearance and upkeep of the ‘non-process area’ of the Cochrane Extraction Plant

Hours:

40 hours/ week

May 2022 – August 2022

As this position is identified as safety-sensitive, employment of a final candidate will be conditional upon completion of pre-employment medical, drug/alcohol  assessments with satisfactory results.

Proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required for this position as a condition of employment. Requests for an exemption under applicable human rights legislation due to medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

While diversity is a fact, inclusion is the act of recognizing the value of our differences and leveraging them for the betterment of our organization. At Inter Pipeline, we are dedicated to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that values, represents, and supports the communities in which we work. We are committed to maintaining a respectful workplace and we are building a culture that supports the diverse needs of our employees. We welcome applications from all individuals including those who are Indigenous, racialized, of varied abilities and ethnicities, members of gender and sexually diverse communities, as well as with any other dimension of diversity.

title: Lawn Maintenance Crew Members
description:
Lawn Maintenance Crew Members (West GTA)

North Star Landscaping Inc is looking for qualified workers to fill openings in its Lawn Maintenance division.  Our accounts are in western GTA and Mississauga.  Lawn Maintenance Crew Member duties include:

- Grass cutting using small engine mowers and tractor mowers

- Spring and fall clean-up

- Cultivation of flower beds and trees pits, hedge trimming

- Spreading soils and mulch, plant trees, flowers and shrubs

- Raking mulch, blowing off hard surfaces

- Lay sod and install hardscaping such as interlocking from time to time as may be required

- Complete daily activity reports, time tickets.

- Provide basic daily maintenance and upcate of equipment being used

- Snow plowing and sidewalk maintenance services during the winter months

- MUST have a valid driver's license and actual lawn maintenance experience.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$28.00 per hour based on experience.

title: Crew Leader/Foreperson - Grounds Maintenance
description:
GROUNDS MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR


Reports to:  Owner, Division Supervisor, Operations Manager 


Summary: 
The Grounds Maintenance Supervisor is responsible for performing a variety of work tasks in order to manage the timely completion of grounds maintenance service contracts. The grounds maintenance foreperson will be required to supervise a crew of laborers and operate a variety of tools and equipment to carry out specified job tasks, as well provide daily progress reporting on job time and cost data. 

Core Capabilities:   

  • Customer and quality focus 
  • Effective communication skills (both verbal and written) 
  • Teamwork 
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities  
  • Responsibility and dependability 
  • Ethics and integrity 
  • Ability to use LMN via a smartphone

Job Duties: 

  • Plan and manage the loading/unloading of trucks and trailers in the AM and PM including all daily labor, equipment and materials required to complete daily objectives 
  • Cut grass, trim edges, clean up refuse, blow trimmings, fertilize and water turf areas and perform other lawn care duties  
  • Move and install soil, mulch and plant material to assist with the construction of landscape gardens and related areas 
  • Spray and dust areas to control insects and or weeds 
  • Operate power equipment including, but not limited to, lawn tractors, lawn mowers, line trimmers, blowers, hedge trimmers, pruning saws, sod cutters, chain saws, and snow blowers 
  • Supervise the work of crew members to ensure proper safety, quality, and productivity 
  • Inspect all work for quality to eliminate the need for return visits and/or re-work due to quality or customer satisfaction issues 
  • Train crew members on proper and safe job methods 
  • Conduct daily inspections and maintenance on vehicles, tools, and equipment 
  • Assist in other job-related duties including construction projects, shop and yard maintenance, vehicle and equipment maintenance 
  • Complete and submit all required paperwork on a daily basis, including, daily time and service record forms, equipment daily inspection forms, attendance tracking, requests for time off, etc.  
  • Maintain and enforce standards of cleanliness and organization in assigned trucks, trailers, equipment, jobsites, and shop/yard areas 
  • Ensure that all work activities are carried out in a safe and efficient manner, and that all crew members are compliance with government and company PPE standards  
  • Comply with all company policies and regulations 
  • Work in accordance with all local health and safety laws and regulations 
  • Communicate with customers in a polite and courteous manner 

Requirements: 

  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent  
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in the landscape/grounds maintenance industry 
  • Capable of operating required equipment and tools in a safe and responsible manner 
  • Effective communication skills – must be able to carry out verbal instructions, read labels and signs, complete daily reports to office and/or customers 
  • Time management skills 
  • Knowledge of specific materials, methods, tools and equipment required to complete various landscape/construction practices 
  • Ability to work both independently with little supervision, and as part of a team 
  • Ability to walk, stand, crouch for long periods of time and carry out strenuous physical tasks 
  • Valid driver’s license and safe driving record 

Work Conditions: 

  • Ability to work with hand tools, power tools, small engine equipment, and materials 
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs. repeatedly through an entire work shift 
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment 
  • Requires good manual dexterity 
  • Excellent stamina is required 
  • Work near heavy equipment and other vehicles on a regular basis  
  • Work outdoors in various conditions including heat and humidity, rain, dust, noise, and cold  
  • Flexible working hours including occasional weekend work 

Rate of Pay & Benefits: 

  • Rate of pay is $20-24/hr. Paid according to experience 
  • Benefits and RSP matching are available for the right candidates 
  • Winter work for those that would like to work with our snowplowing division.

title: Concierge
description:
Nous recherchons actuellement un Concierge qui serait intéressé à travailler dans une entreprise spécialisée dans le secteur alimentaire

Si vous avez déjà occupé un poste de concierge et que vous avez de l'expérience dans le domaine industriel, notre équipe de Lachine souhaite discuter avec vous .

Avantages
- Quart de jour : $16.48+0.75/hrs du Lundi au Vendredi
- Accessible en transport en commun
- Ben environnement de travail

Responsabilités
Le titulaire du poste de concierge s’assure de la propreté :
1. Dans la cuisine
2. Dans l’usine
3. Dans la section des casiers et vestiaires hommes/femmes
4. Dans les escaliers
5.Toutes les taches connexes

Qualifications
Compétences particulières:
- esprit d’équipe, autonome,
-sens de l’initiative
-organisation efficace

Sommaire
Si vous croyez être la personne que nous recherchons, communiquez avec nous sans tarder, vous pouvez faire parvenir votre CV à yann.bazabas@randstad.ca

Saviez-vous que pour chaque personne que vous nous référez et que nous emploierons durant au moins 4 semaines consécutives ou que nous embaucherons pour un poste permanent, nous vous donnerons un minimum de 50$. Facile, non? Inviter vos amis et votre famille a venir ouvrir un dossier a l'une de nos succursales

Vous ne trouvez pas un poste qui vous intéresse?
Vous recherchez un poste dans le domaine industriel, que ce soit pour un poste de journalier, preparateur de commandes, operateur de machine, cariste

Appelez-nous immediatement au 514-366.2336

N'oubliez pas d'aimer notre page Facebook Randstad Lasalle.

A fin de vous permettre de demeurer a jour au niveau des postes de disponible, je vous invite a télécharger l'application ''MyRandstad'' sur votre téléphone. Grace a l'application, vous serez rapidement informé de tous nos postes disponible et vous serez en mesure de postuler et choisir des quarts de travail qui concorde avec votre horaire.


Yann

téléphone:
514.366.2336
télécopieur:
514.366.2598

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Maintenance - Lead Hand
description:
PURPOSE OF POSITION:

This role is primarily responsible for assisting in the management of the day to day workload for the maintenance team to ensure an effective and efficient service is delivered and departmental targets are achieved, including the planning and resourcing of Planned Preventative Maintenance (PPM) and maintenance shutdown. Drive a culture of continuous improvement throughout the team. Provide leadership to the team, coordinating and overseeing their workloads, providing support to ensure that the team delivers, monitoring any issues, and ensuring targets.  Assist in developing the team by focusing on individual performance and support requirements to achieve high standards, while helping foster a culture of working safely. 

 

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Assist in running an efficient maintenance operation which is able to fulfil operational and customer demand and meet set targets
  • Perform effective diagnosis of breakdowns and timely repair of equipment to maximize availability
  • Perform scheduled planned preventative maintenance in accordance to minimize unplanned downtime
  • Assist in the analysis of issues to root cause and development of countermeasures, improvement actions and/or suggestions to improve
  • Control and source maintenance tools, equipment and spares
  • Document breakdowns, identifying root cause and remedial action to help identify and resolve recurring issues
  • Effectively lead the maintenance team, working with manager and colleagues to ensure smooth workflow with maximum output
  • Provide technical expertise to the team
  • Assist in the identification of areas of development within the team to achieve a flexible and responsive team which can support the demands of the organization
  • Motivate and coach the team to operational success
  • Consistently promote high standards through personal example and roll out through the team so that each member of the team understands the standards and behaviours expected of them
  • Assist the departments to efficiently use materials, labour and equipment to meet and exceed production targets.
  • Strong leadership and communication skills along with organizational skills are required
  • Undertake continuous training and development
  • Assist management in the coordination and communication of the department during vacations and absences.

 

Health & Safety

  • Enforce and actively promote safe work and good housekeeping practices within the current Ontario Safety legislation and the Active Safety program by employing daily job observation.
  • Adheres to safety practices and lockout applications. Participates in all 5S activities.

 

 

Training & Supplies

  • Ensures proper training and instruction of team with respect to expected standards of work performance, and job safety.
  • Advises on and applies technical knowledge / training to the team. Ensures required supplies for the team are on hand. Troubleshoots processes and equipment.

 

General

  • Completes and ensures that all necessary reports and written documentation in order to comply with Active Exhaust Policies and Procedures.
  • Participate in Continuous Improvement of department.
  • Ensure fair treatment of all employees consistent with the Employment Standards Act, the Human Rights Code, Active employee relations policies and the Collective Bargaining Agreement.
  • Immediately advise Manager of any circumstances that affect production, or safety.
  • Performs other duties as assigned

 

Requirements:

  • Min. grade 12 or equivalent
  • 3 years relevant experience (maintenance)
  • Computer literate
  • Highly developed written and communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a team player

title: Maintenance Worker (Part-time)
description:
It's an amazing time to join Golden Life as we continue to expand our seniors housing, care, and services within western Canada.

We’re looking for a qualified, part-timeMaintenance Workerto join our team at Mountain Side Village in Fruitvale, BC. This position will include work on 1 day (8 hours) a week. If you are an enthusiastic team player, with a passion for providing high quality care and support for seniors, then we would love to hear from you!

Duties will include, but are not limited to:
  • Under the direction of the Community Manager will maintain all aspects of the building including but not limited to building interior, exterior, and grounds, mechanical, electrical and site aesthetics.
  • Ensure preventative maintenance duties on all building components are fulfilled as per the preventative maintenance schedule and manufactures specification.
  • In conjunction with the Community Manager, will review, perform or coordinate all maintenance requests and resident requests; these items will be reviewed daily and will be prioritized in order of importance.
  • Directly deal with trades, suppliers and contracted services that relate to the maintenance department.
  • Works closely with the Community Managers to mitigate all resident and staff
    complaints.
  • Sources new trades, suppliers, material & manpower.
  • Assists the Community Managers in training and ongoing education of staff in
    relation to building system components and maintenance practices.
  • Works closely with construction during the turnover of a new building, addition or
    project.
The successful candidate will meet the following qualifications:
  • A strong mechanical or electrical understanding.
  • Minimum of three years’ related experience.
  • Must have a strong ability to trouble shoot and work through a variety of situations.
  • Ability to multi-task, manage time effectively and prioritize work.
  • Ability to plan, deliver and evaluate budgets.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • The ability to create sound & economical solutions in emergency situation.
  • Able to provide a Clear Vulnerable Sector Criminal Record Check.
  • Able to provide a Physician’s Waiver.
  • Proof of full and current Covid-19 vaccines.
Our culture attracts proactive self-starters who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, inclusion, integrity, passion, and curiosity. If this resonates, maybe you’re the right person to join the Golden Life team.

What we offer you

At Golden Life Management Corporation, we are purpose-led. Our Philosophy is focused entirely upon providing the best possible quality of care to our residents and those we serve. We recognize that engaged employees are necessary to achieve our purpose and our Philosophy.

As a Golden Life Team member, you can expect to be treated with dignity and respect, to be challenged with your work, and to have the autonomy necessary to excel. We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package that includes a voluntary retirement program with company contributions, for eligible employees.

Golden Life welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

If this sounds attractive to you, please apply today!

title: Maintenance Temp
description:
Location



First Canadian Place - 100 King Street West



Business




Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations — bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. It’s why the world’s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.




If you’re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.




Job Description




Working within a multi-task team environment performing and/or assisting in maintenance routines on building equipment. The position demands flexibility, availability to work primarily day shifts, and a positive, cooperative work attitude. Perform preventative maintenance routines on building equipment and washroom deficiencies.




RESPONSIBILITIES:



+ Perform standard maintenance routines on building equipment and systems.


+ Perform standard washroom inspections and minor repairs.


+ Respond to Tenant calls regarding lighting and plumbing issues.


+ Cleaning and Painting as required.


+ Other duties as assigned.


+ Embody and support Brookfield Properties’ Safety, Health and Environment Policy.


+ Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate hazards to reduce risk to the workplace.


+ Engage in training and continuing education to develop the knowledge, skills, and competencies required to work safely.


+ Take action to stop work if it cannot be executed safely or if conditions or behaviours are unsafe.


+ Immediately report SH&E incidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and/or at-risk behaviours to their supervisor; then diligently work to correct the problem.


+ Promote safe work practices and safe working conditions in accordance with all Brookfield Properties Safe Work Procedures.


+ Wear Personal Protective Equipment when required.





SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS:


Service oriented with excellent communication skills. Must be self-motivated, with the ability to work both independently and in a team, while learning from others. Must have a positive attitude and present a professional image.




EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:



+ General building maintenance experience


+ Available to work afternoons





EDUCATION/DESIGNATIONS/LICENSES:



+ Minimum Grade 12 education


+ A certificate in Building Systems Engineering or working towards it.






We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will accommodate the needs of all qualified applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

title: Landscape Maintenance Crew Leader
description:
Landscape Maintenance Crew Leader

Are you looking for an opportunity where you can shine off your leadership and landscape maintenance abilities?  You have a positive team orientated attitude, a mature disposition where others want to follow you, strong attention to detail and a desire to always grow.  If this describes you, let’s talk!

At Garden Grove we’re a tight-knit crew who are as passionate about caring for our clients as we are about each other. Though we’re larger in size than most landscape companies, we maintain a small company feel and supportive environment that makes our team members feel at home.

If you are looking to join a company with a heightened commitment to safety and quality, and be part of a crew of talented go-getters, you might just have found your match. With our range of services, including commercial grounds maintenance, landscape enhancements, and snow removal there’s no limit to what we can do, and what you can achieve.

Garden Grove promotes a teamwork culture, developing and training our staff to provide next-level service to our customers.

We are eagerly seeking a Crew Leader to join our Landscape Maintenance team, responsible for the efficient delivery of all property landscape maintenance services. 

 

Job Duties 

  • Lead, instruct, organize and co-ordinate schedules and work with a crew of 3-4 people
  • Ensuring properties are maintained to the high level of quality that is expected while maintaining budgeted productivity
  • Identify issues within the accounts that you service, recording those issues and reporting them to your manager
  • Dedicated to quality customer service you go the extra mile to ensure customer satisfaction
  • Ensure company policies and procedures are implemented and adhered to at all times, ensures all health & safety requirements are followed and enforces compliance
  • Utilization and proficiency with turf and lawn care equipment
  • High level of horticultural and landscaping skill and ability combined with strong work ethic
  • Ability to maintain a highly organized work schedule, while keeping your fellow team members on task and leading them to the finish line
  • Perform snow removal duties during snow season while ensuring proper safety procedures

 

Working Conditions

  • Duties will primarily be outdoors and regularly exposed to varying weather conditions i.e. wet and/or humid conditions, hot and cold temperatures, snow and ice storms.
  • Physical demands include but may not be limited to standing, walking, sitting, climbing, stooping, kneeling, bending, lifting, reaching, squatting, carrying, pushing, and pulling.
  • Occasional irregular hours due to unexpected circumstances.

 

Qualifications

  • A valid drivers license with clean drivers abstract
  • Minimum 2 years' in a comparable leadership role
  • Desire to work in horticultural/landscape industry
  • Knowledge of local plant material and equipment is required
  • 1-2 years experience in the landscape industry an asset

 

 Our Culture

  • Communication - Just like a fresh cut lawn, we pride ourselves on clean lines of communication.
  • Respect - Respect the process, C.A.R.E. about a job well done.  Operate in the spirit of cooperation.
  • Trustworthy - To be trusted, you need to be trustworthy.  Have the courage and integrity to make the tough decisions.
  • Motivated - Motivation can out-perform talent with the right mindset.
  • Teamwork - Teamwork requires everyone to be focused on our common goal.  Work together to achieve greatness.
  • Innovation - Adapting to change we challenge ourselves to always innovate.

 

Incentives for You

  • Seasonal and Full Time year round employment
  • Competitive wages and bonuses
  • Training, development, and paid certifications
  • Benefits Package
  • Opportunity for career ladder advancement within Garden Grove

 

Garden Grove Landscaping Inc. offers diverse opportunities in landscape and snow management services. 

 

As a leader in the industry, we have developed a strong reputation for excellence.  We continue to grow as an organization because of our focus on team building, quality and customer satisfaction.  Our unique culture has enabled Garden Grove to remain a successful family-oriented business, founded on principles of trust, honesty and respect.  This guides our relationships with each other, our customers, and cultivates a positive atmosphere where growth is encouraged, and where individuals can achieve their potential.  

Our team is growing forward – Garden Grove is the ideal place to start or further your landscape career.  Since our inception in 1990, Garden Grove Landscaping has seen steady growth and has become widely recognized as a service leader in the landscape industry. Having developed a strong reputation for excellence we continue to grow as an organization because of our focus on team building, quality and customer satisfaction. 

 

Join our team today!  Apply online at GardenGrove.ca/Careers  

Garden Grove is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Turf Care Supervisor
description:
Commercial Outdoor Services is seeking a highly motivated individual to join our team. In this position you will provide direction to summer staff with regards to total turf care.

Qualifications

  • Licensed Pesticide Applicator in Landscape and Industrial Vegetation
  • A Horticultural Technician Certification would be an asset
  • Minimum valid G Ontario Driver’s License
  • Valid CPR/First Aid certificate would be an asset
  • Minimum 3 years previous experience in turf care

Summer Responsibilities and Accountabilities:

  • Directly supervise and support spray technicians as required.
  • Experienced and knowledgeable in turf maintenance.
  • Inspect turf areas for weeds, insect, and disease problems.
  • Apply all turf products including fertilizers, and pesticides as part of a comprehensive IPM program
  • Ensure all employees under your supervision are properly trained.
  • Prioritize, schedule and coordinate client visits for turf care
  • Visit sites and evaluate the effectiveness of the turf care program.
  • Stock and maintain chemical inventory.
  • Maintain spray records and sign technician logbooks
  • Issue written and verbal instructions
  • Ensure appropriate scheduling and maintenance of vehicles and equipment
  • Learn minor repairs on equipment
  • Ensure timely and accurate completion of crew’s time sheets, approving through LMN
  • Evaluate regularly Clintar’s service to customers, and help to eliminate customer complaints
  • Be a hands-on supervisor that works directly with crews when short staffed, or falling behind
  • Evaluate performance, make recommendations, praise, or discipline of field staff in accordance with company policies
  • Ensure requested work is completed and to standard of quality expected
  • Attend weekly management meetings
  • Observe workers on site and evaluate if they are following safety procedures and correct any training issues so quality can be achieved.
  • Promote positive company image
  • All training and certifications are kept up to date.
  • Maintain and upgrade industry knowledge and education
  • Work with Sales Manager to sell turf care packages to clients

title: Landscaping Lead Hand - Summer Seasonal
description:
Whistler Blackcomb’s Mission Statement is “Experience of a Lifetime” Love what you do! Because that’s what we’re all about. The Whistler Blackcomb staff is comprised of individuals who thrive in the outdoors, love the mountains, and are passionate about what they do. We look for applicants who share in this passion, whether you are looking for a seasonal job or wanting to build an exciting career, don’t miss the chance to work and play in BC’s winter wonderland. If you sound like our ideal applicant please apply online and show us what you’ve got. #wbworklove


As of Nov. 15, 2021, Vail Resorts will be requiring all employees across North America to be vaccinated for COVID-19.


Top five reasons to work in Maintenance:


1. Working outside in Whistler British Columbia


2. Once in a lifetime learning experience


3. Best schedule – 3 days off every week.


4. Every single working day presents challenges different from the last day


5. Great team environment


Position Status: Full Time (30-40 hours/week) Seasonal, Hourly


Seasonal positions can be differentiated from year round jobs as the have predefined start and end dates. These dates may vary due to seasonal business fluctuations.


Job Summary:


Landscape Technician II position, under supervision must possess working knowledge of methods, tools, materials and practices used in landscape and grounds maintenance, and to be able to perform these activities effectively while maintaining landscape standards to the highest level.


Lead Hand position will be responsible for overseeing a crew of landscapers: training new staff, designating tasks, maintaining quality standards and organization of time in each location.


What you’ll be doing:


+ Planting installation (annuals, perennials, bulbs, shrubs and trees) for a variety of ornamental beds and landscape areas and provide follow up maintenance to include pruning, weeding, deadheading, watering and fertilizing.

+ Installation of seasonal hanging baskets and planter displays and provide routine maintenance to include watering, fertilizing and pruning

+ Three-season turf maintenance to include aerating, edging, seeding, mowing, trimming and fertilizing.

+ Prepare soils for various kinds of plantings and cultivate around plants, shrubs, and trees.

+ Clean and sweep WB outdoor areas and buildings (ie patios, walkways etc where plants are located)

+ Live and work by our core values: Teamplay, Employee Experience, Striving to be the Best, Customer Loyalty, Honesty and Integrity, Community and Environment, and Playing Safely.

+ Always show up on time, in uniform, and adhere to the grooming policy!


Qualifications:


+ Possession of Valid B.C. Class 5 driver's license is mandatory

+ Previous supervisory experience is an asset

+ Minimum 2 years experience in landscape maintenance technician position

+ Physically fit to perform required duties such as bending, kneeling and heavy lifting

+ Ability follow oral and written instructions and to communicate effectively

+ Able to work well independently and in a team environment,

+ Ability to operate power equipment and to use the tools and materials with efficiency and safety.

+ Must be task and project oriented, with a proven excellent work ethic with high standards and a good eye for detail

+ Ability and willingness to adapt to changing work assignments

+ Works well under all weather conditions and to practice the highest level of guest service.

+ Proof of clear criminal record check.


We’re looking for team members whose legendary attention to detail and commitment to phenomenal service comes naturally. Pursue a lifestyle that will elevate your expectation of what work can look like. Nothing is too big or too small for the staff to bravely pursue and elevate the expectations of the guest. Do you possess a calling for delivering world-class events and amenities? Explore Employment Opportunities with Whistler Blackcomb! www.vailresortscareers.com/whistlerblackcomb


_Vail Resorts is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law._


Requisition ID 419570

title: Landscape Lead Hand / Lead Horticultural Technician
description:
Position: LandscapeLead Hand

Organization: Garden Partywww.gardenpartyto.com


About us:

Garden Party is a landscape design, installation, and maintenance company located in the west end of Toronto. We offer a range of horticultural services including garden design, installation, maintenance, seasonal planter displays, and occasionally retail storefront displays.

We see every garden as an opportunity for conservation. We do our best to use sustainable practices and utilize native and pollinator-friendly species wherever we can. We are proud of our contributions to the beauty of our city and look forward to another season of creating healthy, sustainable gardens. 

Garden Party values the diversity and lived experience of all people. This means we celebrate our differences and cultivate an environment where everyone can feel safe and respected. We are committed to supporting all employees to fully develop their talents and strengths in the horticulture industry. Garden Party is a Living Wage certified business.

We are looking to fill one Landscape Lead Hand position for the 2022 season. This is an excellent opportunity to elevate your career in horticulture and mentor others. Experience with leadership is an asset, but not a requirement. 

 

About you: 

  • You are knowledgeable: We ask that you have at least two full seasons of experience in the garden. You are confident in standard maintenance practices, pruning, and planting.  You can identify common perennials and pests. Horticultural schooling and experience in leadership are assets, but not required.
  • You are strong: You are comfortable bending, twisting, kneeling, crouching, and lifting up to 50 lbs. You are motivated by hard work and able to work through unfavorable weather conditions.
  • You are a problem solver:  You can think on your feet and fly by the seat of your pants. You are capable of utilizing your crew and the tools around you to work through new challenges.
  • You are a teacher: You are motivated to share your knowledge and mentor team members to pursue a career and education in horticulture.
  • You are a communicator:  You can confidently comprehend written and oral instructions and clearly communicate and delegate tasks to others. You are organized and can keep track of information.
  • You are a cheerleader: You are able to motivate your team to achieve a high quality of work. You are comfortable providing constructive feedback as well as praise. 
  • You love what you do:  You are interested in horticulture, ecology, and garden design. You are open to learning and growing in the field. You take satisfaction in a job well done. 
  • You can drive: You possess a G driver’s license with a clean driving record. Please let us know if this is a barrier for you as we may be able to work with you on this.

  

About the Job:

  • You will work closely with our Field Manager to plan and manage our daily on-site work. This includes assisting in acquiring materials from weekly shopping lists and using given plans and instructions to delegate work to your team. 
  • While on worksites, you will independently supervise a team of 2-4 landscape technicians. You will be responsible for overseeing time management and quality control for each job.
  • You will oversee Garden Party’s full range of horticultural services including garden maintenance, planting, the composition of seasonal planters, and landscape staging for real estate.
  • You will work with the Field Manager to educate team members and provide them with regular feedback. 
  • Lead Hands transport their crew to and from work sites using a company vehicle. Sites are primarily located within the city of Toronto, however, we do occasionally venture into the GTA. 
  • Lead Hands will be responsible for keeping our home base organized. This means upkeep of tools, watering plants, and organizing storage spaces.

 

What we offer: 

  • Hourly rate starting at $25 per/hr
  • Full-time use of a Garden Party vehicle
  • Seasonal employment from April to December 
  • Paid orientation & training
  • Interesting and varied work with rewarding results and a great team environment

 

Our headquarters are located in Toronto’s west end. We start work at 7:00 am through the summer, and 7:30 am through the fall. You will have full-time use of a Garden Party vehicle to transport yourself to and from work.

Please send a brief cover letter and your resume to

hello@gardenparyto.com

with the subject line ‘Landscape Lead Hand’ by March 24, 2022. We can’t wait to hear from you!

title: Part Time Maintenance
description:
Weekend Maintanenace

Ottawa, On – Rideau Center

Who You’ll Work For

REEF’s mission is to connect the world to your block. 

We transform underutilized urban spaces into neighborhood hubs that connect people to locally curated goods, services, and experiences.

With an ecosystem of 5,000 locations and a team of 18,000 people, REEF is the largest operator of mobility, logistics hubs, and neighborhood kitchens in North America.

Together we are leveraging the power of proximity to keep our communities moving forward in a sustainable and thoughtful way.
 

What You’ll Do

  • Pick up all garbage and litter throughout the parking facility, including entrance and exit ramps.
  • Replace bags in the garbage cans throughout the parking facility.
  • Wipe down all garbage receptacles.
  • Pick up litter in all pay on foot vestibules.
  • Hand sweep areas of garbage where required i.e. Dirt accumulation in corners etc.
  • Parking office to be swept and mopped.
  • Wash garbage containers in the parking facility.
  • Clean the washrooms and parking office windows.
  • These are guidelines and express the minimum expectations, other duties may be assigned.
  • Staircases need to be cleaned and swept if need. 

Physical Demands:

  • Move around the property by walking for extended periods of time.
  • Must be able to lift 15 lbs on a daily basis.
  • Must be able to stand/walk for periods of time.

Working Conditions:

  • Work is performed in a covered outdoor environment.
  • Employees are subject to environmental conditions including heat and cold weather.
  • Protection from weather conditions will be provided, but not necessarily from temperature changes.

REEF Technology is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. REEF does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. REEF complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

#AB

title: Spécialiste en entretien paysager (25$+/heure)
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Envisagez de rejoindre une équipe qui est dédiée à l'excellence. Techo-Bloc a remporté le prix de l'entreprise la mieux gérée à deux reprises, une distinction qui reflète sa capacité à honorer la progression de ses employés!

Nous sommes un fabricant prospère, entrepreneurial, orienté vers la croissance et au rythme rapide, qui produit des pavés et des murs de soutènement qui inspirent les paysages artistiques à travers l'Amérique du Nord.  Nous formons des équipes qui veillent à ce que nos produits soient durables, de qualité et d'une beauté étonnante.

Avec bientôt 9 usines de fabrication (et ce n’est pas fini), 30 brevets internationaux et plus de 800 employés, nous évoluons dans un environnement passionnant et dynamique. Alors que nous poursuivons notre expansion, les membres de notre équipe se voient offrir des opportunités de développement professionnel, d'apprentissage de nouvelles compétences et de poursuite de projets qui les passionnent.

Si vous souhaitez travailler pour une entreprise qui est à l'écoute de ses employés et qui se consacre à votre progression, il s'agit peut-être de votre prochaine opportunité de carrière!

Pourquoi travailler chez Techo-Bloc

Nous aimons nous vanter! En plus d'un salaire compétitif et d'un ensemble complet d'avantages sociaux, Techo-Bloc offre plusieurs avantages tels que :

  • Des leaders qui s'investissent dans votre réussite ;
  • Emploi dynamique et un cheminement de carrière évolutif ;
  • Développement professionnel ;
  • Bonus de fin d'année ;
  • Un programme de REER disponible en 2022 ;
  • Barbecues et fêtes de Noël épiques ;
  • Cuisine remplie de collations ;
  • Stationnement gratuit ;
  • Des primes de référencement généreuses ;
  • Rabais pour les employés sur les produits de Techo-Bloc ;
  • Programme d'aide aux employés (PAE disponible 24/7).
Description du poste

Sous la responsabilité du gestionnaire du service après-vente, le membre de l'équipe d'entretiensera chargé de se rendre chez différents clients, nécessitant parfois des déplacements de nuit, afin d'effectuer des installations, des nettoyages et des réparations de pavés.

Les principales responsabilités sont les suivantes :

  • Fournir des services de nettoyage, de réparation et d'installation d'aménagements paysagers selon les besoins ;
  • Fournir la documentation ou les photos requises au coordonnateur de supports et soutien aux clients pour la fermeture des projets ;
  • Réapprovisionner notre réseau de distributeurs en documentation marketing : guides de spécifications, catalogues, brochures ;
  • Être un ambassadeur de la marque Techo-Bloc en assurant la cohérence de la marque et en garantissant l’excellence du service à la clientèle.
Qualifications

  • 2 ans d'expérience dans le domaine de l'aménagement paysager (installation de pavés et de murs et expérience en nettoyage est un atout) ;
  • Expérience avec les scies à béton portatives ;
  • Détenir un permis de conduire valide ; avoir un dossier de conduite en règle et en fournir une copie à jour ;
  • Capacité à conduire une remorque (Camion, remorque et équipement de travail vous seront fournis) ;
  • Être en mesure de soulever 50 livres ;
  • À l'occasion, être en mesure de travailler à genoux pendant de longues périodes de temps ;
  • Être prêt à travailler à l'extérieur et à l'intérieur ;
  • Capacité à travailler de manière autonome ;
  • Adopter un comportement sécuritaire au travail ;
  • À l'occasion, des déplacements de nuit seront requis.


Informations complémentaires

Votre contribution est très précieuse pour nous, tout comme les pierres que nous produisons. Techo-Bloc favorise une culture de l'innovation où chaque individu apporte une touche particulière à son domaine d'expertise. L'entreprise est en pleine croissance, vos idées et vos talents sont requis pour contribuer au développement de l'image de marque prestigieuse que Techo-Bloc a su développer au fil des ans.

Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt, mais seules les personnes retenues seront contactées.

L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
Black & McDonald’s Saskatchewan team is growing! If you are a hands-on, customer service-oriented, and technically-inclined professional searching for the opportunity to build a solid foundation for your career, this position is for you. The Maintenance Worker is located in Regina & 15 Wing Moose Jaw and reports directly to the Project Manager.

The Maintenance Worker is responsible for facility general maintenance and repairs, minor carpentry, drywall repair and painting, preventative maintenance, and assisting other trades.

  • Prepare areas for painting by repairing & patching surfaces.
  • Perform various duties to maintain the Facility including work associated with carpentry, furniture, drywall, painting, mechanical & plumbing repairs.
  • Assist with obtaining quotes, meet with sub-contractors and quote work.
  • Provide repairs and preventative maintenance to locks, doors & door closing systems.
  • Responsible for replacing locks, hinges, changing cores and adjusting door closers.
  • Assist other maintenance trades and perform other duties, e.g. changing filters or fan belts, preparing HVAC & plumbing systems for operation or winterization.
  • Assist in grounds keeping and snow removal
  • Performs daily rounds and log readings.
  • Complete maintenance records and work orders; input histories and comments as required.
  • Observe and implement safety regulations and practices.
  • Maintain the cleanliness of all sites, workspaces, and mechanical rooms.

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Holds Self and Others Accountable
  • Teamwork and Collaboration
  • Values and Respects Others
  • Change Orientation
  • Continuous Learning
  • Customer Focus
  • Problem Solving & Innovation
  • Working Knowledge of Email Platforms & Calendars

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • A minimum of 3 years’ experience in all aspects of facility maintenance.

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Basic general maintenance knowledge and experience.
  • Knowledge of the Health and Safety Act and all applicable CSA Codes.
  • Must be able to speak, read & write in English.
  • Must work in compliance with the provisions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and the regulations including but not limited to: use or wear of equipment or protective devices or clothing for safety purposes, report any known contravention of this Act or regulations or the existence of any hazards.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills required.
  • Follow instructions both written and verbal.
  • Maintain a professional demeanor at all times with fellow employees and customer.
  • Maintain clear and courteous phone etiquette.
  • A team player, committed to working in a quality environment.
  • Comply with all company policies and procedures and adhere to company standards.
  • Act in accordance with the commitment to safe and compassionate patient care and a safe and healthy work environment.
  • Must be able to lift up to 30 kg (bending and lifting is required).
  • Must be able to work on ladder or scaffold at various heights.
  • Must be able to pass Federal Security Clearance to work on military facilities.
  • Must provide proof of double vaccination to meet Covid protocols.

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Maintenance Worker III
description:
Our client is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

Duties:
  • Provides semi-skilled and general maintenance, repair, building, and installation services
  • Acceptable experience in routine maintenance tasks, general labouring, and/or building maintenance tasks including the operation and maintenance of hand and power tools.
  • Acceptable experience in providing leadership, supervision and direction to work crews, reviewing crew work and performance management;
  • Acceptable experience in the supervision of job sites in relation to the maintenance and repair of built infrastructure at campgrounds, and day use areas, and other built assets.
  • Acceptable is defined by a minimum of 12 months experience.
Knowledge:
  • Knowledge of building maintenance and construction techniques;
  • Knowledge of appropriate use, care and maintenance of construction and maintenance equipment;
  • Knowledge of safety procedures;
  • Knowledge of Parks Canada and its mandate and corporate objectives including the National Parks Act, park regulations and policies.

Abilities:

  • Ability to supervise staff, including use of constructive criticism and positive reinforcement;
  • Ability to construct and/or maintain assets including not limited to buildings, roads, campgrounds and day use areas;
  • Ability to lead, plan and organize for successful delivery of project requirements;
  • Ability to read and interpret construction plans and specifications;
  • Ability to think analytically, problem-solve and make decisions;
  • Ability to maintain logs and records;
  • Ability to use a variety of computer software programs such as Microsoft Office and e-mail;
  • Ability to lift and carry 45 kilograms or allowable under OHS requirements.
Personal Suitability:
  • Provides vision and leadership;
  • Personally connects with others;
  • Exercises sound judgment;
  • Dependable;
  • Demonstrates initiative;
  • Works well in adverse weather conditions;
  • Helps create a team environment.
Other condition(s) of employment:
  • You are required to possess and maintain a valid Class 5 driver’s licence recognized by the province/territory applicable to this offer of employment.
  • You must be willing to work overtime.
  • You will be required to work shift-work, and/or weekends, and/or statutory holidays and provincial/territorial holidays as scheduled by your delegated manager.
  • You may be required to wear a uniform while performing your duties. In this case, Parks Canada will provide you with the uniforms you require in accordance with the Parks Canada Uniform Policy;
  • You must be willing to work and travel in a variety of terrains and weather conditions in the performance of the duties.
  • You must be willing to obtain and maintain a valid Standard First Aid and CPR-C.
  • You will be required to work primarily on job sites, and have minor administrative functions.

title: Crew Member/Labourer on Landscape Installation Crew
description:
We are looking for a self-motivated, detail-oriented and hardworking individual to be a crew member on a lanscape installation crew.   

Requirements for a successful applicant:

  • must have own transportation to and from the shop
  • general knowledge of equipment
  • critical thinking
  • ability to work as a team player
  • reliable & punctual

Experience is an asset but we are willing to train. 

Payment is based on experience.  Benefits are available after a short probationary period for full-time employees.

title: Landscape Gardener
description:
Flourish Garden Services is hiring gardeners to join our 2022 team, full- or part-time. We’d love to hear from you, if you are:

  • Passionate about gardening
  • Physically strong, fit and energetic
  • Friendly, positive and a team player
  • Eager to learn and contribute

 

Who Are We?

We provide expert sustainable garden care, planting installation and enhancements services to our Toronto clients. We have been doing so since 2007. We believe healthy beautiful natural spaces are vital to the well-being of our urban community. Plus, we get to work outside, in nature, every day.

 

We are a conscientious boutique company where each member’s input is valued. We look out for each other, strive to do our best every day, and focus on making a difference – garden by garden.

 

Who Are You?

You love plants, enjoy working hard outdoors and being part of a team that shares and cares. You take pride in your work and completing your tasks to the highest standards. You want to learn and seek professional growth in the landscape industry.

 

What We Offer:

  • On-the-job training, learning opportunities & career growth
  • Performance-based bonuses
  • Paid Stat Holidays (*after June, pro-rated for part-time)
  • Health Savings Account
  • Uniforms, PPE & COVID-19 prevention protocols
  • $18-25 hourly wage (based on experience & skills)
  • Work/life balance

Extra skills = wage/position consideration:

  • Full G driver’s license (clean abstract), experience driving in Toronto
  • Previous gardening experience

 

Opportunity:

  • Gardening: weeding, pruning, tending plants, trimming, topdressing, raking, organic lawn care
  • Assist with planting installations, seasonal arrangements
  • Follow company policies and all Health & Safety policies
  • Use and maintain standard small landscape power tools & equipment
  • Drive and/or organize, clean vans
  • Complete daily time & materials tracking, job reporting.

 

Term: 2022 Season April - December

Hours: typically 7 a.m. to 5 p.m., M-F (flexible outside of peak season)

Location: We are located in the Queen St. West area and travel to our clients throughout Toronto

title: Lawn Maintenance Technician
company: Hauraney Enterprises Limited o/a The Garden Girls
description:
Lead Lawn Maintenance Technician

Hours 20+ Weekly

 

TurfNDirt is a caring & growing family business that has been maintaining Oakville, Mississauga, Burlington and Etobicoke Lawns since 2011 and has been providing the lawn maintenance services for The Garden Girls Garden Care since their inception.  

 

Do you have experience in lawn care maintenance or a willingness to learn the position with the opportunity to grow with our growing company? Are you able to communicate with customers with a friendly and positive attitude?  Are you able participatein  a co-operative and comfortable team environment and nurture a positive and flexible work environment? Do you have the ability to make a difference in our customers day? 

 

Our primary goal is to deliver weekly consistent, responsible lawn service to a variety of customers in different stages of their lives using standard lawn maintenance equipment. Regular Maintenance Duties include tending our customer’s grass areas with line trimming, backpack blowing and lawn mowing. Assistance as needed in other areas within the company including sod repairs, top dressing & seeding, mulching, soil delivery and application. 

 

This position pays $18-20 per hour depending on experience and knowledge. Able to work outdoors for extended periods in varying weather conditions • Able to wear personal protective equipment deemed necessary to perform this job safely (may include; gloves, mask and / or face shield, non-slip shoes, steel toe shoes etc

 

No weekends, No holidays

title: Landscape skilled labour
company: M&S Landscaping Design And Build Inc.
description: To perform specialist functions to construct and build landscape environments which include   Natural stone, Interlock pavers, Deck & Fence, Pergolas, Cabana, Water Future, Retaining walls, Steps, Patios, Driveway, Walkway, flowers, trees, shrubs, lawns and construction landscapes. Candidates must have over 5 years experience in landscape construction industry.

title: Landscape Maintenance Leadhand
description:
Who You Are:

You’re an active adventurer with a green thumb. You’re a passionate plant lover. You’re a positive motivator with a tenacious spark.

Working outdoors excites you and you desire to learn and grow with other like-minded individuals in a green industry career. At the end of the day, when your hands are marred with dirt and there are grass stains on your pants, you step back and are proud of what you’ve accomplished because you know it will be enjoyed by many.

Who Are We?

We’re a very tight knit group of professionals looking to add to our growing team. Belleview Landscapes was established to serve both people and the environment. We have the ambition to directly impact the love and wellbeing of the people in our communities and create meaningful change in the spaces in which we interact. That is what cultivates our passion for building community resilience and supporting sustainably focused initiatives. We imagine, design , create, and maintain the environments in which we live, work and play. And we can’t wait to meet you, our new Property Maintenance Specialist.

In Your New Role…

As Property Maintenance Specialist you will be the foundation for our emerging maintenance division. You will participate in a range of landscape activities from enhancements to property maintenance including garden care. You will work with new and emerging technology and equipment. You will support the existing team in achieving their goals while being supported in achieving your own.

What You Already Have:

- 3-5 seasons working with a landscape firm or equivalent

- A knowledge of plants is a must with an understanding of proper garden and plant care practices

- A diploma, apprenticeship or certification in the landscape profession are considered valued assets

- Other related licenses or certifications is an asset

- G class drivers license with a good driver abstract

What We Will Provide:

- Uniform and PPE

- Training – both on the job and personal development

- Benefits package (currently in development)

- Potential for sales commissions

- $25+ per hour

- Seasonal and Full-Time employment options

Join our team today!

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Salary: $20.00-$30.00 per hour

title: Seasonal Gardener
description:
Job Description

Employer: gardenKitchener Position: Gardener

Status: Full time seasonal April/October

Effective Date: April 2022

gardenKitchener, or the Kitchener Horticultural Society (KHS), was established in 1872 and is 150 years old. We promote horticultural and environmental awareness in Waterloo Region through a variety of activities for our 500+ members including garden tours, perennial exchanges, bulb sales, seminars & workshops, youth events, horticultural therapy programs, bus trips, and much more.

Rockway Gardens, 7 Floral Crescent, is a public Botanical Gardens run by the Kitchener Horticultural Society as the showpiece for the Kitchener Waterloo area. Established in the 1920s as place of beauty for locals to enjoy including six water features, a Rock Garden, perennial border and formal annual beds.

A team consisting of a supervisor, grower, lead hand, gardeners, planters, and laborers that design, propagate, plant, prune and nurture the grounds to present to the public the best representation of a Victorian garden.

The Rockway team manages all aspects of Rockway Gardens, 7 Floral Crescent Kitchener, Ontario The team is accountable for the care and maintenance of the gardens, the grounds, the structures of the Gardens. Part of the role is to answer any questions from the public who visit the gardens and be a visible representative of gardenKitchener to visitors.

We are looking for an individual to join our team as a gardener. We take great pride in our work here at Rockway and we are looking for the right candidate to help us be successful with our season.

Skills and experience required or beneficial for success in the position
The successful candidate must:

  • Work well within a team environment
  • Be detailed oriented and follow instructions
  • a working knowledge of plant identification and care for these plants would be beneficial
  • Be physically fit, capable of bending, lifting up to 40 pounds, digging and raking.
  • A Driver’s License and own transportation to Rockway Gardens and off-sight Greenhouse
  • This position requires 40 hours a week of physical labour.
  • The incumbent will participate in all aspects of maintenance which may include:
  • Spring clean-up, raking leaves, pruning, cleaning up debris, clean up ponds and fountains.
  • Work at the greenhouse assisting the Grower in the spring
  • Planting annuals
  • Weeding and watering
  • Fertilizing
  • Pond maintenance including cleaning debris and removal of algae
  • Garbage Pick up as needed
  • plant removal
  • mulching
  • installing approximately 20 000 bulbs as a team

 

Work Start Date: Monday, April 11, 2022. Work End Date: Friday, November 04, 2022.

 

Contact: Karin Clemens

Email: rockwaygarden@gmail.com

Industry: Horticulture

Contract length: 7 months

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal Contract

Salary: $17.00 per hour

We promote horticultural and environmental awareness in Waterloo Region through a variety of activities for our 500+ members including garden tours, perennial exchanges, bulb sales, seminars & workshops, youth events, horticultural therapy programs, bus trips, and much more.', 'Be detailed oriented and follow instructions', 'Weeding and watering', 'Rockway Gardens, 7 Floral Crescent, is a public Botanical Gardens run by the Kitchener Horticultural Society as the showpiece for the Kitchener Waterloo area. title: Maintenance Grounds Assistant (FT)
description:
REQUIREMENTS OF AN ASSISTANT MAINTENANCE/GROUNDSKEEPER PERSON:
  • Must be available to work a 5-day week with occasional overtime
  • Follow all Workplace Health & Safety guidelines with respect to the operation of equipment as well as all COVID-19 precautionary measures.
  • Enjoy working with other team members and guests while promoting a positive, professional attitude with all.
  • Enjoy performing physical work outdoors in a variety of temperatures and weather conditions.
  • Possess or have the willingness to obtain training such as Workplace Health & Safety Awareness and WHMIS.
  • Ensure the resort and its facilities are kept safe, clean and in good operating condition by performing general maintenance and minor repairs to buildings, grounds and equipment as required.
  • Must be comfortable using a variety of tools and equipment.
  • Must be able to understand and follow verbal and written communications with minimal supervision.
  • Have reliable transportation to and from work.
  • Have a G1 driver's license and meet insurance requirements.
  • Proof of two (2) Covid-19 Vaccines.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Watering and caring for plants and lawns, continuously monitoring beach and accommodation areas for cleanliness as well as safety concerns, removal of trash and recycling from bines and other receptacles daily.
  • Painting, staining, minor repairs, and other related functions that promote a clean, safe, and enjoyable environment for our guests and visitors.
  • Racking/blowing leaves, removal of branches and twigs as well as any other assorted debris from the property.
  • Assist with seasonal preparations of resort amenities such as swimming pool, hot tub, canoes, boats, waterfront toys and patio furniture.
  • Perform snow removal using shovels and snowblower, application of sand/ice melt materials to walkways, ramps, stairs, etc.
  • Assist other team members with repairs and/or periodic maintenance in their areas.
