title: Landscape Construction Crew Foreperson
description:
Assign tasks based on work schedules, keep workers on task, complete timesheets and inspect the quality of work to ensure job requirements are met. Instruct crew members on proper work standards. Interact with customers to resolve issues or answer questions. Crew leaders, also called foreperson, work along with crew members in completing all landscaping installations/maintenance. Operate a variety of hand tools and equipment such as packers, chain saws, hedge shears, sod cutters, pruning saws, mowing equipment, etc. to complete landscape and garden projects.

All PPE and uniforms provided, on the job training, Health Benefits package after 3 months, Paid Stat Holidays, Team building events, seasonal or full time employment options.  All crews dispatch from our ancaster location, but arrangements can be made to pick up employees at a pickup point if required.

title: Assistant Manager, Landscape Supply Centre
description:
About the Job:

The Assistant Manager, Landscape Supply Centre (AMLSC) will be responsible to support the Store Manager and Wholesale Landscape Manager in achieving wholesale sales and margin objectives.  Your role is to manage employees, oversee wholesale sales and merchandising initiatives by working cross-functionally with other departments, provide exemplary guest service, and help achieve company goals.  This is a salaried position offering full benefits, an incentive plan, and company pension.  



Your Accountabilities:

  • Assist the Store Manager and Wholesale Landscape Manager in planning and implementing strategies to meet and exceed annual wholesale sales revenues and profit budgets.
  • Exhibit, and foster amongst all employees, an enthusiastic, helpful, and positive sales-oriented attitude towards all guests, ensuring a high level of service.
  • Provide leadership and direction to employees by actively providing training, coaching, and mentorship.
  • Assist in planning of department floor plan along with the implementation of floor displays while adhering to corporate merchandising standards and directives.
  • Actively promote Sheridan services, as well as corporate and in-store events and oversee the planning, preparation, and implementation at the store level.
  • Organize visits to competitors on a regular basis and communicate useful feedback as requested.
  • Creation and approval of wholesale product orders placed from the store while working within corporate parameters, ensuring that all purchase orders are completed in accordance with company policy.
  • Work in conjunction with the Assistant Manager, Operations, Category Managers, and Store Category Supervisors to maintain inventory at levels that both allow for maximum sales and ensure that inventory targets are met at year end.
  • Maintain accurate records and ensure that all requests are followed up on in a timely manner.
  • Resolve guest and employee issues and concerns.
  • Actively seek to increase knowledge base of Sheridan products and services.
  • Provide a safe work environment through active observations, hazard reporting, coaching on relevant health and safety best practices, and leading by example while ensuring all employees are adhering to company policies and guidelines.
  • Support the Store Management team as needed, serving as a backup in their absence, including taking on additional responsibilities as the role evolves at the direction of the Wholesale Landscape Manager.



Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Must have completed high school and be legally eligible to work in Canada.
  • 5+ years of experience in a retail setting.
  • Previous management or supervisory experience with proven leadership and organizational abilities.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills when interfacing with guests and employees.
  • Ability to maintain a professional demeanor and cooperative attitude in all situations, including peak seasons.
  • Passion for the industry, sales, and guest service.
  • Existing product knowledge or ability to learn.
  • Previous horticulture or landscape industry experience an asset. 
  • Effective time management, with the ability to adapt and prioritize multiple tasks and situations.
  • Active listening and trust building.
  • Have the courage to resolve problems and trouble shoot guest issues or complaints.
  • Punctual and dependable, and highly value honesty, integrity, and authenticity.
  • Flexibility to work a variety of shifts including day, evening, weekends, and holidays as seasonal peaks require, including store opening and closing responsibilities.
  • This job requires extended periods of walking and standing, as well as the ability to lift 50lbs and work in various weather conditions and environments.
  • Please be advised that being fully vaccinated for Covid-19 is a condition for employment (subject to any accommodation required under the Ontario Human Rights Code).

We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

If selected, please advise if you require special accommodation to attend the interview.

coaching, and mentorship.', 'Assist the Store Manager and Wholesale Landscape Manager in planning and implementing strategies to meet and exceed annual wholesale sales revenues and profit budgets.', 'Active listening and trust building.', '5+ years of experience in a retail setting.', 'Actively seek to increase knowledge base of Sheridan products and services.', 'Work in conjunction with the Assistant Manager, Operations, Category Managers, and Store Category Supervisors to maintain inventory at levels that both allow for maximum sales and ensure that inventory targets are met at year end.', 'Maintain accurate records and ensure that all requests are followed up on in a timely manner.', 'Previous horticulture or landscape industry experience an asset.', 'Effective time management, with the ability to adapt and prioritize multiple tasks and situations.', 'The Assistant Manager, Landscape Supply Centre (AMLSC) will be responsible to support the Store Manager and Wholesale Landscape Manager in achieving wholesale sales and margin objectives. \xa0Your role is to manage employees, oversee wholesale sales and merchandising initiatives by working cross-functionally with other departments, provide exemplary guest service, and help achieve company goals.\xa0 This is a salaried position\xa0offering full benefits, an incentive plan, and company pension.']

title: Crew Member/Labourer - Grounds Maintenance
description:
GROUNDS MAINTENANCE LABORER  

Reports to: Foreman

Company:

We are a growing company that specializes in Design Build Landscape work in a busy landscaping and excavation industry. Ability to grow with company, options for advancement. No weekend work, working Monday to Friday approximately 40 hrs. With Fridays being a shortened day. Paid weekly, bonus on a yearly basis. Great rate of pay, training available. Options to work yearly. Snowplowing and excavation work in the winter months. Working hours are 7-5pm, except Fridays. RSP matching available to the right candidates. Safety equipment provided. Work boot allowance on a yearly basis.

Character:

We are looking for motivated employees, that have valid transportation, clean drivers abstract, ability to work as a team member in an environment that promotes professional workmanship, quality work, and passion for working in one of the most rewarding and wonderful industries. Abilities should include, fast thinker, problem solving, attention to details, abilities to work in a fast-paced environment, working in all weather conditions. Working with and around heavy equipment. Good mathematical skills, some knowledge of small engine repair and maintenance. Priorities will be given to those with previous experience, and or AR, DZ or AZ licenses.

Summary:

The Grounds Maintenance Laborer is responsible for performing a variety of work tasks in order to complete grounds maintenance service contracts. The grounds maintenance laborer will be required to operate a variety of tools and equipment to carry out specified job tasks.

Core Capabilities:

  • Customer and quality focus
  • Effective communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Teamwork
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities
  • Responsibility and dependability
  • Ethics and integrity

Job Duties:

  • Aid in the loading/unloading of trucks and trailers in the AM and PM
  • Cut grass, trim edges, clean up refuse, blow trimmings, fertilize, and water turf areas and perform other lawn care duties as directed by foreman
  • Move and install soil, mulch, and plant material to assist with the construction of landscape gardens and related areas
  • Spray and dust areas to control insects and or weeds
  • Operate power equipment including, but not limited to, lawn tractors, lawn mowers, line trimmers, blowers, hedge trimmers, pruning saws, sod cutters, chain saws, and snow blowers
  • Conduct daily inspections and maintenance on vehicles, tools, and equipment
  • Assist foreman in other work-related duties including construction projects, shop and yard maintenance, vehicle, and equipment maintenance
  • Always wear appropriate personal protective equipment
  • Comply with all company policies and regulations
  • Work in accordance with all local health and safety laws and regulations
  • Communicate with customers in a polite and courteous manner

Requirements:

  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent
  • Minimum one year experience in the landscape/construction industry
  • Capable of operating required equipment and tools in a safe and responsible manner
  • Effective communication skills – must be able to carry out verbal instructions, read labels and signs, complete simple reports, report progress to foreman
  • Time management skills
  • Knowledge of specific materials, methods, tools and equipment required to complete various landscape/construction practices
  • Ability to work both independently with little supervision, and as part of a team
  • Ability to walk, stand, crouch for long periods of time and carry out strenuous physical tasks
  • Preference will be given to candidates with a valid driver’s license and safe driving record

Work Conditions:

  • Ability to work with hand tools, power tools, small engine equipment, and materials
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs. repeatedly through an entire work shift
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Requires good manual dexterity
  • Excellent stamina is required
  • Work near heavy equipment and other vehicles on a regular basis
  • Work outdoors in various conditions including heat and humidity, rain, dust, noise, and cold
  • Flexible working hours including occasional weekend work

Wages:

Wage Rate start at $18.00 and can range to $22.00, premium paid for winter snow work

title: Landscape Foreman
description:
Homescapes Complete Residential Landscape has an immediate opening for a Landscape Foreman.

About the Job:
In collaboration with the Superintendent, the Foreman plans and schedules key construction activities for each week and establishes production priorities in keeping with project schedules and budget.

Responsibilities:
  • Large-scale landscape installation in residential communities.
  • Coordinate, manage, and motivate the day-to-day activities of crew members and sub-contractors. 
  • Read blueprints.
  • Participate in construction activities and support your team in accomplishing daily production targets.
  • Implement operating methods and procedures designed to improve productivity and product quality with guidance from the Superintendent.
  • Review all project specifications, the scope of work, and site conditions with the Superintendent and help establish project schedules and priorities.
  • Identify needs for supplies, materials, & equipment and report to the Superintendent at the beginning of each week and ensure their availability prior to project construction.
  • Accountable for assigned truck, trailer, bobcat, and other tools/equipment to ensure their safe operation and maintenance.
  • Identify hazards and other potential obstacles during project construction and recommend potential solutions.
  • Responsible for overall health & safety of crew members and job site including training, incident reporting, and enforcement.
  • Prepare daily timesheets for crew members and ensure time is coded to the proper job costing.
  • Provide coaching, training, performance evaluation, and communicate job expectations to direct reports.

Core Competencies: 
  • Ability to communicate effectively with clients, subordinates, and other colleagues.
  • Ability to effectively oversee the work activities of direct reports.
  • Strong customer service and conflict resolution skills.
  • Ability to manage a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
  • Physical Capabilities: heavy lifting up to 50 lbs, physically demanding requiring walking, bending, crouching, kneeling, and standing for long periods of time, working long hours in all types of weather conditions.
  • Proper PPE is required.
  • Health & safety oriented.

Technical Requirements:
  • 2 years (minimum) of Foreman experience.
  • Class 5 driver’s license & own vehicle required; driver’s abstract MUST be provided.
  • Experience operating landscaping and construction equipment (i.e., skid steers, etc.)

Education:
  • Completion or in the process of completing the Certified Horticultural Technician program is considered an asset
  • Other related construction or safety training program completion is considered an asset

Starting wage $25.00 - $28.00 / hour.
Overtime paid after 8 hours/day and 44 hours per week.
This is a full-time, seasonal position available immediately to approximately November 25, 2022; with the possibility of winter snow removal employment.

Homescapes Complete Residential Landscaping specializes in the design and construction of new homes and renovation landscaping. Homescapes has been creating outdoor living in the Calgary area for over 16 years and our award-winning team has over 50 combined years of experience and training. From creative and functional landscape designs to skillful and inspired landscape construction, Homescapes has the industry professionals to guide you to your outdoor oasis.

Please email your resume to

info@homescapes.com

, or fax (403) 569-0055.

Only applicants of interest will be contacted for an interview. Thank you for taking the time to apply.

title: Landscape Labourer
description:
About the Job:

LandscapeLabourers are responsible for the day-to-day duties of landscaping as directed by their Foreman.

Details:
  • Weeding, pruning, trimming trees and plants.
  • Cart and spread topsoil and other materials.
  • Lay sod or seed lawns.
  • Plant bulbs, flowers, shrubs, and trees.
  • Ability to push, pull and lift weight of up to 50 lbs.
  • Ability to communicate with Foreman and other crew members.
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize in order to meet tight deadlines.
  • Good hand-eye coordination.
  • Physical dexterity to handle prolonged sitting, standing, kneeling, or walking.
  • Demonstrated attention to detail and the ability to follow directions.
  • Reliable, punctual, and a team player.
  • Build fences, decks, pergolas, interlocking bricks, retaining walls.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Pay: 
  • Starting wage $18.00/hour 
  • Overtime paid after 8 hours/day and 44 hours per week
  • Potential of working a maximum of 12-hour shifts, dependent on weather.

This is a full-time, seasonal position available April 4, 2022, to approximately November 25, 2022; with the possibility of winter snow removal employment.

Requirements:
  • Candidates MUST have a license and reliable vehicle to drive to the site location (s) in Calgary.
  • Steel-toed boots and work gloves are required.
  • Must be willing to work 8 - 12 hour days Monday to Saturday.

Qualifications: 
  • No formal education is required; residential landscaping or construction-related experience is considered an asset.

Physical Capabilities: 
  • Attention to detail.
  • Heavy lifting up to 50 lbs, physically demanding requiring walking, bending, crouching, kneeling, and standing for long periods of time, working long hours.

Essential Skills: 
  • Take direction, work well with others.
  • Good communication skills. 
  • Multi-tasking. 
  • Punctual. 
  • Assist with landscape construction, construction, and install decks, fences, retaining walls, patios, water features, tree/shrub planting, grading, landscape lighting, sod, mulching, brick edge. 

Please email your resume to

info@homescapes.com

, or fax (403) 569-0055.

Homescapes Complete Residential Landscaping specializes in the design and construction of new homes and renovation landscaping. Homescapes has been creating outdoor living in the Calgary area for over 16 years and our award-winning team has over 50 combined years of experience and training. From creative and functional landscape designs to skillful and inspired landscape construction, Homescapes has the industry professionals to guide you to your outdoor oasis.

Only applicants of interest will be contacted for an interview. Thank you for taking the time to apply.

title: Landscape Crew Leader
description:
Spec Plus Inc. is always seeking talented individuals who are looking to build a career with our fast growing company.   In business for 6 years, we are landscape professionals serving the GTA, specializing in landscape design, consultation and installation of both residential and commercial developments.  We also offer summer lawn care and winter maintenance services.  

We are currently seeking a Landscape Crew Leader to join our team to assist in providing services in landscape construction and maintenance, consultation and professional installation with a focus on creating beautifully landscaped properties to meet clients unique needs. This position will also assist in managing and training crew members on proper work standards and ensuring job requirements are met.

 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Direct, plan and coordinate daily work activities of crew members
  • Work along with crew members in completing all landscaping installations/maintenance
  • Instruct crew members on proper work standards 
  • Complete timesheets
  • Inspect the quality of work to ensure job requirements are met
  • Conduct site visits during construction as required
  • Meet deadlines for project stages
  • Trimming using line trimmers
  • Blowing leaves and grass clippings using backpack blowers
  • Weeding, pruning, planting, cultivating and edging beds, laying sod etc.
  • Drives company vehicle (and trailer) to clients locations
  • Snow removal and salting
  • Interact with clients to resolve issues and/or answer questions
  • Operate, train and maintain a variety of landscaping equipment 
  • Able and willing to work outside in various types of summer weather conditions
  • Assist in general office duties as required
  • Perform other duties as may be assigned

 

SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum College Diploma/Certificate or enrolment in Horticulture or Landscape Design or related field and/or extensive proven industry experience will be considered.  
  • Knowledge of construction techniques and basic knowledge of horticulture and plants an asset 
  • Working knowledge of Windows OS software
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on customer service
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Ability to operate a variety of hand tools and equipment such as packers, chain saws, hedge shears, sod cutters, pruning saws, mowing equipment, etc. to complete landscape and garden projects 
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Valid G driver’s license required. D/AZ driver’s license is preferred with a clean driver’s abstract

 

Successful candidates will be required to meet the following criteria:

  • Personal transportation to and from the office/yard
  • Available to work Monday-Friday 8:00am-5:00pm
  • Willing to work extra hours during busy times
  • Eager to learn and expand skills
  • Adhere to company policies & procedures 

 

 Compensation and Benefits:

  • $20 to $ 28 / hour based on experience
  • Paid statutory holidays
  • All uniforms and PPE paid for by company 
  • Training and career development opportunities
  • Winter work available 

Interested applicants kindly submit a resume and cover letter to hr@specplus.pro

title: Concierge
description:
SKYSERVICE AVIATION D’AFFAIRES 

Skyservice est un chef de file nord-américain de l'aviation d'affaires. Établissur les principes clés de sécurité et de l'excellence du service, nous offrons une expérience de service complète, allant de la gestion au nolisement d’avions, en passant par la maintenance et la vente d'avions à partir de nos terminaux de services aéronautiques qui s’étendent du Canada à l'ouest des États-Unis. Les gens et les valeurs sont des atouts inséparables qui animent notre engagement en matièrede qualité, de sécurité, de respect et d'efficacité. Ces valeurs fondamentales nous guident quotidiennement et contribuent à construire notre réputation de chefs de file dans les services de l’aviation. Skyservice est une équipe dévouée au soutien et au perfectionnement de ses employés. Si vous souhaitez optimiser votre carrière, élargir vos horizons et votre expérience, Skyservice est l'équipe idéale pour vous.

SOMMAIRE DES RESPONSABILITÉS :

  • Fournir un niveau élevé de service à la clientèle, conforme aux principes de Skyservice;
  • Faciliter de façon efficace et courtoise les arrivées et départs des clients; y compris conduire les véhicules de l’entreprise de façon sécuritaire en tout temps;
  • Assurer efficacement la communication et la coordination entre les clients, les représentants du service à la clientèle, les équipes du service au sol et les collègues;
  • Accueillir et assister les équipages relativement aux demandes de carburant, aux réservations d’hôtel, aux services de restauration, aux dispositions de limousine ou navette et autres aspects de soutien au sol;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de service au sol et les pilotes pour veiller à combler tous les besoins du service à la clientèle;
  • Faciliter le confort des passagers ou invités et créer une atmosphère harmonieuse;
  • Répondre aux multiples lignes téléphoniques et acheminer les appels en conséquence;
  • Maintenir une communication bilatérale avec les avions entrants par radio sol-air;
  • Fournir des observations et renseignements au directeur ou au superviseur du Service à la clientèle relativement aux questions de service ou aux préoccupations des clients;
  • Comprendre les règles, règlements et procédures internes pertinentes et s’assurer de leur respect;
  • Fournir efficacement des laissez-passer de sécurité aux invités qui ont besoin d’accéder à des zones sécurisées, et surveiller la piste pour s’assurer qu’il n’y a pas d’infraction aux règles de sécurité;
  • Signaler tout laissez-passer manquant au directeur ou au superviseur du Service à la clientèle;
  • Aider les clients en leur fournissant des indications routières pour nos installations, les restaurants et les hôtels
  • Assurer l’organisation et la propreté du comptoir d’accueil, du vestiaire principal, de la zone café et du salon.
  • Faire le plein de fournitures non techniques (café, crème, lait, etc.) pour la zone café
  • Autres tâches assignées

FORMATION ET COMPÉTENCES EXIGÉES :

  • Permis de conduire valide correspondant au type de véhicule conduit;
  • Permis d’exploitation de véhicules côté piste (AVOP) et certificat d’opérateur radio valides;
  • Au moins de 4 à -5 années d’expérience dans un environnement de service à la clientèle exigeant;
  • Disponible au travail durant différents quarts de travail, y compris les fins de semaine et les jours fériés
  • Doit présenter une preuve de dossier de chauffeur sans points d’inaptitude;
  • Excellentes aptitudes de communication;
  • Solide connaissance de Microsoft Outlook;
  • Aptitude à fournir un service courtois, discret, efficace et professionnel;
  • Attitude proactive et compréhension des besoins du client;
  • Solides techniques organisationnelles;
  • Aptitude à travailler sous pression;
  • Attitude positive constante;
  • Diplôme d’études secondaires;
  • Études postsecondaires, un atout;

Skyservice est un employeur qui souscrit à l’équité en matière d’emploi et qui accepte la candidature de toute personne intéressée. Si, pour une raison quelconque, vous ne pouvez soumettre votre candidature par notre site d’emploi, communiquez avec un membre de notre équipe des Ressources humaines pour prendre des dispositions spéciales.

title: Landscape Manager
description:
SUPERVISOR PARKS

  • Job ID: 16328
  • Job Category: Parks & Natural Resources
  • Division & Section: Parks, Forestry & Recreation, PFR Parks
  • Work Location: Oriole Yard: 247 Esther Shiner Boulevard, G. Ross Lord Yard: 4801 Dufferin Street, Esther Shiner Stadium: 5720 Bathurst Street, Rockcliffe Yard: 301 Rockcliffe Boulevard, Emery Yard: 27 Toryork Drive, Toronto Island: 9 Queen's Quay West
  • Job Type & Duration: Full-time, Permanent
  • Salary: $88,979.80 - $104,624.00, PSG TM0746, Wage Grade 6.5
  • Shift Information: 40 hours per week
  • Affiliation:  Non-Union
  • Number of Positions Open: 6
  • Posting Period: 23-Feb-2022 to 09-Mar-2022

Major Responsibilities:

Reporting to a General Supervisor Parks, the Supervisor, Parks' main function is to supervise, plan and deliver operations and maintenance services in support of all parks and related activities within a geographic area of the City of Toronto.

  • Supervises the integrated operation and maintenance of parks and open space within a designated area, which includes horticulture, turf management, artificial and natural ice rink operations, winter maintenance, general maintenance, managing parks events and other applicable disciplines
  • Supervises the day to day operation of all assigned staff including the scheduling, assigning and reviewing of work. Recommends to General Supervisor, the vacation and overtime requests for authorization.
  • Monitors and evaluates staff performance, approves salary increments, hears grievances and recommends/implements disciplinary action when necessary
  • Implements detailed plans and recommends policies/procedures regarding program specific requirement
  • Supervises, motivates and trains assigned staff, ensuring effective teamwork, high standards of work quality, productivity and organizational performance
  • Directs and monitors staff through on site assessments of related work practices to ensure practices conform to relevant policies and procedures, established parks standards, legislation and regulations, including health and safety, asset and risk management, labour relations and Collective Bargaining Agreement
  • Investigates conflicts, complaints and implement actions to successfully resolve
  • Monitors work related to new park development and park renovation
  • Communicates with staff across the Division to ensure consistency in delivery of service
  • Represents the Division/Branch on project committees and consults with senior management and local Councillors in the community
  • Collects and analyses feedback and information obtained from multiple user groups in order to assess the need for park upgrades and standard maintenance practices and the implementation of new procedures for parks operation
  • Provides input into and administers assigned budget, ensuring that expenditures are controlled and maintained within approved budget limitations
  • Ensures the effective maintenance of facilities, fleet / equipment repairs, replacements and upgrades and other physical resources
  • Develops recommendations for the General Supervisor regarding changes to the on-going operation of parks maintenance, related services and facilities projects based on site evaluations
  • Acts as a Supervisor under the definitions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act, and ensures that adequate training, safety equipment and safe work procedures are in place in order to develop a strong culture of Health and Safety and minimize any Health and Safety issues

Key Qualifications:

  1. Post-secondary education in a discipline pertinent to the job function or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  2. Considerable supervisory experience gained through progressively responsible positions in parks maintenance and operations.
  3. Considerable experience directing or supervising in a diverse working environment (including union environment).
  4. Must possess a valid Ontario Class "G" driver’s licence and ability to obtain a City driver’s permit.
  5. Ability to operate as a member of a management team and self-directed work team, work cooperatively with frontline staff, community groups, bargaining units and other divisions.
  6. Knowledge in the core functions of the parks portfolio that may include horticulture, turf management, general maintenance, winter and parks operations.
  7. Proficiency in various competencies that include strong interpersonal, customer service, written and oral communication and conflict resolution skills.
  8. Effective administrative, planning, human resources and financial management skills.
  9. Proficient in the use of corporate computer software applications.
  10. May be required to work shifts, weekends, overtime and holidays.
  11. Familiarity with Ontario Statutes, including the Occupational Health and Safety Act, Collective Agreements and other relevant legislation.

Communication:

Please note that all applicants are encouraged to provide a valid email address for communication purposes. Applicants may receive written correspondence regarding this job posting directly to the email address provided on their resume or to the one used to set-up their Candidate Profile if applying on TalentFlow. As an applicant, it is your responsibility to ensure that you check your email regularly.

 

 

Note: 

All City of Toronto employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire in accordance with the City's Mandatory Vaccination Policy. Candidates will be required to show proof of vaccination during the recruitment process.

Equity, Diversity and Inclusion

The City is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace culture of inclusiveness that reflects the diverse residents that we serve. Learn more about the City’s commitment to employment equity.

Accommodation

The City of Toronto is committed to fostering a positive and progressive workforce reflecting the citizens we serve. We provide equitable treatment and accommodation to ensure barrier-free employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the

City of Toronto's Accommodation

Policy. You can request for accommodation related to the protected grounds at any stage of the City's hiring process, i.e., application, screening, assessment and placement. If you are an individual with a disability and you need accommodation in applying for this position, please email us at

application.accommodation4@toronto.ca

quoting the job ID #2284858 and the job classification title.

If you are invited to participate in the assessment process, we ask that you provide your accommodation needs in advance at that time. Please be advised that you may be requested to provide medical/other documentation to Human Resources to ensure that appropriate accommodation is provided to you throughout the hiring process.

Apply Here:

https://jobs.toronto.ca/jobsatcity/job/Toronto-SUPERVISOR-PARKS-ON-M5V-3C6/556821917/

title: General Labour/Golf Course Greenskeeper (Part-Time, Seasonal)
description:
General Labour/Golf Course Greenskeeper (Part-Time)

Donalda Club is one of the finest multi-activity, family oriented private clubs in the country that strives to exceed our members expectations daily. In operation since 1960, Donalda Club has a longstanding history and has built a culture and environment for our members and their families to create lifelong memories. Similarly, our staff is part of that family culture, creating an ideal working environment alongside one of the most beautiful facilities in the city.?

The Position:

We are looking for Golf Course Greenskeepers for the Summer 2022 season. A successful candidate would be energetic, enthusiastic (loves golf!), has leadership and personal skills who can work independently and collaboratively with other team members.

As a member of the Donalda Grounds Team, you will work alongside the Golf Course Superintendent and his assistants for maintenance of the golf course to deliver the best possible playing conditions for the membership on a daily basis.

An Overview of Main Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Mowing and maintenance of greens, tees, fairways and rough
  • Raking and maintenance of sand traps
  • Raking and removal of leaves and other debris
  • Other turf duties as requested by grounds management team
  • Our goal is to provide our membership with a high-class golf experience daily. We strive to staff our turf maintenance team with talented people who share our level of enthusiasm.
  • Operation of light equipment such as hand-powered tools, riding mowers, tractors, etc.

Requirements:

  • Ability to work early mornings (5:30-6:00 A.M. start times)
  • Available to work the required weekends and holidays
  • Positive attitude and willingness to learn
  • Physically capable of completing required tasks
  • Valid driver’s license - G/G2 required
  • Previous landscaping experience (preferred, but not necessary)
  • Golf course experience an asset (but not necessary)
  • Must possess excellent customer service skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Detail-oriented and works with a high degree of accuracy
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
  • Must be extremely responsible with integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion

We are looking for motivated individuals who are available  part time  from April 2022-November 2022  (weather dependent) until the end of the golf season.

Employment with the Donalda Club will be conditional upon the successful candidate having received a COVID-19 vaccine series approved by Health Canada, at least 14 days prior to their start date. This requirement is subject to exemptions pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.

EXPECTED START DATE:  April (weather dependent)

Applicants who do not already have legal permission to work in Canada will not be considered.

Donalda Club is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations for disabilities will be provided to support participation in all aspects of the recruitment process.

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary

Salary: $17.25 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
All staff will be provided the necessary PPE including face masks, hand sanitizer and equipment disinfectants. In addition, signage has been posted throughout the staff building and hand sanitizer has been provided at all entry points.

title: Crew Member/Landscape Maintenance Technician
description:
BELVEDERE LANDSCAPING LTD.

Job Description

Position Overview

We are looking for a hardworking, independent individual to join our small family owned landscaping business. This team member will be responsible for improving the look and function of clients’ properties.

Primary Tasks & Responsibilities:

  • Complete landscape maintenance duties such as mowing, line trimming, pruning, spring and fall cleanup, planting, mulching and sodding.
  • General garden maintenance such as weeding, cultivating, pruning of plants and shrubs.
  • Operate a variety of tools and equipment, ie. Line trimmers, hedge trimmers, mowers, back pack blowers etc.
  • Travel to meeting area will be required each morning (yard is located at north end of Markham).
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Possibility of winter work (assist in hand shoveling and salting walkways).

Qualifications:

  • Valid G license with a clean driving record.
  • At least 1 year of landscape maintenance experience.
  • Able to operate equipment such as mowers, blowers, line trimmers, hedge trimmers, etc.
  • Combination of sitting, standing, walking, bending, crouching, kneeling is required.
  • Physically fit / energetic. This is a physically demanding job.
  • Able to lift 50 lbs independently.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Willingness to learn.
  • Good interpersonal and organizational skills.

Work Conditions:

  • Working outdoors in all-weather environments including heat, humidity, wind and cold.
  • 40 hours per week on average-sometimes more depending on time of year.  Generally busiest April, May, June and July.
  • Occasionally work on Saturdays (when and if required).

Rate of Pay:

·        $18.00 - $25.00 per hr depending on experience.

Thank you for your application!

title: Inspired Gardener Leader
description:
Who you are:

Are you looking to join a team that will allow you to learn and grow in a rewarding, fun and positive environment while sharing your knowledge and expertise with others? The Perennial Gardener is looking for a Diligent Gardener Leader to join our team! You will become a full member of the crew and will oversee a small team offering an ongoing opportunity for you to further develop your leadership skills. You will be committed so that both you and your entire team can be successful. You will be organized and have excellent communication skills with a passion for quality and customer satisfaction.

Your Responsibilities:

The Diligent Gardener Leader will direct a team in their duties on different garden projects throughout the day. You will be responsible for keeping the clients’ gardens in a clean state, this will involve driving to the site, weeding, trimming and general tidying of each property all while adhering to a defined time management plan. Duties may include planting, mulching, removing weeds, trimming shrubs, deadheading plants and improving the overall look of the garden by spotting and identifying problems and offering your recommendations and solutions to meet the client’s needs. Your duties will also include managing your team and ensuring that they are efficiently performing their tasks while being safe. 

Benefits to Working with us:

  • We are a family run company where you will have an opportunity to feel pride and a sense of accomplishment in the work that you do.
  • Your ideas will be heard and encouraged to be shared, and open and respectful communication will be at the forefront of all interactions. You will be treated like a person and will not need to ask for respect.
  • We will provide you with training and learning opportunities allowing you to develop in your career.
  • We offer benefits after 3 months and a fair salary.
  • We encourage an attitude of working to live instead of living for work. Work-life balance is important to us!

Requirements:

  • 35 to 40 hours per week.
  • Leadership Skills
  • Able to lift a minimum of 24 kg
  • Knowledge of plants and shrubs an asset, training provided
  • Valid driver’s license a must
  • Safety shoes are a must
  • Like to work outdoors
  • Able to use gas and battery-powered tools

Benefits:

  • Healthcare for full-time employees is available
  • Covid aware and reduced risk workplace
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • Harassment free workplace
  • Member of Landscape Ontario
  • Safety and health-conscious workplace

Salary

  • Range:  $25 - $30 per hour
  • Season: April – November

 

CONTACT 

Matt Ramsay 647-391-5805

matt@perennialgardener.ca

Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Roads and Grounds Operative I
description:
Position Description


Are you a self-starter always thinking of better ways to do things? Are you looking to be part of a dynamic team focused on providing top-quality services to customers? If yes, please keep reading! As a member of Serco’s dynamic team, your expertise and collaborative skills will make a positive impact towards our military defense and safety of our soldiers.


As the Royal Canadian Air Forces’ prime service provider at 5 Wing Goose Bay, Labrador, our team delivers comprehensive air operations, emergency services, logistics and engineering expertise to the Department of National Defence. We work on behalf of DND’s “no fail” mission at Goose Bay: supporting NORAD operations for the projection of air power on the north and northeast coasts of Canada, while supporting military training for the Canadian Armed Forces, Allies and NORAD. 5 Wing Goose Bay provides effective training facilities, adaptable infrastructures, and a unique, austere, and challenging training location. Currently, Serco Canada has over 1,200 employees across four provinces, including a strong and growing Indigenous workforce.


You will be part of a team that works closely with the military customer and other Serco teams to deliver quality and efficient services to DND. The Serco team has been recognized as one of Atlantic Canada’s Top Employers for 4 years in a row and received the prestigious Atlantic Canadian Aerospace and Defence Association. Industry Excellence Recognition Award for Gender and Diversity Excellence.


In this role, you will:


+ Garbage collection from PMQ's, Mess Hall, Trade Shops, and clean up grounds.

+ Perform snow removal in accordance with SNIC Plan.

+ Perform grass cutting in accordance with Grass Cutting Plan.

+ Perform landscape maintenance.

+ Assist with repairs to concrete and asphalt surfaces on the Airfield and on Domestic roads.

+ Repair/replace signage on Domestic roads and on the Airfield..

+ Lifting heavy materials/equipment in performance of duties.

+ Operating light vehicles as required with proper licensing.

+ Operate light vehicles such as 44 Passenger Buss, Taxi and Ambulance.

+ Operate specialized equipment such as ride-on lawn mowers, power saws, hedge trimmer, 60LB buster, farm tractor, bobcat loader, snow blower, JLG lift, forklift, turf sweeper, etc.

+ Operate communication equipment for Airfield & Domestic operations.

+ Responsible for recording time daily in TMA.

+ Other related duties relevant to this position as may be required.


Qualifications


To be successful in this role, you will have:


+ Some secondary school education.

+ Possession of a valid NL Driver’s License Class 5 is required (Class 2 and 4 with 9 Endorsement would be an asset).

+ Possession of or the ability to obtain and maintain a Ramp Defensive Driving Course (DND/RDDC) certification to operate vehicles on the airfield is required.

+ Ability to obtain and maintain an Enhanced Reliability security clearance is required. May be required to upgrade to Secret Level II (dependent upon customer’s security requirements).

+ Ability to obtain DND 404 to operate Government owned vehicles (CFR Plated Equipment).

+ Ability to successfully pass a pre-employment drug and alcohol screening test.


Hourly Rate : $24.19


Weekly Hours : 37.5


Serco has had a significant, stable presence in Canada for several decades - anchored in the defence space by our contract to provide comprehensive air navigation and base management services at 5 Wing Goose Bay, Labrador. If you are interested in supporting and working with our military and a passionate Serco team- then submit your application now for immediate consideration. It only takes a few minutes and could change your career!


Company Overview


Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. Federal civilian agencies, the Intelligence Community, the Canadian government, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, Serco Americas has over 9,000 employees and is part of a $4 billion global business that helps transform government and public services around the world. At Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset - we listen, respect and support them throughout their career at Serco. We invite you to become part of our dynamic team. Serco is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying our workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/ Vets).


To review Serco benefits please visit: https://www.serco.com/na/careers/benefits-of-choosing-serco .


If you require an accommodation with the application process please email: careers@serco-na.com or call the HR Service Desk at 800-628-6458, option 1. Please note, due to EEOC/OFCCP compliance, Serco is unable to accept resumes by email.


Serco does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies without being a contracted approved vendor. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Serco and will not be obligated to pay a placement or contract fee. If you are interested in becoming an approved vendor at Serco, please email Agencies@serco-na.com .


COVID-19 Regulations: Serco complies with all applicable COVID-19 requirements. This may require employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, provide attestations regarding vaccination status and/or COVID-19 testing, or satisfy other conditions of employment that Serco deems appropriate, and employees may be required to show proof of vaccination and/or negative COVID-19 test results as a condition of employment (except in limited circumstances where an employee is legally entitled to an accommodation).

Refer a friend for this job


New to Serco?


Join our Talent Community! (https://talent.serco-na.com/talentcommunity/signup)

title: Maintenance
description:
Job description

Maintenance technicians at Wet ‘n’ Wild Toronto are responsible for the general upkeep and safety of our, buildings, utilities, infrastructure and attractions on a daily basis. Some of the physical duties assigned to Maintenance Technicians are:

•Daily Preventative maintenance inspections of all attractions and key equipment.

•Monitoring, inspecting, performing predictive and reactive maintenance to filtration and water treatment equipment, pumping lift stations and building systems.

•Assisting with the implementation of new equipment and updating existing systems to meet the parks efficiency and lean goals.

•Repair and maintenance of the parks various, pneumatic, control, HVAC, electrical and plumbing systems. This position requires associates to document much of their work for compliance with various regulatory requirements as well as work in an “on call” capacity while on shift.

1.Applicants must be fluent in English and have excellent reading and writing skills.

2.Applicants must be able to communicate effectively through use of various systems such as, online notebooks, documentation databases, and two-way radio.

QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

An ideal applicant will be enrolled or have been enrolled in a millwright or other industrial trade related program, engineering or facility maintenance program. In addition to this an ideal applicant would also possess.

•G2 or G drivers license

•MOL Working at Heights Training

•Own Hand Tools

PREFERRED SKILLS

•Knowledge of use of hand and power tools

•Understanding of hardware and uses.

•Fiberglass/bodywork experience would be considered an asset.

•Knowledge of pneumatic, control and plumbing systems an asset.

Contract length: 4 months

Work hours: 30 - 40 per week

Expected start date: 2022-05-10

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Salary: $18.00-$18.50 per hour

title: Outside Maintenance Worker
description:
This position, reporting directly to the company Property Manager, is responsible for the maintenance activities of land and buildings maintained by the company.

This is a very hands-on position that involves duties including tenant relations, maintenance and repair, security, janitorial services, landscaping, snow removal, garbage collection, etc.

The Outside Maintenance Worker is charged with carrying out the daily scheduled duty tasks as well as any unscheduled jobs that may come up, in a safe and environmental sound manner keeping in mind management's goals and objectives.

Full-time: Permanent
Career Level:Experienced
Compensation: $15 - $18 / hour

title: Markstone Landscaping Crew Member / Labourer
description:
No experience necessary- we will train!

For more than a decade, Markstone Landscaping Ltd. has been the local leader in professional landscaping. The secret to our success? Our people. 

We’re interested in dedicated people who are looking for a career, not just a job.

If you have the right attitude and skills, we’re happy to train you in an area that best fits your interests and aptitude.

At Markstone, we value professional development and training as highly as we value camaraderie. 

We work hard, we play hard, and we take pride in our work.

 

What we offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Benefits package
  • Training and development opportunities
  • Learn from the best - recently rated top 3 landscaping companies!

 

Job Requirements:

  • Valid drivers license and reliable transportation to Burlington
  • Must be punctual, have a positive attitude and be willing to learn
  • Skilled at safety operating a truck and trailer, skid steer, mini excavator, saws and any other equipment an asset (...but willing to train!)
  • Previous experience framing or forming concrete an asset

 

To find out more about Markstone, visit our website at www.markstonelandscaping.com.

If this job interests you, we look forward to seeing your application!

title: Landscape Crew Leader (Foreman)
description:
Join the team that won the 2020 Landscape Ontario Employer of Choice Award! Rockscape is a Muskoka based design/build firm that specializes in high-end residential landscaping. We are an established firm with a solid reputation and we are looking for individuals to help us growthat reputation as we enter the 2022 season.

Who do we need?

You! If you:

  • Have 3+ years of experience leading a hardscape crew
  • Willing to work alongside crew members to build exceptional landscapes
  • Want to be proud of your employer and the work that you do
  • Want to join a fun, dynamic team
  • Can work in a physically demanding occupation
  • Enjoy the possibility of boating to work
  • Willing to get your hands dirty

Why join Rockscape?

  • Work with colleagues who love their job
  • Challenging and unique projects
  • Well maintained tools, equipment and trucks
  • Benefits/RRSP matching for full-time staff after 1 full year

This position offers a variety of career opportunities. We are creating new positions as we continue to grow. We are passionate about developing personally and professionally and provide many opportunities to learn new skills.

Interested?

Got questions? Ask us anything!

Contract length: 7 months

Application deadline: 2022-02-28

Expected start date: 2022-04-18

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal

Salary: $26.00-$35.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • landscaping: 3 years (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class G Licence

title: Gardener Assistant
description: Looking for a team member to assist with maintenance of residential gardens. Open to flexible schedule of part time or full time hours. No weekend work or evening work. Must have an interest in working outside in all types of weather and have a passion for creating and maintaining beautiful gardens. Preference if for those that have experience and an interest in pursueing a career in Horticulture. Job does require physical requirement of planting,digging,bending, kneeling and moving dirt and mulch with an wheelbarrow. Ongoing support and training will be provided. Although knowledge of identifying weeds and working with perennials and annuals if preferential. Bonus if you have taken any horticultural courses and willing to enhance your education during the winter months is a plus. Preference if for those that have access to their own transportation, as you may work on your own part days.

title: Landscape Construction Crew Leader
description:
Landscape Construction Crew Leader:

-Work alongside and supervise a crew of employees on a landscape construction job site

-Ensure a safe work environment for themselves and other

-Knowledge in landscape construciton; grading, paver installation, interlock, planting etc

-Common plant knowledge

-Machine experience; skidsteer, mini-ex, stone saw etc

-Valid G license or higher with clean drivers abstract.

-Potential for full time year round employement with employee benefits.

title: Yard Worker
description:
Job description: Yard Worker – Edmonton, AB

 

AFA Forest Products Inc. is 100% Canadian owned and operated distribution company that stretches coast to coast with a goal to provide unmatched service in the distribution industry, while leading the way with innovative products and marketing ideas for the building materials future. AFA prides itself in keeping up with today’s trends and staying at the forefront of the ever-evolving distribution industry. For more information about the company and the products we provide, please visit www.afaforest.com.

The AFA Forest Products Inc. Branch in Edmonton, AB is seeking a Yard Worker for Full-Time employment to work alongside our team, Monday-Friday (no weekends).

 

Responsibilities:

  • Serve customers as they enter the yard
  • Load and unload building materials operating a forklift 
  • Prepare, pick and pack customer orders

Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in lumber and building material industry
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Detail-oriented with commitment to doing things right
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Ability to lift and carry items up to 60 lbs on a daily basis
  • Forklift certification and minimum 1 year experience of operation

Additional Information:

  • Group Benefit Plan available
  • RRSP Contribution available
  • Profit sharing program available
  • Opportunities for advancement within the company

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

COVID-19 considerations: COVID-19 Protocols are in place.

title: Lawn Care Specialist
description:
The Yardfather is a landscaping company that offers services for both residential or commercial property. Starting out small, The Yardfather has become the trusted source with a variety of satisfied clients in the Milton Area.  The Yardfather has built a reputation of reliability and value with our commitment to meeting the requirements of our clients. Creating and maintaining beautiful landscaping is what we do best, always done with our signature touch, in any season

Come join our growing Team of Lawn, YardCare and Landscape Professionals!

We are looking for a dedicated lawn care specialist to join our team. The lawn care specialist's responsibilities include maintaining the yards of private and corporate clients, mowing lawns, planting grass, applying pesticides, and ensuring that green spaces look beautiful.

 

Lawn Care Specialist Responsibilities:

  • Meeting with clients and identifying yard maintenance needs.
  • Maintaining gardens and flower beds.
  • Mowing grass.
  • Seeding and fertilizing lawns.
  • Trimming hedges and trees.
  • Performing routine checkups on clients' yards.
  • Maintaining the aesthetic appeal of clients' gardens, yards, and outdoor areas.
  • Applying pesticides and preventing weed growth.
  • Shoveling snow from walkways, if necessary.

Lawn Care Specialist Requirements:

  • A high school diploma
  • Experience in lawn care and maintenance.
  • Familiarity with lawn care equipment and tools.
  • Experience in handling chemicals and a solid understanding of the safe use of pesticides.
  • Manual dexterity, physical strength, and stamina.
  • Attention to individual and team safety.
  • Strong communication, teamwork, and customer service skills.
  • Class G Drivers License

title: Property Caretaker (live-in)
description:
property caretaker (live-in)

Are you looking for a career opportunity within a global, growing real estate company?

Then you might be our next .

Join us and be a part of our journey.
 

job description

Akelius is seeking a property caretaker to live at and maintain a residential property within the portfolio.

The property caretaker will live onsite and assist the property manager with maintaining the property and living conditions to Akeliusâ€™ standards.

The successful candidate will be a great communicator.
They will have strong time management and problem solving skills.  

Two bedroom accommodations will provided in a desirable location.

  • assist the property manager to keep present suitable residents and to attract a high caliber of new residents
  • perform landscaping duties
  • address common area deficiencies by making repairs or escalating the matter to the Property Manager
  • complete regular scheduled inspections
  • inspect all vacant units once weekly to ensure units is in good showing condition
  • respond to all emergencies such as fire, floor, no heat, elevator failure, power failure and any other such problem that could be termed as emergency
  • secure the property by controlling master keys and the keys of all vacant suites
  • test all fire alarms and emergency generators and carry out all inspections and update all log books required for fire safety
  • inspect sidewalk and driveway conditions at a minimum three times a day and maintaining a daily snow log form during the winter season
  • other duties as assigned

who you are

  • three plus years of experience in building and mechanical maintenance repair, or an acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience
  • knowledge in using hand and power tools
  • clean driving record
  • problem solving- ownership of responsibilities , able to anticipate and address issues in emergency situations
  • great communication skills â€“ able to interact with tenants, people focused, positive and stay professional
  • time management â€“ organized, set priorities, meet daily targets and deadlines

about Akelius

Akelius acquires, upgrades, manages residential properties.

Akelius owns 16,000 rental apartments in Boston, New York, Washington, Austin, Montreal, Toronto, Paris and London.

Read more at www.akelius.com

Akelius Canada is committed to providing accommodations for employees with disabilities. If you are contacted for this position and require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please let the HR team know.

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
Westridge HR, on behalf of the Skylon Tower looking to fill the role ofMaintenance Team Member.

Job Summary:

As a member of the Maintenance Department, you will be responsible for the on-going maintenance of the building, the building’s systems, and property grounds. This will include conducting minor equipment repairs, painting, basic carpentry, basic plumbing, and basic electrical.

Start:Asap

Shifts:Days, evenings, weekends, and holidays.

Job Type:Full-Time

Compensation:$15 to $17 per hour, based on experience.

Why Choose the Skylon Tower?

· Work at the iconic Skylon Tower in the heart of the Niagara Falls Tourist District.

· Great opportunity to meet new people from all over the world.

· Work in a fun location where you can feel like you are part of a winning team.

Responsibilities:

· Greet all customers and guests in a friendly manner.

· Ensure that property is maintained and is safe for both guests and employees

· Ensure maintenance/repair services level is maintained to include electrical, plumbing, refrigeration, HVAC, structural, facilities, ground, and parking areas.

· Ensure timely response to requests for service by guests, employees, and management to include repair or replacement of all interior fixtures and furnishings.

· Ensure implementation of ongoing Preventive Maintenance program.

· Maintain emergency procedures and equipment and assists with the implementation of all emergency procedures for the safety of all guests and employees.

· Maintain a clean and orderly work area free of hazards.

· Ensure that all public areas are clean and orderly, including picking up debris or garbage.

· Maintain departmental communication.

· Other duties as assigned by management.

Qualifications:

· 5+ years ‘hands on’ general institutional or industrial building maintenance experience.

· Plumbing, electrical, and/or mechanical experience a definite asset.

· Strong problem-solving skills.

· Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing.

· Ability to multi-task and establish priorities.

· High degree of resourcefulness, flexibility, and adaptability.

· Demonstrated ability to prioritize a diverse workload.

· Must be available to work evenings and weekends.

How to Apply:

Qualified candidates, please send your resume. We thank all who apply however, only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

Skylon Tower is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse workforce. Skylon Tower believes in fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment that brings people together to realize their full potential. We are committed to compliance with all applicable legislation including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.

title: AAA Garden Maintenance Crew Member @ foliage outside matters
description:
Our mission to make our clients outside matter!

We are a Gardening & Horticultural company that likes to elevate residential properties through detailed, meticulous maintenance, and soft-scaping.

  • The season starts end of March/early April through to the Beginning of December.
  • Monday to Friday schedule (no weekend work scheduled)
  • Our work takes us to residential properties in the neighborhoods of the Beaches, Rosedale, North York, and downtown Toronto.
  • We have great equipment: from our fleet of well-kept vehicles to some of the latest battery powered equipment.
  • The shop is TTC accessible near Yonge and Sheppard at Senlac and Sheppard in North York. We are a few minutes away from Yonge and #401
  • Previous experience in gardening and lawn maintenance with an attention to detail
  • Skills with ground maintenance equipment and accepted practices
  • Knowledge of Plant and shrub identification/ care
  • Formal, informal education or training in Gardening/Horticulture.
  • Valid G class “Ontario” license, clean drivers abstract and experience driving in the city

 

You are

  • Physically fit and active,
  • Experienced in working long, physically demanding hours
  • Ready to work in all weather Sunshine or Rain

 

Wage and Benefits

  • Competitive wages offered based on experience and demonstrated skills ($19 base rate up to $26 for lead hand).
  • Weekly pay.
  • Paid travel between shop and job sites, Vehicle allowance if meeting on site.
  • Health spending account after 3 months (RMT, Dental, Prescription drugs, Physio).
  • Paid sick/personal day program after 3 months with top ups after 6 months.
  • Paid uniforms and PPE, you’ll get the works!
  • Discounts at Marks Work Warehouse and other suppliers.
  • For returning employees: We encourage personal & professional growth by investing in off season development with Industry standard Courses & apprenticeship sponsorship.
  • Supplementary Unemployment Benefit Plan through the Winter.

If your interested in more info email us

info@foliagegardenin.ca

 or check us out at www.foliagegardening.ca

title: Horticultural Technician (Lead Hand) - Grounds Maintenance Team
description:
We are an established Landscape Design / Build & Grounds Maintenance company located in Carrying Place, ON. We design, build & maintain beautiful and functional landscapes for our clients individual needs, tastes and lifestyles. With this goal in mind, we strive to promote, nurture and encourage a fun, safe, professional and rewarding company culture for all team members!

We are currently seeking out creative, self-motivated & purpose driven individuals with a great eye for detail to fill the following position:



Horticultural Technician (Lead Hand) – Grounds Maintenance Team



Job Description:

  • Perform Spring and Fall lawn & garden clean-ups to both residential & commercial properties
  • Perform plant & garden care and maintenance duties including: weeding, pruning, soil amending, installation of mulches and seasonal fertilizers, soil cultivating (when required) and monitoring of plant material health on client properties
  • Perform turf aerating, topdressing and overseeding, application of lawn fertilizers and monitoring of turf health on client properties
  • Removal of brush and debris from client properties by truck and trailer
  • Perform lawn mowing and line trimming to client properties & MELD business yard
  • Responsible for the daily inspection, loading and care of maintenance tools and equipment as well as safe operation of company truck and trailers
  • Responsible for keeping track of inventory and required maintenance equipment parts
  • Responsible for the daily maintenance and care of tools and equipment in use, including mixing of fuel and refueling of equipment as required
  • Responsible for the completion of daily work description logs and accurate record keeping
  • Responsible to comply, encourage and enforce all of the company’s Health & Safety policies and procedures.



Required Work Experience

  • Post-secondary diploma, GED or equivalent
  • Apprenticeship or other formal training in the landscape/horticultural field an asset
  • 2+ years’ experience in landscape / garden maintenance duties, greenhouse operations, arboriculture or landscape construction duties preferred
  • Proficient knowledge of common trees, shrubs and perennials found in Ontario, as well as their habit and care.
  • Proficient knowledge of pruning & shaping of trees and shrubs



Required Skills:

  • Ability to follow instruction and work independently
  • Excellent hand / eye co-ordination and an eye for detail
  • Previous experience in operating small, gas powered equipment such as cut-off saws, ride-on or “zero turn” mowers, push mowers, line trimmers and rototillers an asset
  • Excellent work ethic
  • Physically fit / energetic
  • Able to lift and transport weight of up to 50lbs on a daily / weekly bases
  • Enthusiastic and willing to learn new skills
  • Excellent customer service skills, and a good communicator
  • Work under stringent time constraints
  • Able to work in, and cope with ever changing weather and climatic conditions
  • Work independently or in a team environment



Work Conditions:

  • Working outdoors in all-weather environments including heat, humidity, dust, mud, noise from power equipment, wind and cold.
  • Working near or around heavy equipment from time to time
  • Flexible work times and schedules, occasionally work on Saturdays (when and if required)



Rate of Pay & Benefits:

  • Wage range is $18.00 - $21.00 / hr , based on qualifications and experience.
  • Performance bonuses and incentives
  • Company uniforms supplied.
  • Merchant & clothing discounts
  • Offer Apprenticeship Training as an approved Horticultural Technician Apprenticeship Program Sponsor .



Career Opportunities:

We offer competitive wages and a chance for advancement within the company as well as personal growth within the industry through the Red Seal Apprenticeship Programs , industry training seminars and Certification Programs offered by the Canadian Nursery LandscapeAssociation (CNLA) and Landscape Ontario Horticultural Trades Association (LO) and the Interlocking Concrete Pavement Institute. (ICPI)

 

We want thank all applicants for showing interest in the position. Only applicants selected for a follow-up interview will be contacted.

title: Maintenance
description:
Does a cleaning and Maintenance clerk ​job interest you?

We are currently searching for a cleaning and Maintenance clerk to work at our Dorval location. Come join our wonderful team! We promise a flawless integration and a harmonious work environment.

Who are we?
We manufacture and distribute industrial plastic equipment for our essential clients all over the world!

Advantages
- $17 - $19.25/h (depending on experience)
- Day shift! Monday - Thursday from 7am to 3:45pm & Friday from 7am to 2:15pm
- Possibility of overtime available
- Location in the West Island (Dorval)
- Accessible by bus
- Possibility of permanent hire based on performance
- Immediate start

Responsibilities
- Plant sanitary management (disinfect the cafeteria, lockers, microwaves, dining tables, etc.)
- Replenishment of toilet consumables (paper, soap and cream)
- Plant maintenance (clean and disinfect common areas, eg: cafeteria, toilets, floors and building access points)
- Empty garbage cans and ashtrays
- Perform tasks assigned by the supervisor
- Various manual work, eg: workstation assembly/disassembly, painting, various repairs and snow removal
- Verification of the inventory of sanitary products and verification of safety data sheets
- Ability to differentiate the materials to put in the recycling vs garbage container

Qualifications
- 6 months of experience as a cleaning and maintenance clerk or in a similar role
- Must have steel toe boots
- Must have a high school diploma
- Have dynamic attitude and good team spirit
- Ability to work under pressure
- Ability to lift loads of up to 50lbs
- Able to travel to Dorval for 7am

Summary
If this cleaning and maintenance clerk position in Dorval located in the West Island of Montreal is of interest to you, please call me at 514.695.9556 or e-mail us at:
jessica.lovelace@randstad.ca
anty.tzitzikas@randstad.ca
taha.bendaoud@randstad.ca

Bring a friend with you! If you refer a friend to Randstad Dorval and they work for 4 weeks+ you might be entitled to a bonus $$$!!!

Follow us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/jobswestisland

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Head Gardener/Crew Leader
description:
Join our growing team and become apart of greener opportunities!

Hands on training and positive work environment. Apprenticeship opportunities and continued education grants available. Work to have fun, come learn and grow with us at RH Designs!

Requirements for consideration of this position are minimum 3 years experience as a crew leader, valid G driver's license, great people and management skills, hard working, organized and a team player.

title: Golf Course Landscape Labourer
description:
Responsibilities:

Working with your Leader, and your team, you’ll help with the installation and renovation of all golf course features. You will actively participate in team and personal development by contributing to our daily huddles and team development through the FlightLine Golf Inc. training program.

Must have the following experience, knowledge, or skills:

A strong need for Professional and Personal growth and the WILL to LEARN.

A valid Ontario Driver’s License with your own reliable vehicle

Physically fit enough to perform your daily duties

Landscape and construction experience considered an asset

Compensation Package:

All of this comes with a great compensation package.

You can expect:

  • Full-time Seasonal Hours, approximately 45-55 hours per week from April to December (weather dependent)
  • $20.00 - $23.00 per hour based on your experience and skill set
  • Paid Statutory and Government holidays
  • Health Spending Account (Health, Dental, Wellness and more!)
  • Employee discounts
  • Company Uniform and swag!
  • Continual Education – we learn on the job, in seminars and other industry classes or courses
  • We work hard but play hard in our company events such as Paintball, Company Golf Tournament, Axe Throwing, BBQ’s and more…

We are People Helping People enjoy a happy and fulfilled life outdoors.  This is what drives us and inspires us. It is our  PURPOSE . Our culture is built around passionate people who act in line with  WHO  we are and know  WHY  they show up to work everyday and are empowered to bring that purpose to  LIFE !

Wow, this all sounds amazing! Is FlightLine Golf Inc. the place for you? Ask yourself these questions:

Do you get tremendous satisfaction from a job well done and  WOW ing others? Do you believe in  working safely  and care about the health and wellbeing of yourself and others? Do you get a real rush from solving problems? Do you  thrive on competition  and strive to be the  best ? Are you looking for a place where you can bring your  unique  talents and strengths and  make a difference ?

If you were able to answer YES to all of the above questions, fantastic! We invite you to apply!

COVID-19 Safety Protocols:  The health and safety of our team, our clients and our communities is important to us. FlightLine Golf Inc. will act in accordance with all Ontario public health measures and restrictions for our sector. As such, we have developed a COVID-19 Safety Plan outlining the safe operating practices for our teams (office and field) which include: working a minimum of 6 ft apart or wearing both masks and eye protection when required to be in closer proximity, Daily Health Assessments submitted before field team members report to work, sanitation practices are in place for high touch zones and equipment. Our office team continues to work remotely at this time and will be offering options for phone/zoom interview until such time as in-person interviewing can resume.

title: CEMETERY OUTSIDE WORKER
description:
Beth Tzedec Memorial Park



Job Description Outside Cemetery Employees



Basic functions and duties:

To carry out, as directed by the Superintendent, all manner of work required for grounds, equipment, building maintenance, construction projects and interment services, in a safe, efficient and dignified manner.



Internal contacts:

The Outside Employee reports directly to the Superintendent or in his absence the cemetery Administrator.



External contacts:

The Employee must deal with the visiting public, funeral directors and contractors in a polite, professional manner. The Employee may not recommend or act as an agent for any personal or cemetery related service while on the grounds.



Basic qualifications:

Read and write English, Valid drivers, Able to carry out physically demanding tasks. Reliable, Polite, Neat appearance. Able to work some Sundays and ‘stat’ holidays.



Qualification assets:

Horticultural experience.

Construction experience.

Backhoe experience.

‘Handyman’ skills.

Small engine and other mechanical skills.

Basic computer skills.

title: Landscape Crane Truck Driver (must have horticultural knowledge)
company: Lawrence Park Complete Garden Care Ltd
description:
Who we are?

Lawrence Park Complete Garden Care is an award-winning full-scale landscaping firm, specializing in landscape design & construction, lawn & garden care, irrigation & lighting, green roofs and horticulture. We are group of dedicated and creative professionals who are proud of the landscapes we create and maintain. We’ve been at it for over 30 years and we continue to grow – this is where you come in!

So what’s in it for you?

  • The chance to work on award-winning projects with an award-winning team.
  • The opportunity to work in beautiful Toronto neighborhoods.
  • Working for a company that values a supportive work environment.
  • Industry leading wages, along with profit sharing bonuses.
  • Group Health Benefits.
  • On the job training.
  • Personal Development Planning.
  • Employee of the Month recognitions and rewards.
  • Employee referral program.
  • Training allowance.
  • Fun social events.

Who are we looking for?

  • A self-motivated individual who is passionate about the work they do.
  • Someone who has problem solving skills, can communicate well, is personable and can be flexible with the fast-paced environment and demands of the work.
  • Have a valid G license and drive/operate crane truck and garbage truck

What we need?

  • Scheduled and unscheduled pickup and delivery of soft and hardscape materials at suppliers, delivery and pickup of landscape equipment and waste on job sites
  • Knowledge of types of plant
  • Good communication skills.
  • Ability to operate motorized landscaping equipment
  • Minimum G license and comfortable driving large vehicles is an asset
  • Ability to work long hours, when necessary, starting at 7am from Monday to Friday; along with occasional weekend work in the Spring and Fall
  • Can meet the physical demands of working outdoors in carrying weather conditions
