title: Relief Caretaker
description:
Position: Relief Caretaker (Part Time, Permanent)
Location: North Vancouver, British Columbia
Start Date: ASAP

About Us
Tribe Management is part of the Tribe Property Technologies family. Together we are the sixth largest strata/condo and rental management company in Canada with offices in downtown Vancouver, Delta, Victoria, Kelowna, Kamloops, Calgary and Cambridge. Our Tribe Management division specializes in strata and rental management services. We are responsible for the day-to-day operation and management of residential & mixed-use properties in our portfolio. Combining our obsession with technology and an unwavering passion for creating vibrant strata communities, we provide community management with heart. 

Job Responsibilities
The position will be responsible for assisting with the operations of a rental property, which include but are not limited to:

  • Administrative work involved in the operation of the property
  • When necessary deal with emergencies on a 24hr basis during the workweek
  • Book viewings of suites and interview potential tenants
  • Complete accurate detailed move in/out reports for each tenant and supervise moves to ensure security is maintained
  • Collect, deposit and record all rents
  • Issue notices/ letters to tenants when applicable
  • Comply with regulations as contained in the Residential Tenancy Act
  • Supervise contractors and process invoices in a timely manner
  • Request Purchase Orders for all work and/or supplies being undertaken at the property
  • Prepare detailed Incident Reports related to accidents, altercations and damage to the property and/or other applicable incidents,

Qualifications

  • Motivated and professional
  • Excellent organization and communication skills
  • Detail-oriented
  • Computer literate
  • Able to take direction and work well with minimal supervision
  • Minimum one year building management or similar experience required
  • Working knowledge of the Residential Tenancy Act an assets
  • Able to live close by

Benefits
We offer a competitive compensation package and a great working environment to the right candidate. If you are currently exploring a new career challenge in property operations, apply online now. Due to anticipated response, only those candidates who will be interviewed will be contacted.

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
Position: Maintenance Worker

Type of Employment: Full Time, Permanent

Reporting to: Property Manager and Maintenance Supervisor

Shift Schedule:9am to 5pm EST Monday to Friday

Pay Rate: $17 per hour

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • To ensure the daily, operation of the buildings is carried out efficiently and safely; to report to the property manager any and all situations, projects, issues, defects noted, repairs completed etc. Other duties as may be directed by the property manager.
  • Respond to tenant inquiries and promptly inform administration; follow up to ensure issue was resolved.
  • Monitor property and trades working on site; reporting back to property manager.
  • Able to move thru tight spaces as well as handle heavy weight items and work at heights
  • Perform inspections, repair and up keeping duties, working safely and with minimal supervision.
  • Radio and cellphone to be worn at all times during work hours.
  • Conduct and log various property inspection checks. Log book updated.
  • Frequently patrol property to ensure cleanings and good working order; maintain and upkeep parking lot.
  • Perform landscaping, housekeeping and property maintenance duties as required.
  • Monitor all equipment and set heating/cooling according to season/weather.
  • Conduct cleaning and repairs to, common areas, service rooms, tenant space and vacant units as needed.
  • Insure site lights and heating/cooling is reprogramed at least once a month to maximize savings.
  • Removal of snow on roof top, stairs, entrances, sidewalks, apply salting or deicing as needed.
  • Determine marketing needs for the weekend and ensure set-up is completed.
  • Maintain roof, roof storm drains, as well as HVAC repairs ensuring all filters and drain caps are clean and in place daily.
  • Ensure tools are maintained cleaned and stored in an organized fashion in a designated clean area.
  • Communicate with supervisor prior to commencing work on an assignment and/or when changing to another project/duty.
  • Maintain daily log book of occurrences noting weather conditions that may affect operations.
  • Submit daily goals list prior to commencement of shift as well as a shift occurrence report at the end of each shift
  • Place service calls for contractors, if needed per instructions given by property manager.
  • Repair drywall; perform routine maintenance jobs, repairs and painting.
  • Clean & tidy uniform to be worn at all times; PPE as needed; steal toe shoes & safety glasses to be worn at all times while on duty.
  • Work flexible hours as needed and on call for emergency service.
  • Ensure safety is always priority one and adherence to privacy and confidentially protocols.

Equipment:

  • HVAC and Air handling Units: ensure all in good operating condition. Paint any rusted units as required. Ensure all mechanical and electrical equipment are maintained in accordance with preventive maintenance.
  • Fire Safety System: Including overseeing of major tenants systems. Meet with Fire Safety Company and ensure all are inspected per code. Understand the Maglocks and the operation of individuals systems. Understand the placement of the smoke detectors. Ensure the fire exits are all accessible and in good repair ensuring that all extinguishers are inspected monthly in place and mounted properly. Log book updated.
  • Elevator/ Escalator: Meet with technicians on site ensuring that maintenance and safety concerns are known. Ensure that the devises are all clean and running smoothly. Log book updated.
  • Sump Pumps: Knowledge of their operation and maintenance is required. Inspections to be conducted weekly and noted. Log book updated.
  • Generators: Ensure annual maintenance is carried out and that all safety guidelines are met. Inspected weekly. Log book updated.
  • Boilers: Ensure boilers are turned on for the heating season and turned off for the cooling season at the appropriate times; ensure biannual water treatment is conducted. Log book updated.
  • Electrical rooms: Maintain all services and electrical rooms with no storage allowed in electrical rooms. Emergency Lighting - responsible to ensure all is in good operating condition and Emergency light test including monthly audit report.
  • Timers: Ensure all light timers are set according to seasonal standards and adjusted monthly.
  • General Equipment: Ensure proper functioning of lights, heaters, washrooms, hot water heaters, pressure pumps (insure pressures are normal), air compressors, sump pumps. Audit report submitted monthly.
  • Troubleshoot: Perform minor repairs on heating, cooling and ventilation systems, Troubleshoot and perform minor repairs on plumbing systems; electrical systems; appliances. Move heavy furniture, equipment and supplies.
  • Any other duties as may be directed by the property manager.

Sky Development Group is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. If you require any type of accommodation, please let the hiring manager know, and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Landscape Technicians and Landscape Gardeners!
description:
Grow with us in 2022! Landscapers, Let your future take root!


Recognized by Landscape Ontario with Awards of Excellence for our work, Landscapes By Lucin is dedicated to providing clients with compelling, creative landscape design.

Based in Toronto, our business is growing, which is why we're looking for energetic, versatile, self-motivated field staff to join our team

Why choose Landscapes By Lucin?

The answer is simple. We truly believe that when it comes to delivering exceptional work and outstanding customer service, our employees are the reason behind our success. That's where we stand out - we consider our employees to be our partners, and we prove it to them every day.

The resources and guidance to help you reach your full potential. You can count on it.

  • We will train you - and continue to make learning a priority.
  • We'll work with you to create a career path based on your strengths, giving priority to your preferences.
  • We offer a variety of roles to keep your work day interesting and motivating.
  • Incentive plans and benefits based on company profitability.

This year, "grow further" in your career by partnering with an employer dedicated to investing in you over the long term - a company that encourages teamwork and rewards initiative.

If you have previous landscaping, stone masonry, planting, carpentry or general construction experience, we'd like to hear from you!

We are rooted in growing our business - and providing opportunities for your professional growth and development.

title: Snow plow operater
description:
Established company looking for reliable, responsible person with drivers licence to operate truck and plow for winter contracts. This position is based on when it snows.  

Must be available anytime it snows Monday to Sunday 24/7 and can involve long hours when snowing.  
It is possible this position could turn into a summer position for grass cutting if both parties are interested.  
Can start immediately.

title: Maintenance Team Member
description:
BOS LANDSCAPING – located in Smithville, Ontario - is committed to bringing our clients quality landscaping, that will enhance their outdoor experience that dreams are made of.

* We are looking for Landscape Professionals to assist in maintaining either High-End Residential properties or Commercial/Industrial properties. *

Key Responsibilities:

  • Plan and manage time-efficient garden maintenance schedules
  • Work alongside crew members ensuring quality work and safety
  • Ensure all company equipment is properly cared for
  • Submit proper organized paperwork via LMN Software
  • Communicate with customers in a polite and courteous manner

Required experience:

  • Ability to communicate with other team members 
  • Able to operate various equipment
  • Assist maintaining all company equipment
  • Prioritize quality work and customer service
  • Submit proper and organized paperwork
  • Dependable team-player
  • Good time management skills
  • Customer service skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Goal oriented, interested in learning
  • Integrity
  • Valid G driver’s license and own transportation
  • Horticultural certificate an asset

Benefits:

  • Full-time Year-Round work available
  • Monday through Friday or Flex days - 50 hours a week work.
  • Education & Training opportunities to grow your career

Hourly wage: $20.00-$25.00 per hour – or based on experience.

*Also, we have entry level positions for persons interested in building a career in Landscaping!*

title: Crew Member/Labourer, Maintenance & Snow
description:
Position Overview

We are looking to add a Crew Members to our growing Maintenance & Snow division. Reporting to the Production Manager and/or his delegate, this team member will be responsible for improving the functionality or aesthetic of a clients property through maintains lawns, gardens, athletic fiends, etc.

Primary Tasks & Responsibilities:

  • Assist Crew Leader in preparing for day-to-day site activities in both winter and summer months.
  • Working as part of a team to complete landscape maintenance duties such as mowing, weed control, trimming, pruning, aeration, spring cleanup, and fall clean up, seasonal plantings and general garden maintenance.
  • Completes landscape enhancement projects such as mulch application, plantings, topsoil application and lawn seeding.
  • Snow removal in the winter months.
  • Operate a variety of tools and equipment, ie. trimmers, hedge trimmers, walker mowers and push mowers.
  • Travel to multiple job sites will be required.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Valid G license with a clean driving record and experience operating a truck and trailer.
  • College Diploma, Apprenticeship, CHT, University degree in Horticulture or Landscape Technology an asset.
  • Prior experience an asset.
  • Good knowledge of best lawn maintenance & snow clearing practices.
  • Good interpersonal and organizational skills.
  • Willingness to learn from others.
  • Able to operate or learn to operate equipment such as mowers, blowers and weed trimmers, walk behind salters, walkway clearing units, etc.
  • Able to lift 50lbs.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Time management.

Wright Landscape Services  is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

To learn more about  Wright Landscape Services  please visit our website at www.wrightlandscape.ca.

title: Landscape Lead Hand
description:
Higgins Hardscape is a passionate team of dedicated landscape professionals looking to expand our crew. If you are looking for a career, not just a job, we offer exciting growth opportunities. Lead hand crew members help motivate and educate team members and lead by example by providing excellent customer service to internal and external clients. If you have several seasons under your belt, enjoy leading people, and want to take the next step in your career, we want to hear from you!

What We Are Looking For:

  • Seeking a full-time year-round worker with interest in working during all 4 seasons.
  • Reliable, hardworking and punctual.
  • Proper use and maintenance of equipment (Skid steer/mini excavator experience is an asset).
  • Strong work ethic.
  • Goal oriented and passionate about the landscape industry.
  • Keeping the job site safe and well organized with attention to detail to ensure operating procedures and safe operations of a variety of machinery
  • Motivated with a passion for the landscape industry with a minimum 2 years of experience in the landscaping industry.
  • Positive attitude with a willingness to learn and demonstrate initiative.
  • G Class License and Clean driving record preferred.
  • Ability to perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment through inspections, lubrication and cleaning daily
  • Have active listening skills to ensure that given instructions are followed through efficiently while following project guidelines.
  • Have the willingness to learn, grow and develop skills.
  • Ability to drive truck and trailer.
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs.

While working for Higgins Hardscape, you will be responsible to perform a variety of  duties and responsibilities  but not limited to:

  • Grading, gravel installation, sod laying, planting, watering, fertilizing, digging, raking, trenching, stone work installation, interlock pavers installation.
  • Build retaining walls, paths and patios, build structures according to landscaping designs, flagstone, armor stones and steps.
  • Operating equipment and machinery such as: tampers, concrete saws, excavators, skidsteer, carpentry tools, chop saw, table saw, basic hand tools, plow trucks and salters.
  • Exceeding customer needs.
  • Carry out foundation work, such as laying drainage or installing irrigation systems, as directed
  • Reshape the landscape with slopes or terraces and create special features such as rock gardens, ponds, fountains and ornamental garden, as directed
  • Assist with lawn area grading via digging, trenching and excavating

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Minimum of 2-3 years working in the landscape construction field doing interlocking, stone work, deck and fence construction
  • Must have valid G class drivers license
  • Your own Transportation to get to and from our shop in Waterdown
  • Must be able to work 40-55 hours a week
  • Must be able to work in all types of weather conditions
  • Horticultural Certification or equivalent would be a strong asset
  • Plant Knowledge and identification is definitely an asset

Wages and Work Perks:

  • Competitive wages will be determined based on experience.
  • $20.00-$25.00/hr
  • Attractive benefits package
  • Option of salary based pay
  • Employee appreciation events
  • Company paid health benefits
  • RRSP program with company contribution
  • Safe & healthy work environment
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Company paid uniforms
  • Bonuses (year end & attendance)

title: Lawn Care Applicator
description:
Do you love working outdoors, being in control of your day, talking to people and making them happy with your outstanding service? Do you take pride in what you do and want to make a difference? If so, keep reading!

 

Our Core Values are: Integrity, Honesty, Helpfulness, Safety, Family, Humility, Respect, Ambition, Professionalism, Authenticity, and Doing the Right Thing. If you can relate, please keep reading because you might be the perfect fit!

 

Working with LawnSavers means opportunities to advance, great tools, a phenomenal group of people to work with, and plenty of engaging, rewarding work. This role is designed for you to flourish and grow on a career path with unlimited opportunities .  

 

Opportunity doesn’t always look the way you expect it to.… forget the starts ups and corporate bureaucracies….come grow with a solid small business with a proven track record of over 31 years and be more than just a number, be a part of the family! 

 

We at LawnSavers are looking for dedicated people to join the team and help us provide our customers with a lawn that will Make ‘em say WOW! LawnSavers will train good people looking to become phenomenal members of the team and grow a career.

 

What we offer

- $700.00 to $950.00 weekly plus daily incentives! 

- $42,000 to $55,000 annually

- Full time year round employment with up to 1 month off each year

- Christmas light installation position from October to February

- Excellent compensation structure

- Medical, dental, life insurance, vision benefits

- 1st time Home Buyers RSP program with company matching

- Recognition awards

- Comprehensive paid training and career development program

 

Responsibilities

- Provides lawn care services to residential or commercial customers

- Drives company truck to customer locations (valid G driver’s license required)

- Start time is 630am Monday to Friday and Saturday as seasonal demand dictates

- Apply fertilizers, seed, compost, weed and insect controls in accordance with I.P.M. standards, work schedules, safety procedures, & label instructions

- WOW customers with the best customer service

- Report to work on time as assigned and complete all tasks with honesty and integrity

 

Requirements

- Able to repeatedly lift and carry 50 lbs

- Computer-literate and good comfort level with technology

- G license required and a clean drivers abstract

- Ability to work independently and as part of a team

- Flexible to work long hours during peak season

- Some Saturdays during peak busy season

- Must be a motivated, high-energy, and a self-starter

 

Key Words:

  • Landscaping, Agronomics, Horticulture, General Labour, Sales, Partner, Customer Service, Lawn/Garden Maintenance, Forestry, Arborist, Golf, Outdoors, Driving, Seasonal, Labour, Supervisor, Golf Course, Landscaping, Maintenance, Gardening, Construction, Lawn Care, Superintendent, Sports, Parks, Pest Control, Vaughan, Toronto, York Region, Linens, HVAC, Service, Contractors, Training, Outdoor, Groundskeeper, Property Maintenance, General Labour, Landscaper
Apply Now

title: Landscaping Supervisor
description:
Job Title: Landscaping Supervisor

NOC Code: 8255

Number of openings:  4

Terms of employment: Permanent, Full-time, 30 hours per week

Language: Ability to communicate in English (basic) is preferred

Wage: $40,000 CAD

Start Date: As soon as possible

Experience: At least 1 year of relevant experience, 2 is preferable

Education: High School

Conditions: Outdoors, fast-paced environment, Physically demanding, Combination of sitting, standing, walking, bending, crouching, kneeling.


Contact information:

Serenity Property Management Inc.

4025 Hwy #118 West, Port Carling, ON  P0B 1J0

Office:  705-765-0389

Email:  1serenity@bellnet.ca

 

ABOUT US

Serenity Property Management Inc. has been in the business of providing concierge-level of property management services to luxury vacation homes in the Muskoka area since 1999.  We offer year-round, full-service attention to detail to fit all our clients’ needs.

Our staff receives regular training in the proper and safe operation of all equipment. Health and safety are a priority and are practiced diligently.  All our staff is fully bonded, discreet and professional.  We carry all necessary insurance and WSIB certifications for job site requirements.  We are a member of the Muskoka Lakes Chamber of Commerce and the Muskoka Lakes Association.

Serenity Property Management has exciting career opportunities for staff working with our professional team for our roster of high-end clients. We pride ourselves on delivering a luxury experience with a concierge touch.

Serenity Property Management Inc. (Port Carling) is looking for enthusiastic people to be part of our team.

JOB DUTIES

  • Supervise and coordinate yard work on lawns, gardens, areas around waterfront and beaches, planters, other landscape spaces.
  • Establish work schedules for cleaning and maintenance of all interior plantscapes, docks, decks, driveways, and pathways for working crews.
  • Organize efficient the planting and maintenance of trees, gardens, lawns, shrubs and hedges, snow, and foliage removal.
  • Work and train others to work in a safe manner and within company guidelines and health and safety procedures, resolve work-related problems, prepare reports, records, and worksheets.
  • Oversee work with tools and power equipment and adapt to ever-changing situations.

 QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS REQUIREMENTS/EDUCATION/WORK EXPERIENCE

  • Ability to perform manual labor duties and lift up to 50 lbs is preferable
  • Ability to follow instructions
  • Experience with hand tools and power equipment is an asset
  • Experience: At least 1 year of relevant experience, 2 is preferable
  • Education: High School is preferable

HOW TO APPLY:

Please forward your resume by email to 1serenity@bellnet.ca with the heading “Landscape” in the subject line to be considered for the position.

We appreciate all expressed interest in this position, however, only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Indigenous persons, youth, newcomers, and persons with disabilities are welcome to apply.

Accommodations are available in our staff house for team members for a nominal weekly fee.

title: Seasonal Winter Grounds Maintenance Worker - 4 positions
description:
Department: Facilities Management
Campus: Barrie
Classification: Support Staff
Posting Date: October 27, 2021
Salary Range: $27.93 (start rate) - $32.38 (4-year rate)
Hours per week: 40 hours per week
Status: Seasonal Full-time
Effective Date: As soon as possible to April 2022

THIS IS A SEASONAL POSITION.

Reporting to the Manager, Facilities Management, the incumbent performs general maintenance on the College grounds including snow removal and ice control, repairs to parking lots, and roadways or signage. Additionally, the incumbent will assist with general building maintenance (moving furniture, cleaning shops, inventorying supplies, minor construction repairs, etc.) during times of little snow activity. Specific duties include, but are not limited to:

• Operating manual and heavy equipment to remove and relocate snow on the college property
• Plowing, salting, both by machine and manually, shovels, doorways and walkways to ensure areas are safe
• Reporting major repairs on equipment including trucks and tractors
• Performing minor repairs to equipment
• Demonstrating correct use of the equipment and explains processes regarding the requirements of the job.
• Reporting any unsafe conditions
• Performing minor repairs when possible
• Providing regular preventative care and maintenance on equipment
• Providing general maintenance to the grounds around campus during periods of no snow
• Demonstrating correct use of the equipment
• Providing regular garbage collection from all exterior containers, and recycle bins
• Cleaning waste areas, organics shed and lose debris
• Installing and removing mobile speed humps / bumps, fills potholes, preparing areas for power sweeping, ensuring signs are in place and facing the correct direction, paint bollards, sign posts, lamp standard bases, re-grades gravel roadways and parking lots, installing and removing curb markers
• Clearing entrance ways of excess salt and debris
• General maintenance of road surfaces-filling pot holes, cracks etc.
• Installing and/or painting signs, posts, parking booths etc.

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Successfully completed a high school diploma
• A minimum of two years' experience snow plowing and using heavy operation equipment
• Valid "G" drivers licence required to operate college vehicles
• Heavy Equipment Operator course preferred
• Incumbent will be required to take and pass Grounds Equipment Training provided by the college within the first month of employment

Georgian College supports diversity, equity and a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. Georgian College is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and workplace. If you are contacted to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please advise the interview coordinator of any accommodations needed with respect to any materials or processes used to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process.

Alternate formats will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process.

Georgian College has a COVID-19 vaccination procedure in place. As a condition of employment, employees are required to be vaccinated for COVID-19 to work on any campus, or a facility owned, operated or controlled by Georgian College unless they have a valid medical or religious belief/creed reason for not getting vaccinated, which reason will be considered on a case by case basis and which will be subject to the College's accommodation processes.

This position is open until filled. While we thank all applicants, only those contacted for an interview will be acknowledged.

title: Groundskeeper
description:
Accountability


Reporting to the head office, the Groundskeeper has specific responsibility for the maintenance and physical condition of all sites managed by CC & group of companies. The Groundskeeper is responsible for ensuring that the physical conditions of all sites are maintained to CC & group of companies standards and in accordance with all municipal and provincial housing/building regulations.


Property Maintenance


Responsible for maintaining the quality of our sites:


  • Daily routine maintenance and preventive grounds work at all sites.

  • Ensure that the grounds, facilities and equipment are safe, clean and conform to all relevant property standards.

  • Repair and maintain exterior area elements such as fences, gates etc.

  • Safely operate equipment and tools necessary to complete tasks.

  • Perform maintenance and repairs on grounds keeping equipment.

  • Manage inventory of tools and supplies, ensuring secure and proper storage.

  • Deliver supplies and equipment as needed to any and all CC & group of companies.

  • Making regular inspections of the site and reporting any issues of concern to the Head Office.

  • Each morning before beginning work walk around and inspect the vehicle (if applicable).

  • Maintaining courteous and professional relationships with tenants, outside contractors/labourers, neighbours and other community members.

  • Document work as part of a detailed logging and work order systems.

  • Working collaboratively with other staff.

  • Completing all assigned work orders as required.

  • Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications


  • Some familiarity with groundskeeping, landscaping, operation of powered equipment, or electrical work.

  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

  • Some knowledge of Google Suite programs.

  • Strong problem solving skills.

  • Time management skills.

  • Willingness to work more than the standard five-day work week.

  • Excellent customer service, organizational, and coordination skills.

  • Strong communication and listening skills, and must be able to pay attention to detail.

  • Able to take initiative and follow tasks through to completion with minimal supervision.

title: Landscape Construction Foreman
description:
In this role, you will be an instrumental leader within the Dutra Landscaping organization. Your respnsibiliies will include but not be limited to:

Assign tasks based on work schedules, keep workers on task, complete timesheets and inspect the quality of work to ensure job requirements are met. Instruct crew members on proper work standards. Interact with customers to resolve issues or answer questions. You may also be called to work along with crew members in completing all projects.

Ideally you have 5+ years in construction landscaping. 
You can operate skidsteers and mini excavators
Can read a grading plan 
Understands elevation plans
Can lay out a full property 
Pool landscape experience would be nice.
 
This role pays $35-45/hour depending on experience. 
Full Benefits
Year end bonus

title: Landscape Labourer
description:
We are a family owned and operated garden centre near Sarnia, Ontario.

We operate a large garden center, wholesale department, and a landscaping division focusing mostly on residential high end installations.

You will assist the landscape crew in installing and maintaining landscape environments which include flowers, trees, shrubs, lawns and construction landscapes. Tasks will include laying out beds, installing plants, installing stone patios, walkways, water features, sod. Uses appropriate tools and equipment required to complete tasks.

$17.00 per hour. 3 positions available.

title: Landscape Manager
description:
Create an integrated master plan which includes drawings with specifications and detailed descriptions for landscaped environments including installation of plants, flowers, trees, shrubs; and construction of structural installations.

Plan and coordinate the growth and use of plants for landscaping, ornamental use and other purposes.

Create project estimates, analyze costs and maintain budgets.

Meet with clients to discuss concepts and plans; sell projects to customers; and provide customer service during the span of the project.

title: Landscaper
description:
We're growing!! And looking for a detail-oriented and enthusiastic candidate to join our team for the temporary position of Landscaping Associate located in Moncton, New Brunswick. This is an ideal full-time opportunity for someone who loves working with their hands and being outside! 

Additional Information
  • Providing great customer service is something you thrive on.
  • You get a thrill from staying organized and details are your "thing".
  • Being part of a great team has been your dream.
  • Working for a growing company that supports environmental stewardship and social responsibilities is a must for you.
  • You love being active and working outside!

*Please note that all Skyline buildings, apartment units, and premises are smoke free, with the exception of a designated outdoor smoking area*

title: Landscape Construction Crew Member
description:
Unique Landscape Services was founded out of the belief that life is much better outdoors. We are committed to improving the lives of homeowners through unique, quality crafted landscapes. We are looking for passionate and motivated  Landscape Construction Crew Members  to join our team.

What does the job look like?

  • Assist in the completion of landscape construction tasks such as installing interlock patios/walkways/driveways, retaining walls, drainage, and wooden fences/decks
  • Follow all Unique’s policies/procedures, represent our Core Values daily and comply with safety regulations
  • Operate hand and power tools, as well as heavy equipment related to Construction work.

What is required from you?

  • 1-2 years  experience in Landscape Construction Industry
  • Ability to operate hand tools, small machinery and willingness to be trained on larger machinery
  • Knowledge of landscape construction processes
  • Reliable transportation to Yard in Mount Hope, ON
  • G-Class drivers licence preferred
  • Ability to work longer hours, weekends if needed
  • Ability to lift heavy items (50-80lbs) and wheelbarrow repetitively throughout the day

Hours of Work
 Monday through Friday, Saturdays as needed
Starting at 7:00AM, end time varies

What can we offer you?

  • Competitive Wages
  • Advancement Opportunities
  • Company BBQ’s and other appreciation events
  • Paid industry related courses
  • Health Benfits

Unique Landscape Services prides ourselves on being able to give back to our employees, in return we expect everyone to be honest, detail focused, strict on safety, and willing to be a productive member of the team.

title: Landscape Installation Crew Member (FT)
description:
Pacific Ridge Landscapes Ltd.

Who is Pacific Ridge? 
We are one of the most well-known landscaping companies in on the Saanich Peninsula (and not just because of our bright pink shirts). We complete high-end projects for families across the island and have a standard of excellence to which we hold all of our employees. If you are looking for a challenge, this is the role for you. We are based in Sidney/North Saanich and our work takes us all over the greater Victoria area, the Saanich Peninsula, and the Gulf Islands.

Our construction crew creates incredible landscapes that include water features, patios, pergolas, boulder walls, greenhouses, stone staircases and so much more and we need to expand! Join us and be part of leaving the world prettier than we found it.

Position: Experience Landscape Installation Crew Member (Full Time Position)

You should apply if you are the following:
  • 2+ years of landscape construction experience.
  • Tenacious
  • Have a proven track record of being detail-focused.
  • Customer service focused.
  • Have a valid BC drivers license.
  • You want meaningful work with opportunities to move into a crew lead role.
The Details: 
  • Large and small equipment operating
  • Carpentry 
  • Creating water features
  • Concrete work
  • Tool maintenance
  • Planting garden beds
  • Working from blueprints 
  • Installing pavers
  • Stonework 
  • Irrigation
Details:
This position is full-time, permanent, and comes with medical, dental, and many alternative care benefits after the 3-month probationary period. 

Application Details:
  • This position is available immediately and will be posted until filled.
  • Please send a cover letter and resume to hello@pacificridgelandscapes.com.  
  • Check us out @prlandscapes and www.pacificridgelandscapes.com 
  • We're awesome and can't wait to meet you!

title: Maintenance Worker
location: RattleSnake Point Golf Club, Milton, ON
description:
RattleSnake Point Golf Club is Hiring! 

The Facility Supervisor is responsible for maintaining all aspects of the building’s systems including but not limited to security, HVAC, electrical, water, fire suppression systems, and sewage & waste management. The Facility Supervisor is also directly responsible for the cleanliness and presentation of both inside and outside the building.  

Requirements: 

  • Perform minor repairs to building interiors and exteriors. 
  • Ensure locker rooms and public areas are clean and presentable. 
  • Maintenance of the building including painting, cleaning, minor plumbing and electrical repairs. 
  • Maintain qualified outside contractors to make necessary repairs as required. 
  • Assist with event setup. 
  • Work within budget guidelines. 
  • Ensure the building is a safe, well maintained up to code workplaces (fire system checks, first aid supplies, and safety equipment etc.). 
  • Perform all other duties and tasks as assigned. 

Qualifications:  

  • Minimum 2-5 years of related experience in facility or property management. 
  • Knowledge of electrical, plumbing, security, HVAC systems and fire suppression systems.
  • Strong time management and communication skills. 
  • Ability to work well in a team environment. 
  • Strong organizational skills to manage competing priorities and balance multiple tasks. 
  • Basic computer knowledge of MS Office, ability to work with reports, spreadsheets, and other various documents. 
  • Proven ability to manage a variety of projects simultaneously. 

This is a full-time position. Some evenings and weekend shifts required. 

ClubLink is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace. Please contact 

jobs@clublink.ca

 if a workplace accommodation is needed throughout the selection process. Thank you for your interest in ClubLink.

title: General Landscape Labourer
description:
It's your lucky day! Atkinson Landscaping is currently seeking to add amazing people to general labour department. This position would entail both yard maintenance and construction roles, training you to use an array of power equipment and teaching you new and useful skills. If you are interested in a career that is outdoors in changing scenery, working hard, and having loads of fun while doing it, please read on!Job DescriptionOur general labourer position entails an individual that is flexible and comfortable in rotating positions. You may be on yard maintenance runs one day where you will be mowing grass, trimming trees, pruning bushes and blowing leaves, and on the next day helping out on a construction project where you could be excavating, moving and laying brick, or levelling foundation. It truly is a jack of all trades position and it is a great opportunity to gain working skills and knowledge on all aspects of the business. Who are we? Atkinson Landscaping specializes in residential, strata and commercial maintenance services and small construction projects. We are well established in the Surrey/Langley area and are continuing to expand at a rapid rate. Our team consists of motivated individuals that love what they do. New hires will find it easy to feel a sense of belonging within our all-star lineup.  Who are we looking for?Are you:
  • In search of full time work?
  • Looking for an outdoor job full of variety?
  • Available Monday to Friday?
  • Comfortable working in all types of weather?
  • Experienced in landscape maintenance and construction? If not, do you take direction well and are you willing to learn new skills from experienced workers?
  • Capable of physically demanding work?
  • A kind and personable individual?
If you answered yes to all of these, please, apply! Other Requirements
  • A driver’s license
  • A working phone with data preferred
  • Comfortable using power tools and other light equipment/machinery
  • Experience is a valuable asset, but is not necessary!
 Benefits/Perks
  • Casual, FUN work environment
  • Flexible hours
  • Competitive, living wage
  • Educational opportunities
  • Team building exercises and outings
 To apply, please email us at admin@atkinsonlandscaping.ca with a copy of your resume and a brief cover letter attached, telling us why you think you would be a good fit for our team. We look forward to hearing from you!

If not, do you take direction well and are you willing to learn new skills from experienced workers?', 'Comfortable working in all types of weather?']

title: Landscape Foreman
description:
Are you looking to gain "concrete" skills that will be an asset for building and Landscape jobs? Atkinson Landscaping is currently seeking to employ hard working, motivated individuals who are willing to work and play as a team in our hardscape/construction department. We specialize in retaining brick walls, stone patios and rock beds and we love watching our hard work transform into works of art that we can be proud of. If this sounds like it could be a rewarding experience, please read further. Job DescriptionOur hardscape/construction department deals with small-to-large residential and commercial projects. We handle all stages of the project, from excavation to installation. Masonry work is often featured in these projects, so being able to handle heavy bricks is expected. Heavy tools and equipment include power saws, drills, tamps, excavators, and dump trailers. The work is labour intensive but the skills you learn and the team you work with make the job rewarding, and dare we say, fun!Who are we?Atkinson Landscaping specializes in residential, strata and commercial maintenance services and construction projects. We are well-established in the Surrey/Langley area and are continuing to expand at a rapid rate. We are a tightly knit team of forward thinking individuals who seek to do things more efficiently and are always looking to improve our craft. Why work with Atkinson Landscaping?A career at Atkinson Landscaping offers employees an opportunity to be a part of a growing company that values hard work and rewards effort. There are many benefits to working at Atkinson Landscaping: flexible hours, competitive wages, fresh scenery, upward mobility, and a solid crew that loves doing what they do best. Atkinson also operates on a transparent, open-book policy, sharing our monthly financial statements with employees, and profit sharing our surpluses with the team. We believe that opening books to the team promotes a sense of ownership and responsibility amongst each and every one of us, while also developing important life skills in financial literacy. Many companies make promises to their employees that they cannot live up to; rest assured that our word is our bond and we make good on our promisesWho are we looking for?Are you:
  • In search of full time work?
  • Looking for an outdoor job full of variety?
  • Available Monday to Friday?
  • Comfortable working in all types of weather?
  • Experienced in landscape maintenance and construction? If not, do you take direction well and are you willing to learn new skills from experienced workers?
  • Capable of physically demanding work?
  • A kind and personable individual?
If you answered yes to all of these, please, apply!Other Requirements
  • A driver’s license
  • A working phone with data preferred
  • Comfortable using power tools and other light equipment/machinery

title: Grounds Crew
description:
Under the direction of the Campus Services Supervisor, this position performs work as a member of the Grounds crew. A Grounds Crew must be able to follow instructions, to consistently perform manual tasks safely and efficiently and have the physical conditioning and ability to perform the duties of the position. They must also be well organized, properly plan work duties and processes, work independently for extended periods and demonstrate the ability to cooperatively work with supervisors, faculty, students and co-workers. They must also be able to work safely with power tools and equipment common to the horticultural/landscaping trade and be able to work from heights.

 

Position Responsibilities

 

  • Maintain campus grounds through the operation of hand tools and industrial equipment related to year-round grounds maintenance. This includes:
    • Mowing, planting, line trimming, raking, removing small trees, limbs, and other organic waste and general campus lawn maintenance;
    • Installing and maintaining signs, benches, garbage cans, bike racks, and other hard features;
    • Clearing snow and deicing campus roadways, parking lots, driveways, sidewalks, walkways, steps, entryways, etc.; performing such tasks with a snow blower or shovel, spreading ice melter by hand or push-spreader, lifting heavy bags or buckets of ice melter into the back of a pickup truck, etc.
  • Maintenance of sports fields including irrigation repair, topdressing, line painting, overseeding, aerating, fertilization and spray applications and filling out maintenance
  • Operate landscape equipment including but not limited to: pick-up trucks, tractors, mowers, small engine equipment, etc.
  • Move furniture, freight and equipment, up to 75
  • Perform inspection and routine maintenance of vehicles and Grounds shop
  • Perform other related duties as directed or


Qualifications

  • Landscape Horticulturist Journeyman, Bachelor of Technology in Environmental Horticulture, or Diploma (three-year) in Landscape Horticulture or Environmental Horticulture
  • Proof of valid provincial Driver’s License
  • Proof of valid Criminal Record Check (CRC) and Vulnerable Sector Checks (VSC)
  • To work as expected and in cooperation with administrators, faculty, students, co-workers, and other staff
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, including fluency in English; integrity, dependability, tact and diplomacy are essential
  • Ability to maintain the level of physical conditioning required to perform duties
  • Ability to operate tools and equipment common to the trade
  • Proficiency with computer and cell phone technology and the Microsoft Office applications
  • Demonstrated use of CSA approved safety equipment and ability to perform tasks related to assignments safely and efficiently
  • Demonstrated professionalism and ability to recognize and deal effectively with custodial problems

 



To Apply: If you are interested in the challenges and opportunities that this position has to offer, please forward your application on or before Friday, September 24, 2021 to:

 

Department of Human Resources Third Floor, Centennial Hall

65 York Street, Sackville NB, E4L 1E4 Fax: (506) 364-2385, Email:

hr@mta.ca

title: Landscape Maintenance - Crew Member
description:
Job Description:

Do you want to work for a well-known company that has been in business for 45 years? Work for a high end Landscape Company that has a well respected name in the industry. Please Apply today for this up coming season! Lots of positions are available. Company is very diverse in the landscape industry. Must be willing to hard physical labor, be a team player, and have a landscape maintenance background.

Landscape maintenance workers provide a pleasant outdoor environment by ensuring that the grounds of houses, businesses, and parks are attractive, orderly, and healthy.

Duties:

Landscape maintenance workers typically do the following:

  • Mow, edge, and fertilize lawns
  • Weed and mulch landscapes
  • Trim hedges, shrubs, and small trees
  • Remove dead, damaged, or unwanted trees
  • Plant flowers, trees, and shrubs
  • Water lawns, landscapes, and gardens

Landscape maintenance workers perform a variety of tasks to achieve a pleasant and functional outdoor environment.

title: Landscape Crew Member
description:
Job Description

This candidate is employed full time during the spring and/or summer seasons. Working days are from Monday to Friday and Saturdays during April-June, and some July Saturdays if needed. Education and experience in landscape management not necessary but is an asset.



Main Duties

  • Garden maintenance – cultivating, weeding, fertilizing, perennial care, pruning
  • Available for early morning starts to load truck and trailer, and water and weed plant inventory
  • Near the end of workday load trailer and clean work site, including sweeping and blowing
  • Operate small equipment like backpack blowers, hedge trimers, etc.
  • Plant trees, shrubs, perennials, and annuals
  • Build gardens – site setup, digging and wheelbarrowing, planting and mulching
  • Lay flagstone and place armour stone
  • Learn and expand knowledge of landscape maintenance and garden installation
  • Take direction and work alongside team leaders and supervisors
  • Follow on-site health and safety procedures
  • Use Jobber software to track time and input notes when required



Job Requirements

  • High school diploma
  • Landscape experience is an asset
  • Physically capable of lifting 40 pounds of more, wheelbarrowing, and repetitive tasks
  • Must be able to work outdoors in a variety of weather conditions
  • High attention to detail
  • Team oriented and able to complete all tasks assigned
  • Problem-solving skills necessary to solve team and/or client issues on site
  • Hard working and self-motivated
  • Willingness to work as part of a team
  • Must provide a valid G2 driver’s license and sometimes provide own transportation to job sites



Miscellaneous Information

  • Provides own transportation
  • Basic tools provided for $200 and bought back at the end of summer for $180
  • Contract signed at start of employment
  • Staff member so taxes deducted with each paycheque or subcontractor status
  • Hourly pay: $17/hour no experience; $18-19/hour depending on experience; progression plan established and linked with pay increases

 

Sakura Gardens is passionate about creating a work environment where each crew member can excel to their fullest potential while enjoying what they do.

We look forward to hearing back from you!

title: Crew Member/Labourer in landscape division
description:
JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Minimum 5 years in landscaping construction
  • Valid drivers licence/own transportation to our Hamilton yard is required as we are not situated on any bus routes.
  • First aid and certificates for operation of equipment (

    bobcat,

    excavators, etc.) is a must - if you do not have your bobcat certification for heavy equipment, we will work with you to receive one
  • Knowledge of specific materials, methods, tools and equipment required to complete projects
  • Operate various tools such as heavy equipment, chainsaws, laser levels, and all manner of small tools
  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings and specifications to complete work activities
  • Have a G-license and clean driving record
  • Personal tools and equipment needed: Steel-toed boots
  • Organizational skills and problem solving.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Maintain and enforce standards of cleanliness and organization in assigned trucks, trailers, equipment, job sites and shop/yard area
  • Perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment according to company standards
  • Complete and submit all required paperwork on a daily basis
  • Comply with all company policies and procedures to ensure work is carried out in a safe and efficient manner, and that all crew members are in compliance with government and company PPE standards
  • Enforce and work in accordance with all local health and safety laws and regulations at shop/yard and on jobsite
  • Complete and maintain the required completion of circle checks of all commercial truck and trailers as per MTO requirements
  • Communicate with customers in a polite and courteous manner
  • Knowledge in the construction of driveways, walkways, patios, carpentry, masonry, water features, gardens, trees, plants, garden lighting, etc.
  • Snow removal in the winter months

title: Crew Leader/Foreperson/Snow Plow Operator
description:
Assign tasks based on work schedules, keep workers on task, complete timesheets and inspect the quality of work to ensure job requirements are met. Instruct crew members on proper work standards. Interact with customers to resolve issues or answer questions. Crew leaders, also called foreperson, work along with crew members in completing all landscaping installations/maintenance. Operate a variety of hand tools and equipment such as packers, chain saws, hedge shears, sod cutters, pruning saws, mowing equipment, etc. to complete landscape and garden projects.

 

Must have valid and clean (no more than 1 violation) Ontario G class licence and comfortable to drive 1 ton dumptruck with 11 foot dumpbody and a 1 ton pickup truck as well. Start ASAP.

  • Ability to operate all equipment (Skid steer, excavator, stone saws, chain saws, destumper, chipper, post hole digger, drills, cutting torches, vibro plate, hand tamper and various hand tools)

Qualifications:   College/University education in relevant discipline an asset, must have a  Valid G license , general knowledge of plant material required, Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in landscape construction.

title: Landscape Crew Leader
description:
Our firm is growing quickly and just made the Canadian Business Growth list ranking 59 out of nearly 500 companies. We have a fun, energetic, youthful, and innovative team culture and environment. If you learn new skills and have a great attitude there is a lot of room to advance.

 

We are currently looking for driven individuals to join our field team. As a member of our field team, you will get to do all the interesting projects that arise from our landscape maintenance and enhancement clients. In any given week you may be installing a new lawn, renovating a garden, or doing a large property clean-up. Whatever you're doing though you won’t be bored. This is the job for someone who wants to do a lot of different projects each week and can think on their feet to get projects to the finish line.

We are NOT an APP and we do not pay based on piecework. We are looking for actual team members to service our over 800 Toronto clients. As a member of our team, you will receive the following benefits:

 

Here are some of the things that you will enjoy being a part of our team:

  • 100% RRSP match (up to $1/hour) so you can save for retirement.
  • We pay overtime when you work more than 44 hours a week.
  • Health benefits after six months.
  • Flex/Sick days after one year.
  • Year-round employment is available for everyone.

Rate of Pay:  $23.00-$27.00 per hour (depending on experience)

 

Job Responsibilities:

  • Installing sod, mulch, plants, and other landscape enhancements (no stonework).
  • Spotting opportunity areas for improvements or upsell on our accounts.
  • Landscape Maintenance (weeding, deadheading, edging, trimming, seasonal pruning)
  • Manage a team of up to 3 people while performing services; motivate, coach, and mentor team

Requirements:

  • Valid G license with a clean driving record
  • At least 2 seasons of landscape maintenance or enhancements experience
  • 1-2 years of experience leading crew members
  • Having a safety-first mindset and minding the safety of yourself, co-workers, and the public.
  • Able to meet the physical requirements of the job including bending, lifting, utilizing hand tools, and working in various weather conditions
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Organized, self-motivated, dependable

COVID-19 precaution(s):

  • Personal protective equipment provided or required
  • Social distancing guidelines in place
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

 

Mr. Mow It All Corp. is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace. We are committed to accessibility and Human Rights. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We thank all candidates who apply, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

 Founded in 1993, Manfer Gardening is dedicated to providing Toronto with premium gardening and lawn care services. Family-owned and with a passion for creating beautiful outdoor experiences, Manfer Gardening is our client's top choice for high quality, boutique lawn and garden solutions.

title: Yard Person
description:
Location: Edmonton, Alberta

Position: Regular / Full Time / Day Shift / Night Shift

Positions Available: 3

 

Waiward is a respected construction and maintenance service provider that operates one of Canada’s largest fabrication shops based out of Edmonton, Alberta. Our mission is To Be Your Trusted Partner which ensures we act with integrity in all that we do. Through planned growth and development, we have kept our commitment to provide our customers with an unsurpassed level of service. Waiward’s historical and future success is grounded in our collective commitment to our core values.

 

At Waiward, we believe a diverse and inclusive workplace is the key to unlocking the full potential of our people. It is essential to build a team that represents the communities and clients we are serving. We attract, hire, and develop people of all backgrounds and ensure fairness and inclusion within our hiring processes. We believe in investing in people based on their expertise, capabilities, aspirations, and performance despite their race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, and beliefs.

As a leader in our industry, we believe diversity and inclusion strengthen our team and are committed to making sustainable progress in our company and the communities and clients we serve. With the support of our leadership team and peers, our people are encouraged to share their perspectives.

 

Job Purpose

The Yard Person is responsible for activities of unloading raw materials and supplying the shop with required job specific material. 


  • Displays a commitment to Waiward’s incident-free vision, values, and culture
  • Reads, understands, and follows all safe work practices and procedures for machinery and equipment
  • Uses the proper tools to meet the specific job requirements
  • Unloads railcars with overhead cranes, as required
  • Unloads truck trailers with overhead crane, as required
  • Locates and loads material onto machines
  • Stocks yard by putting away materials
  • Retrieves materials from stock yard
  • Returns off-cuts to stock and empty scrap bins
  • Maintains documentation
  • Attends Daily Tool Box Meetings
  • Follows work schedules
  • Orgranizes multiple tasks and effectively delegates tasks when needed
  • Follows and documents established procedures
  • Takes reasonable care and cooperates with employer to protect the health and safety of all workers
  • Reports personal injuries, no matter how minor, and obtains medical attention as required
  • Performs other related duties as assigned

  • Certified Overhead Crane Operator preferred
  • Advanced and Basic Rigging Course preferred
  • FLHA Training
  • Lock Out/Tag Out Training
  • WHMIS

Working Conditions

The incumbent is required to work outdoors in a fabrication yard with moderate noise.

 

Physical Requirements

The incumbent is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: viewing a computer terminal for extended periods of time; and extensive reading. The incumbent is also required to stand and sit for extended periods of time and will require good physical attributes for walking on uneven ground, climbing, confined space entry, limited lifting, and sitting.

 

 *Please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted. Waiward is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Arborist Climber
description:
If you enjoy working outdoors in a professional and safe environment, consider a career with Bartlett Tree Experts! At Bartlett, we value a strong culture of excellence in safety, scientific research, lifelong learning, and career development.





As an Arborist Climber, you will be an integral member of a tree care crew with the primary responsibility of tree climbing and assisting Arborist Crew Leaders in performing all tree and shrub care services on residential and commercial properties.









We offer competitive compensation, as well as:



+ A safety-first culture and professional workplace


+ Advancement opportunities - we promote from within


+ Life, LTD, ADD, medical and dental


+ RPP Plan, Healthcare spending account, and paid vacation and holidays


+ Industry credential/license pay increases


+ Company-paid uniforms, PPE, gear, and equipment


+ Boot reimbursement up to $200


+ Access to training, continuing education programs, and a variety of resources provided by the Bartlett Tree Experts Research Laboratories






To find out more about what life is like at Bartlett, check us out on Instagram @LifeatBartlett.









As an Arborist Climber, you will play an important role in:



+ Performing ground, tree climbing, and aerial lift duties in support of specific job assignments, as directed by the Arborist Crew Leader and Local Manager


+ Safely performing all aspects of arboriculture, including:



+ Pruning


+ Cabling and bracing


+ Rigging


+ Removals


+ Properly maintaining and operating equipment (hand tools, chainsaws, chippers, and aerial lifts)




+ Learning, understanding, and adhering to all safety rules and company safety policies





+ A passion for nature, the environment, and the outdoors


+ At least one (1) year of tree climbing (DdRT or SRT) and aerial lift operation experience in the tree care industry


+ Valid driver's license and clean motor vehicle record (Class B CDL preferred)


+ Ability to work outdoors year-round in all weather conditions






The F. A. Bartlett Tree Expert Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer.








Vernon

BC

Production Arborist

5/6/2022

Regular Full-Time



ID: 2022-14575

External Company URL: https://englishcareers-bartlett.icims.com

title: Arborist I - Certified - (Job Number: 43591)
description:
Description43591
Qualifications

Looking for a great place to work? A place where our culture means safety, respect, quality and excellence and putting our customer’s interests ahead of our own? Then think City of Edmonton - City Operations.


We strive to help our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone’s contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth and provides continuous opportunities for development.


As an Arborist I, you will be maintaining our Urban Forest with best practices in pruning, maintenance and plant health care. Some key responsibilities will be to:

  • Ensure safety, structural development and health of trees by utilizing hand, power, hydraulic tools and aerial lift units
  • Ensure trees are free of broken, crossing/rubbing branches, dead/diseased wood and damaged wood
  • Remove and/or pile branches and brush
  • Provide proper clearances above roads and sidewalks, from traffic signs, streetlights, buildings and other trees
  • "Train" trees to maintain a shape that is consistent with characteristics of its species
  • Ensure sidewalk and street clearance as well as accommodating park settings
  • Attend to storm-damaged trees (usually broken or split limbs)
  • Remove of tree stakes as necessary
  • Remove adventitious growth (water sprouts & suckers) as required
  • Bolt, cable and brace in non-complex situations
  • Thin tree crown to limit stress on the portion of trunk weakened by the cavity or an injury
  • Perform surgeries by tracing damaged wood with a surgery knife rounding the margins
  • Remove small and large trees following directions from Parks Leader and Arborist II
  • Chip trees as required
  • Know how to use chipping equipment safely and how to maintain chipping schedules
  • Complete structural risk assessments
  • Identify tree pests and diseases and identify tree health care issues in the early stages
  • Work on public complaints (tree problems and concerns) and attend to tree work generated by requests/complaints
  • Perform other related duties as required

title: Skilled Ground Worker (Fort Hills)
description:
Position Scope:

NACG is looking for a labourer to work on a remote mining site in the Fort McMurray area. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Site: Fort Hills

Schedule: 14x7- 12 hours (paid for 11.5 hours) (Days and nights)

Accommodations: Camp provided

Transportation: Flights are provided to and from Edmonton or Calgary. All individuals utilizing provided flights must be fully vaccinated as per federal transportation regulations. Bussing provided from Fort McMurray to site (before and after shifts)

Overtime:  Provided after 8 hours a day or 44 hours a week

 

The successful candidate  will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955.  

 

Responsibilities:
  • Successful applicants must to be willing to help out in all tasks for general labourer duties.
  • Familar with pumps/hoses & dewatering activities
  • Must have a valid driver's license.

**Must be physically fit and be able to lift 50 pounds**  

Summary:

All successful candidates must:

  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  4. Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  5. Disclose COVID-19 vaccination status:
    • Fully immunized individuals must provide government issued proof of vaccination to be exempt from site testing requirements
    • Individuals not fully immunized may be subject to site COVID-19 testing requirements and associated costs

       

  7. Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

 

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  1. CSO or BSO Certification
  2. Copy of Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Copy of recent Driverâ€™s Abstract
  4. VOID cheque/direct deposit form
  5. Hydrogen Sulpjide Awareness
  6. Silica Awareness
  7. OHS Alberta Legislation Awareness

Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  1. Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  2. An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  3. After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

 

Overview:

North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.   In that time, weâ€™ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. Weâ€™ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers.  

In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

  • Significant Growth â€“ As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
  • Long Term Contracts â€“ With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
  • Commitment To Safety â€“ With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
  • Competitive Compensation â€“ NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

 

Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Greenskeeper I (Seasonal) - James Island
description:
TITLE:             Greenskeeper I (we have openings for seasonal FT team members from April – September)

 

REPORTS TO: Golf Course Superintendent


 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTION:

 

As a member of the Golf Course Maintenance Team, the Greenskeeper I is responsible for maintaining our Jack Nicklaus Signature golf course and providing world-class playing conditions daily. Following directions and performing tasks under the supervision of the Superintendent, they will ensure daily standards for the course are met with precise detail. The Greenskeeper I is dependable, enthusiastic, and exhibits a strong work ethic and willingness to learn.

 

Although the Greenskeeper I is an entry-level position, it is an integral one within Golf Course Maintenance and this individual is a key player on our team.

 

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Assist with bunker raking; general landscaping; green, tee and approach mowing; and various other golf course and landscape maintenance tasks
  • Communicate daily with supervisor to report concerns/observations about the golf course quality or to provide maintenance suggestions to improve efficiency
  • Be aware of safety requirements and report unsafe conditions or accidents to supervisor
  • Perform daily vehicle and equipment refueling/cleaning and immediately report problems and failures to the Equipment Manager or Superintendent
  • Attend department meetings and trainings as necessary
  • Support other departments to ensure an excellent overall Member and guest experience
  • Ensure appearance is in keeping with Handbook
  • Additional duties may be assigned as required

 

SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS:


  • Ability to closely follow all instructions given by their supervisor
  • Comfortable with independent decision-making and able to complete work assignments both with and without supervision
  • Ability to work in a team environment, maintain good working relationships with other employees, and operate in a safe, professional manner
  • Possess a valid driver’s license and the ability to operate vehicles
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, and holiday and a shift greater than eight (8) hours in length
  • Ability to meet the physical demands of the position including, but not limited to, working outdoors in all weather conditions, standing, walking, and moving for periods of greater than four (4) hours, and lifting and carrying items sometimes greater than 50 pounds
  • Ability to stay calm and focused during the busiest of times
  • Playing knowledge of the game preferred but not required

 

 

COMMITMENT TO COMMUNITY AND THE ENVIRONMENT

 

Two of the primary principles with which James Island Golf and Ocean Club conducts business are its commitment to the environment in which we live and the community of which we are a part. At all times you will be conscious of the treatment of our daily environment and will share responsibility for the environmental stewarding of James Island. You will also honor the responsibility we each have to be respectful of our community and to look for ways to support our community. 

 

 

WORKING ON ISLAND

 

We don’t think there’s a more beautiful, special place to spend your days than on James Island. In addition to a great setting, we offer:

  • An employee meal program
  • Competitive wages
  • A fun, unique and collaborative work environment
  • The opportunity to grow with the club through ongoing training and support (whether you’re joining us year-round or hope to return next season)
  • Shuttle boat transportation to/from Island (about a 5-minute trip)

 

About Discovery Land Company


Founded in 1994 by Michael S. Meldman, Discovery Land Company specializes in building luxury residential private club communities and resorts throughout North America. We have grown to be the premier player in the high-end resort residential niche with 20 world-class projects in our portfolio. Our communities are distinct with their own architectural styles, world-class amenities, and high levels of service.

We don’t build buildings, but rather we build settings where families can create intergenerational memories and enrich their lives in exquisite and untouched sanctuaries. These settings offer a casual and comfortable sense of community through outstanding clubhouses, premier golf courses, welcoming staff, world-class culinary offerings, and outdoor pursuits. To ease and enrich your experiences, Discovery holds itself to the highest of service standards. Every decision we make is driven by one fundamental objective: to make the time you spend with the people you care about most not merely enjoyable, but memorable.

title: Lawn & Landscape Team Member
company: The Grounds Guys of South Surrey
description:
We began with a single vision shared between 10 brothers. Originally, we opened our doors as Sunshine Grounds Care in 1987. As time passed and more brothers joined in the project, it became a widely recognized brand built on the principles of excellent workmanship, customer satisfaction, and real care. We abide by the simple values outlined in our company acronym "C.A.R.E.", which are: Customers first, Attitude, Respect, and Enjoy life in the process!As a member of the Ground Guys team you perform landscape maintenance and design at high levels of quality and service. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.  You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and are able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines. You have at least one year of landscaping experience and proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.Specific Responsibilities:
  • Performs landscape maintenance duties such as mowing, fertilizer application, weed control, aeration, spring clean-up, fall clean-up, trimming, and pruning
  • Operates a variety of mechanical equipment including but not limited to bed edgers, commercial mowers, blowers, dump trailers, chainsaws, line trimmers, and tillers
  • Performs landscape enhancement activities such as mulch application, plantings, top soil application, lawn seeding
  • Addresses clients' questions, comments, and concerns or refers clients to the Team Leader as appropriate
  • Assists Team Leader with route and job planning and organization, thereby ensuring sufficient resources and materials are readily available
  • Assists with equipment maintenance and repair under supervision of the Team Leader
  • Applies chemicals under the direction of a licensed applicator, and with all required protective equipment
  • Performs other duties as required
Job Requirements:
  • High school diploma/GED (or current student status)
  • One year experience in this or a related field is required
  • Valid Driver's License with clean record
  • Willingness to work occasional (paid) overtime
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds to waist level and perform all other physical requirements associated with a position of this nature
Benefits: Benefits package varies by locationWe are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow up!

Notice

The Grounds Guys LLC is the franchisor of the The Grounds Guys® franchised system. Each The Grounds Guys® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, The Grounds Guys LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. The Grounds Guys LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent The Grounds Guys® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither The Grounds Guys LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. The Grounds Guys LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Landscape Construction Crew Foreman/Manager
description:
Mr. Lawnmower Job Posting.

Here we grow again, if you like working outdoors, really enjoyed your summer job mowing lawns in middle school then a job in Horticultural Industry is for you. Horticultural companies work to preserve and enhance a client’s landscape.

Horticultural Projects can be as simple as caring for grass and shrubs, or as elaborate as tending to turf, trees, and other landscape elements at a luxury resort.

Since maintaining the “attractiveness” of landscapes is so popular, there is rarely a shortage of work as a horticultural professional. This isn’t your simple summer lawn-mowing job anymore!

We at Mr. Lawnmower are looking for energetic and motivated individuals that have tremendous leadership qualities and are attention to detail-oriented. Mr. Lawnmower is based in Scarborough, and currently has an opening for a Lawn Maintenance/Landscape Construction Foreman and Landscape/Lawn-care Technicians. Candidates must be Dependable, Honest, and Trustworthy. References will be mandatory.

Descriptions:

Landscape Construction Crew Foreman/Manager:
A qualified landscape construction foreman will be expected to have experience in and required to do the following:
  • Read blueprints and specs for projects.
  • Complete daily job site journals/work orders.
  • Perform weekly toolbox meetings.
  • Help with maintenance and cleaning of vehicles and equipment.
  • Ability to operate various pieces of equipment.
  • Hold a valid class G License.
  • Provide own transportation to project sites.
  • Work weekends and long hours.
  • Schedule materials and equipment for the next day.
  • Schedule and run crews.
  • Will be required to plant trees, shrubs and lay sod.
  • Ability to rake, level, and grade.
  • Ability to install hard and soft landscapes (Wet Lay and asset).

Education:
  • High school diploma.
  • CLT/CLP or Two-year technical college certificate in horticulture an asset.
  • Valid first aid certificate an asset.
  • WHMIS training an asset.
  • 2-4 years of experience.

All Applicants interested and qualified applicants should be able to work well with others, have good communication skills, and be able to start immediately and work overtime as requested. All resumes and cover letters should be e-mailed to: careers@mrlawnmower.ca.

*Apprenticeship students are encouraged to apply

PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT DUE TO THE ANTICIPATED HIGH VOLUME OF RESPONSE TO THIS AD, MR. LAWNMOWER IS NOT ABLE TO RESPOND TO EVERY APPLICANT. SOMEONE FROM MR. LAWNMOWER WILL CONTACT QUALIFIED APPLICANTS THAT MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE POSITION AND MATCH THE BACKGROUND AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE.
