title: Labourer/Landscaper
description:
Goals & Outcomes:
Effectively perform any combination of receiving, storing, and moving parts and equipment to assist the warehouse and service operations of Paramount. As well as maintain and update commercial landscape projects for clients.

Essential Functions:
  • Load and unload trucks and moves items to assigned areas.
  • Loads/unloads equipment and moves items to assigned areas.
  • Completes all required paperwork in an accurate and timely manner.
  • Ability to maintain a valid forklift license issued by the Company.
  • Maintains a clean, sanitary and safe work area.
  • Follow all required work-safe practices. This would include wearing all required PPE in designated areas, confined space safety, safe chemical handling, fall restraints, etc.
  • Duties are related to parking lot maintenance and repair.
  • Mowing, edging, and fertilizing lawns
  • Weeding and mulching landscape beds
  • Trimming small trees, hedges, and shrubs
  • Removing unwanted, dead, or damaged trees
  • Planting shrubs, flowers, and trees
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements:
  • High School Diploma or equivalent preferred. 
  • 1 year of experience required.
  • Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs, frequently lift and/or move above shoulder height, stand, walk, kneel.
  • Be able to effectively work in a team environment.
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills.
  • Familiarity with asphalt repair a plus.
  • Valid Class 3 Driver’s License is a plus.
  • Experience with operation and basic maintenance of any and all equipment related to landscape work, lawnmower, sod cutter, edger, etc.
  • Must be able to pass all pre-employment screens (including drug, background, and criminal checks).




    About Paramount Services:

    Paramount Service Ltd. began as Paramount Restaurant Service Ltd. over 25 years ago. Since then, the company has evolved into a full-service equipment supply and facility maintenance company based from Winnipeg, Manitoba. Our presence is focused in South West Ontario & North West Ontario, Manitoba and Saskatchewan but we have strong partnerships spanning coast-to-coast-to-coast across Canada. As part of our full-service commitment throughout the country, we employ refrigerationber, HVAC, plumbing and electrical journeymen, handymen, general labourers and we have over 600 subcontractors at our disposal. Our customer relationships are based on our performance and built on trust. As a result, our customers ask us if we can do more, and we do. From general contracting to minor service calls, landscape and parking lot maintenance, to hot and cold beverage services, equipment sales to preventative maintenance – we do it all.

title: Maintenance Worker III
description:
Why Fraser Health?:

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlakaâ€™pamux Nations. Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.

 

Effective October 26, 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization â€œWHOâ€ approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.

 

We currently have an exciting opportunity for you to utilize your skills as a Full Time Maintenance Worker III at Chilliwack General Hospital.

 

Detailed Overview:

Under general supervision, the Maintenance Worker III performs operational and maintenance duties related to buildings, equipment, furnishings and grounds in one or a variety of areas such as electrical, plumbing, carpentry and painting.

Responsibilities:
  1. Identifies nature of malfunction of equipment and appliances such as wheelchairs, paging systems, toasters, food mixers and blenders; performs electrical and mechanical repairs by disassembling motors and equipment, cleaning, oiling, greasing and replacing parts such as brushes, elements, bearings, filters, belts, wires and soldering connections.
  2. Maintains related preventative maintenance inspection reports, records and documents, as required; logs activities such as preventative and demand work, test results on fire alarms, auxiliary generators, HVAC systems etc.; completes, collates and files documentation in accordance with established standards and procedures.
  3. Maintains working areas in a clean and safe condition.
  4. Works with Supervisor in developing and maintaining rolling stock program.
  5. Repairs furniture such as tables, cupboards and shelves; repairs items such as walls, doors, floors, ceilings and windows by applying materials such as drywall, wood paneling, wallpaper, millwork, drapery tracks, glass and locks; constructs such items as shelves and cupboards.
  6. Applies paint and other finishes by brush, roller or spray; removes and replaces coverings such as tiles, linoleum, carpets and baseboards.
  7. Performs electrical maintenance such as replacing light bulbs, switches, electric plugs, extension cords, sockets and receptacles; checks all electrical equipment for CSA approvals and arranges for the required electrical testing of patient owned equipment as required.
  8. Replaces, repairs and maintains plumbing fixtures such as sinks, toilets, and plumbing fixtures. Unplugs drains, toilets, blocked sewer lines, etc.
  9. Checks and changes medical gas cylinders, delivers where required.
  10. Collects and disposes garbage on an as required basis; cleans, clears snow, and sands pathways as required.
  11. Performs other related duties as required.
Qualifications:

Education and Experience

Grade 10 plus two (2) yearsï¿½ recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.

title: Yard Labourer
description:
Inland Concreteis currently looking for a responsible, safe, and dependable Yard Labourer/Loader Operator to join our local team in Lacombe.In this positionyou will support plant needs by ensuring a safe and productive work environment. In this position, you will have the opportunity to use different skills every day as you learn the industry and fill in for vacancies in various areas of our plant.

What You Will Get to Do:
  • Assist with plant tasks including lubrication, maintenance, repairs
  • Operateopen wheel loader on plant property when needed
  • Maintain cleanliness of plant work areas
  • Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental regulations, as well as company policies and procedures; assist with physical inspections of plant property/departments.

    Who We Are Looking For:
  • High school diploma or GED required
  • Previous experience operating loader and offloading barges an asset
  • Experience using (or ability to learn) plant mobile equipment
  • Desire to work cooperatively as part of a productive team
  • Ability to work safely, and independently without constant supervision
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Capable of learning through on the job training
  • Able to work inside and outside in year-round weather conditions
  • In good physical condition, able to lift and carry up to50 lbs., sit and stand for extended periods of time, kneel, climb ladders, and walk on varied terrain
  • Ability to work different extended hours, holidays and/or overtime required

    Who We Are:
    Lehigh Hanson Materials is part of the Lehigh Hanson group of companies. Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.
    With our diverse product lines and locations across North America, there are opportunities to explore different roles and work on a variety of exciting and interesting projects. At Lehigh Hanson, we believe our employees play a key role in the company’s success and future growth.
    Lehigh Hanson is a drug free workplace. Our pre-employment process includes reference checks, medical screening, drug & alcohol testing and a drivers abstract may be required.

title: Yard Labourer
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

Lafarge is recruiting a Yard Labourer at our Exshaw AB cement plant. Labourers are responsible for aiding in all areas of the plant. They participate in housekeeping, maintenance and other various tasks throughout the plant. A high level of safety practices must be used at all times. 

Responsibilities

  • Receive oral instructions to determine work assignments.
  • Perform physical activities that require considerable use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling of materials.
  • May assist with minor repairs and maintenance.
  • Remove rubble and other debris in the facility.
  • Complete Field Level Risk Assessments before beginning each task.

Qualifications

Education Required: 

  • High School Diploma

Years of Experience: 

  • 1-2 years is preferred

 

Specific Experience:

  • Prior experience in and industrial setting would be an asset
  • Comfortable working indoors and outdoors and in a noisy plant setting
  • Safety Oriented
  • Able to lift 50 lbs
  • Able to work in a fast paced, high production environment
  • Willing to work overtime and shifts when needed
  • Able to work unsupervised
  • Able to work well with others
  • Good communication skills

 

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Gardener - Temporary Full-Time Contract
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Canadian Base Operators’ Meaford team is growing! If you are a committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you.

The Temporary Full-Time Contract Gardener position starts May 16, 2022 and goes to September 16, 2022 and is located in Meaford at the 4th Canadian Division Training Centre. This position typically reports directly to the Roads and Grounds Supervisor. Their primary focus is to tend to the gardens and flowerbeds in the garrison as well as help with grounds down range under the direction of the Facilities Manager. Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Keep work spaces and general areas clean, orderly and hazard free
  • Wear personal protective equipment
  • Be familiar with the maintenance of flowerbeds – planting, weeding, mulching
  • Recognition of common flowers and weeds
  • Operate various pieces of equipment (string trimmers, edger, mowers) associated with grounds-keeping, as per instruction
  • Help maintain grounds both on garrison and down range
  • Working out of doors in various weather conditions; complete physically demanding work
  • Prepare personal timesheets

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

The following certifications/designations/experience are considered an asset:

  • Certificate in Horticulture
  • Similar horticultural experience

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Demonstrated ability in the following:

  • gardening
  • use of lawn equipment
  • hand tools and power tools
  • Hold a valid driver’s licence, class “G”
  • Be physically fit and reliable
  • Able to complete physical work including, but not limited to:
    • lifting
    • pulling
    • pushing
    • able to work on uneven ground
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs
  • Provide own CSA approved work-boots in serviceable condition

Due to many mandatory vaccination requirements at client projects / facilities, in order to provide substantial employment by ensuring compliance with our clients’ mandates, the successful candidate may be required to validate full vaccination prior to hire.

Please forward your application prior to close of business April 29, 2022

Canadian Base Operators welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Playland Groundskeeper
description:
Playland Groundskeeper


Seasonal Part-time: ASAP – November 2022


(weekends and evening as required)


Wage & Pay Grade: $17.00/hour (PG 72); plus 5% in lieu of benefits and vacation


Date Posted: April 19, 2022





Who we are…


The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 112 year old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of $48 million dollars and generates revenue through three activity streams: the 15 day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events. The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best we can be.





We are looking for a talented individual to join our PNE Grounds Maintenance Team and ensure all areas of the Playland site, including public-access locations in buildings and rides, are maintained in a clean and debris-free manner. Supports the Grounds Maintenance team to ensure site cleanliness standards are being adhered to and that team members are adequately equipped.





Why join our Team?



+ Exhilarating and fun-loving culture


+ Flexible work environment


+ Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more


+ Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands


+ On-site fitness center


+ Competitive compensation package


+ Opportunity to create lasting memories and friendships!






What will you do this year?


In your role as a Playland Groundskeeper, your primary accountabilities will be to:



+ Operate equipment including, but not limited to:


+ Pressure washers


+ Leaf blowers


+ Floor buffers


+ Paint and compete touch-ups


+ Conduct minor repairs on Grounds Maintenance equipment


+ Conduct regular-interval inventory counts


+ Treat and remove in-ground weeds


+ Remove debris in active ride areas, following established lock-out procedures


+ Ensure that ride units are kept clean


+ Provide guidance for Grounds Maintenance team members


+ Monitor cleanliness of park while in operation, including all washrooms


+ Complete before and after season clean-up of both the Playland site and related Grounds Maintenance equipment


+ Arrange for the placement and storage of all waste receptacles, cleaning supplies and Grounds Maintenance equipment


+ Adhere to PNE policies and guidelines


+ Ensure that proper PNE dress code is adhered to at all times


+ Perform other related duties as required by the Manager






What else?



+ Knowledge of materials, methods, and cleaning tools used in janitorial/site clean-up work


+ Previous experience working in a janitorial capacity is required


+ Ability to arrange an effective work schedule under minimum supervision


+ Ability to interact with guests in a courteous and professional manner


+ Ability to understand and effectively carry out oral and written instructions


+ Sufficient physical strength, stamina, and coordination to permit the performance of assigned tasks


+ Must possess valid WHIMIS certification


+ Must be able and willing to work a variety of shifts, including evening, day shifts, and weekends


+ Must be available to work up to full-time hours (40 hours per week)


+ Candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check.






Who are you?



+ Proactive


+ Hardworking


+ Committed


+ Team player


+ Reliable






Where and when to APPLY?


Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.





Preference will be given to candidates who submit their resume/cover letter before Sunday May 22nd, 2022. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Yard Labourer
description:
Company Background and Culture

Geotech Drilling is a dynamic international drilling company headquartered in Prince George, Vernon & Delta. Our strategy is to grow our company through developing our pipeline of high-quality advanced-stage projects.

Geotech owns and operates state-of-the-art Drilling Equipment throughout western Canada. Geotech is one of the larger exploration and geotechnical Drilling companies in Canada, with a fleet of over 50 rigs. One of the large advantages Geotech has over its competition are the long-term contracts in place throughout Western Canada. In addition to the long-term contracts, Geotech also has various other Geotechnical, Exploration & CPT work throughout the Territories & Western Canada.

The company has recently established permanent operations in Grand Prairie, AB. Since setting up shop in Grand Prairie, our team has been focusing on projects associated with abandoned wells and site investigations for pipeline alignments in Alberta and Northeast British Columbia.

In addition to the activities underway throughout Canada, Geotech continues to commit to professional development, partaking in a variety Geotechnical & Mining conferences to ensure our employees have the knowledge to maintain our place as a leader in the industry. For more information on Geotech, visit our website at https://www.geotechdrilling.com.

Key Responsibilities

  • Perform routine labour tasks daily.
  • Filling out requisitions for project work.
  • Operating a forklift & other hand-held equipment.
  • Ensure outgoing loads are organized, complete and secure for transport.
  • Maintain constant communication with yard and operations staff.
  • Exert excellent prioritizing skill to meet and exceed project timelines.
  • Understand and follow all company safety policies and procedures.
  • Other related duties as required.

Professional Experience / Qualifications

  • Must possess and maintain a valid Canadian Driver's License.
  • Must be physically fit and able to lift 30-50 lbs. to shoulder height 2-4 times/shift and able to work primarily outdoors in various weather conditions.
  • Forklift experience considered an asset

Education

  • High School Diploma or equivalent.

Compensation

At Geotech, we pride ourselves in offering a challenging and rewarding work environment. Our employees have the opportunity for career and professional growth through development and education.

In addition, our compensation benefit package includes competitive salaries and vacation packages, Health and Insurance benefit program, and Retirement Savings Plan.

If you are qualified for the position posted and are interested in being part of reshaping the future of Geotech Drilling, please contact us through our website at https://www.geotechdrilling.com/geotech-careers/job-opportunities/

title: Crew Lead - Landscaping and Grounds Maintenance
company: Canadian Grounds Landscaping and Snow Removal
description:
About Us:

Canadian Grounds Landscaping and Snow Removal (“Canadian Grounds”) was started in 1996 with the goal of being an owner-operated company that could provide educated and competent service to its customers. We have established a reputation as a leader in quality, services, experience, and value.

Our client list includes large hospitals and health facilities, major hotels, commuter train depots and parking lots, downtown business complexes and large industrial properties within Greater Toronto.

About the Position:

Canadian Grounds is looking for a crew leader with experience in landscaping and grounds maintenance.  This person will perform work to assist in maintaining the landscape of our commercial properties for summer and winter.

Work Location:

  • Checkpoint - 69 Advance Road, Etobicoke

Responsibilities:

  • Supervision of a single crew (typically 3 people) 
  • Cut grass, rake, aerate, dethatch, fertilize and water lawns, weed gardens, prune shrubs and trees and perform other maintenance duties as directed by the supervisor.
  • Spread topsoil, lay sod, plant flowers, grass, shrubs and trees and perform other duties to assist with the construction and maintenance of sites.
  • Operate and maintain power mowers, tractors, chain saws, electric clippers, sod cutters, pruning saws, snowblowers and other landscape maintenance equipment
  • Perform other manual duties to clean and maintain landscaped environments, such as litter pick up and shovelling snow and salting walkways in the winter.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 5 years experience in snow removal, landscaping and groundskeeping management
  • Minimum 2 years experience with supervising crews
  • Must have experience with zero turn lawn mower 
  • Must have a G drivers license with clean drivers license abstract
  • Able to work under adverse weather conditions
  • Able to work flexible hours during winter

Wages and Benefits:

Salary: $24 and up depending on experience 

Health and Dental Benefits: Yes

Other: Paid Training and Career Development opportunities, such as DZ training.

title: Lawn Maintenance Lead Hand (FT)
description:
Oakridge Landscape Contractors has a need for a Lawn Maintenance Lead Hand (Full-time) in Hamilton to join our dynamic team of talented individuals!

Oakridge Group Inc. Established in 1992, our team of trusted professionals strives to accomplish the best outcome for every single one of our clients, every time. With 30 years of experience, we stand firmly behind our work and take immense pride in all of our projects, both big and small. Our focus and client dedication can be seen throughout decades of Oakridge Landscape Contractors' award-winning residential and commercial projects. We have won 9 Landscape Ontario awards in 2021 for our residential and commercial projects.

Position: Lawn Maintenance Lead Hand.
Location: Brantford, Ontario 
Pay: Up to $24 per hour.
  • Benefits: after 3 months of employment
  • Company events

Job Duties:
  • Lawn Maintenance Lead Hand related to the landscape gardening industry. 
  • The position of Lawn Maintenance Lead Hand will involve assisting in the daily management of maintenance projects for Oakridge Landscape Contractors. 
  • This position also includes the use of numerous types of related equipment.

Key duties include:
  • Assisting foreperson in managing a crew of 3-5 people.
  • Mowing grass.
  • Flower bed maintenance.
  • Pulling weeds.
  • Trimming.
  • Raking.
  • Pruning.
  • On occasion, drive company pickup and trailer.

Job Requirements:
  • Valid Driver’s License “G” is required.
  • Clean Driver’s Abstract.
  • 3-5 years of field experience.
  • Strong knowledge of job safety and safe work habits.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Ability to work long hours.
  • Tolerance to various weather conditions.

Oakridge Group is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties. If you are a person with a disability and have a question or require assistance with the application process, please contact me via email.




    About Oakridge Landscape Contractors:

    Oakridge Landscape Contractors specializes in landscape applications for industrial, commercial, institutional, parks, heritage sites, and highway road infrastructure restoration.Our extensive landscape construction knowledge and installation abilities combined with our team, sub trade relationships and central location allow our company to complete both large and small scale successfully.

title: Landscaper
description:
Description:
Come grow your career as a Landscaper with our awesome company!
Agilus is recruiting for several Landscapers in the landscape construction industry in Vancouver, British Columbia.
Our community based client is looking for Landscapers to join their team. Their head office is located in Coquitlam. This is a full-time permanent role, Monday to Friday 8am-5pm. We are looking for individuals who are team players and eager to learn and grow with the company. There are also plenty of opportunities for career development.
Responsibilities:
  • Build to completion various precast concrete retaining walls and paving stone applications
  • Finish hard and soft landscaping installation
  • Fill out daily form to record progress

Successful candidates will have:
  • 1 year of direct experience in hardscape landscaping
  • Experience independently working hardscaping, pavers, and retaining wall systems
  • Planted trees, sod and fine grading
  • Ability to read landscape construction drawings
  • Drivers License

What's in it for you:
  • $25.00 - $35.00 hourly
  • Overtime pay available
  • Permanent role, Monday-Friday, 9am-5pm
  • Full benefits and wellness program
  • Opportunities for personal development and career growth
  • On site parking and company events
  • Be a part of a company that values their employees and the community!

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email mdhaliwal@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Golf Grounds Maintenance
description:
POSITION: Golf Grounds Maintenance DEPARTMENT: Golf STATUS OF POSITION: Seasonal WHO WE ARE: At Horseshoe Resort, we are a team that loves to serve people, priding ourselves on the service that our colleagues deliver to our guests
Horseshoe Resort is always looking for talented individuals to join our growing team of hospitality professionals and recreation enthusiasts
If you are outgoing, friendly and love adventure and the outdoors, you may be the person we are looking for! Position Summary The Golf Grounds Maintenance team is responsible for ensuring the golf grounds of the Resort are presented in a well-groomed and manicured manner
Duties and Responsibilities: Planting and maintaining flower beds, shrubs, plants, and trees throughout both courses Lawn mowing, pruning, trimming, and edging various plants Proper operation of hand and power tools & light and heavy equipment Minor equipment repairs such as sharpening blades Debris and garbage removal from walkways, pathways, course, patios, and parking lots Other duties as assigned Qualifications: Golf course or landscaping experience preferred Good working knowledge of plants and landscape maintenance equipment Must be able to lift 50 lbs
and stand for long periods of time Ability to work outdoors in all conditions Knowledge of irrigation repairs, operation, and application Must be able to work weekends and holidays Join our team today, and enjoy employee perks such as Resort staff pass for yourself and your dependents, retail, lodging, and restaurant discounts, along with additional perks and discounts at our other affiliated resort – Deerhurst Resort in Muskoka

title: Maintenance
description:
Our Maintenance People,

 

As Canada’s largest residential landlord, CAPREIT prides itself on the smooth operation and safety of our properties. Our Maintenance Crew is responsible for the coordination of all major repairs and improvements necessary for a portfolio of properties. They key goal of the team is to maintain a properly functioning and inviting environment throughout the building for our staff and residents.

 

An ideal candidate for this position should have excellent communication skills, a background in building mechanics, good knowledge of painting and accessories, general HVAC/plumbing knowledge, and the ability to handle multiple jobs in an organized fashion. In order to be considered for this position, candidates must possess a means of travelling between properties throughout the day.

 

Please note that applications from all interested individuals are appreciated; however, we will only contact candidates that are selected for an interview.

 

CAPREIT values diversity in the workforce and is an equal opportunity employer. 

CAPREIT welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Night Maintenance Associate (FT)
description:
Do you love hospitality? Love to meet and interact with fun and diverse people? Love to work in a friendly environment? If so, come be a part of our Boulevard Club family.

We take pride in providing safe and inclusive communities;
that inspire wellness, growth, and excellence.
We create exceptional, social, athletic, and recreational
environments; celebrating memorable experiences
and positive connections.

For over a century, The Boulevard Club has built a reputation around time honoured traditions, exemplary service, and unrivalled athletics programs for all ages and abilities, including tennis, badminton, water sports, fitness, swimming, basketball, pickleball, and more.

We pride ourselves on creating an exceptional Member experience thanks to an equally diverse and inclusive team. We know that our team members are vital to the success of the Club, which is why we hire well and enjoy developing and rewarding our team.

If you would like to work and learn from a team of professionals and build your career at one of Toronto’s top private clubs, The Boulevard Club may be a good fit.

As an employee of The Boulevard Club, you will enjoy a high quality pleasant working environment and the following benefits:

  • Education & Professional Development Assistance
  • Employee Health & Wellness Program
  • Extensive medical and dental benefits for Employees and their families
  • Summer and Holiday Bonus (eligibility criteria applies)
  • Meal Plan
  • Bike Share TO
  • Night Transportation Assistance
  • Summer Recognition Program
  • Complimentary Parking (subject to availability)

Job Overview

Reporting to the Facilities Manager and Night Supervisor, this person will perform tennis court maintenance and repairs as well as will ensure the Club property and equipment are maintained in good working order and well presented for the benefit of Members and Staff. Specific duties would include, but are not limited to:

  • Maintains tennis courts (including watering, dragging, sweeping, rolling, court amenities, etc.) and grounds within and around the tennis courts, including the tennis patio (cleaning, tidying, set up/take down of the patio).
  • Monitors air temperatures and pressure readings of the tennis bubbles and takes immediate action to correct incorrect conditions.
  • Performs nightly walk rounds within the Club’s property.
  • Clears snow from doorways, walkways, around structures and applies salt/ice melter product to outdoor surfaces as required.
  • Performs general cleaning tasks such as windows, spider webs, doors, handles, etc. as required.
  • Provides support (physical and/or skilled labour) to other departments as directed.

Job Qualifications

  • Related post-secondary education and/or skills and experience
  • Awareness of health and safety
  • Private Club industry experience an asset
  • Ability to speak, read and write English
  • Pleasant personality appropriate for a hospitality environment

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

The Boulevard Club is an inclusive work environment and as such, has a workplace accommodation policy in place. Accommodations are available, upon request, for the interview process and other selection stages for job applicants with accessibility needs. Please contact Human Resources to discuss further.



About boulevardclub.com:

The Boulevard Club is a family-oriented waterfront community that embraces caring, friendly individuals in an environment that celebrates diversity, respect and teamwork.Our Workplace Values are: Caring, Creativity, Diversity, Friendliness, Fun, Integrity, Respect and Teamwork.

title: Concierge
description:
Description

Appartenir à Air Canada, c’est appartenir à un symbole canadien, Air Canada récemment élue meilleur transporteur aérien en Amérique du Nord. Faites décoller votre carrière en vous joignant à notre équipe novatrice et diversifiée à l’avant-garde du transport aérien de passagers. 
 
Le poste se situe près de l'Aéroport international Pearson de Toronto.
 
Un emploi permanent à temps plein est de 40 heures par semaine et un emploi permanent à temps partiel peut être programmé pour un minimum de 20 heures et un maximum de 32 heures par semaine. Le salaire actuel est de 16,56$ l'heure, conformément à la convention collective.

Résumé des fonctions
  • La principale fonction d'un agent du Service Concierge à Air Canada consiste à permettre à nos clients à forte valeur de vivre une expérience des plus agréables à l'aéroport.
  • Ce rôle englobe tous les points essentiels du service offert aux clients à forte valeur, comme l'enregistrement, les salons Feuille d'érable et les services personnels traditionnels.
  • Le poste s'inspire du service de conciergerie d'un hôtel cinq étoiles.
  • Les tâches qui seront confiées au titulaire du poste varieront d'un jour à l'autre, selon les divers besoins de nos clients à forte valeur de statut supérieur.
  • Un agent du Service Concierge se montre toujours serviable, donne toujours suite à une demande et adopte toujours la bonne attitude. L'agent du Service Concierge veille au confort de nos clients à forte valeur et les traite avec tous les égards voulus, simplement en faisant tout le nécessaire pour eux.
Activités principales de l'agent du Service Concierge
  • Relever et examiner les réservations des clients de statut supérieur et de Classe affaires internationale, avant le départ ou l'arrivée de leur vol, pour s'assurer que toutes leurs demandes de services spéciaux ont été traitées.
  • Assurer la parfaite continuité des services pendant tout le voyage en communiquant par le réseau mondial des agents du Service Concierge d'Air Canada.
  • Accueillir et aider tous les clients à forte valeur ou de prestige.
  • Apporter son aide aux clients qui ont des besoins spéciaux.
  • Faire le suivi des correspondances et prendre des mesures proactives pour modifier les réservations, au besoin.
  • Collaborer étroitement avec le service de réservations Air Canada Super Élite et les Relations clientèle pour répondre aux besoins des clients Air Canada Super Élite et régler les manquements au service.
  • Tenir à jour la bibliothèque de documents de référence des agents du Service Concierge et le registre quotidien.
  • Établir un réseau de spécialistes et de ressources pouvant contribuer à répondre aux diverses demandes de nos clients de statut supérieur.

Qualifications

Les candidats doivent avoir le droit de travailler dans le pays choisi au moment où un emploi leur est offert. Il incombe entièrement aux employés posant leur candidature d’obtenir les permis de travail, les visas ou toutes autres autorisations requises pour le poste.
 
Technique :
  • La connaissance et l'expérience en tant qu'agent de vente et de service à la clientèle d'un aéroport seraient considérées comme un atout.
  • Une connaissance supérieure de l'information sur les services des compagnies aériennes et des procédures aéroportuaires serait considérée comme un atout.
  • Connaissance approfondie des attractions, événements, hôtels, restaurants et services de la ville.
  • Une expérience de la billetterie serait considérée comme un atout.
Comportemental :
  • Vaccination contre la COVID-19 requise 
  • Excellentes compétences en matière de service à la clientèle.
  • Forte volonté de dépasser constamment les attentes des clients tout en offrant un service personnalisé.
  • Attitude proactive et responsable dans la résolution de problèmes avec des solutions créatives.
  • Bon sens du jugement pour trouver un équilibre entre les intérêts des clients et la politique de l'entreprise.
  • Compétences supérieures en matière de leadership et de relations humaines, avec une capacité avérée à travailler en équipe.
  • Motivé(e) et capable de travailler sous pression tout en gérant plusieurs tâches en même temps.
  • Toilette impeccable, excellent sens de l'organisation, grand souci du détail.
  • Excellente fiche de présence.
  • Volonté et capacité de travailler en équipe.
Exigences linguistiques
  • Ce poste exige une bonne maîtrise de la langue.  La priorité sera accordée aux candidats maîtrisant parfaitement l'anglais et le français.
  • Les candidats parlant couramment l'anglais, le français et une ou plusieurs des langues suivantes seront également considérés : Japonais, coréen, cantonais, mandarin, espagnol, italien, allemand, arabe, hébreu, portugais ou grec.
Diversité et inclusion
 
Air Canada est fermement engagée à l'égard de la diversité et de l'inclusion et vise à créer un milieu de travail sain, accessible et enrichissant qui met en valeur les contributions uniques des employés au succès de notre entreprise.
 
En tant qu'employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi, nous accueillons les candidatures de tous pour nous aider à constituer un effectif diversifié qui reflète la diversité de nos clients et des collectivités dans lesquelles nous vivons et que nous servons.
 
Air Canada remercie tous les candidats de leur intérêt ; toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les personnes sélectionnées pour poursuivre le processus.
skills: ["Ce poste exige une bonne maîtrise de la langue. \xa0La priorité sera accordée aux candidats maîtrisant parfaitement l'anglais et le français.", 'Attitude proactive et responsable dans la résolution de problèmes avec des solutions créatives.']

title: Landscape Foreman / Supervisor
description:
Description:
Are you a Landscape Supervisor looking for a permanent, full-time position in a respectful work environment? We’ve got the perfect role for you!
Agilus is recruiting for a Landscape Foreman/Supervisor in the construction industry in Vancouver, British Columbia.
Our environmentally conscious client is looking for a Landscape Foreman to join their team. This is a full-time permanent role, Monday to Friday, 8 hours a day. We are looking for a individual who is a team player and who works with integrity. There are also plenty of opportunities for career growth.
Duties:
  • Lead and support the team
  • Build to completion various precast concrete retaining walls and paving stone applications
  • Finish hard and soft landscaping installation
  • Fill out daily form to record progress

Successful candidates will have:
  • Minimum 2 years in a foreman/supervisor role working in commercial construction
  • Experience independently working hardscaping, pavers, and retaining wall systems
  • Planted trees, sod and fine grading
  • Ability to read landscape construction drawings
  • Class 5 Driver’s License

What's in it for you:
  • Wage: $30-$40/hr depending on experience
  • Overtime pay available
  • Permanent role, Monday-Friday, 9am-5pm
  • Benefits and wellness program
  • Opportunities for personal development and career growth
  • On site parking and company events
  • Be a part of a company that values their employees and the community

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email mdhaliwal@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.

We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

title: Landscape Construction Crew Member
description:
Green Collar Landscaping is a well-established company located in Hamilton. Our team has been providing top quality services in maintenance and landscape construction for our residential and commercial clients since 2009. We are currently searching for motivated, reliable, punctual, and courteous individuals to join our team. The applicants must be willing to work full-time; five days a week.

 

Crew Member:

  • Assist in the construction of retaining walls, paver/slab installations, grading, etc..
  • Carrying stones, lumber & pushing wheelbarrows
  • Operation, maintenance and transport of various landscaping equipment: concrete saws, plate compactor, drills and various hand tools
  • Maintaining/cleaning of work trucks and tools/equipment
  • Properly care for tools/equipment on job site to avoid loss or misuse

 

Qualifications: Previous experience with landscaping/construction & valid G license an asset.

 

What We Will Provide:

  • Uniform and PPE provided
  • Training – both on the job and personal development
  • Health Benefits package after three months
  • Profit Sharing
  • Paid Stat Holidays
  • Incentive Programs
  • Boot Allowance
  • Team Building and Company events
  • Seasonal and Full-Time employment options

title: Landscape Construction Crew Member
description:
SERVICE WORLD-CLASS CLIENTS AND SUPPORT A ROCK STAR TEAM!

Soares Landscaping is a family-owned and operated business that offers a white-glove service for landscape design & construction. Founded in 2006, we are known for our customer experience and quality backed by our industry-leading warranties. Our goal is to provide the best customer experience, paired with the highest quality installs.

Benefits of Working with Soares Landscaping:

  • Profit-Sharing & Performance Bonuses
  • Health Spending Account
  • Industry Training & Education Reimbursement
  • Lastest Tools & Equipment
  • Regular Lunches & Annual Appreciation BBQ
  • Statutory Holidays Off
  • Build Projects That Change Lives And Better The Community!

Position: 

  • Landscape Construction Crew Member

Responsibilities:

  • Communication:
    • Communicate with the Crew Leader to brainstorm changes or issues that need to be resolved
    • Fosters an enthusiastic, creative, "can do" attitude and shares the responsibility for the success of the Company in reaching its goals
  • Installation:
    • Complete installations that match the design and/or are modified to still provide the design intent that our projects are known for
    • Aim to complete an installation exceptionally well the first time, to the highest standards possible
    • Operate all types of equipment and machines required to complete installations
  • Fleet & Safety:
    • Provide essential equipment maintenance and provide records to the office
    • Encourage a safe work environment for yourself and your colleagues
  • Other duties may be assigned

Qualifications:

  • Industry certifications preferred - Formal & On-The-Job Training available!
  • Must own a reliable vehicle
  • Must have a G2 driver's license or higher
  • Must have a clean driver's abstract

Skills:

  • Strong oral communication skills
  • A passion for building & creating
  • Punctual and reliable
  • Proficient learner and follow direction well
  • Willing to get dirty!

Our Commitment: 

Soares Landscaping is committed to honouring people's rights and freedoms. Please let us know if you need accommodations in your application, and we'll work with you to meet those needs.

title: Maintenance
description:
Company Description

We are more than just your local restaurant. We are a collection of hardworking small-business owners.

Did you know that from coast to coast, we serve delicious choices to more than 2.5 million people in over 1,400 locations every day, or that we have proudly helped more than 387,000 Canadian families with sick children through Ronald McDonald House Charities?

 

Job Description

Our offer

Working with us means that you will have the opportunity to earn and learn, flexibility, and a safe and inclusive work environment. What this means in practice is:

·       Access to education and skills development opportunities that take you further

·       A total rewards package that includes discounts, incentives, and recognition perks

·       Flexible hours/shifts that suit your needs

·       A safe, respectful and inclusive workplace

·       Bring your authentic self to work – welcoming people of every age, background, and culture – just like the guests who visit our restaurants every day

The job

We are sure that you have an idea about what working with us is like, but just in case here are some of the highlights on what your job will entail:

·       Maintaining a clean, safe, and secure work environment for guests, coworkers, and yourself, leveraging your knowledge of safety regulations and equipment.

·       Multi-tasking in between troubleshooting, tending to store areas and appliances during your shift, and repairing décor and equipment, whether it’s during the day or throughout the night.

·       Managing priorities, staying organized, and keeping on top of the various tasks with limited supervision.

Your vibe and experience

You are trustworthy and have trust in others. You’re a curious mind. You love to see how things work and are fascinated by the intricacies of objects. You’re good with your hands and mechanically adept. You’re always willing to learn and grow. You remain cool, calm and collected in a fast-paced environment. You’d rather do a job right the first time, than do it twice.

Additional Information

About us

In 1954, an enterprising salesman named Ray Kroc discovered a small burger restaurant in California, and wrote the first page of McDonald’s history. In 1967, the first McDonald’s Canada opened in Richmond, B.C. and we’ve been growing with our communities and serving quality food at great a value ever since. Today, McDonald’s Canada is proud to be one of the world’s leading foodservice retailers, offering job opportunities at corporate-owned restaurants or restaurants owned by independent franchisees.

McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Landscape Crew Lead - Labourer
description:
About Us...

Cobble Beach Golf Links is located in Kemble ON, which is 10 minutes north of Owen Sound. We are a community based, award winning, four-season resort that includes an 18 hole championship golf course, several communal amenities, dozens of homes and condominiums and a growing population. It’s an exciting time within the community as the second phase of residential construction is underway. The addition of homes and members will continue to boast the Cobble Beach club experience. The Turf Department responsibilities extend into various aspects of the property. The maintenance of the golf course, home lawns, communal and personal gardens, tennis courts, an industrial dock, a year round trail system, a beach club and winter snow removal. The department is branching out into a landscape division and we are looking for individuals to help grow the department and Cobble Beach. This is an excellent opportunity to learn hard/soft landscaping and maintenance from an experienced landscaper.

Job Description:  LANDSCAPE CREW LEAD-LABOURER

Under the supervision the Assistant Property Manager (APM) and the Golf Course Superintendent (GCS) the successful candidate will:

  • Work as a part of a dynamic team of skilled landscapers installing high end quality landscapes for residential resort properties. As a part of the Landscape Construction Crew, you will be responsible for assisting with a variety of tasks related to hard and soft landscaping.
  • Work as part of the Landscape Construction team on resident’s homes, new builds and property lands to the standards of the Cobble Beach Landscape Department.
  • Perform any other work related duties required on the Cobble Beach property and/or the golf course as directed by management.

Requirements:

  • First and foremost; a positive attitude, open mind and strong work ethic.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, physically demanding work environment.
  • Ability to work independently and with others.
  • Prior knowledge or education in horticultural is an asset but not required.
  • Must be willing to work in all reasonable types of weather.
  • Must be willing to work some weekends.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Follow direction from the APM/Crew Lead and efficiently carry out tasks such as:
  • Site preparation (demo, layout, excavation etc.)
  • Hard Landscaping (retaining walls, interlock/natural stone - driveways, patios, porches & walkways etc.)
  • Soft Landscaping (planting, mulching, sodding etc.)
  • Operate various tools and equipment, including: plate tampers, laser levels, measurement equipment, shovels, rakes, hammers, drills etc.
  • Perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment by conducting inspections, lubricating, and cleaning on a daily basis.
  • Assist with loading and unloading of materials, tools, and equipment required to complete projects.
  • Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) at all times and comply with all company policies, procedures and regulations. Work in accordance with all local health and safety laws and regulations.
  • Assist in daily record keeping and work orders.
  • Assist in shop organization and cleanliness.

Qualifications:

  • Preference will be given to candidates with previous landscaping and/or construction experience.
  • Experience operating small equipment an asset ( mini ex/skid steer)
  • Valid G class driver’s license; May be driving a company vehicle on site.
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints and specifications an asset
  • Knowledge of specific materials, methods, tools and equipment required to complete various landscape/construction practices.
  • Ability to work both independently with little supervision and as part of the Landscape Construction team.
  • Ability to walk, stand, crouch for long periods of time and carry out strenuous physical tasks
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs. repeatedly through an entire work shift.

Personal Attributes:

  • Punctual, responsible and dependable.
  • Come to work attentive, ready to learn and work hard.
  • Customer and quality focus.
  • Effective communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Works well in a team setting and individually.
  • Excellent problem solving abilities.
  • Ethics and integrity.
  • Takes initiative.
  • Demonstrate continuous growth through personal goal achievement.

Schedule:

  • Monday through Friday, 7:00am-4:30pm
  • Weekend work when required.
  • Season typically runs from mid March to mid December

Compensation:

  • Hourly rate ranges from $16.00 -$21.00

Contact Us:

  • Check out our website:www.cobblebeach.com

title: Yard Crew (8:00-13:00)
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Job Summary
This position is responsible for cleaning trailers, performing yard check, and yard inventory. The employee may utilize heavy machinery to complete tasks. This position performs other tasks as assigned in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:

Qualifications:

  • Ability to lift up to 70 lbs./32 kgs.
  • Ability to read and write.
  • Use of Excel
  • Availability to work flexible shift hours, up to 5 days per week

title: Hiring Team members for Grounds maintenance
description:
We began with a single vision shared between 10 brothers. Originally, we opened our doors as Sunshine Grounds Care in 1987. As time passed and more brothers joined in the project, it became a widely recognized brand built on the principles of excellent workmanship, customer satisfaction, and real care. We abide by the simple values outlined in our company acronym "C.A.R.E.", which are: Customers first, Attitude, Respect, and Enjoy life in the process!

As Team Leader, you are responsible for managing a team up to 6 people while performing the delivery of services. Our clients trust to us to provide quality services and you are key in helping us live out our values every day.

You are a proactive leader and self-starter who can interact with the public and our employees. You have a strong work ethic and are able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines. You have experience in landscaping and previous supervisory experience, as well as proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Manage team of up to 6 people while performing services; motivate, coach, and mentor team
  • Perform landscape maintenance duties, such as mowing, fertilizer application, weed control, aeration, spring clean-up, fall clean-up, trimming, and pruning
  • Operate a variety of mechanical equipment including but not limited to bed edgers, commercial mowers, blowers, dump trailers, chainsaws, line trimmers, and tillers
  • Perform landscape enhancement activities such as mulch application, plantings, top soil application, lawn seeding
  • Address clients' questions, comments, and concerns
  • Prepare daily team performance reports
  • Assist with employee recruiting and selection
Job Requirements:

  • Current and unrestricted Driver's license with a clean record
  • One year experience in this or a related field is required
  • Previous leadership experience
  • Willingness to learn
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds to waist level and perform all other physical requirements associated with a position of this nature
Benefits: Benefits package varies by location

We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow up!

Notice

The Grounds Guys LLC is the franchisor of the The Grounds Guys® franchised system. Each The Grounds Guys® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, The Grounds Guys LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. The Grounds Guys LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent The Grounds Guys® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither The Grounds Guys LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. The Grounds Guys LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Yard Hand - Seasonal
description:
Burlington Garden Supplies is looking for a motivated individual with machine experience for a seasonal part time position.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Loading vehicles and assisting customers.
  • Organizing product and raw material.
  • Basic machinery maintenance and assuring all equipment is in good working order.
  • Maintaining the yard and keeping it clean and tidy.
  • Occasional deliveries of product

 

Qualifications:

  • Operation of Frontend Loader experience an asset, but not required.
  • Team player and excellent communication skills.
  • Excellent customer service skills.
  • Ability to lift up to 40 lbs. when needed.
  • Willingness to work Saturdays on a regular basis
  • Valid class G Driver’s license with a clean driver’s abstract

 

To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter to

info@millgrovegardensupplies.com

or fax to: 905.689.9760

title: Landscape Maintenance Specialist (25$+/hour)
description:
Company Description

Consider joining a team that is focused and dedicated to excellence. Techo-Bloc is a two-time award winner for best managed company.  A distinction that reflects its ability to honor the progress of its people! 

We are a successful, entrepreneurial, growth-oriented, and fast-paced manufacturer producing paving stones and retaining walls that inspires artscapes across North America.  We build teams that ensure our products are functional, durable, and astonishingly beautiful. 
 
With soon to be 9 manufacturing facilities (and counting), 30 international patents and over 800 employees, we operate in an exciting and dynamic environment. As we continue to expand, our team members are offered opportunities to professionally develop, learn new abilities and pursue projects that excite them. 

If you want to work for a company that listens and is dedicated to your progress this may be your next career move! 

Why work with us

We love to brag. Techo Bloc offers its valued employees a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package. Here are a few of our perks:

  • Leaders who are invested in your success;
  • Have a dynamic job and evolving career path;
  • Develop your skills and grow;
  • Competitive salary Annual bonus;
  • RRSP Program available in 2022;
  • Epic barbecues and Christmas parties;
  • Snack filled kitchens;
  • Free parking;
  • Considerable referral bonuses;
  • Employee discounts on Techo-Bloc’s products;
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP available 24/7).
Job Description

Under the responsibility of the After-Sales Support Manager, the Hardscape Field Service Crew Specialist will be responsible for traveling to different customers, occasionally requiring overnight travel, to carry out minor hardscape installations, cleaning, and repairs. 

Key responsibilities include:

  • Provide after sales service and merchandising;Provide hardscape cleaning, repairs, and landscape installation services as assigned; 
  • Provide documentation or pictures as required to Client Support Coordinator to close projects; 
  • Replenish Dealer network with marketing collateral: Spec guides, catalogues, brochures;
  • Be a brand ambassador ensuring Techo-Bloc’s brand consistency and customer service is excellence.
Qualifications

  • 2 years’ experience in landscape (installation of pavers and walls, cleaning experience is a plus);  
  • Experience with handheld concrete saws;
  • Hold a valid driver's license; a safe driving record and provide an up to date copy; 
  • Ability to drive a trailer (Truck, trailer and work equipment will be provided);
  • Be able to lift 50lbs;
  • On occasion be able to work on knees for extended periods of time;
  • Be able to work outdoors and indoors; 
  • Be able to work independently;
  • Adopt a safe behavior at work;
  • On occasion overnight travel is required. 


Additional Information

Your contribution is very precious to us, just like the stones we produce. Techo-Bloc foster a culture of innovation where each individual brings a special touch to his field of expertise. The company is growing, your ideas and your talents are required to contribute to the development of the prestigious brand image that Techo-Bloc has developed over the years.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
Company mission is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

We are seeking a full-time skilled building maintenance worker to support the Facilities team. The successful candidate will be accountable for, but not limited to overseeing and completing scheduled maintenance and emergency (after hours) repairs to building systems, response times of service requests, shipping and receiving, light repairs, grounds and equipment for appearance and safety.
We are looking for someone who can work on their own initiative, take responsibility, and represent the Facilities team following company standards with our goal of operational excellence and continual improvement in mind.

You Are Great At:
General Building Maintenance:
  • Conducts daily routine inspections of premises, equipment, and grounds
  • Completes daily visual inspections of building operating systems for proactive maintenance
  • Monitors work performed by 3rd party contractors, contact vendors and suppliers to obtain quotes and arranges for major repairs and maintenance work
  • Works with Facility Manager to establish, monitor and carry out preventative maintenance procedures and schedules
  • Ensures building and grounds meet all safety, security, and fire regulations according to policies and procedures
Maintains building maintenance manual for building operations

General Labour:
  • Performs general repairs that do not require a specialized technician. Examples may include carpentry, electrical, painting, mechanical and plumbing, maintenance, and repairs such as adjusting furniture, constructing shelves, basic appliance repairs, applying paint and other finishes, repairing drywall
  • Cleans external areas such as entranceways, sidewalks and parking lot stairwells using power washer, brooms, rakes, shovels, and other equipment to remove dirt, leaves, snow and other refuse.
  • Moving of equipment, furniture and supplies manually and/or using aides such as pump trucks, dollies, and carts
  • Manages the receipt of all products, materials, and supplies
  • Arrange furniture for special event set ups
  • Assist with minor MAC (Moves, Adds, & Changes) requests i.e. employee moves
  • Ensuring all your workspaces are kept organized, clean and safe
  • Orders and pick up supplies when necessary
  • All tools, equipment, and uniform to be supplied

What It Takes:
  • Basic knowledge of HVAC, and Building Automation Systems (BAS), on the job training offered
  • Basic knowledge of plumbing and electrical systems
  • Basic knowledge of mechanical systems
  • Basic computer skills, (ticketing system, outlook, office suite)
  • Skilled with various hand and power tools
  • Ability to prioritize tasks
  • Ability to read technical manuals and drawings
  • Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of employees, vendors, and suppliers
  • Ability to respond quickly for emergencies (leaks/heating etc.) outside of normal business hours
  • Prolonged periods standing and walking
  • Must be physically able to climb ladders, bend, or crawl into awkward spaces
  • Must be able to lift up to 40-50 pounds at a time
  • Have an eye for detail and strong time management skills
  • You will be well presented, and have an outgoing personality
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Minimum 4+ years of maintenance experience
  • Experience working in a corporate environment an asset
  • Valid driver’s license and vehicle required

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
Black & McDonald's Saskatchewan team is growing! If you are a hands-on, customer service-oriented, and technically-inclined professional searching for the opportunity to build a solid foundation for your career, this position is for you. The Maintenance Worker is located in Regina & 15 Wing Moose Jaw and reports directly to the Project Manager.

The Maintenance Worker is responsible for facility general maintenance and repairs, minor carpentry, drywall repair and painting, preventative maintenance, and assisting other trades.

  • Prepare areas for painting by repairing & patching surfaces.
  • Perform various duties to maintain the Facility including work associated with carpentry, furniture, drywall, painting, mechanical & plumbing repairs.
  • Assist with obtaining quotes, meet with sub-contractors and quote work.
  • Provide repairs and preventative maintenance to locks, doors & door closing systems.
  • Responsible for replacing locks, hinges, changing cores and adjusting door closers.
  • Assist other maintenance trades and perform other duties, e.g. changing filters or fan belts, preparing HVAC & plumbing systems for operation or winterization.
  • Assist in grounds keeping and snow removal
  • Performs daily rounds and log readings.
  • Complete maintenance records and work orders; input histories and comments as required.
  • Observe and implement safety regulations and practices.
  • Maintain the cleanliness of all sites, workspaces, and mechanical rooms.

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Holds Self and Others Accountable
  • Teamwork and Collaboration
  • Values and Respects Others
  • Change Orientation
  • Continuous Learning
  • Customer Focus
  • Problem Solving & Innovation
  • Working Knowledge of Email Platforms & Calendars

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • A minimum of 3 years' experience in all aspects of facility maintenance.

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Basic general maintenance knowledge and experience.
  • Knowledge of the Health and Safety Act and all applicable CSA Codes.
  • Must be able to speak, read & write in English.
  • Must work in compliance with the provisions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and the regulations including but not limited to: use or wear of equipment or protective devices or clothing for safety purposes, report any known contravention of this Act or regulations or the existence of any hazards.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills required.
  • Follow instructions both written and verbal.
  • Maintain a professional demeanor at all times with fellow employees and customer.
  • Maintain clear and courteous phone etiquette.
  • A team player, committed to working in a quality environment. 
  • Comply with all company policies and procedures and adhere to company standards.
  • Act in accordance with the commitment to safe and compassionate patient care and a safe and healthy work environment.
  • Must be able to lift up to 30 kg (bending and lifting is required).
  • Must be able to work on ladder or scaffold at various heights.
  • Must be able to pass Federal Security Clearance to work on military facilities.
  • Must provide proof of double vaccination to meet Covid protocols.

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Maintenance Grounds Assistant (FT)
description:
REQUIREMENTS OF AN ASSISTANT MAINTENANCE/GROUNDSKEEPER PERSON:
  • Must be available to work a 5-day week with occasional overtime
  • Follow all Workplace Health & Safety guidelines with respect to the operation of equipment as well as all COVID-19 precautionary measures.
  • Enjoy working with other team members and guests while promoting a positive, professional attitude with all.
  • Enjoy performing physical work outdoors in a variety of temperatures and weather conditions.
  • Possess or have the willingness to obtain training such as Workplace Health & Safety Awareness and WHMIS.
  • Ensure the resort and its facilities are kept safe, clean and in good operating condition by performing general maintenance and minor repairs to buildings, grounds and equipment as required.
  • Must be comfortable using a variety of tools and equipment.
  • Must be able to understand and follow verbal and written communications with minimal supervision.
  • Have reliable transportation to and from work.
  • Have a G1 driver's license and meet insurance requirements.
  • Proof of two (2) Covid-19 Vaccines.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Watering and caring for plants and lawns, continuously monitoring beach and accommodation areas for cleanliness as well as safety concerns, removal of trash and recycling from bines and other receptacles daily.
  • Painting, staining, minor repairs, and other related functions that promote a clean, safe, and enjoyable environment for our guests and visitors.
  • Racking/blowing leaves, removal of branches and twigs as well as any other assorted debris from the property.
  • Assist with seasonal preparations of resort amenities such as swimming pool, hot tub, canoes, boats, waterfront toys and patio furniture.
  • Perform snow removal using shovels and snowblower, application of sand/ice melt materials to walkways, ramps, stairs, etc.
  • Assist other team members with repairs and/or periodic maintenance in their areas.


About Patterson Kaye Resort:

Our resort is in the heart of cottage country, Muskoka, Ontario. We offer relaxed cottage rentals from 2-12 person occupancy, a wide variety of 24 units, studios to fully equipped cottages. Our restaurant on site is kept busy year round with a variety of events and celebrations from weddings to business meetings. As well as a variety of seasonal amenities and activities.We are looking to employ multiple full and part time positions year round and can cross train if you are interested in multiple departments. We are also willing to fully train persons interested in entering the hospitality industry who have an enthusiastic, hard working personality and work well in a team.

title: Crew Leader/Foreperson - Grounds Maintenance
description:
GROUNDS MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR


Reports to:  Owner, Division Supervisor, Operations Manager 


Summary: 
The Grounds Maintenance Supervisor is responsible for performing a variety of work tasks in order to manage the timely completion of grounds maintenance service contracts. The grounds maintenance foreperson will be required to supervise a crew of laborers and operate a variety of tools and equipment to carry out specified job tasks, as well provide daily progress reporting on job time and cost data. 

Core Capabilities:   

  • Customer and quality focus 
  • Effective communication skills (both verbal and written) 
  • Teamwork 
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities  
  • Responsibility and dependability 
  • Ethics and integrity 
  • Ability to use LMN via a smartphone

Job Duties: 

  • Plan and manage the loading/unloading of trucks and trailers in the AM and PM including all daily labor, equipment and materials required to complete daily objectives 
  • Cut grass, trim edges, clean up refuse, blow trimmings, fertilize and water turf areas and perform other lawn care duties  
  • Move and install soil, mulch and plant material to assist with the construction of landscape gardens and related areas 
  • Spray and dust areas to control insects and or weeds 
  • Operate power equipment including, but not limited to, lawn tractors, lawn mowers, line trimmers, blowers, hedge trimmers, pruning saws, sod cutters, chain saws, and snow blowers 
  • Supervise the work of crew members to ensure proper safety, quality, and productivity 
  • Inspect all work for quality to eliminate the need for return visits and/or re-work due to quality or customer satisfaction issues 
  • Train crew members on proper and safe job methods 
  • Conduct daily inspections and maintenance on vehicles, tools, and equipment 
  • Assist in other job-related duties including construction projects, shop and yard maintenance, vehicle and equipment maintenance 
  • Complete and submit all required paperwork on a daily basis, including, daily time and service record forms, equipment daily inspection forms, attendance tracking, requests for time off, etc.  
  • Maintain and enforce standards of cleanliness and organization in assigned trucks, trailers, equipment, jobsites, and shop/yard areas 
  • Ensure that all work activities are carried out in a safe and efficient manner, and that all crew members are compliance with government and company PPE standards  
  • Comply with all company policies and regulations 
  • Work in accordance with all local health and safety laws and regulations 
  • Communicate with customers in a polite and courteous manner 

Requirements: 

  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent  
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in the landscape/grounds maintenance industry 
  • Capable of operating required equipment and tools in a safe and responsible manner 
  • Effective communication skills – must be able to carry out verbal instructions, read labels and signs, complete daily reports to office and/or customers 
  • Time management skills 
  • Knowledge of specific materials, methods, tools and equipment required to complete various landscape/construction practices 
  • Ability to work both independently with little supervision, and as part of a team 
  • Ability to walk, stand, crouch for long periods of time and carry out strenuous physical tasks 
  • Valid driver’s license and safe driving record 

Work Conditions: 

  • Ability to work with hand tools, power tools, small engine equipment, and materials 
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs. repeatedly through an entire work shift 
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment 
  • Requires good manual dexterity 
  • Excellent stamina is required 
  • Work near heavy equipment and other vehicles on a regular basis  
  • Work outdoors in various conditions including heat and humidity, rain, dust, noise, and cold  
  • Flexible working hours including occasional weekend work 

Rate of Pay & Benefits: 

  • Rate of pay is $20-24/hr. Paid according to experience 
  • Benefits and RSP matching are available for the right candidates 
  • Winter work for those that would like to work with our snowplowing division.
