title: Landscape Construction Crew Member
description: Responsible for ensuring projects are completed on time and on budget whilst maintaining a safe work environment. Main duties are to direct, plan and coordinate daily work activities for workers. In larger operations this is done through crew leaders/forepersons; and in smaller operations personally directs workers who perform tasks in ground maintenance, landscape construction, greenhouse or nursery operations. Often the supervisor, in smaller operations, will work hands-on as well as overseeing the workers. Also in smaller operations, where there is no manager, may be involved in presenting and selling landscape installations, maintenance projects and services, plants, shrubbery, trees, etc. to customers.

title: Lawn Care & Irrigation Technician
description: Contributor to improving the environment by helping homeowners create  healthy lawns. Everyone loves a lawn expert, we will train and coach you to become the person that people rely on and trust to have a lawn they can be proud of through lawn care and irrigation services.

title: Landscape Crew Member
description:
Spec Plus Inc. is always seeking talented individuals who are looking to build a career with our fast growing company.   In business for 6 years, we are landscape professionals serving the GTA, specializing in landscape design, consultation and installation of both residential and commercial developments.  We also offer summer lawn care and winter maintenance services.  

We are currently seeking a Landscape Crew Member to join our team to assist in providing services in professional landscape installation and garden  maintenance with a focus on creating and maintaining beautifully landscaped properties to meet clients unique needs.

 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Under the direction of the crew leader, assist in performing all landscaping installations and garden maintenance related duties
  • Property maintenance – cultivating, weeding, fertilizing, perennial care, pruning
  • Load truck and trailer
  • Plant trees, shrubs, perennials, and annuals
  • Build softscapes and gardens
  • Learn and expand knowledge of landscape maintenance and garden installation
  • Able and willing to work outside in various types of summer weather conditions
  • Perform other duties as may be assigned

 

 SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum College Diploma/Certificate or enrolment in Horticulture or Landscape Design or related field and/or extensive proven industry experience will be considered.  
  • Knowledge of construction techniques and basic knowledge of horticulture and plants an asset 
  • Working knowledge of Windows OS software
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on customer service
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Ability to operate a variety of hand tools and equipment such as packers, chain saws, hedge shears, sod cutters, pruning saws, mowing equipment, etc. to complete landscape and garden projects 
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Valid G driver’s license required. D/AZ driver’s license is preferred with a clean driver’s abstract

 

Successful candidates will be required to meet the following criteria:

  • Personal transportation to and from the office/yard
  • Available Monday-Friday 8:00am-5:00pm
  • Willing to work extra hours during busy times
  • Eager to learn and expand skills
  • Adhere to company policies & procedures

 

 Compensation and Benefits:

  • $18 to $20 / hour based on experience
  • Paid statutory holidays
  • All uniforms and PPE paid for by company
  • Training and career development opportunities
  • Winter work available

 

Interested applicants kindly submit a resume and cover letter to hr@specplus.pro

title: Maintenance Worker 5
description:
Job Description:
Job Title: Maintenance Worker 5
Work Site: Plant Maintenance, Vancouver General Hospital
Status: Temporary Full Time
Start Date: As soon as possible
Salary: $26.22 per hour

Hours:

 

0730-1530, Monday to Friday

Days off: Saturday, Sunday, Statutory Holidays

Reference#: 159756-lba

 

Come work as a Maintenance Worker with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Maintenance Worker to join the Plant Maintenance team at Vancouver General Hospital. Apply today to join our team!

 

As a Maintenance Worker at Vancouver Coastal Health you will:

  • Perform trades duties approaching the journeyman level in a variety of tradesâ€™ areas such as electrical, mechanical, plumbing, carpentry, painting, and welding.
  • Perform maintenance and repair duties related to buildings and equipment and perform mechanical and electrical repairs to equipment and systems.
  • Participate on the Rapid Response Team and as a member of the Maintenance team.
  • You will assist other team members in their duties to ensure a timely and complete delivery of service to our clients.
  • Act in various capacities, supporting maintenance in general terms.
  • Act as a customer service advocate, accelerating the resolution of customer concerns.

This position may require inter-site work assignments, and working in a support role to trades personnel.

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Experience

  • Grade 10, plus four (4) yearsâ€™ recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Knowledge & Abilities

  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.

The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?


VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.

  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff

Diversity, equity and inclusion are essential to delivering exceptional care and building a great place to work. At VCH, we value and accommodate unique differences to ensure that our staff and medical staff (both current and prospective) have the opportunity and are supported to thrive.

To build a strong and representative workforce, we are seeking candidates who will contribute to a caring and inclusive culture. We encourage applications from members of communities that are disadvantaged on any grounds under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including Indigenous Peoples, people of colour, people of all genders and sexualities and people with disabilities.

VCH is proud to be recognized as a Best Place to Work in Canada in 2021 by Glassdoor and Forbes.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.


***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Landscape Gardener/Golf Course Greenskeeper
description:
General Labour/Golf Course Greenskeeper (Full Time, Seasonal)

Donalda Club is one of the finest multi-activity, family oriented private clubs in the country that strives to exceed our members expectations daily. In operation since 1960, Donalda Club has a longstanding history and has built a culture and environment for our members and their families to create lifelong memories. Similarly, our staff is part of that family culture, creating an ideal working environment alongside one of the most beautiful facilities in the city.?

The Position:

We are looking for Golf Course Greenskeepers for the Summer 2022 season. A successful candidate would be energetic, enthusiastic (loves golf!), has leadership and personal skills who can work independently and collaboratively with other team members.

As a member of the Donalda Grounds Team, you will work alongside the Golf Course Superintendent and his assistants for maintenance of the golf course to deliver the best possible playing conditions for the membership on a daily basis.

An Overview of Main Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Mowing and maintenance of greens, tees, fairways and rough
  • Raking and maintenance of sand traps
  • Raking and removal of leaves and other debris
  • Other turf duties as requested by grounds management team
  • Our goal is to provide our membership with a high-class golf experience daily. We strive to staff our turf maintenance team with talented people who share our level of enthusiasm.
  • Operation of light equipment such as hand-powered tools, riding mowers, tractors, etc.

Requirements:

  • Ability to work early mornings (5:30-6:00 A.M. start times)
  • Available to work the required weekends and holidays
  • Positive attitude and willingness to learn
  • Physically capable of completing required tasks
  • Valid driver’s license - G/G2 required
  • Previous landscaping experience (preferred, but not necessary)
  • Golf course experience an asset (but not necessary)
  • Must possess excellent customer service skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Detail-oriented and works with a high degree of accuracy
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
  • Must be extremely responsible with integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion

We are looking for motivated individuals who are available  full time  from April 2022-November 2022  (weather dependent) until the end of the golf season.

Employment with the Donalda Club will be conditional upon the successful candidate having received a COVID-19 vaccine series approved by Health Canada, at least 14 days prior to their start date. This requirement is subject to exemptions pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.

EXPECTED START DATE:  April (weather dependent)

Applicants who do not already have legal permission to work in Canada will not be considered.

Donalda Club is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations for disabilities will be provided to support participation in all aspects of the recruitment process.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Salary: $17.25 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
All staff will be provided the necessary PPE including face masks, hand sanitizer and equipment disinfectants. In addition, signage has been posted throughout the staff building and hand sanitizer has been provided at all entry points.

title: Roads and Grounds Operative II
description:
Position Description


Are you a self-starter always thinking of better ways to do things? Are you looking to be part of a dynamic team focused on providing top-quality services to customers? If yes, please keep reading! As a member of Serco’s dynamic team, your expertise and collaborative skills will make a positive impact towards our military defense and safety of our soldiers.


As the Royal Canadian Air Forces’ prime service provider at 5 Wing Goose Bay, Labrador, our team delivers comprehensive air operations, emergency services, logistics and engineering expertise to the Department of National Defence. We work on behalf of DND’s “no fail” mission at Goose Bay: supporting NORAD operations for the projection of air power on the north and northeast coasts of Canada, while supporting military training for the Canadian Armed Forces, Allies and NORAD. 5 Wing Goose Bay provides effective training facilities, adaptable infrastructures, and a unique, austere, and challenging training location. Currently, Serco Canada has over 1,200 employees across four provinces, including a strong and growing Indigenous workforce.


You will be part of a team that works closely with the military customer and other Serco teams to deliver quality and efficient services to DND. The Serco team has been recognized as one of Atlantic Canada’s Top Employers for 4 years in a row and received the prestigious Atlantic Canadian Aerospace and Defence Association. Industry Excellence Recognition Award for Gender and Diversity Excellence.


In this role, you will:


+ Garbage collection from PMQ's, Mess Hall, Trade Shops, and clean up grounds.

+ Perform snow removal in accordance with SNIC Plan.

+ Perform grass cutting in accordance with Grass Cutting Plan.

+ Perform landscape maintenance.

+ Assist with repairs to concrete and asphalt surfaces on the Airfield and on Domestic roads.

+ Repair/replace signage on Domestic roads and on the Airfield..

+ Lifting heavy materials/equipment in performance of duties.

+ Operating light vehicles as required with proper licensing.

+ Operate light vehicles such as 44 Passenger Buss, Taxi and Ambulance.

+ Operate specialized equipment such as ride-on lawn mowers, power saws, hedge trimmer, 60LB buster, farm tractor, bobcat loader, snow blower, JLG lift, forklift, turf sweeper, etc.

+ Operate communication equipment for Airfield & Domestic operations.

+ Responsible for recording time daily in TMA.

+ Other related duties relevant to this position as may be required.


Qualifications


To be successful in this role, you will have:


+ Some secondary school education.

+ Possession of a valid NL Driver’s License Class 5 is required (Class 2 and 4 with 9 Endorsement would be an asset).

+ Possession of or the ability to obtain and maintain a Ramp Defensive Driving Course (DND/RDDC) certification to operate vehicles on the airfield is required.

+ Ability to obtain and maintain an Enhanced Reliability security clearance is required. May be required to upgrade to Secret Level II (dependent upon customer’s security requirements).

+ Ability to obtain DND 404 to operate Government owned vehicles (CFR Plated Equipment).

+ Ability to successfully pass a pre-employment drug and alcohol screening test.


Hourly Rate : $25.29


Weekly Hours : 37.5


Serco has had a significant, stable presence in Canada for several decades - anchored in the defence space by our contract to provide comprehensive air navigation and base management services at 5 Wing Goose Bay, Labrador. If you are interested in supporting and working with our military and a passionate Serco team- then submit your application now for immediate consideration. It only takes a few minutes and could change your career!


Company Overview


Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. Federal civilian agencies, the Intelligence Community, the Canadian government, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, Serco Americas has over 9,000 employees and is part of a $4 billion global business that helps transform government and public services around the world. At Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset - we listen, respect and support them throughout their career at Serco. We invite you to become part of our dynamic team. Serco is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying our workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/ Vets).


To review Serco benefits please visit: https://www.serco.com/na/careers/benefits-of-choosing-serco .


If you require an accommodation with the application process please email: careers@serco-na.com or call the HR Service Desk at 800-628-6458, option 1. Please note, due to EEOC/OFCCP compliance, Serco is unable to accept resumes by email.


Serco does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies without being a contracted approved vendor. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Serco and will not be obligated to pay a placement or contract fee. If you are interested in becoming an approved vendor at Serco, please email Agencies@serco-na.com .


COVID-19 Regulations: Serco complies with all applicable COVID-19 requirements. This may require employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, provide attestations regarding vaccination status and/or COVID-19 testing, or satisfy other conditions of employment that Serco deems appropriate, and employees may be required to show proof of vaccination and/or negative COVID-19 test results as a condition of employment (except in limited circumstances where an employee is legally entitled to an accommodation).

title: General Landscape "Handy-Person"
description:
No experience necessary- we will train!

For more than a decade, Markstone Landscaping Ltd. has been the local leader in professional landscaping. The secret to our success? Our people.

We’re interested in talented people who are looking for a career, not just a job.

 If you have the right attitude and skills, we’re happy to train you in an area that best fits your interests and aptitude.

At Markstone, we value professional development and training as highly as we value camaraderie. We work hard, we play hard, and we take pride in our work.

Our team is always  on the lookout for exceptional talent.   

 

What we offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Benefits package
  • Training and development opportunities
  • Learn from the best - recently rated top 3 landscaping companies!

 

Job Requirements:

Work includes, but not limited to:

  • Reliable transportation to Burlington
  • Sealing Concrete (approximately 1 day a week)
  • Ensuring all warranty work is done and completed
  • Odd jobs around the yard and at client properties (i.e. damaged grass, railing, other damages)
  • Must be punctual, have a positive attitude and be willing to learn

 

To find out more about Markstone, visit our website at www.markstonelandscaping.com.

If this job interests you, we look forward to seeing your application!

title: Landscape Lead Hand (Hardscape)
description:
Muskoka/Georgian Bay

Rockscape is an award-winning design/build firm that specializes in high-end residential landscaping. We are an established firm with a solid reputation and we are looking for individuals to help us maintain that reputation as we enter the 2021 season.

Who do we need?

You! If you:

  • Have at least 2 years experience in the Landscape Industry
  • Want to be proud of your employer and the work that you do
  • Want to join a fun, dynamic team
  • Can work in a physically demanding occupation
  • Enjoy the possibility of boating to work
  • Willing to get your hands dirty

Why join Rockscape?

  • Winner of the 2020 Landscape Ontario Employer of Choice award
  • Challenging and unique projects
  • Well maintained tools, equipment and trucks
  • Benefits/RRSP matching for full-time staff after 1 full year

This position offers a variety of exciting career opportunities. We are creating new positions as we continue to grow. We are passionate about growing personally and professionally through education and also provide many opportunities to learn new skills.

Interested?

Got questions? Ask us anything!

Contract length: 7 months

Application deadline: 2022-02-28

Expected start date: 2022-04-18

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal

Salary: $24.00-$26.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: Outside Maintenance Worker
description:
This position, reporting directly to the company Property Manager, is responsible for the maintenance activities of land and buildings maintained by the company.

This is a very hands-on position that involves duties including tenant relations, maintenance and repair, security, janitorial services, landscaping, snow removal, garbage collection, etc.

The Outside Maintenance Worker is charged with carrying out the daily scheduled duty tasks as well as any unscheduled jobs that may come up, in a safe and environmental sound manner keeping in mind management's goals and objectives.

Full-time: Permanent
Career Level: Experienced
Compensation: $15 - $18 / hour

title: Yard Attendant
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

Bucks Auto Parts is a self-serve auto parts and vehicle recycling facility, if you have an aptitude for automobiles and/or suitable experience, a solid work ethic, a record of success, and great communication skills, we want to talk to you!

We are currently seeking a vehicle processor to work at the Buck Auto parts Calgary location operated by EVRAZ North America. Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Processor will be responsible for vehicle processing and draining appropriate fluids from cars, and removing good sets of rims. All processors rotate through pre-processing, processing (tanking), tire shop, and yard maintenance.

  • Prepare vehicles for processing by removing garbage, batteries, mercury switches

  • Drain appropriate automobile fluids (gasoline, antifreeze, etc.) to assist with the processing of vehicles

  • Remove automobile parts: the catalytic converter

  • Take off tires and remove valve stems and wheel weights from rims, stack and load tires and other parts into shipping containers

  • Complete yard maintenance and keep work area clean

  • Notify appropriate personnel of any procedural abnormalities

  • Assist with site maintenance (parts yard, production area, office and parking lot)

  • collect and remove all non-ferrous items from vehicles prior to crush

  • Observe and follow all safety rules and regulations

Requirements

  • No experience necessary but previous work experience in a manufacturing, production, or similar scrapyard/auto part environment will be considered an asset

  • Knowledge of automotive components is a definite asset

  • Able to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, lifting at least 50lbs, and pushing and pulling

  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions

  • Organized and able to prioritize competing priorities

  • Strong communication skills – communicates clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing, and over mobile radio devices

  • Strong work ethic – uses time efficiently

  • Able to work with minimal supervision/general oversight

  • Safety oriented and willing to follow all site safety procedures

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Landscape Service and Installation Assistants
description:
About the Job:

Our Commercial Solutions division is growing, and we are looking to build our team!  Based in Georgetown, Ontario, this position involves landscape and custom design installations for our corporate guests in the GTA and Waterloo Region.  This is a seasonal contract position with a target start date of April 2022.



Your Accountabilities:

  • Working as part of the Commercial Solutions team to support landscape and custom design installations and activations in the Greater Toronto Area and Waterloo Region.
  • Providing landscape services, installations and custom designs, including corporate containers/urns, and planting beds.
  • Product delivery, off-site installation, plant maintenance, and guest interactions.
  • Receiving and maintenance of live product at our facility in Georgetown.
  • Pulling and staging of product orders for our clients.
  • Actively seek to increase knowledge base of Sheridan products and services.
  • Contribute to a safe work environment by observing health and safety best practices and protocols, hazard reporting, and leading by example.
  • Other duties as assigned.



Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • You are an energetic self-starter who is willing to grow as our business grows. 
  • Previous experience with landscaping services and installations.
  • Experience with custom designs utilizing plant material is an asset.
  • Knowledge of interior tropical and house plants as well as seasonal annuals is an asset.
  • Must have a valid G license and reliable transportation to our Head Office in Georgetown and various job sites throughout the GTA (Note: all personal vehicle expenses for business purposes will be reimbursed).
  • Existing product knowledge or ability to learn.
  • Passion for the industry and guest service.
  • Effective time management, with the ability to adapt and prioritize multiple tasks and situations.
  • Highly adaptable, with an ability to take direction and work independently, as well as in a team environment.
  • You are punctual and dependable, and highly value honesty, integrity, and authenticity.
  • Must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
  • Flexibility to work full-time from Monday-Friday in a variety of job locations, with additional availability for evenings and weekends as seasonal peaks require. 
  • This job requires extended periods of walking and standing, with bending and squatting required at various times. Must have the ability to lift 50lbs and work in various weather conditions and environments.
  • Please be advised that being fully vaccinated for Covid-19 is a condition of employment (subject to any accommodation required under the Ontario Human Rights Code).

 

We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

If selected, please advise if you require special accommodation to attend the interview.

title: Groundskeeper
company: Northview Canadian High Yield Residential Fund
description:
Description: The Groundskeeper makes sure that Northview’s buildings show pride of ownership and respect for our residents, by ensuring that the grounds and buildings are maintained, in good repair, with pleasant curb appeal.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensuring safety of common areas, and complying with Northview’s Health and Safety requirements
  • Maintain lawns, shrubs, and trees flower beds (Includes pruning, raking, mowing grass, fertilizing, weeding control)
  • Moving furniture, equipment, materials and supplies including clearing of vacant suites as necessary
  • Snow removal and ice control from all entrances/exits and walkways as required when necessary.
  • Delivery of notices to building residents & posting of notices in common areas where applicable required
  • Maintain clean vacant lots, keeping grounds free of debris
  • Maintain tools and equipment
  • Maintain company vehicle where applicable
  • Assisting with suite renovations and other upgrades
  • Resident Services and assistance as required and maintaining good resident relations
  • Completion of suite inspections where applicable
  • Assisting with the implementation of preventative maintenance programs
  • Other duties relating to upkeep of buildings and grounds as assigned

Qualifications:

  • The position requires someone who is able to work independently, is a self-starter and takes pride in a job well done
  • Previous experience working outdoors doing manual labour, in diverse weather conditions is required
  • Proven ability to work productively and safely while under pressure, with good time management
  • Good customer service skills and pleasant demeanor, and an ability to speak and write English fluently
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs, 
  • Work weekends if necessary

Why Northview

Northview Canadian High Yield Residential Fund (“Northview”) owns and operates real estate properties across six provinces and two territories with a portfolio of approximately $1.9 billion in assets consisting of approximately 11,000 multi-residential units, 1.1 million sq. ft of commercial space, and 200 executive suites. Northview’s Class A Units trade on the Toronto Stock Exchange (“TSX”) under the symbol “NHF.UN” along with two classes of unlisted units.

At Northview, we are a passionate, community-focused team dedicated to making our properties the best they can be. We are proud to live, work, and play in the neighborhoods we serve, next to our residents, hotel guests and commercial tenants.

Northview is committed to health and safety in the workplace for the protection of its employees, residents, tenants, and guests. As a condition of employment, all Northview employees are expected to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or can provide reason for exemption based on a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation. The successful candidate will be required to demonstrate their vaccinated status or reason for exemption before they start work with Northview. Northview will review and consider requests for exemption and will accommodate where required. Personal preference is not sufficient grounds for an exemption.

title: Landscape Maintenance Crew Member/Labourer
company: Lawrence Park Complete Garden Care Ltd
description:
Who we are?

Lawrence Park Complete Garden Care is an award-winning full-scale landscaping firm, specializing in landscape design & construction, lawn & garden care, irrigation & lighting, green roofs and horticulture. We are group of dedicated and creative professionals who are proud of the landscapes we create and maintain. We’ve been at it for over 30 years and we continue to grow – this is where you come in!

So what’s in it for you?

  • The chance to work on award-winning properties with an award-winning team.
  • The opportunity to work in beautiful Toronto neighborhoods.
  • Working for a company that values a supportive work environment.
  • Industry leading wages, along with profit sharing bonuses.
  • Group Health Benefits.
  • On the job training.
  • Personal Development Planning.
  • Employee of the Month recognitions and rewards.
  • Employee referral program.
  • Training allowance.
  • Fun social events.

Who are we looking for?

  • A self-motivated individual who is passionate about the work they do.
  • Someone creative, who has problem solving skills, can communicate well, is personable and can be flexible with the fast-paced environment and demands of the work.

What we need?

  • Landscape maintenance experience.
  • Post secondary education in horticulture or equivalent is an asset.
  • Knowledge of plants, along with the knowledge of horticultural practices.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Ability to operate motorized landscaping equipment.
  • A minimum G license and comfortable driving large vehicles is an asset.
  • Ability to work long hours, starting 7am from Monday to Friday; along with occasional weekend work.
  • Can meet the physical demands of working outdoors in varying weather conditions

title: GARDENER II, DISTRICT (6-Month Contract)
description:
Job Description:

 

Exciting things are happening at the City of Brampton. Take a look at what employees are working on related to our Term of Council Priorities moving us forward towards The Brampton 2040 Vision.

 

 

GARDENER II, DISTRICT (6-Month Contract)

 

 

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

 

Reporting to the Foreperson, Horticultural/Supervisor, Operations Facility, this position designs and maintains annual beds, shrubs and turf in assigned City Parks (maintains Park facilities). Directs students/temporary and full-time employees as assigned.

  • Diagnoses flower, shrub, and turf problems and sprays as needed: selects required pesticide, calibrate required amounts and apply, ensuring safety.
  • Designs, prepares, and maintains annual and shrub beds and planters, including selecting flowers/shrubs, laying topsoil, fertilizer, and developing a program of care. Plants, cultivates, prunes and fertilizes. Inspects beds and performs required maintenance; sprays with pesticides as needed.
  • Directs assigned staff including assigning, scheduling, and verifying on-site work, providing training in horticultural practices and policies.
  • Responsible for an individual budget for the year; estimating, selecting plants, ordering, receiving, reconciling material as well as ordering supplies and hard goods from vendors
  • Selection of trees and shrubs needed for replacement or new planting.
  • Prunes, maintains, transplants trees; checks for damage/disease, potential hazards and risks, improvements in aesthetics, and provides general health management
  • Responds to on-site public requests, provides information.
  • Maintains turf areas: cuts/mows, fertilizes, aerates, dethatches, irrigates, seeds, sods, applies top dressing and applies herbicides/pesticides.
  • Inspect and maintain irrigation systems throughout the City.
  • Interiorscaping for indoor plants; selects, purchases, designs, waters, fertilizes, repots, and applies pesticides.
  • Adheres to Integrated Pest Management practices to control and eliminate pests, adapting and implementing methods as required
  • Prepare stock requirement for tender and provide input with regard to suppliers.
  • Attend related seminars, trade shows and maintain certifications.
  • Keeps abreast of industry trends and practices, researching new plants, equipment, materials, and methods
  • Operates tractors, mowers, chainsaw, brush chipper, water and spraying equipment, snow removal equipment, and hand tools. Maintains equipment/tools, and sets-up for Park projects. e.g. removes trees, plants or transplants/stakes.
  • Maintains park areas including litter and debris pick-up, removing and replacing garbage cans, overpainting graffiti, checking Park buildings for cleanliness, etc.
  • Repairs, assembles Park facilities, i.e. constructs or repairs planters, beds, fencing, signs, pathways, sports facilities (e.g. bleachers), etc.
  • Provides advice to Foreperson and Landscape Architects regarding horticulture, maintenance routines, pathways, and other park planning matters.
  • Liaise with industry professionals on projects and oversees work of contractors
  • Performs winter maintenance: operates equipment to clear snow from park walkways, bridges, outdoor ice rinks, etc. Salts and sands park areas; grooms ski trails.
  • Inspects Park facilities/fixtures on an on-going basis to identify required repairs, and to ensure public safety. Informs Foreperson of required work.
  • Fulfils administrative duties as required; documenting inspections, completing work orders, preparing weekly planners, handling purchases
  • Maintain knowledge of applicable legislation, manuals, and established procedures related to Environment, Workplace Health and Safety, Vehicular Safety
  • Performs additional similar and related duties as assigned.

 SELECTION CRITERIA:

  • High school (Grade 12) graduation plus an additional program of up to one (1) year in Landscape Technology, Horticulture Science, or equivalent.
  • Over two (2) years, up to and including four (4) years of in a horticulture, greens keeping or gardening environment.
  • A valid, non-probationary Ontario Class D license with airbrake Z endorsement.
  • Landscape Exterminator License
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on customer service.
  • Able to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.

 

**Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the selection criteria.

 

Job status:   Contract

Job Type:      Union

 

Hourly rate:    $31.02

Applications must be received by July 1, 2022

Alternate formats will be provided  upon request.

 

   

 

If this opportunity matches your interest and experience, please apply online by clicking the button above, by July 1, 2022  and complete the attached questionnaire. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The successful candidate(s) will be required, as a condition of employment, to execute a written employment agreement. A Criminal Record Search will be required of the successful candidate at their own expense to verify the absence of a criminal record for which a pardon has not been granted.

 

Preference will be given to students that have a permanent residency in Brampton.

 

As part of the application process, applicants will be invited to complete a self identification survey. The survey is voluntary. Participation in the survey will have no impact on hiring decisions.   All information collected is confidential and will not be shared with the hiring manager. The surveys will be anonymized and will be kept separate from applicant or employee files, such that the individuals who completed the surveys will not be identifiable.   The results of the survey will assist in the analysis of disaggregated metrics for organizational planning purposes and our commitment to advance and foster diversity, equity, and inclusion. The City may use anonymized data to produce aggregate reports for internal or external use.

 

Please be advised, the City of Brampton uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicantâ€™s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the Job Competition and your application will be removed from the Competition.

 

The City is an equal opportunity employer.   We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If you require any accommodations at any point during the application and hiring process, please contact TalentAcquisition@brampton.ca or 905-874-2150 with your accommodation needs, quoting the job opening ID#, job title. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

title: Landscape Irrigation Specialist - 2022
description:
Overview:

Apply irrigation throughout the park following a specific schedule.

This position pays $18.75-$19.75 per hour.

Responsibilities:
  • Assist with the operation of existing park irrigation system to implement the turf irrigation program: ensuring maximum efficiency; appropriate schedules and application rates are applied as required to water turf grass and flower beds
  • Troubleshoot/repair various system components as required (heads/valves/piping)
  • Assist in the installation of modifications to existing system or the addition of new systems
  • Assist in the implementation of the turf maintenance program as required (top dressing, seeding, turf repair, laying sod)
  • Line trimming and backpack blowing as required
  • Assist with other duties as required
Qualifications:

â€¢ Minimum 2-5 yearsâ€™ experience in the operation and maintenance of automated/manual commercial irrigation systems
â€¢ Certified Irrigation Technician status (Landscape Ontario) or equivalent is an asset
â€¢ Familiar with plumbing techniques and materials as well as turf maintenance equipment operation and practices
â€¢ Able to meet the physical requirements of the job including bending, lifting, utilizing hand tools and working in various weather conditions (must be able to lift, pull and push 20kg)
â€¢ Valid Ontario driverâ€™s license (class G/G2)
â€¢ Able to work cooperatively in a team environment
â€¢ Must provide own CSA approved safety footwear
â€¢ Able to work 6:00am-2:30pm spring, summer and fall and possible shifts from 12am to 9am during the irrigation season (Monday-Friday) and occasional overtime and weekends
â€¢ Able to wear personal protective equipment deemed necessary to perform this job safely (may include; gloves, mask and/or face shield, non-slip shoes etc)

title: Landscape Technicians and Landscape Gardeners!
description:
Grow with us in 2022! Landscapers, Let your future take root!


Recognized by Landscape Ontario with Awards of Excellence for our work, Landscapes By Lucin is dedicated to providing clients with compelling, creative landscape design.

Based in Toronto, our business is growing, which is why we're looking for energetic, versatile, self-motivated field staff to join our team

Why choose Landscapes By Lucin?

The answer is simple. We truly believe that when it comes to delivering exceptional work and outstanding customer service, our employees are the reason behind our success. That's where we stand out - we consider our employees to be our partners, and we prove it to them every day.

The resources and guidance to help you reach your full potential. You can count on it.

  • We will train you - and continue to make learning a priority.
  • We'll work with you to create a career path based on your strengths, giving priority to your preferences.
  • We offer a variety of roles to keep your work day interesting and motivating.
  • Incentive plans and benefits based on company profitability.

This year, "grow further" in your career by partnering with an employer dedicated to investing in you over the long term - a company that encourages teamwork and rewards initiative.

If you have previous landscaping, stone masonry, planting, carpentry or general construction experience, we'd like to hear from you!

We are rooted in growing our business - and providing opportunities for your professional growth and development.

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
We are excited to announce the opening of Golden Life’s newest location, Ocean Front Village, in the gorgeous Comox Valley! We are on track to open in Summer of 2022, and this will be our company’s first Village on Vancouver Island. We are excited to build an amazing team, and we are looking for exceptional, passionate individuals dedicated to providing an unparalleled experience for our residents.

We’re looking for a Maintenance Worker to grow with our team at Ocean Front Village in Courtenay, BC. If you are an enthusiastic team player, who is mechanically-inclined with a passion for providing high quality care and support for seniors, then we would love to hear from you!

Duties will include, but are not limited to:
  • Under the direction of the Community Manager will maintain all aspects of the building including but not limited to building interior, exterior, and grounds, mechanical, electrical and site aesthetics.
  • Ensure preventative maintenance duties on all building components are fulfilled as per the preventative maintenance schedule and manufactures specification.
  • In conjunction with the Community Manager, will review, perform or coordinate all maintenance requests and resident requests; these items will be reviewed daily and will be prioritized in order of importance.
  • Directly deal with trades, suppliers and contracted services that relate to the maintenance department.
  • Works closely with the Community Managers to mitigate all resident and staff
  • complaints.
  • Sources new trades, suppliers, material & manpower.
  • Assists the Community Managers in training and ongoing education of staff in relation to building system components and maintenance practices.
  • Works closely with construction during the turnover of a new building, addition or project.
Our culture attracts proactive self-starters who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, inclusion, integrity, passion, and curiosity. If this resonates, maybe you’re the right person to join the Golden Life team.

The successful candidate will meet the following qualifications:
  • A strong mechanical or electrical understanding.
  • Minimum of three years’ related experience.
  • Must have a strong ability to trouble shoot and work through a variety of situations.
  • Ability to multi-task, manage time effectively and prioritize work.
  • Ability to plan, deliver and evaluate budgets.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • The ability to create sound & economical solutions in emergency situation.
  • Clear Vulnerable Sector Criminal Record Check.
  • Physician’s Waiver, Negative TB Screening, and Immunization Record.
  • Can provide proof of full and current COVID-19 vaccines.
What we offer you

At Golden Life Management Corporation, we are purpose-led. Our Philosophy is focused entirely upon providing the best possible quality of care to our residents and those we serve. We recognize that engaged employees are necessary to achieve our purpose and our Philosophy.

As a Golden Life Team member, you can expect to be treated with dignity and respect, to be challenged with your work, and to have the autonomy necessary to excel. We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package that includes a voluntary retirement program with company contributions, for eligible employees.

Golden Life welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

If this sound attractive to you, please apply today!

title: Caretaker
description:
Position: Caretaker (Full Time, Permanent)
Location: Kamloops, British Columbia
Start Date: ASAP

About Us
Tribe Management is part of the Tribe Property Technologies family. Together we are the sixth largest strata/condo and rental management company in Canada with offices in downtown Vancouver, Delta, Victoria, Kelowna, Kamloops, Calgary and Cambridge. Our Tribe Management division specializes in strata and rental management services. We are responsible for the day-to-day operation and management of residential & mixed-use properties in our portfolio. Combining our obsession with technology and an unwavering passion for creating vibrant strata communities, we provide community management with heart. 

Job Responsibilities

  • Responsible for all administrative work involved in the operation of the Property according to procedures and set out by instruction from the Property Manager
  • Work cooperatively alongside other onsite staff to ensure the Property maintains a high standard of professionalism
  • Handle Move in/ Move out and bank deposits processes
  • Arranging and organizing vendors and working with maintenance
  • Cleaning units and assisting with minor repairs
  • Perform minor plumbing repairs
  • Issue Purchase Orders for all work and/or supplies being undertaken at the building and supervise contractors
  • Prepare detailed Incident Reports related to accidents, altercations and damage to the property and/or other applicable incidents
  • Deal with emergencies on a 24hr basis during the workweek
  • Schedule and supervise move in and outs of the building as per the Rules & Regulations
  • Maintain accurate tenant files and collect rents
  • Other duties as required from time to time, available for call outs

Qualifications

  • Two to three years relevant experience
  • Working knowledge of the Residential Tenancy Act
  • Motivated and professional with a service-oriented mindset
  • Excellent communicator; both verbal and written
  • Strong interpersonal skills; able to handle conflict tactfully
  • Computer literate; knowledge of Microsoft Office and overall computer skills
  • Organized and detail oriented
  • Must own a vehicle, class 5 driverâ€™s license with clean driving records
  • Reliable

If you are currently exploring a new career challenge in property operations, apply online by submitting your resume. Due to anticipated response, only those candidates who will be interviewed will be contacted.

title: Maintenance Temp (Part-Time)
description:
Brookfield Properties, Office

At Brookfield Properties, our success starts with our people. People like you.

We develop, operate, and manage more than 650 properties and 325 million square feet of real estate across the globe. Itâ€™s a feat that wouldnâ€™t be possible without our team, a diverse group of creative visionaries and innovative experts who are relentless in pursuit of one goal: to ensure our buildings donâ€™t simply meet the needs of our tenants, residents, and communities â€” but exceed them, every day.

Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations â€” bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. Itâ€™s why the worldâ€™s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.

If youâ€™re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.

As part of employment with Brookfield Properties, successful candidates must be fully vaccinated and are required to provide proof in the form of a government issued record prior to their first day.

DESCRIPTION: 

Working within a multi-task team environment performing and/or assisting in maintenance routines on building equipment.  The position demands flexibility, availability to work primarily day shifts, and a positive, cooperative work attitude.  Perform preventative maintenance routines on building equipment and washroom deficiencies.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Perform standard washroom inspections.
  • Cleaning and Painting as required.
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Embody and support Brookfield Propertiesâ€™ Safety, Health and Environment Policy.
    • Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate hazards to reduce risk to the workplace.
    • Engage in training and continuing education to develop the knowledge, skills, and competencies required to work safely.
    • Take action to stop work if it cannot be executed safely or if conditions or behaviours are unsafe.
    • Immediately report SH&E incidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and/or at-risk behaviours to their supervisor; then diligently work to correct the problem.
    • Promote safe work practices and safe working conditions in accordance with all Brookfield Properties Safe Work Procedures.
    • Wear Personal Protective Equipment when required.

QUALIFICATIONS:

SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS: 

Service oriented with excellent communication skills.  Must be self-motivated, with the ability to work both independently and in a team, while learning from others.  Must have a positive attitude and present a professional image.

EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:

  • General building maintenance experience
  • Available to work afternoons

EDUCATION/DESIGNATIONS/LICENSES:

  • Minimum Grade 12 education
  • A certificate in Building Systems Engineering or working towards it.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

Brookfield is committed to accommodating the individual needs of all applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process as required under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

title: Lawn Care Technician (Clone)
description:
Do you love working outdoors, being in control of your day, talking to people and making them happy with your outstanding service? Do you take pride in what you do and want to make a difference? If so, keep reading!

 

Our Core Values are: Integrity, Helpfulness, Safety, Family, Humility, Respect, Thoughtfulness, Ambition, Professionalism, Authenticity, and Doing the Right Thing. If you can relate please keep reading because you might be the perfect fit!

 

Working with LawnSavers means opportunities to advance, great tools, a phenomenal group of people to work with, and plenty of engaging, rewarding work. This role is designed for you to flourish and grow on a career path with unlimited opportunities .  

 

Opportunity doesn’t always look the way you expect it to.… forget the starts ups and corporate bureaucracies….come grow with a solid small business with a proven track record of over 30 years and be more than just a number, be a part of the family! 

 

We at LawnSavers are looking for dedicated people to join the team and help us provide our customers with a lawn that will Make ‘em say WOW! LawnSavers will train good people looking to become phenomenal members of the team and grow a career.

 

What we offer

- $650.00 to $850.00 weekly plus daily incentives! 

- $40,000 to $55,000 annually

- Full time year round employment

- Christmas light installation position from October to February

- Excellent compensation structure

- Medical, dental, life insurance, vision benefits

- RSP program with company matching

- Recognition awards

- Comprehensive paid lawn care technician training

 

 

Responsibilities

- Provides lawn care services to residential or commercial customers

- Drives company truck to customer locations (valid G driver’s license required)

- Start time is 6am Monday to Friday and Saturday as seasonal demand dictates

- Apply fertilizers, weed and insect controls in accordance with I.P.M. standards, work schedules, safety procedures, & label instructions

- WOW customers with the best customer service

- Report to work on time as assigned and complete all tasks with honesty and integrity

 

Requirements

- Able to repeatedly lift and carry 50 lbs

- Computer-literate and good comfort level with technology

- G license required and a clean drivers abstract

- Ability to work independently and as part of a team

- Flexible to work long hours during peak season

- Must work Saturdays in busy season

- Must be a motivated, high-energy, and a self-starter

 

Key Words:

  • Landscaping, Agronomics, Horticulture, General Labour, Sales, Partner, Customer Service, Lawn/Garden Maintenance, Forestry, Arborist, Golf, Outdoors, Driving, Seasonal, Labour, Supervisor, Golf Course, Landscaping, Maintenance, Gardening, Construction, Lawn Care, Superintendent, Sports, Parks, Pest Control, Vaughan, Toronto, York Region, Linens, HVAC, Service, Contractors, Training, Outdoor, Groundskeeper, Property Maintenance, General Labour, Landscaper

title: Landscape Maintenance Technician
description:
Here we grow again, if you like working outdoors, really enjoyed your summer job mowing lawns in middle school then a job in Horticultural Industry is for you. Horticultural companies work to preserve and enhance a client’s landscape.

Horticultural Projects can be as simple as caring for grass and shrubs, or as elaborate as tending to turf, trees, and other landscape elements at a luxury resort.

Since maintaining the “attractiveness” of landscapes is so popular, there is rarely a shortage of work as a horticultural professional. This isn’t your simple summer lawn-mowing job anymore!

We at Mr. Lawnmower are looking for energetic and motivated individuals that have tremendous leadership qualities and are attention to detail-oriented. Mr. Lawnmower is based in Scarborough, and currently has an opening for a Lawn Maintenance/Landscape Construction Foreman and Landscape/Lawn-care Technicians. Candidates must be Dependable, Honest, and Trustworthy. References will be mandatory.

Descriptions:

Landscape Maintenance Technicians
A qualified Landscape Maintenance Technician will be expected to have experience in and required to do the following:
  • General Lawn Maintenance including grass cutting, trimming and blowing.
  • Spring and Fall Property Cleanups.
  • General Garden Maintenance including weeding, soil turning, edging, pruning, and planting.
  • Garbage removal.
  • Winter work including snow removal.

Please be advised that due to the anticipated high volume of response to this ad, Mr. Lawnmover is not able to respond to every applicant. Someone from Mr. Lawnmover will contact qualified applicants that meet the requirements of the position and match the background and professional experience.




    About Mr. Lawnmower Landscaping Services Ltd. :

    Mr Lawnmower Landscaping Services is a reliable and professional landscape company with a commitment to excellence and quality. We have been serving the Greater Toronto Area since 2003. At Mr Lawnmower, we are proud to have a very large client base in Toronto, Ontario. These clients have used our services many times which is a testament to the outstanding service that we provide.

title: Landscaper
description:
Are you easy to “get a lawn” with? Do you have two green thumbs? Are you not afraid of getting down and dirty? Atkinson Landscaping is currently seeking to add new team players to our awesome roster. We are a landscaping company that truly strives to set itself apart from the competition. To achieve this end, we are committed to wowing every customer with excellent customer service and professionally executed work. We offer competitive wages with great bonus incentives that reward a strong work ethic and a commitment to the craft. We believe in creating a strong learning environment that encourages everyone to continue leveling up their skills, promoting personal and community growth. We want to be the best landscaping company in the Surrey/Langley area; the only way to accomplish this is to ensure our employees feel valued and proud of our team’s mission.  Who are we? Atkinson Landscaping specializes in residential, strata and commercial maintenance services and small construction projects. We are well established in the Surrey/Langley area and are continuing to expand at a rapid rate. Our team consists of motivated individuals that love what they do. New hires will find it easy to feel a sense of belonging within our all-star lineup.  Who are we looking for?Are you:
  • In search of part/full time work?
  • Looking for an outdoor job full of variety?
  • Available Monday to Friday?
  • Comfortable working in all types of weather?
  • Experienced in landscape maintenance and construction? If not, do you take direction well and are you willing to learn new skills from experienced workers?
  • Capable of physically demanding work?
  • A kind and personable individual?
If you answered yes to all of these, please, apply! Other Requirements
  • A driver’s license
  • A working phone with data preferred
  • Comfortable using power tools and other light equipment/machinery
  • Experience is a valuable asset, but is not necessary!
 Benefits/Perks
  • Flexible hours
  • Competitive, living wage
  • Educational opportunities
  • Casual, FUN work environment
  • Team building exercises and outings

title: Landscape Labourer
description:
Working outdoors April to Nov/Dec 7:30am to 6pm

 

We are a family owned and operated garden centre near Sarnia Ontario. We operate a large garden center, wholesale department , and a landscaping division focusing mostly on residential high end  installations. You will assist the landscape  crew in installing and maintaining landscape environments which include flowers, trees, shrubs, lawns and construction landscapes.  Tasks will include laying out beds, installing plants, installing stone patios, walkways, water features, sod. Uses appropriate tools and equipment required to complete tasks. 17.00 per hour.

JOB PURPOSE:As a member of our landscaping team, Landscapers complete various gardening and lawn maintenance duties as provided by the Landscape Designer and Crew Leader.

JOB SUMMARY:
Landscapers will be responsible for planting, installing and maintaining customer gardens and lawns through the use of various tools and machinery with a priority on customer service, efficiency and safety. 

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Install rock gardens, ponds, patios, drainage systems, irrigation systems, retaining walls, fences, water features, lighting and planters
  • Spread top soil; lay sod; plant flowers, grasses, shrubs and trees
  • Perform fall and spring clean-up; weed gardens, prune shrubs and trees; and execute other maintenance duties as directed by supervisor/manager
  • Edge around flower beds, walkways, and walls
  • Attach wires from planted trees to support stakes
  • Decorate gardens with stones and mulch
  • Be respectful of customers’ homes and yards. Ensure job sites are cleaned of all debris and materials before leaving the client’s property
  • Refrain from swearing, shouting and partaking in inappropriate topics and discussions
  • Follow all health & safety regulations including wearing appropriate protective equipment and following Safety Data Sheets (SDS) for safe handling of fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides and other dangerous chemicals
  • Converse with customers in regards to their questions, concerns, or complaints in a courteous and helpful manner; inform them of proper maintenance procedures and plant care or refer to crew leader or designer
  • Respect tools and equipment. Make sure all are clean, organized and returned to proper place in shop or trucks.
  • Perform daily safety circle checks on vehicles and machinery before they leave the yard. Check fluid levels and fill out vehicle inspection books accurately. Notify a manager of any issues.
  • Arrive to work on time and be ready and engaged to start the day.
  • Perform timely deliveries for retail, record time spend and hand in delivery slips
  • Adhere to the driving hands free policy and obey speed limits and rules of the road when driving company vehicles

TOOLS & EQUIPMENT:

  • Small tractors, skid steers, tillers, rollers, etc.
  • Power equipment such as shears, saws, sod cutters, line trimmers and edger’s, plant augers, drills, etc.
  • Hand tools such as shovels, rakes, hammers, wheelbarrows, picks, pruning shears, handheld and hose-end sprayers, soil cultivators, water sprinklers, packers, hedge shears, sod cutters, pruning saws, cut-off saws, string & bush trimmers, power blowers, rototillers, etc.

 

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Clean driver’s abstract; Valid G Licence; own vehicle/transportation

Knowledge of landscape and construction techniques, practices and terminology

Ability to understand and execute oral and written instruction

Ability to interpret plans and specifications related to the work assigned

Ability to perform multiple job tasks to meet various project deadlines

Ability to read instructions, warning labels; job instructions and procedures may be required

Ability to read WHMIS labels, equipment manuals, complete logs and incident reports, job instructions and procedures

Ability to lift and work in diverse weather conditions i.e. wet and/or humid conditions; hot or cold

Ability to lift heavy rocks, trees, etc.

Ability to take instruction and work in a team

Willingness to learn

TRAINING PROVIDED

  • Vehicle inspection
  • Tools and machinery hands on training
  • Plans and specification interpretations
  • Health and Safety, WHMIS and Sipkens’ Policies

title: Landscape Construction - Crew Member
description:
Job Summery:

The Landscape Construction Crew Member is responsible for working as a team member under the direct supervision of the Landscape Construction Foreman. Responsible for completing construction landscape installation jobs throughout the Niagara Region and surrounding areas, in an efficient manner, promoting job worksite safety, providing excellent customer service, and exhibits pride and quality workmanship.

Essential Duties:

  • Work closely with Foreman and Crew Leader in installation of landscape construction projects.
  • Always represent the company’s best interest, maintain the highest level of integrity and professionalism.
  • Maintain a clean and safe job site, and assist Foreman and Crew Leader in keeping an orderly and stocked equipment trailer.
  • Maintain and care for company equipment, tools and vehicles.
  • Perform highly physical installation work on a consistent basis.
  • Work as part of a team and take direction.
  • Understand and meet production and project schedule deadlines without sacrificing great customer service or excellent quality.
  • Keep accurate time-sheet records
  • Attend training classes and seminars as requested by management.
  • Perform other tasks or projects as assigned / instructed by Foreman and/or Crew Leader.

title: Arborist Climber
description:
If you enjoy working outdoors in a professional and safe environment, consider a career with Bartlett Tree Experts! At Bartlett, we value a strong culture of excellence in safety, scientific research, lifelong learning, and career development.





As an Arborist Climber, you will be an integral member of a tree care crew with the primary responsibility of tree climbing and assisting Arborist Crew Leaders in performing all tree and shrub care services on residential and commercial properties.









We offer competitive compensation, as well as:



+ A safety-first culture and professional workplace


+ Advancement opportunities - we promote from within


+ Life, LTD, ADD, medical and dental


+ RPP Plan, Healthcare spending account, and paid vacation and holidays


+ Industry credential/license pay increases


+ Company-paid uniforms, PPE, gear, and equipment


+ Boot reimbursement up to $200


+ Access to training, continuing education programs, and a variety of resources provided by the Bartlett Tree Experts Research Laboratories






To find out more about what life is like at Bartlett, check us out on Instagram @LifeatBartlett.







+ Perform all required ground, climbing, and aerial lift duties in support of specific job assignments, as directed by crew leader


+ Demonstrate high safety standards, sound tree risk assessment skills, equipment inspection skills, proper application of approved knots, proper climbing techniques and procedures, proper pruning and small removal skills, and proper rigging skills


+ Learn, understand, and adhere to all safety rules and company safety policies


+ Responsible for carrying out other duties as assigned by the Crew Leader or designated supervisor, Arborist Representative, or Local Manager








+ At least 1 year of climbing (DdRT or SRT) and bucket operation experience in the tree care industry


+ Valid driver's license and clean MVR


+ Degree in Arboriculture, Forestry, Horticulture, Plant Science, Landscape Management, Environmental Science or a related field is preferred but not required



The F. A. Bartlett Tree Expert Company is an Equal Opportunity and E-Verify Employer.


Oakville

ON

Production Arborist

5/6/2022

Regular Full-Time

External Company URL: https://englishcareers-bartlett.icims.com

title: Seasonal Developmental Arborist - (Job Number: 43462)
description:
Description43462
Qualifications

Assist and help in maintaining the City of Edmonton, one tree at a time!


This position will have you assisting in pruning and maintaining trees as a Developmental Arborist with Certified Arborists in daily operations. Come join the Forestry Operations Team as a Seasonal Developmental Arborist I.


Main responsibilities and tasks:

  • Operate equipment related to urban tree care
  • Prune trees to develop and maintain tree health
  • Tree Removals
  • Hazard Tree removals
  • Respond to emergency storm-related work
  • Operate and perform minor maintenance on equipment which may include: chainsaws, brush blades and various pruning tools
  • Provide traffic control and direction including greeting the public and providing prompt and courteous service
  • Respond to tree complaints related to the Urban Forest
  • Conduct job duties in a safe manner in compliance with City and Provincial Occupational Health and Safety Legislation regulations, codes, policies and competency training
  • Update inventory using digital software
  • Complete digital task cards, work records and interpret work assignments
  • Other related duties as required

title: Yard Associate
description:
Company Overview:

Whether you are experienced in the green industry, a professional looking for a career change, or a new graduate or veteran transitioning into the workforce, we are confident you will find opportunity and reward with SiteOne.  

 

SiteOne Landscape Supply is the largest and only national wholesale distributor of landscaping products in the United States and Canada. With over 500 branches across the U.S. and Canada, we offer a comprehensive selection of products including:   irrigation supplies, fertilizer and control products, nursery goods, hardscapes, landscape lighting, drainage and erosion control products, tools, and other landscaping accessories and supplies.

 

Come grow with our associates who are customer obsessed, always safe, continuously improving, and having fun!

Position Overview:

Our Yard Labors help organize product for deliveries to job sites and help maintain the overall organization of the branch.

 

What youâ€™ll do:

  • Unload product from incoming truck
  • Load product to outbound vehicles
  • Restock product
  • Assisting customers
  • Other duties as needed
Skills We Are Seeking::
  • Must be able to lift 50 pounds
  • Be enthusiastic and dependable and work as a team player
  • Customer focused
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Safety minded; safety boots required

Perks:

  • Medical, Dental and Vision plans
  • Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays
  • Competitive Compensation
  • 401k with company match
  • Company paid life insurance, Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability Insurance
  • Product Discounts
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Opportunity for Advancement

 

THE INFORMATION CONTAINED HEREIN IS NOT INTENDED TO BE AN EXHAUSTIVE LIST OF ALL RESPONSIBILITIES, DUTIES AND QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED OF INDIVIDUALS PERFORMING THE JOB. THE QUALIFICATIONS DETAILED IN THIS JOB DESCRIPTION ARE NOT CONSIDERED THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS NECESSARY TO PERFORM THE JOB, BUT RATHER AS GUIDELINES. THEY MAY VARY FROM POSITION TO POSITION.

title: Landscape Maintenance Labourer
description:
CSL Group Ltd. is a family-based company committed to our company values (SHARING â€“ Safety, Humility, Accountability, Respect, Integrity, Nurturing, Growth).  We invest a phenomenal amount into our employees, which is one of the things that makes us so fantastic to work for. Our focus is on career development and promotion - people are at the core of everything we do. If you are looking for a career, not just a job, youâ€™re in the right place!

Job Duties:

  • Minimum 1 years experience in landscaping
  • Experience in general grounds keeping including but not limited to: cutting, trimming, maintaining flower beds, planting, sodding, turf management, etc.
  • Able to operate basic landscaping equipment including but not limited to: mowers, tractors, sod cutters, pruning saws, etc.
  • Able to perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment by conducting inspections, lubricating, and cleaning daily
  • A willingness to learn, demonstrated initiative, ability to make decisions based on sound judgment
  • Ability to drive a truck and trailer
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs, climb, bend, dig, etc.
  • Comply with all company policies and regulations

Work Perks:

  • Competitive wages
  • Company paid benefits package
  • Employee appreciation events
  • Company paid uniforms & safety boot allowance
  • RRSP and DPSP

If you would like to speak directly to CSL's Recruiter.  Please call:

title: Maintenance Worker II
description:
Please Note:

As per Article 16.11, Regular Float/Vacation Relief Position. Rotation will vary according to line being covered. Where appropriate, a float pool employee may be required to perform work at more than one work site of the Employer.

Why Fraser Health?:

We invite you to apply today and find out why more than 95% of new employees recommend Fraser Health to their friends as an exceptional place to work. A 2022 BC Top Employer, we value diversity in the work force and seek to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.

 

We hire great people for outstanding jobs and need your help to expand the ability to deliver prompt and professional service. We are looking for a  Relief Full Time Maintenance Worker II for our Royal Columbian Hospital  located in New Westminster, B.C. The work requires mechanical and electrical aptitude, site maintenance and working with trades journeymen and contractors.

 

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlakaâ€™pamux Nations. Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.  

 

Effective October 26th 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization â€œWHOâ€ approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines).   Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.

 

Curious to learn what itâ€™s like to work here? Like us on  Facebook  (@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on  Twitter  &  Instagram  (@FHCareer), or connect with us on  LinkedIn  (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights.

 

Detailed Overview:

Under general supervision, position performs maintenance duties related to buildings, ground and equipment in one or a variety of areas such as electrical, plumbing and painting.

Responsibilities:
  1. Performs electrical maintenance duties such as replacing extension cords, sockets and receptacles.
  2. Replaces and cleans items such as light bulbs, fluorescent tubes and ballasts.
  3. Performs carpentry maintenance such as replacing glides on furniture, removing and replacing door handles and attaching items such as pictures, drapery tracks and baseboards to walls.
  4. Performs plumbing maintenance such as unblocking sewer lines; replacing fixtures such as flush tank mechanisms and faucets.
  5. Performs painting maintenance such as preparing plaster, wood, metal or other surfaces by scraping, brushing, sanding, burning off existing surfaces and/or removing and replacing wall plates; applying paint and other finishes by brush and/or roller as directed; removes and replaces tiles; makes signs and notices using materials such as stencils.
  6. Performs mechanical maintenance on equipment such as wheelchairs, beds and carts by cleaning, greasing, oiling and replacing broken and worn parts such as castors and filters; performs engine maintenance such as changing oil, cleaning/replacing spark plugs and checking and topping up battery and other fluids.
  7. Transports heavy furniture and/or equipment manually and/or using aides such as dollies and carts.
  8. Assists journeyman by performing duties related to shop work as required.
  9. Maintains materials and supplies for assigned area.
  10. Performs other related duties as required.
Qualifications:

Education and Experience

Grade 10 plus one year's recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal effectively with others.
  • Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
