title: Groundskeeper
description:
Ã‚  :

Are you an outdoor enthusiast with a passion for maintaining grounds?  

Are you looking for seasonal employment with a residential property management company listed as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada?

 

Summary:  

Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Groundskeeper will work closely with the Community Manager and Land Lease Maintenance, maintain grounds, participate in grounds construction activities and ensure proper operation of all necessary equipment.

 

This role is ideally suited to candidates located in or around Brooks, AB, to travel to communities nearby. If you take pride in maintaining a functional, inviting, and aesthetically pleasing environment and are able to handle multiple jobs in an organized fashion, we want to hear from you!

 

Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate with Operations Manager and or Community Manager by appropriate methods to resolve site issues and report all issues
  • Distribute notices and letters to tenants as required
  • Work at multiple Mobile Home Communities, on an as-need basis
  • Be on call as necessary
  • Participate in safety training
  • Follow up on tenant issues as assigned
  • Assist with, set up, general repairs and maintenance of CAPREIT owned homes
  • Request material for the items required for work orders
  • Other duties as assigned

 

Maintenance of Site

  • Repair and maintenance of common areas
  • General grounds keeping including mowing, pruning, whipper snipping, and clearing catch basins
  • Cleaning of vacant lots
  • Salting, sanding and snow removal (where applicable)

 

Qualifications:

  • 1+ years of relevant experience
  • Qualifications in one of the mechanical trades a strong asset
  • Organized and able to oversee multiple projects simultaneously
  • Valid driverâ€™s licence, clean driver abstract, reliable, insured means of transportation to and between work locations may be required for some locations
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Be available to work 25-30 hours per week and on call for emergencies

title: Playland Groundskeeper
description:
Job Description:

Playland Groundskeeper

Seasonal Part-time: ASAP â€“ November 2022

(weekends and evening as required)

Wage & Pay Grade: $17.00/hour (PG 72); plus 5% in lieu of benefits and vacation

Date Posted: April 19, 2022

 

Who we areâ€¦

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 112 year old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of $48 million dollars and generates revenue through three activity streams:   the 15 day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights,   year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events.   The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best we can be.

 

We are looking for a talented individual to join our PNE Grounds Maintenance Team and ensure all areas of the Playland site, including public-access locations in buildings and rides, are maintained in a clean and debris-free manner.   Supports the Grounds Maintenance team to ensure site cleanliness standards are being adhered to and that team members are adequately equipped.

 

Why join our Team?

  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Flexible work environment
  • Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more
  • Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands
  • On-site fitness center
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to create lasting memories and friendships!

 

What will you do this year?

In your role as a Playland Groundskeeper, your primary accountabilities will be to:

  • Operate equipment including, but not limited to:
  • Pressure washers
  • Leaf blowers
  • Floor buffers
  • Paint and compete touch-ups
  • Conduct minor repairs on Grounds Maintenance equipment
  • Conduct regular-interval inventory counts
  • Treat and remove in-ground weeds
  • Remove debris in active ride areas, following established lock-out procedures
  • Ensure that ride units are kept clean
  • Provide guidance for Grounds Maintenance team members
  • Monitor cleanliness of park while in operation, including all washrooms
  • Complete before and after season clean-up of both the Playland site and related Grounds Maintenance equipment
  • Arrange for the placement and storage of all waste receptacles, cleaning supplies and Grounds Maintenance equipment  
  • Adhere to PNE policies and guidelines
  • Ensure that proper PNE dress code is adhered to at all times
  • Perform other related duties as required by the Manager

 

What else?

  • Knowledge of materials, methods, and cleaning tools used in janitorial/site clean-up work
  • Previous experience working in a janitorial capacity is required
  • Ability to arrange an effective work schedule under minimum supervision
  • Ability to interact with guests in a courteous and professional manner
  • Ability to understand and effectively carry out oral and written instructions
  • Sufficient physical strength, stamina, and coordination to permit the performance of assigned tasks
  • Must possess valid WHIMIS certification
  • Must be able and willing to work a variety of shifts, including evening, day shifts, and weekends
  • Must be available to work up to full-time hours (40 hours per week)
  • Candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check.

 

Who are you?

  • Proactive
  • Hardworking
  • Committed
  • Team player
  • Reliable

 

Where and when to APPLY?

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

 

Preference will be given to candidates who submit their resume/cover letter before Sunday May 22nd, 2022. We look forward to hearing from you!

 

The PNE is proud to be an  equal  opportunity  employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at  

hr@pne.ca

.

title: Gardener
location: The Lake Joseph Club, Port Carling, ON
description:
The Lake Joseph Club is Hiring!

The Horticulturalist/Gardener is responsible for the enhancement and quality of the landscaped areas at the ClubLink property. This position offers you the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment while being exposed to all facets of gardening.  

Responsibilities:

  • Aid in the design of new gardens.
  • Prune, fertilize, and apply other gardening techniques as required. 
  • Advise, obtain quotes, and assist in the purchasing of horticultural tools, supplies, and materials.  
  • Select the appropriate plants for new and existing gardens at the Club.  
  • Spray plants to control pests and diseases.  
  • Plant and maintain all gardens to the high standards of ClubLink. 
  • Create and implement a five-year plan for on-course gardens and native areas.  
  • Keep accurate records of tasks and duties performed. 

Qualifications: 

  • Knowledge, understanding, and experience working in all areas of garden design and plants.  
  • Diploma or certificate in horticulture or equivalent considered an asset. 
  • A self-starter and able to work independently with minimal instructions. 
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. 
  • Have both excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
  • High regard for the health and safety of self and others.  

This is a Seasonal Position.  

ClubLink is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace. Please contact jobs@clublink.ca if a workplace accommodation is needed throughout the selection process. Thank you for your interest in ClubLink.

title: Groundsman/woman
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

The Groundsman/woman will carry out scheduled ground maintenance work. In this role, you will report to Plant Operator and work co-operatively with all Greater Calgary personnel.

Responsibilities:
  • Ensure the safety of company personnel, the community, and environment
  • Seek out and implement Best Practices
  • Create an atmosphere of teamwork and ensure the development of personnel and arbitrate to resolve conflicts
  • Identify and communicate product problems and information
  • Perform several types of manual work
  • Handle materials, tools, and equipment
  • Operate automotive vehicles when required
  • Shovel spillage around conveyors

SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Ensure safety goals are achieved
  • Comply with all company safety rules
Qualifications:
  • Semi-skilled, enthusiastic, has the ability to work on their own initiative
  • Knowledge in general maintenance work
  • Capable of working in an outdoor environment year round

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Landscape Maintenance Personnel
description:
Brandt is currently seeking Landscape Maintenance Workers. The Landscape Maintenance Worker is a seasonal full time position.This position is responsible for all aspects of landscape and grounds maintenance for residential and commercial landscaping job sites. Duties include but not limited to: lawn care maintenance, fertilizing, watering, weeding, irrigation maintenance, tree pruning, spring/fall cleanups, golf course maintenance, basic equipment maintenance, and some light landscaping.

Ability to work in all weather conditions, be reliable, capable of performing physically demanding work, attention to detail, ability to work independently and on a team, respectful operation of equipment, and able to work various shifts including weekends are all assets.

Experience in operating landscaping tools and equipment required. This includes lawn mowers, chain saws, string trimmers, reel mowers etc. Preference will be given to those candidates who have previous experience working on a golf course, as well as those able to work the entire season.

title: Yard Worker
description:
OK Ready Mix, a division of Lehigh Hanson Materials limited is currently looking for responsible, safe, and dependable Form Yard Workers to join our local team. As a Form Yard Worker you will support our business needs by ensuring a safe and productive work environment. In this position, you will have the opportunity to use different skills every day as you learn about the form business in Kelowna, BC.

We offer:
  • Secure, long-term employment
  • Competitive wage and benefits package
  • Training and development
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • OT available

What You Will Get to Do:
  • Operate mobile equipment on plant property (forklift)
  • Maintain cleanliness of work areas
  • Clean, maintain, build and lubricate concrete forms
  • Prepare form orders for delivery.
  • Transport materials to and from storage and shop areas
  • Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental regulations, as well as company policies and procedures; assist with physical inspections of plant property/departments.

Who We Are Looking For:
  • High school diploma or GED required
  • Previous experience in concrete or construction is an asset
  • Previous experience using power tools such as routers, circular saws and cordless drills
  • Desire to work cooperatively as part of a productive team
  • Ability to work safely, and independently without constant supervision
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Capable of learning through on the job training
  • Able to work inside and outside in year-round weather conditions
  • In good physical condition, able to lift and carry up to50 lbs., sit and stand for extended periods of time, kneel, climb ladders, and walk on varied terrain
  • Ability to work different extended hours, holidays and/or overtime required

title: Concierge
description:
Description

Appartenir à Air Canada, c’est appartenir à un symbole canadien, Air Canada récemment élue meilleur transporteur aérien en Amérique du Nord. Faites décoller votre carrière en vous joignant à notre équipe novatrice et diversifiée à l’avant-garde du transport aérien de passagers. 
 
Le poste se situe près de lAéroport international de Vancouver.
 
Un emploi permanent à temps plein est de 40 heures par semaine et un emploi permanent à temps partiel peut être programmé pour un minimum de 20 heures et un maximum de 32 heures par semaine. Le salaire actuel est de 16,56$ l'heure, conformément à la convention collective.

Résumé des fonctions
  • La principale fonction d'un agent du Service Concierge à Air Canada consiste à permettre à nos clients à forte valeur de vivre une expérience des plus agréables à l'aéroport.
  • Ce rôle englobe tous les points essentiels du service offert aux clients à forte valeur, comme l'enregistrement, les salons Feuille d'érable et les services personnels traditionnels.
  • Le poste s'inspire du service de conciergerie d'un hôtel cinq étoiles.
  • Les tâches qui seront confiées au titulaire du poste varieront d'un jour à l'autre, selon les divers besoins de nos clients à forte valeur de statut supérieur.
  • Un agent du Service Concierge se montre toujours serviable, donne toujours suite à une demande et adopte toujours la bonne attitude. L'agent du Service Concierge veille au confort de nos clients à forte valeur et les traite avec tous les égards voulus, simplement en faisant tout le nécessaire pour eux.
Activités principales de l'agent du Service Concierge
  • Relever et examiner les réservations des clients de statut supérieur et de Classe affaires internationale, avant le départ ou l'arrivée de leur vol, pour s'assurer que toutes leurs demandes de services spéciaux ont été traitées.
  • Assurer la parfaite continuité des services pendant tout le voyage en communiquant par le réseau mondial des agents du Service Concierge d'Air Canada.
  • Accueillir et aider tous les clients à forte valeur ou de prestige.
  • Apporter son aide aux clients qui ont des besoins spéciaux.
  • Faire le suivi des correspondances et prendre des mesures proactives pour modifier les réservations, au besoin.
  • Collaborer étroitement avec le service de réservations Air Canada Super Élite et les Relations clientèle pour répondre aux besoins des clients Air Canada Super Élite et régler les manquements au service.
  • Tenir à jour la bibliothèque de documents de référence des agents du Service Concierge et le registre quotidien.
  • Établir un réseau de spécialistes et de ressources pouvant contribuer à répondre aux diverses demandes de nos clients de statut supérieur.

Qualifications

Les candidats doivent avoir le droit de travailler dans le pays choisi au moment où un emploi leur est offert. Il incombe entièrement aux employés posant leur candidature d’obtenir les permis de travail, les visas ou toutes autres autorisations requises pour le poste.
 
Technique :
  • La connaissance et l'expérience en tant qu'agent de vente et de service à la clientèle d'un aéroport seraient considérées comme un atout.
  • Une connaissance supérieure de l'information sur les services des compagnies aériennes et des procédures aéroportuaires serait considérée comme un atout.
  • Connaissance approfondie des attractions, événements, hôtels, restaurants et services de la ville.
  • Une expérience de la billetterie serait considérée comme un atout.
Comportemental :
  • Excellentes compétences en matière de service à la clientèle.
  • Forte volonté de dépasser constamment les attentes des clients tout en offrant un service personnalisé.
  • Attitude proactive et responsable dans la résolution de problèmes avec des solutions créatives.
  • Bon sens du jugement pour trouver un équilibre entre les intérêts des clients et la politique de l'entreprise.
  • Compétences supérieures en matière de leadership et de relations humaines, avec une capacité avérée à travailler en équipe.
  • Motivé(e) et capable de travailler sous pression tout en gérant plusieurs tâches en même temps.
  • Toilette impeccable, excellent sens de l'organisation, grand souci du détail.
  • Excellente fiche de présence.
  • Volonté et capacité de travailler en équipe.
Exigences linguistiques
  • Ce poste exige une bonne maîtrise de la langue.  La priorité sera accordée aux candidats maîtrisant parfaitement l'anglais et le français.
  • Les candidats parlant couramment l'anglais, le français et une ou plusieurs des langues suivantes seront également considérés : Japonais, coréen, cantonais, mandarin, espagnol, italien, allemand, arabe, hébreu, portugais ou grec.
Diversité et inclusion
 
Air Canada est fermement engagée à l'égard de la diversité et de l'inclusion et vise à créer un milieu de travail sain, accessible et enrichissant qui met en valeur les contributions uniques des employés au succès de notre entreprise.
 
En tant qu'employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi, nous accueillons les candidatures de tous pour nous aider à constituer un effectif diversifié qui reflète la diversité de nos clients et des collectivités dans lesquelles nous vivons et que nous servons.
 
Air Canada remercie tous les candidats de leur intérêt ; toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les personnes sélectionnées pour poursuivre le processus.
skills: ["Ce poste exige une bonne maîtrise de la langue. \xa0La priorité sera accordée aux candidats maîtrisant parfaitement l'anglais et le français.", 'Attitude proactive et responsable dans la résolution de problèmes avec des solutions créatives.']

title: Landscaper
description:
Description:
Are you a Landscaper looking for a permanent, full-time position in a respectful work environment? We’ve got the perfect role for you!
Agilus is recruiting for several Landscapers in the construction industry in Vancouver, British Columbia.
Our environmentally conscious client is looking for Landscapers to join their team. This is a full-time permanent role, Monday to Friday 8 hours a day. We are looking for individuals who are team players and who work with integrity. There are also plenty of opportunities for career growth.
Duties:
  • Build to completion various precast concrete retaining walls and paving stone applications
  • Finish hard and soft landscaping installation
  • Fill out daily form to record progress

Requirements:
  • Minimum 1 year experience working in a commercial construction site
  • Experience independently working hardscaping, pavers, and retaining wall systems
  • Planted trees, sod and fine grading
  • Ability to read landscape construction drawings
  • Class 5 Driver’s License

What's in it for you:
  • Wage: $25-$30/hr depending on experience
  • Overtime pay available
  • Permanent role, Monday-Friday, 9am-5pm
  • Benefits and wellness program
  • Opportunities for personal development and career growth
  • On site parking and company events
  • Be a part of a company that values their employees and the community!

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email mdhaliwal@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Landscape Construction Crew Leader
description:
Green Collar Landscaping is a well-established company located in Hamilton. Our team has been providing top quality services in maintenance and landscape construction for our residential and commercial clients since 2009. We are currently searching for motivated, reliable, punctual, and courteous individuals to join our team. The applicants must be willing to work full-time; five days a week.

 

Crew Leader:

  • Ability to operate all equipment necessary for projects
  • Ability to read and follow designs
  • Delegation of appropriate tasks to crew on job sites
  • Completion of daily timesheets for entire crew
  • Maintaining/cleaning of work trucks and tools/equipment
  • Properly care for tools/equipment on job site to avoid loss or misuse
  • Must be able to report all aspects of construction phases to supervisor/management
  • Drive to and from sites

 

Qualifications: Minimum 3 years’ experience in landscape construction & valid G license an asset.

 

What We Will Provide:

  • Uniform and PPE provided
  • Training – both on the job and personal development
  • Health Benefits package after three months
  • Profit Sharing
  • Paid Stat Holidays
  • Incentive Programs
  • Boot Allowance
  • Team Building and Company events
  • Seasonal and Full-Time employment options

 

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

 

Salary: $18.00-$40.00 per hour

title: Landscape Labourer
description:
Landscape Labourer
Full-Time Seasonal
$17-21/hour + Over Time

Who are we?

Our company, Earthscape, is recognized as an award-winning design-build firm that specializes in high-end residential landscaping.

We are a group of young, enthusiastic, creative dreamers and builders who work hard and are exceptionally proud of what we design and create. Our project managers aren't afraid to get their hands dirty and our installation crews know that we trust, and highly-value, their work. It makes for a positive, productive, fun and rewarding environment, with enough challenges and opportunities to keep us growing.

Our focus is on designing thoughtful, creative and innovative outdoor spaces that offer a unique vision for each client using a wide variety of materials.  For examples of past landscape design-build projects, visit our website at http://www.earthscape.ca/

Our main office and yard are located just outside of Elmira, Ontario; a second office/yard is located in Toronto.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for a Landscape Labourer to assist our crews in the construction of hardscape areas such as pavers, flagstone, natural stone, walls, steps, drainage/utilities installation. It also includes construction of softscape areas such as grading, sod, garden beds, planting. You must be able to lift 50 lbs and be able to work at a fast pace throughout the season. This is a full-time, seasonal position starting ASAP.

To be the successful candidate you:

  • Align with Earthscape core values of integrity, hard work, team work, the pursuit of excellence and loving what we do;
  • Communicate effectively with supervisors, colleagues and clients;
  • Uphold high standards for safety, construction standards and quality control;
  • Thrive in a busy work environment and demonstrate initiative in meeting project goals;
  • Want to be proud of your employer and work for a highly regarded industry-recognized leader;
  • Demonstrate competency in specific materials, methods, tools, equipment, and techniques requested to complete tasks in a safe and responsible manner;
  • Have a minimum G class license.

What's in it for you?

This job will offer you the opportunity to work on some of southern Ontario's most beautiful residential landscape projects. The pace, challenges and problem-solving opportunities will mean you are never bored. You will have the chance to develop and refine a wide variety of skills in our rapidly growing business. Your colleagues are all highly skilled, with an impressive range of backgrounds and expertise. Above all they are dedicated to Earthscape's success.

We want you to be successful, and we believe in rewarding our staff for exceptional work. In addition to excellent on-the-job training, a safe and inclusive work environment for you and your colleagues, we offer:

  • The chance to work on award-winning projects and designs;
  • Extended health and dental care, life insurance and AD&D
  • Profit sharing and performance bonuses;
  • Participate in our employee share ownership program (ESOP) after 1 year;
  • Overtime pay;
  • Company events & social hours.

Job Type: Full Time Seasonal

Compensation: $17-21/hour depending on experience

Location: Wallenstein, ON with crews working around KW & Guelph

Accommodations: We are committed to treating all people in a way that respects their dignity and independence. Should you require any accommodation during the recruitment process or otherwise, please notify us of this when you apply and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Pre-employment checks: As part of our selection process, successful candidates may be required to consent to background checks relevant to the role, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, criminal offence and driver's license record. 

Safety protocols: During the COVID19 pandemic, Earthscape has followed the recommendations of public health authorities. For more information about our COVID safety protocols, please contact us.

title: Landscaping and Grounds Maintenance Labourer (NOC 8612 - CG)
company: Canadian Grounds Landscaping and Snow Removal
description:
About Us:

Canadian Grounds Landscaping and Snow Removal (“Canadian Grounds”) was started in 1996 with the goal of being an owner-operated company that could provide educated and competent service to its customers. We have established a reputation as a leader in quality, services, experience, and value.

Our client list includes large hospitals and health facilities, major hotels, commuter train depots and parking lots, downtown business complexes and large industrial properties within Greater Toronto.

About the Position:

Canadian Grounds is looking for landscaping and grounds maintenance labourers to perform work to assist in constructing and maintaining our commercial properties for summer and winter.

Work Location:

  • Checkpoint - 69 Advance Road, Etobicoke

Responsibilities:

  • Spread topsoil, lay sod, plant flowers, grass, shrubs and trees and perform other duties to assist with the construction and maintenance of sites.
  • Cut grass, rake, aerate, dethatch, fertilize and water lawns, weed gardens, prune shrubs and trees and perform other maintenance duties as directed by the supervisor.
  • Operate and maintain power mowers, tractors, chain saws, electric clippers, sod cutters, pruning saws, snowblowers and other landscape maintenance equipment
  • Perform other manual duties to clean and maintain landscaped environments, such as litter pick up and shovelling snow and salting walkways in the winter.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 2 years experience in snow removal, landscaping and groundskeeping management
  • Must have a G drivers license with clean drivers license abstract
  • Able to work under adverse weather conditions
  • Able to work flexible hours during winter

Wages and Benefits:

Salary: $21 and up depending on experience 

Health and Dental Benefits: Yes

Other:

  • Paid Training and Career Development opportunities, such as DZ training.

title: Maintenance
description:
Company Description

We are more than just your local restaurant. We are a collection of hardworking small-business owners.

Did you know that from coast to coast, we serve delicious choices to more than 2.5 million people in over 1,400 locations every day, or that we have proudly helped more than 387,000 Canadian families with sick children through Ronald McDonald House Charities?

 

Job Description

Our offer

Working with us means that you will have the opportunity to earn and learn, flexibility, and a safe and inclusive work environment. What this means in practice is:

·       Access to education and skills development opportunities that take you further

·       A total rewards package that includes discounts, incentives, and recognition perks

·       Flexible hours/shifts that suit your needs

·       A safe, respectful and inclusive workplace

·       Bring your authentic self to work – welcoming people of every age, background, and culture – just like the guests who visit our restaurants every day

The job

We are sure that you have an idea about what working with us is like, but just in case here are some of the highlights on what your job will entail:

·       Maintaining a clean, safe, and secure work environment for guests, coworkers, and yourself, leveraging your knowledge of safety regulations and equipment.

·       Multi-tasking in between troubleshooting, tending to store areas and appliances during your shift, and repairing décor and equipment, whether it’s during the day or throughout the night.

·       Managing priorities, staying organized, and keeping on top of the various tasks with limited supervision.

Your vibe and experience

You are trustworthy and have trust in others. You’re a curious mind. You love to see how things work and are fascinated by the intricacies of objects. You’re good with your hands and mechanically adept. You’re always willing to learn and grow. You remain cool, calm and collected in a fast-paced environment. You’d rather do a job right the first time, than do it twice.

Additional Information

About us

In 1954, an enterprising salesman named Ray Kroc discovered a small burger restaurant in California, and wrote the first page of McDonald’s history. In 1967, the first McDonald’s Canada opened in Richmond, B.C. and we’ve been growing with our communities and serving quality food at great a value ever since. Today, McDonald’s Canada is proud to be one of the world’s leading foodservice retailers, offering job opportunities at corporate-owned restaurants or restaurants owned by independent franchisees.

McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Maintenance Worker III
description:
Our client is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

Duties:
  • Provides semi-skilled and general maintenance, repair, building, and installation services
  • Acceptable experience in routine maintenance tasks, general labouring, and/or building maintenance tasks including the operation and maintenance of hand and power tools.
  • Acceptable experience in providing leadership, supervision and direction to work crews, reviewing crew work and performance management;
  • Acceptable experience in the supervision of job sites in relation to the maintenance and repair of built infrastructure at campgrounds, and day use areas, and other built assets.
  • Acceptable is defined by a minimum of 12 months experience.
Knowledge:
  • Knowledge of building maintenance and construction techniques;
  • Knowledge of appropriate use, care and maintenance of construction and maintenance equipment;
  • Knowledge of safety procedures;
  • Knowledge of Parks Canada and its mandate and corporate objectives including the National Parks Act, park regulations and policies.

Abilities:

  • Ability to supervise staff, including use of constructive criticism and positive reinforcement;
  • Ability to construct and/or maintain assets including not limited to buildings, roads, campgrounds and day use areas;
  • Ability to lead, plan and organize for successful delivery of project requirements;
  • Ability to read and interpret construction plans and specifications;
  • Ability to think analytically, problem-solve and make decisions;
  • Ability to maintain logs and records;
  • Ability to use a variety of computer software programs such as Microsoft Office and e-mail;
  • Ability to lift and carry 45 kilograms or allowable under OHS requirements.
Personal Suitability:
  • Provides vision and leadership;
  • Personally connects with others;
  • Exercises sound judgment;
  • Dependable;
  • Demonstrates initiative;
  • Works well in adverse weather conditions;
  • Helps create a team environment.
Other condition(s) of employment:
  • You are required to possess and maintain a valid Class 5 driver’s licence recognized by the province/territory applicable to this offer of employment.
  • You must be willing to work overtime.
  • You will be required to work shift-work, and/or weekends, and/or statutory holidays and provincial/territorial holidays as scheduled by your delegated manager.
  • You may be required to wear a uniform while performing your duties. In this case, Parks Canada will provide you with the uniforms you require in accordance with the Parks Canada Uniform Policy;
  • You must be willing to work and travel in a variety of terrains and weather conditions in the performance of the duties.
  • You must be willing to obtain and maintain a valid Standard First Aid and CPR-C.
  • You will be required to work primarily on job sites, and have minor administrative functions.

title: Landscape Gardener/Golf Course Greenskeeper (Student, Seasonal)
description:
General Labour/Golf Course Greenskeeper (Student, Seasonal)

Donalda Club is one of the finest multi-activity, family oriented private clubs in the country that strives to exceed our members expectations daily. In operation since 1960, Donalda Club has a longstanding history and has built a culture and environment for our members and their families to create lifelong memories. Similarly, our staff is part of that family culture, creating an ideal working environment alongside one of the most beautiful facilities in the city.?

The Position:

We are looking for Golf Course Greenskeepers for the Summer 2022 season. A successful candidate would be energetic, enthusiastic (loves golf!), has leadership and personal skills who can work independently and collaboratively with other team members.

As a member of the Donalda Grounds Team, you will work alongside the Golf Course Superintendent and his assistants for maintenance of the golf course to deliver the best possible playing conditions for the membership on a daily basis.

An Overview of Main Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Mowing and maintenance of greens, tees, fairways and rough
  • Raking and maintenance of sand traps
  • Raking and removal of leaves and other debris
  • Other turf duties as requested by grounds management team
  • Our goal is to provide our membership with a high-class golf experience daily. We strive to staff our turf maintenance team with talented people who share our level of enthusiasm.
  • Operation of light equipment such as hand-powered tools, riding mowers, tractors, etc.

Requirements:

  • Ability to work early mornings (5:30-6:00 A.M. start times)
  • Available to work the required weekends and holidays
  • Positive attitude and willingness to learn
  • Physically capable of completing required tasks
  • Valid driver’s license - G/G2 required
  • Previous landscaping experience (preferred, but not necessary)
  • Golf course experience an asset (but not necessary)
  • Must possess excellent customer service skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Detail-oriented and works with a high degree of accuracy
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
  • Must be extremely responsible with integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion

We are looking for motivated individuals who are available  part time  from May 2022-August 2022  (weather dependent) until the end of the golf season.

Employment with the Donalda Club will be conditional upon the successful candidate having received a COVID-19 vaccine series approved by Health Canada, at least 14 days prior to their start date. This requirement is subject to exemptions pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.

EXPECTED START DATE:  April (weather dependent)

Applicants who do not already have legal permission to work in Canada will not be considered.

Donalda Club is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations for disabilities will be provided to support participation in all aspects of the recruitment process.

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary

Salary: $16.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
All staff will be provided the necessary PPE including face masks, hand sanitizer and equipment disinfectants. In addition, signage has been posted throughout the staff building and hand sanitizer has been provided at all entry points.

In operation since 1960, Donalda Club has a longstanding history and has built a culture and environment for our members and their families to create lifelong memories. title: Maintenance Worker 5
description:
Job Description

Job Title: Maintenance Worker 5Work Site: Plant Maintenance, Vancouver General HospitalStatus: Temporary Full TimeStart Date: As soon as possibleSalary: $26.22 per hour

Hours:

 

0730-1530, Monday to Friday

Days off: Saturday, Sunday, Statutory Holidays

Reference#: 159756-lba

 

Come work as a Maintenance Worker with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Maintenance Worker to join the Plant Maintenance team at Vancouver General Hospital. Apply today to join our team!

 

As a Maintenance Worker at Vancouver Coastal Health you will:

  • Perform trades duties approaching the journeyman level in a variety of trades’ areas such as electrical, mechanical, plumbing, carpentry, painting, and welding.
  • Perform maintenance and repair duties related to buildings and equipment and perform mechanical and electrical repairs to equipment and systems.
  • Participate on the Rapid Response Team and as a member of the Maintenance team.
  • You will assist other team members in their duties to ensure a timely and complete delivery of service to our clients.
  • Act in various capacities, supporting maintenance in general terms.
  • Act as a customer service advocate, accelerating the resolution of customer concerns.

This position may require inter-site work assignments, and working in a support role to trades personnel.

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Experience

  • Grade 10, plus four (4) years’ recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Knowledge & Abilities

  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.

The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.

  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff

Diversity, equity and inclusion are essential to delivering exceptional care and building a great place to work. At VCH, we value and accommodate unique differences to ensure that our staff and medical staff (both current and prospective) have the opportunity and are supported to thrive.To build a strong and representative workforce, we are seeking candidates who will contribute to a caring and inclusive culture. We encourage applications from members of communities that are disadvantaged on any grounds under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including Indigenous Peoples, people of colour, people of all genders and sexualities and people with disabilities.VCH is proud to be recognized as a Best Place to Work in Canada in 2021 by Glassdoor and Forbes.Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting. ***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

Apply today to join our team!', 'Perform maintenance and repair duties related to buildings and equipment and perform mechanical and electrical repairs to equipment and systems.', 'Grade 10, plus four (4) years’ recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.', 'Perform trades duties approaching the journeyman level in a variety of trades’ areas such as electrical, mechanical, plumbing, carpentry, painting, and welding.', 'Education & Experience', 'Act in various capacities, supporting maintenance in general terms.', 'Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.', 'Participate on the Rapid Response Team and as a member of the Maintenance team.', 'You will assist other team members in their duties to ensure a timely and complete delivery of service to our clients.']

title: Landscape Crew Member/Labourer
company: Lawrence Park Complete Garden Care Ltd
description:
Who we are?

Lawrence Park Complete Garden Care is an award-winning full-scale landscaping firm, specializing in landscape design & construction, lawn & garden care, irrigation & lighting, green roofs and horticulture. We are group of dedicated and creative professionals who are proud of the landscapes we create and maintain. We’ve been at it for over 30 years and we continue to grow – this is where you come in!

So what’s in it for you?

  • The chance to work on award-winning projects with an award-winning team.
  • The opportunity to work in beautiful Toronto neighborhoods.
  • Working for a company that values a supportive work environment.
  • Industry leading wages, along with profit sharing bonuses.
  • Group Health Benefits.
  • On the job training.
  • Personal Development Planning.
  • Employee of the Month recognitions and rewards.
  • Employee referral program.
  • Training allowance.
  • Fun social events.
  • Seasonal from April to December

Who are we looking for?

  • A self-motivated individual who is passionate about the work they do.
  • Someone creative, who has problem solving skills, can communicate well, is personable and can be flexible with the fast-paced environment and demands of the work.

What we need?

  • Landscape installation and maintenance experience.
  • Post secondary education in horticulture or equivalent is an asset.
  • Knowledge of plants, along with the knowledge of horticultural practices.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Ability to operate motorized landscaping equipment.
  • A minimum G license and comfortable driving large vehicles is an asset.
  • Ability to work long hours, starting at 7am from Monday to Friday; along with occasional weekend work in the Spring and Fall
  • Can meet the physical demands of working outdoors in varying weather conditions

title: Yard Attendant
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES

We are currently seeking a Yard Attendant to work at the Buck Auto Parts Calgary location operated by EVRAZ North America. Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Yard Attendant will be responsible for vehicle processing and draining appropriate fluids from cars, and removing good sets of rims. All processors rotate through pre-processing, processing (tanking), tire shop, and yard maintenance.

EVRAZ is committed to maintaining and promoting a safe, healthy and injury-free environment.  It is required for all jobs.

  • Prepare vehicles for processing by removing garbage, batteries, mercury switches

  • Drain appropriate automobile fluids (gasoline, antifreeze, etc.) to assist with the processing of vehicles

  • Remove automobile parts: the catalytic converter

  • Take off tires and remove valve stems and wheel weights from rims, stack and load tires and other parts into shipping containers

  • Complete yard maintenance and keep work area clean

  • Notify appropriate personnel of any procedural abnormalities

  • Assist with site maintenance (parts yard, production area, office and parking lot)

  • collect and remove all non-ferrous items from vehicles prior to crush

  • Observe and follow all safety rules and regulations

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • No experience necessary but previous work experience in a manufacturing, production, or similar scrapyard/auto part environment will be considered an asset

  • Knowledge of automotive components is a definite asset

  • Able to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, lifting at least 50lbs, and pushing and pulling

  • Able to operate the skid steer

  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions

  • Organized and able to prioritize competing priorities

  • Strong communication skills – communicates clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing, and over mobile radio devices

  • Able to work with minimal supervision/general oversight

  • Safety oriented and willing to follow all site safety procedures

  • Mechanically inclined

  • Good attention to detail and quality control

  • Mentally alert to surroundings

  • Self-motivated: Initiates and takes action before being required to do so

  • Strong work ethic: uses time efficiently, work safely and making sure everyone around him/her are working safely

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: LANDSCAPER CONSTRUCTION (6-Month Contract)
description:
Job Description:

 

Exciting things are happening at the City of Brampton. Take a look at what employees are working on related to our Term of Council Priorities moving us forward towards The Brampton 2040 Vision.

 

 

LANDSCAPER CONSTRUCTION (6-Month Contract)

 

 

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

 

Reporting to the Foreperson, Construction, assists the Supervisor in completion of landscaping projects. This position directs work crews.  

  • Install and repair of paving, timber structures, benches, bleachers, playground equipment, fencing and drainage structures.
  • Submit schedule of manpower and equipment to complete projects for approval by Supervisor; would also include estimating material costs and delivery schedules.
  • Inspects/supervises work performed by members of crew on a project; ensures quantity, quality of work and safe/efficient use of equipment, tools, and materials.
  • Operates equipment/tools/i.e. backhoe, large trucks.
  • Make arrangements for marking of underground utilities, Gas, Bell, Hydro, Cable, Water, fibre optics or traffic signals. Meet on site with locater or have them mark and fax information.
  • Communicate with the public in a courteous and efficient manner regarding inquires, complaints and emergencies. Investigate complaints and determine a resolution.
  • Co-ordinate manpower, equipment and materials for the completion of projects with other supervisors and foremen in the Parks Division, assist them in emergency situations and co-ordinate with contractors working on this job site.
  • Trains staff to perform work safely and efficiently.
  • Assists supervisor in administrating the section by recording of time, costing of projects and purchase of materials. This may involve computer input and data retrieval necessary for completion of projects.
  • Site meetings with Landscape architects for pre-construction and to discuss final acceptance of project. Determine deficiencies and repairs needed.
  • Provide assistance in snow removal; snow ploughing, Parkskeeper 1-4 duties, pruning, removal & wood clean up, wood lot maintenance, stump removal.
  • Storm Centre Management, coordinating staff/equipment to respond to any weather event on an as and when required basis.
  • Co-ordinate and purchase parts and supplies for the construction area projects. Blanket purchase orders and credit cards are used for this purpose.
  • Provide special events support services on a city wide basis, as required.

SELECTION CRITERIA:

  • High school (Grade 12) graduation plus an additional program of over one year and up to two years in a landscape technician program or equivalent.
  • Over two (2) years up to, and including four (4) years in landscaping or horticulture.
  • A valid, non-probationary Ontario Class AZ or ARZ driverâ€™s licence.
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on customer service.
  • Able to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office.

 

**Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the selection criteria.

 

Job status:  Contract

Job Type:     Union

 

Hourly rate:    $31.48

Applications must be received by July 1, 2022

Alternate formats will be provided  upon request.

 

   

 

If this opportunity matches your interest and experience, please apply online by clicking the button above, by July 1, 2022  and complete the attached questionnaire. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The successful candidate(s) will be required, as a condition of employment, to execute a written employment agreement. A Criminal Record Search will be required of the successful candidate at their own expense to verify the absence of a criminal record for which a pardon has not been granted.

 

Preference will be given to students that have a permanent residency in Brampton.

 

As part of the application process, applicants will be invited to complete a self identification survey. The survey is voluntary. Participation in the survey will have no impact on hiring decisions.   All information collected is confidential and will not be shared with the hiring manager. The surveys will be anonymized and will be kept separate from applicant or employee files, such that the individuals who completed the surveys will not be identifiable.   The results of the survey will assist in the analysis of disaggregated metrics for organizational planning purposes and our commitment to advance and foster diversity, equity, and inclusion. The City may use anonymized data to produce aggregate reports for internal or external use.

 

Please be advised, the City of Brampton uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicantâ€™s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the Job Competition and your application will be removed from the Competition.

 

The City is an equal opportunity employer.   We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If you require any accommodations at any point during the application and hiring process, please contact TalentAcquisition@brampton.ca or 905-874-2150 with your accommodation needs, quoting the job opening ID#, job title. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

title: Yard Associate (Mon-Fri)
description:
Overview:

Master Halco, North Americaâ€™s leading manufacturer/distributor of fencing and perimeter security products is seeking a Yard Associate. This position performs an array of functions including pulling and preparing accurate orders for customers, safely using a forklift to load/unload trucks, and maintaining yard stock in a clean and organized manner.

 

This is a very exciting time to join our company. We are continuing to grow (70 locations), introducing new products, making technological investments, and implementing innovative marketing strategies. We are also focused on our people -- our most important resource. At Master Halco, we believe in transparency, open communication, and rewarding success with a path to fully develop your potential while building a career.

 

If you enjoy a fast-paced work environment and the opportunity to show us your best customer service skills, this is the right place for you!  

 

Master Halco offers advancement opportunities at every level. We are always looking for people with the drive to learn and determination to succeed.

 

Working With Us Has Its Rewards:

  • Competitive hourly wage of $22.95/hrly.
  • Eligible for a wage progression plan with pay increases every 6 months over a 3 year period.
  • Monday through Friday schedule, day shift
  • A competitive health care plan
  • A generous matching 401(k) plan
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Bonus Opportunities
  • A generous paid-time off package, and more

title: Landscape Turf Equipment Operator I - 2022
description:
Overview:

Operate heavy equipment in order to maintain all turf areas within the park.

This position pays $20.00 per hour.

Responsibilities:

 

â€¢ Operate Zero Turn ride-on rotary mower
â€¢ Maintain turf using a walk behind mower, backpack blower and line trimmer
â€¢ Assist with seeding, sodding, fertilizing, aerating, topdressing, irrigating as needed
â€¢ Assist with providing direction to Turf Technicians
â€¢ As required, operate machinery to assist in the implementation of other property maintenance programs, including site cleanup (litter control, pavement washdown, pressure washing and waste handling and recovery) and vehicle/equipment maintenance (cleaning, sanding, hand painting)
â€¢ Assist with other duties as required

Qualifications:
  • Ontario Secondary School Diploma preferred
  • Minimum two (2) years of experience in the operation and routine preventive maintenance of various types of commercial turf equipment in a commercial, municipal or golf course setting
  • Previous experience with operation of Zero Turn mower is required
  • CCHT (Canadian Certified Horticultural Technician)-Landscape Maintenance designation is an asset
  • Familiarity with Occupational Health and Safety Act
  • Valid Ontario driverâ€™s license (class G/G2) with a clean abstract
  • Able to meet the physical requirements of the job including bending, lifting, utilizing hand tools and working in various weather conditions (must be able to lift, pull and push 20Kg)
  • Ability to work co-operatively in a team setting
  • Ability to work 6:00am to 2:30pm during the spring and fall, 6:00am-3:30pm during full time operating season (Friday shifts are from 6:00am-10:00am) with occasional overtime and weekends
  • Must provide own CSA approved safety footwear
  • Able to wear personal protective equipment deemed necessary to perform this job safely (may include; gloves, mask and/or face shield, non-slip shoes etc)

title: Landscape Construction Crew Foreman/Manager
description:
Mr. Lawnmower Job Posting.

Here we grow again, if you like working outdoors, really enjoyed your summer job mowing lawns in middle school then a job in Horticultural Industry is for you. Horticultural companies work to preserve and enhance a client’s landscape.

Horticultural Projects can be as simple as caring for grass and shrubs, or as elaborate as tending to turf, trees, and other landscape elements at a luxury resort.

Since maintaining the “attractiveness” of landscapes is so popular, there is rarely a shortage of work as a horticultural professional. This isn’t your simple summer lawn-mowing job anymore!

We at Mr. Lawnmower are looking for energetic and motivated individuals that have tremendous leadership qualities and are attention to detail-oriented. Mr. Lawnmower is based in Scarborough, and currently has an opening for a Lawn Maintenance/Landscape Construction Foreman and Landscape/Lawn-care Technicians. Candidates must be Dependable, Honest, and Trustworthy. References will be mandatory.

Descriptions:

Landscape Construction Crew Foreman/Manager:
A qualified landscape construction foreman will be expected to have experience in and required to do the following:
  • Read blueprints and specs for projects.
  • Complete daily job site journals/work orders.
  • Perform weekly toolbox meetings.
  • Help with maintenance and cleaning of vehicles and equipment.
  • Ability to operate various pieces of equipment.
  • Hold a valid class G License.
  • Provide own transportation to project sites.
  • Work weekends and long hours.
  • Schedule materials and equipment for the next day.
  • Schedule and run crews.
  • Will be required to plant trees, shrubs and lay sod.
  • Ability to rake, level, and grade.
  • Ability to install hard and soft landscapes (Wet Lay and asset).

Education:
  • High school diploma.
  • CLT/CLP or Two-year technical college certificate in horticulture an asset.
  • Valid first aid certificate an asset.
  • WHMIS training an asset.
  • 2-4 years of experience.

All Applicants interested and qualified applicants should be able to work well with others, have good communication skills, and be able to start immediately and work overtime as requested. All resumes and cover letters should be e-mailed to: careers@mrlawnmower.ca.

*Apprenticeship students are encouraged to apply

PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT DUE TO THE ANTICIPATED HIGH VOLUME OF RESPONSE TO THIS AD, MR. LAWNMOWER IS NOT ABLE TO RESPOND TO EVERY APPLICANT. SOMEONE FROM MR. LAWNMOWER WILL CONTACT QUALIFIED APPLICANTS THAT MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE POSITION AND MATCH THE BACKGROUND AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE.




    About Mr. Lawnmower Landscaping Services Ltd. :

    Mr Lawnmower Landscaping Services is a reliable and professional landscape company with a commitment to excellence and quality. We have been serving the Greater Toronto Area since 2003. At Mr Lawnmower, we are proud to have a very large client base in Toronto, Ontario. These clients have used our services many times which is a testament to the outstanding service that we provide.

title: Lawn and Garden Maintenance Crew Member/Labourer
description:
Responsible for ensuring projects are completed on time and on budget whilst maintaining a safe work environment. Main duties are to direct, plan and coordinate daily work activities for workers. In larger operations this is done through crew leaders/forepersons; and in smaller operations personally directs workers who perform tasks in ground maintenance, landscape construction, greenhouse or nursery operations. Often the supervisor, in smaller operations, will work hands-on as well as overseeing the workers. Also in smaller operations, where there is no manager, may be involved in presenting and selling landscape installations, maintenance projects and services, plants, shrubbery, trees, etc. to customers.

All PPE and uniforms provided, on the job training, Health Benefits package after 3 months, Paid Stat Holidays, Team building events, seasonal or full-time employment options.  All crews dispatch from our ancaster location, but arrangements can be made to pick up employees at a pickup point if required.

title: Arborist Climber
description:
Overview:

 

If you enjoy working outdoors in a professional and safe environment, consider a career with Bartlett Tree Experts! At Bartlett, we value a strong culture of excellence in safety, scientific research, lifelong learning, and career development.

 

As an Arborist Climber, you will be an integral member of a tree care crew with the primary responsibility of tree climbing and assisting Arborist Crew Leaders in performing all tree and shrub care services on residential and commercial properties.

 

Benefits:

 

We offer competitive compensation, as well as:

  • A safety-first culture and professional  workplace
  • Advancement opportunities - we promote from within
  • Life, LTD, ADD, medical and dental
  • RPP Plan, Healthcare spending account, and paid vacation and holidays
  • Industry credential/license pay increases
  • Company-paid uniforms, PPE, gear, and equipment
  • Boot reimbursement up to $200
  • Access to training, continuing education programs, and a variety of resources provided by the Bartlett Tree Experts Research Laboratories

 

To find out more about what life is like at Bartlett, check us out on Instagram @LifeatBartlett.  

 

Responsibilities:

 

As an Arborist Climber, you will play an important role in:

  • Performing ground, tree climbing, and aerial lift duties in support of specific job assignments, as directed by the Arborist Crew Leader and Local Manager
  • Safely performing all aspects of arboriculture, including:
    • Pruning
    • Cabling and bracing
    • Rigging
    • Removals
    • Properly maintaining and operating equipment (hand tools, chainsaws, chippers, and aerial lifts)
  • Learning, understanding, and adhering to all safety rules and company safety policies
Qualifications:
  • A passion for nature, the environment, and the outdoors
  • At least one (1) year of tree climbing (DdRT or SRT) and aerial lift operation experience in the tree care industry
  • Valid driver's license and clean motor vehicle record (Class B CDL preferred)
  • Ability to work outdoors year-round in all weather conditions

 

The F. A. Bartlett Tree Expert Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Groundskeeper
description:
Are you an outdoor enthusiast with a passion for maintaining grounds? 

Are you looking for seasonal employment with a residential property management company listed as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada?

 

Summary: 

Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Groundskeeper will work closely with the Community Manager and Land Lease Maintenance, maintain grounds, participate in grounds construction activities and ensure proper operation of all necessary equipment.

 

This role is ideally suited to candidates located in or around Brooks, AB, to travel to communities nearby. If you take pride in maintaining a functional, inviting, and aesthetically pleasing environment and are able to handle multiple jobs in an organized fashion, we want to hear from you!

 

Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate with Operations Manager and or Community Manager by appropriate methods to resolve site issues and report all issues
  • Distribute notices and letters to tenants as required
  • Work at multiple Mobile Home Communities, on an as-need basis
  • Be on call as necessary
  • Participate in safety training
  • Follow up on tenant issues as assigned
  • Assist with, set up, general repairs and maintenance of CAPREIT owned homes
  • Request material for the items required for work orders
  • Other duties as assigned

 

Maintenance of Site

  • Repair and maintenance of common areas
  • General grounds keeping including mowing, pruning, whipper snipping, and clearing catch basins
  • Cleaning of vacant lots
  • Salting, sanding and snow removal (where applicable)

 

Qualifications:

  • 1+ years of relevant experience
  • Qualifications in one of the mechanical trades a strong asset
  • Organized and able to oversee multiple projects simultaneously
  • Valid driver’s licence, clean driver abstract, reliable, insured means of transportation to and between work locations may be required for some locations
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Be available to work 25-30 hours per week and on call for emergencies

title: Golf Course Mechanic
location: Rocky Crest Golf Resort, Mactier, ON
description:
Rocky Crest Golf Club is Hiring!

You're mechanically inclined and have a background in mechanics. Your experience includes engine repair, working with hydraulic and electrical systems, reel grinding and you possess an urgency to get your work done in an efficient manner. You're organized and skilled at record-keeping and have knowledge of purchasing while adhering to budgets.

  • Keep detailed records of scheduled and completed equipment maintenance and repair.    
     

QUALIFICATIONS:   

  • Experience in engine repair, hydraulic systems, electrical systems and reel grinding.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.

This is a full-time Monday-Friday position.

if a workplace accommodation is needed throughout the selection process. Thank you for your interest in ClubLink.

title: Grounds Maintenance- Overnight Clean-Up Crew - 2022
description:
Overview:

Operatate heavy equipment to maintain the grounds throughout the park.   This position is a night shift and requires candidates to work from 12:00am - 9:00am.

This position pays $19.00-22.00 per hour.

Responsibilities:

 

Operate heavy equipment related to specific elements of the property maintenance program in either of the following areas:

  • Site cleanup (street scrubber, vehicle mounted hot water pressure washer)
  • As required, and with appropriate training, operate machinery to assist in the implementation of other property maintenance programs, including site washdown/recovery (pavement washdown, waste handling/recovery, litter control, pressure washing, general cleanup) or turf maintenance (mowing, trimming, seeding, sodding, fertilizing, aerating, topdressing, irrigating), vehicle/equipment maintenance (cleaning, sanding, hand painting) or other duties as required
Qualifications:
  • Ontario Secondary School Diploma is preferred and minimum two (2) yearsâ€™ experience in the operation and routine preventive maintenance of various types of heavy commercial equipment in a commercial, municipal, or golf course setting
  • Minimum of 18 years of age is required to be considered for this posiiton
  • Familiar with Occupational Health & Safety Act required
  • P.R. Basic Rescuer/First Aid is an asset
  • Valid Ontario Driverâ€™s License (class G/G2) with a clean abstract
  • Able to meet the physical requirements of the job including: bending, lifting, utilizing hand tools and working in various weather conditions
  • Able to work cooperatively in a team setting
  • Work a flexible, rotating shift schedule (7 on 3 off, 7 on 4 off)
  • Ability to work 12:00am to 9am during the full time operating season, averaging 40 hours per week with frequent overtime
  • Able to wear personal protective equipment deemed necessary to perform this job safely (may include; gloves, mask and/or face shield, non-slip shoes etc)

title: Landscape Maintenance Crew Foreman/Manager
description:
Here we grow again, if you like working outdoors, really enjoyed your summer job mowing lawns in middle school then a job in Horticultural Industry is for you. Horticultural companies work to preserve and enhance a client’s landscape.

Horticultural Projects can be as simple as caring for grass and shrubs, or as elaborate as tending to turf, trees, and other landscape elements at a luxury resort.

Since maintaining the “attractiveness” of landscapes is so popular, there is rarely a shortage of work as a horticultural professional. This isn’t your simple summer lawn-mowing job anymore!

We at Mr. Lawnmower are looking for energetic and motivated individuals that have tremendous leadership qualities and are attention to detail-oriented. Mr. Lawnmower is based in Scarborough, and currently has an opening for a Lawn Maintenance/Landscape Construction Foreman and Landscape/Lawn-care Technicians. Candidates must be dependable, Honest, and Trustworthy. References will be mandatory.

Descriptions:

Landscape Maintenance Crew Foreman/Manager
A qualified landscape foreman will be expected to have experience in and required to do the following:
  • Oversee the work and keep the workers in the field on task.
  • Coordinate jobs, make assignments, deal with the customers on-site and take advantage of sales opportunities that may arise.
  • Must have a valid G license and a mode of transportation
  • Train and supervise lawn technicians and assist with marketing projects.
  • Will be directly responsible for the overall quality of the work.

Education: 
  • High school diploma • CLT/CLP or Two-year technical college certificate in horticulture an asset • Valid first aid certificate an asset • WHMIS training an asset • 2-4 years of experience Landscape Maintenance Technicians A qualified Landscape Maintenance Technician will be expected to have experience in and required to do the following:
  • General Lawn Maintenance including grass cutting, trimming and blowing.
  • Spring and Fall Property Cleanups.
  • General Garden Maintenance including weeding, soil turning, edging, pruning, and planting.
  • Garbage removal.
  • Winter work including snow removal.

Please be advised that due to the anticipated high volume of response to this ad, Mr. Lawnmover is not able to respond to every applicant. Someone from Mr. Lawnmover will contact qualified applicants that meet the requirements of the position and match the background and professional experience.




    About Mr. Lawnmower Landscaping Services Ltd. :

    Mr Lawnmower Landscaping Services is a reliable and professional landscape company with a commitment to excellence and quality. We have been serving the Greater Toronto Area since 2003. At Mr Lawnmower, we are proud to have a very large client base in Toronto, Ontario. These clients have used our services many times which is a testament to the outstanding service that we provide.

title: Arborist Climber
description:
Overview:

If you enjoy working outdoors in a professional and safe environment, consider a career with Bartlett Tree Experts! At Bartlett, we value a strong culture of excellence in safety, scientific research, lifelong learning, and career development.

 

As an Arborist Climber, you will be an integral member of a tree care crew with the primary responsibility of tree climbing and assisting Arborist Crew Leaders in performing all tree and shrub care services on residential and commercial properties.  

 

Benefits:

We offer competitive compensation, as well as:

  • A safety-first culture and professional  workplace
  • Advancement opportunities - we promote from within
  • Life, LTD, ADD, medical and dental
  • RPP Plan, Healthcare spending account, and paid vacation and holidays
  • Industry credential/license pay increases
  • Company-paid uniforms, PPE, gear, and equipment
  • Boot reimbursement up to $200
  • Access to training, continuing education programs, and a variety of resources provided by the Bartlett Tree Experts Research Laboratories

 

To find out more about what life is like at Bartlett, check us out on Instagram @LifeatBartlett.  

Responsibilities:
  • Supervise and manage tree care crew while performing all aspects of tree care services, as directed by the Arborist Representative and Local Manager
  • Review scope of work and safety issues with the Arborist Representative prior to beginning each work assignment
  • Ensure that each crew member is trained appropriately for each designated job assignment
  • Demonstrate the ability to manage a crew safely
  • Ensure that all tree care work is performed in accordance with industry and company standards
  • Interact with clientele in order to help ensure job satisfaction
  • Bring a cooperative and enthusiastic attitude to the job site
Qualifications:
  • At least 3 years of climbing (DdRT or SRT) and bucket operation experience in the tree care industry
  • Valid driver's license and clean MVR
  • Degree in Arboriculture, Forestry, Horticulture, Plant Science, Landscape Management, Environmental Science or a related field is preferred but not required

The F. A. Bartlett Tree Expert Company is an Equal Opportunity and E-Verify Employer.

title: Landscape Enhancement Labourer
description:
Why CSL? 

CSL Group is a dynamic family-based company committed to its employees. We are a growing company with a fantastic reputation and are searching for new team members to grow and develop. If you are looking for a career, not just a job, we offer exciting growth and advancement opportunities. All employees at CSL are committed to our company values (SHARING - Safety, Humility, Accountability, Respect, Integrity, Nurturing, Growth). If working for a company that is committed to upholding its SHARING values excites you, please apply today! 

Job Duties:

  • 2 years of experience in the landscape enhancements industry 
  • Demonstrates initiative: ability to think, work and make decisions based on sound judgment
  • Able to operate basic construction equipment (excavator, skid steer, earth movers, etc)
  • Experience in working in repairing fences, tree planting/cutting, hardscaping, laying mulch, patio stones etc. 
  • Superior strengths including lifting, climbing, bending, digging
  • Examples of duties include excavation, grading, layout and basic construction labour tasks
  • Perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment by conducting inspections, lubricating, and cleaning on a daily basis
  • Comply with all company policies and regulations
  • Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with extreme weather fluctuation
  • This is a full time position throughout the spring, summer, and fall seasons. This position transitions into winter duties.  

Work Perks:

  • Competitive wages
  • Company paid benefits package
  • Employee appreciation events
  • Company paid uniforms & safety boot allowance
  • RRSP and DPSP

title: Landscape Turf Equipment Operator II - 2022
description:
Overview:

Operate turf equipment in order to maintain all turf areas within the park.

This position pays $19.00 per hour.

Responsibilities:
  • Maintain turf using a walk behind mower, backpack blower and line trimmer
  • Assist with seeding, sodding, fertilizing, aerating, topdressing, irrigating as needed
  • Assist with providing direction to Turf Technicians
  • As required, operate machinery to assist in the implementation of other property maintenance programs, including site cleanup (litter control, pavement washdown, pressure washing and waste handling and recovery) and vehicle/equipment maintenance (cleaning, sanding, hand painting)
  • Assist with other duties as required

  • Minimum two (2) years of experience in the operation and routine preventive maintenance of various types of commercial turf equipment in a commercial, municipal or golf course setting
  • Experience in truck/trailer operation an asset
  • CCHT (Canadian Certified Horticultural Technician)-Landscape Maintenance designation is an asset

  • Ability to work co-operatively in a team setting
  • Ability to work 6:00am to 2:30pm during the spring and fall, 6:00am-3:30pm during full time operating season (Friday shifts are from 6:00am-10:00am) with occasional overtime and weekends
